transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Earth.  Fire.  Air.  Water.  When I was a boy, my father, Avatar Aang, told me the story of how he and his friends heroically ended the Hundred Year War.  Avatar Aang and Fire Lord Zuko  transformed the Fire Nation colonies into the United Republic of Nations,  a society where benders and nonbenders from all over the world could live and thrive together in peace and harmony.  They named the capital of this great land, Republic City.  Avatar Aang accomplished many remarkable things in his life.  But sadly, his time in this world came to an end. And like the cycle of the seasons, the cycle of the Avatar began anew.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: The White Lotus has honored my family by coming.  Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Welcome.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: We have investigated many claims, both here and in the Northern Tribe. All have turned out to be false.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Then you should be happy to know, your search has come to an end.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: What makes you so sure your daughter is the one ?

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Korra! Please come in here!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm the Avatar! You gotta deal with it!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: She's strong.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: She lacks restraint.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Woohoo!  Hey, why all the doom and gloom, people?  We should be celebrating!  Three elements down,  one to go!

transcript.speaker: Yim
transcript.text: You're getting ahead of yourself as usual , Korra. We haven't decided if you passed your firebending test yet.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: Ever since you were a little girl, you've excelled at the physical side of bending, but completely ignored the spiritual side.  The Avatar must master both.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I haven't ignored it, it just doesn't come as easy to me.  But that's why I should start training with Tenzin immediately.  He's Mister Spiritual.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: Do you believe she's ready, Master Katara?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Yes. If anyone can teach her what she needs to learn, it's Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: Very well, Korra. It's time for you to begin your airbending training.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes! Finally!  I mean,  thank you all for believing in me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga, you should have seen it!  I kicked some firebender butt, and I passed!  Tenzin will be here in a few days.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Just taking Naga out for a stroll.  Don't worry, we're not going far.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga, go!  That a girl. Go! Go! Go!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Are we there yet? Are we there yet? Are we there yet?  It looks like we're there.  I know it, this is very familiar! Are we here yet? Are we here yet? Ooh, please tell me we're here!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, Ikki,  as I've been telling you for the last fifteen minutes, we are,  finally , here.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hello, Mother.  I can't tell you how happy I am to see you.  Please, help me.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Unhand me, strange woman!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's your grandmother, Meelo.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: It's so good to see all of you.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Gran Gran, I've been reading all about your old adventures. I've been dying to ask you: What happened to Zuko's mom?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Well, Jinora, it's an incredible tale--

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Gran Gran, you look old. How old are you? And why is it so cold in the South Pole?  Can we make a campfire, and all huddle around it, and tell scary stories, and make snowmen?  And then can you make the snowmen move with waterbending and chase us? Wouldn't that be  fuuun? Huh?  Wouldn't it?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Pema, let me help you. Careful now, careful.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Stop doting on me. I'm not helpless, I'm just pregnant.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: The baby's strong .  I see another airbender in your future.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: All I want is one child like me ,  a nice non -bender, who doesn't  blast wind in my face every five seconds.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Mommy, look,  I'm a snowbender !

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Were Tenzin and his siblings this crazy when they were kids?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Kya and Bumi certainly were, but  Tenzin has always been ...  rather serious.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Mother, please .

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra?  Look at you, so big and strong.  You've grown into quite the young Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Master Tenzin, I'm so glad you're here. I can't wait to get started.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, well ...

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: You're going to have to tell her sooner or later.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tell me what?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: You're not staying, are you?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm afraid not. We're only visiting for the night. Then I have to return to Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But ... no, you're supposed to move here.  You're supposed to teach me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm sorry, Korra. Your airbending training is going to have to wait.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, how long until you're ready to teach me airbending?  A week? A month?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It could be much longer.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't understand. Why are you making me wait?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I have a responsibility to Republic City. I am one of its leaders, and the situation there is very unstable right now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But you also have a responsibility to teach me.  Believe me, I'd be happy to find another airbending master, but you're the only one.  We're stuck with each other.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I wish there were another way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, there is! If you can't stay here, then I'll go back to Republic City with you! It's perfect!

transcript.speaker: White Lotus leader
transcript.text: Absolutely not!  The city is far too dangerous. Avatar Aang tasked us with keeping you safe while you mastered the four elements.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I get that, but I don't think keeping me locked up in this compound like a prisoner is what he had in mind.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know this is difficult to accept, but it's not the right time for you to come to the city.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whatever.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Goodbye, Gran Gran!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oogi, yip-yip!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Nice night for an escape, isn't it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I have to leave. I have to find my own path as the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I know you do.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Aang's time has passed.  My brother and many of my friends are gone.  It's time for you and your generation to take over the responsibility of keeping peace and balance in the world.  And I think you're going to be a great Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Goodbye, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mom, Dad.  I'll miss you.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: We love you so much.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga, we're here!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks for the ride!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wow, look at this place.  I've never seen so many Satomobiles!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Air Temple Island. That's where Tenzin lives.  You ready for a little swim, girl?  Okay, okay! Food first, then air temple!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Watch out, Naga! Look out!

transcript.speaker: Pedestrian
transcript.text: Watch where you're going!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whoops, sorry about that. Excuse us. Coming through. Heads up. Eh, sorry, we're new in town.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga, wait.  We'll take one of everything, please.

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: That will be twenty yuans.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh ... I don't have any money?

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: Then what good are you to me?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't worry, girl.  The city's huge. I bet we could find a place to rustle up something to eat.

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Uh, say, think I can I get one of them tasty-smelling  fishies?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, uh, yeah, sure.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, do you ... live in  that bush?

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Yes, presently that is what I do call home. Took me a while to procure a bush that beauteous.  This park is quite popular with all the vagabonds.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So there are a lot of you out here? I thought everyone in this city was "living it up".

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Hey, you've got a lot to learn, newcomer.  Welcome to Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Guard
transcript.text: Hey, you!  Stop! You can't fish here!

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: You best skedaddle!

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Are you tired of living under the tyranny of benders? Then join the Equalists!  For too long, the bending elite of this city  have forced nonbenders to live as lower class citizens. Join Amon, and together we will tear down the bending establishment.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you talking about?  Bending is the coolest thing in the world.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Oh yeah? Let me guess: you're a bender.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, I am.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Then I bet you'd just love to knock me off this platform with some waterbending, huh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm seriously thinking about it.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: This is what's wrong with this city! Benders like this girl only use their power to oppress us!

transcript.speaker: Crowd
transcript.text: Yeah! Get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? I'm not oppressing anyone!  You're ... you're oppressing yourselves!

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: That didn't even make sense.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Excuse me, I think I'm lost.  How do I get to Air Temple Island from here?

transcript.speaker: Old woman
transcript.text: Just head down this street.

transcript.speaker: Old woman
transcript.text: You should get moving, young lady.  It isn't safe.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Mr. Chung, please tell me that you have my money,  or else I can't guarantee I can protect your fine establishment.

transcript.speaker: Chung
transcript.text: I'm sorry, business has been slow. Please,  take one of my phonographs.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: My friend here is not a music lover.  Give me the money, or else -

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Or else what, hoodlum?

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Since you're obviously fresh off the boat, let me explain a couple things.  You're in Triple Threat Triad territory, and we're about to put you , in the hospital.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're the only ones who are gonna need a hospital  and, for your sake, I hope there's one nearby.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Who do you think you are?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why don't you come and find out?

transcript.speaker: Old woman
transcript.text: What just happened?

transcript.speaker: Young man
transcript.text: Did she just earthbend?

transcript.speaker: Old woman
transcript.text: Can she firebend, too?

transcript.speaker: Young man
transcript.text: Could she be?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Got an idea about who I am now , chumps?

transcript.speaker: Mushi
transcript.text: Come on!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're not getting away!

transcript.speaker: Metalbending cops
transcript.text: Police! Freeze where you are!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Cool! Metalbenders!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I caught the bad guys for you, officers.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Arrest them!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: You're under arrest, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do you mean I'm under arrest?  Those are the bad guys over there! They were smashing up a shop!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: From the looks of it, you smashed up a lot more than that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, you - you can't arrest me!  Let me explain!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: You can explain yourself all you like, down at headquarters.

transcript.speaker: Driver
transcript.text: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Let's see.  Multiple counts of destruction of private and city property,  not to mention evading arrest ...  You're in a whole mess of trouble, young lady.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But there were some thugs threatening a helpless shopkeeper, and I had it ...

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Can it!  You should have called the police and stayed out of the way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But I couldn't just sit by and do nothing. It's my duty to help people.  See, I'm the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Oh, I am well aware of who you are.  And your Avatar title might impress some people,  but not me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right, fine.  Then I want to talk to whoever's in charge.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You're talking to her. I'm Chief Beifong.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, Beifong? Lin Beifong?  You're Toph's daughter!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What of it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well then, why are you treating me like a criminal? Avatar Aang and your mother were friends. They saved the world together.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: That's ancient history.  And it's got diddly-squat to do with the mess you're in right now.  You can't just waltz in here and dole out vigilante justice like you own the place!

transcript.speaker: Metalbending cop
transcript.text: Chief,  Councilman Tenzin is here.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Let him in.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin, sorry ...  I got a little sidetracked on my way to see you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin, you are looking radiant as usual.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Cut the garbage, Tenzin. Why is the Avatar in Republic City? I thought you were supposed to be moving down to the South Pole to train her.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: My relocation has been delayed.  The Avatar, on the other hand, will be heading back to the South Pole immediately, where she will stay put.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But—

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: If you would be so kind as to  drop the charges against Korra, I will take full responsibility for today's regrettable events and cover all the damages.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Fine.  Get her out of my city.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Always a pleasure, Lin.  Let's go, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin, please,  don't send me back home.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You blatantly disobeyed my wishes and the orders of the White Lotus.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Katara agreed with me that I should come.  She said my destiny is in Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Don't bring my mother into this!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, I can't wait any longer to finish my training.  Being cooped up and hidden away from the world isn't helping me become a better Avatar.  I saw a lot of the city today, and it's totally out of whack. I understand now why you need to stay. Republic City does need you. But it needs me, too.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You ... ah ...

transcript.speaker: Ruffled police officer
transcript.text: Is this your polar bear dog, miss?

transcript.speaker: Meelo and Ikki
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Are you coming to live with us on the island?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I'm sorry, Ikki. I have to go home now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Wait.  I have done my best to guide Republic City toward the dream my father had for it, but you're right. It has fallen out of balance since he passed. I thought I should put off your training in order to uphold his legacy,  but you are his legacy.  You may stay and train airbending here with me.  Republic City needs its Avatar once again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes! Thank you! You're the best!

transcript.speaker: Meelo, Ikki, and Jinora
transcript.text: Yaaaaay!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hello?  I'm Korra,  your new Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Male journalist #1
transcript.text: Does this mean you've moved to Republic City?

transcript.speaker: Female journalist
transcript.text: Were you trying to send a message to the Triads yesterday?

transcript.speaker: Male journalist #2
transcript.text: Will you be fighting crime or the Anti-bending Revolution, or both?

transcript.speaker: Male journalist #3
transcript.text: Will you be working with Chief Beifong and the police?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh ... yes, I am definitely here to stay, but honestly I - I don't exactly have a plan yet.  See, I'm still in training, but, look, all I know is  Avatar Aang meant for this city to be the center of peace and balance in the world, and I believe we can make his dream a reality.  I look forward to serving you!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm so happy to be here. Thank you, Republic City!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: All right, that's all the questions the Av–

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: Amon, how do you want to handle this?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: So, the Avatar has arrived early.  It looks like we'll have to accelerate our plans.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Earth. Fire. Air. Water. Only the Avatar can master all four elements and bring balance to the world.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Republic City welcomes a new citizen into our arms. Avatar Korra! After years of seclusion in the South, this master of water, earth, and fire seeks to add airbending to her list of skills. And under the tutelage of Tenzin, Avatar Aang's son, she should go far. But will this cool, calm, collective master of air be able to tame this hotheaded teen?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And, in the final round, the Buzzard Wasps  w on with a decisive knockout!  What do you say we go to the arena tonight,  catch a few pro-bending matches?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That sport is a mockery of the noble tradition of bending.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Come on, Tenzin! I've dreamed about seeing a pro-bending match since I was a kid  and now I'm just a ferry ride away from  the arena.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, you're not here to watch that drivel. You're here to finish your Avatar training.  So, for the time being, I want you to remain on the island.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is that why you're keeping the White Lotus sentries around,  to watch my every move?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes. In order to learn airbending I believe you require a calm,  quiet environment, free from any distractions.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right,  you're the master.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: So, my mother informed me that  you've never been able to airbend before.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, but I don't know why. The other elements came so easily to me,  but every single time I've tried airbending-  nothing.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's perfectly all right. You just need to be patient.  Often the element that's the most difficult for the Avatar to master is the one most opposite to the Avatar's personality.  For Aang, it was earthbending.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah. Well, I'm about as opposite an airbender as you can get.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Let's begin your first lesson.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Korra's gonna airbend! Korra's gonna airbend!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What is that contraption?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: A time-honored tool that teaches the most fundamental aspect of airbending. Jinora, would you like to explain this exercise?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: The goal is to weave your way through the gates and make it to the other side without touching them.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Seems easy enough.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Jinora forgot to say that you have to make it through while the gates are spinning.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The key is to be like the leaf.  Flow with the movement of the gates.  Jinora will demonstrate.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Airbending is all about spiral movements. When you meet resistance, you must be able to switch direction at a moment's notice.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's do this!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Don't force your way through!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Dance! Dance like the wind!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Be the leaf!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Airbend!  What is wrong with me? Airbend!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Aargh!  Maybe I'm just not cut out to be an airbender, huh, Naga?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Ladies and gentlemen! I'm coming to you live from Republic City's Pro-bending Arena, where tonight the best in the world continue their quest  for a spot in the upcoming championship tournament.  Grab your snacks and grab your kids because this next match is gonna be a doozy!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: This Mako's got moxy! He advances, fires two quick shots.  Yomo is hammered back to zone three!  Clock is winding down, can Yomo hold on?  He's teetering on the edge of the ring now.  The Fire Ferrets line up to strik-

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, come down here please.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You shut it off at the best part!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I thought I made myself clear. I don't want you listening to this distracting nonsense.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But it's their radio. And technically, you said I couldn't watch a match.  You didn't say anything about listening to one.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You-  ... you know what I meant!  Anyway shouldn't y-? Shouldn't you be in bed by now?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think I'm doing it wrong.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: There's nothing to do. Let your mind and your spirit be free,  for air is the element of freedom.  Is something ... funny?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, you're telling me to embrace freedom, but you won't even let me listen to the radio. And forget about leaving this island!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Please, Korra.  Look at Meelo; he's able to meditate peacefully.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Actually, I think he's asleep.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What? Well, at least he has the relaxing part down.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whatever. None of this airbending stuff makes any sense to me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know you're frustrated, but these teachings will sink in over time. Then one day, they'll just click.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, it's not sinking in yet.  I'm gonna go get a glass of lychee juice.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, the meditation's not over yet!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Daddy, can I have some lychee juice too?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Toza
transcript.text: Hey,  what're you doin' in my gym?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh, I was just looking for a bathroom and I got lost.

transcript.speaker: Toza
transcript.text: Ah, the old "I had to pee" excuse!  You know, I'm sick and tired of you kids sneakin' in without payin'!  I'm taking you to security!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, wait!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: There you are! I've been looking everywhere for you!  It's all right Toza,  she's with me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, I'm with him.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, you see, we're together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, not together together, more like friends.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Right, friends.  No, no, I didn't mean to imply.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, you implied it.

transcript.speaker: Toza
transcript.text: Ah, I don't care what you are! I got work to do.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Rrright this way, miss.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And thank you, sir!  Seriously, thanks.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whaddya think? Best seats in the house, huh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whoa! Unbelievable!  This place is even more amazing than I imagined!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Name's Bolin, by the way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Psst,  Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I told you, you have to stop bringing your crazy fangirls in here before the matches. Get her out of here.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Come on, Mako! Right, look, I kinda promised her she could stay,  but man, I got a good feeling, there's somethin' special about her. I know it!  Come here, I want you to meet my brother, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako? Wow, I-I heard you playing on the radio.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, Bolin, we're up.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: ... or I could meet him later.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, sorry about that. My brother just gets real ... focused before a match.  Okay, I gotta go, wish me luck.  Not ... that I'll need it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Good luck.  Knock 'em out!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Introooooducing  the Fire Ferrets!

transcript.speaker: Fangirl
transcript.text: Aaaaaah! I love you, Bolin! Aaaaaah!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The rookie Ferrets came from out of nowhere  and have made it further than anyone expected this season.  But tonight, they face their toughest test yet, folks.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: And they're off! The two teams waste no time trying to blast each other out of zone one!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Hasook is the first to feel the heat of the Tigerdillos! He tries to return the favor, but they're too fast for him, while Mako shows off his trademark "cool under fire" style!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Oooh, the Tigerdillos score with a walloping one-two combo!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Can their teammate hold on to their zone one territory? Guess not!  Mako's over the line!  The Tigerdillos get the green light and advance into Ferret territory!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Come on, Ferrets!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Looks like Hasook's in trouble! He's in zone three teetering over the drink!  And Hasook takes a dip! He'll be back for round two!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Assuming the fabulous bending brothers can hold their ground until the next round.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.text: Round one goes to the  Golden Temple Tigerdillos!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, Hasook! Get your act together!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Fire Ferrets are knocked into zone two and the Tigerdillos advance!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Fire Ferrets cinch the round in the closing seconds! It's one apiece,  still anyone's match as we go into the third and final round!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Hasook stumbles, and now he tumbles right into his teammate!  He and Bolin better untangle quick if they don't want to ...  oh, too late!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, no!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: It's all up to Mako now!  He's bobbing and weaving! He's weaving and bobbing!  But he's not hitting back!  If Mako's knocked out, the Ferrets' fabulous season is over!  He is dancing on the edge of the ring, surviving the three on one barrage! It seems his plan is to let the Tigerdillos punch themselves out!  And his plan is working! Han is in the pool!  They've got nothing left in the tank and Mako is on the offensive!  It's two on one!  Scratch that, it's one on one, and it's an earth and fire slllugfest! There's so much smoke and dust from the firefight, I can't even see where the Fire Ferret is!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: It's a knockout! What a wing-dinger of a hat trick, folks!  Mako pulls off the upset of the season, winning the match for the Fire Ferrets!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Woohoo! Yes!  One more win and we're in the championship tournament!  So, what'd ya think, Korra? Bolin's got some moves, huh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What did I think? What did I think ? That was am​azing!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You did more harm than good out there. You almost cost us the match!

transcript.speaker: Hasook
transcript.text: We won, didn't we?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Barely!

transcript.speaker: Hasook
transcript.text: Get off my case, pal!  Ugh!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Useless.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You guys were incredible out there!  Especially you, Mr. Hat Trick!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Oh, you're still here?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, you're still a jerk?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ooh!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Anyway,  I've been immersed in bending my entire life, but I never learned how to move like that! It's like there's a whole new style here!  Think you could show me a few tricks?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ab-so-lutely!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Right now? Come on, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Just ignore him.  Yeah, I could show you the basics.  I'm just not sure how my earthbending would translate to your waterbending,  but we'll figure it out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Won't be a problem.  I'm actually an earthbender.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm sorry, no, no! I didn't mean to assume. 'Cause I, you know, I was just figuring ... with your Water Tribe getup ... that you are ... a Water Tribe ... gal.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nope, you're right. I'm a waterbender. And a firebender.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mm. Mm-hmm. I'm very confused right now.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're the Avatar,  and I'm an idiot.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Both are true.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No ... way .  Th​e Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right! Let's see what'cha got!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That was great! Good power! But in a real match, you'd be a sitting turtle duck.  Not so upright and flatfooted!  Stay light on your toes, right up until the moment when you need to dig in and strike. Then ...  pop, pop!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, let me try it again.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wow! Nice adjustment!  You're a natural at this.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Not bad.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's it take to impress this guy?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What? I said "not bad".  You know what, it's getting late.  I think I'm gonna turn in. You kids have fun.  Nice to meet you, Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, been a real pleasure.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: See ya upstairs, bro.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Upstairs?  You guys live here ?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yup. In the attic. It's nothin' fancy, but we have some great views!  So, back to bending. Why don't you throw that combo one more time?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Patience, Korra!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That was a two-thousand-year-old historical treasure!  What ...  What is wrong with you?!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's nothing wrong with m​e ! I've been practicing just like you taught me, but it isn't sinking in, okay?  It hasn't clicked like you said it would!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, this isn't something you can force. If you would only listen to me ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I have been! But you know what I think? Maybe the problem isn't me! Maybe the reason I haven't learned airbending yet is because  you're a terrible teacher!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yeah! You're a terrible teacher, Daddy!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Okay! Everyone here?  Wait. Where's Korra?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Honestly, Pema, I am at my wit's end with that girl! I ... I don't know how to get through to her!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Dear, the best thing you can do right now is to give Korra some space.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You must promise me that your teenage years won't be like this!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I will make no such promises.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I didn't miss your match, did I? You guys look like you lost already.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We might as well have.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hasook's a no-good no-show!

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: You got two minutes to come out ready to play, or you're disqualified.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, there goes our shot at the tournament ... and the winnings.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Can't you ask one of those guys to fill in?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Nah. The rules say you can only compete on one team.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, then ...  how about me? I'm a top-notch waterbender,  if I do say so myself.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But, you're the Avatar.  Isn't that cheating?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It isn't cheating if I only do waterbending.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No way. I'd rather forfeit than look like a fool out there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wow, thanks for the vote of confidence.

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Time's up. You in or out?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We're in!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We are?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey, I didn't agree to this!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You can thank me later.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This girl is crazy.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Looks like the Fire Ferrets have ferreted out a last minute replacement waterbender.  Let's see if she's another diamond in the rough like the brothers from the school of hard knocks!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't do anything too fancy or aggressive.  In fact, don't do anything. Just try not to get knocked off the ring.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You got it, captain .

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Players! Are you ready?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Woohoo! Man overboard!

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Fire Ferret waterbender, penalty! Move back one zone!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? Why?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're only allowed to knock players off the back of the ring! Not over the sides!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh. Whoops.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: And we're back in action after that hiccup, but I'm not so sure this replacement player knows what she's doing.

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Foul! Over the line! Move back to zone three!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Urgh!  I'll show you over the line!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Platypus Bears take round one!  The Platypus Bears know a green player when they see one, and they are focusing the brunt of their bending on this poor girl!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Wait a minute! Did that waterbender just earthbend ?

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Foul! I ... think.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Did I see that right?  Hold on, folks, we're just waiting for the referee's official call, but ...  I-I think this replacement player could be ... no, there's no way!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Pardon me, everyone, have you seen Korra this evening? She's not in her room.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: You've gotta be kidding me!  She's the Avatar , folks!  Playing in a pro-bending match!  Can you believe that?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'll get her myself!

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: The Avatar will be permitted to continue so long as she solely bends water!

transcript.speaker: Platypus Bears
transcript.text: Awww!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: This girl may be the Avatar, but she's no pro-bender and the Platypus Bears are intent on exploiting that weakness!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: They're giving her their best, and her best ain't good enough to stop it!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Aaaaand she's in the drink.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, hey, Tenzin. I thought you didn't like coming to these matches.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Once again, you have flagrantly disobeyed my orders. You were to stay on the island! Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! I'm kind of in the middle of something.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I have tried my very best to get through to you by being gentle and patient,  but clearly the only thing you respond to is force! So I am ordering you to come back to the temple right now !

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why? So I can sit around and meditate about how bad I am at airbending?  You know, I'm beginning to think there's a reason I haven't been able to learn it! Because, maybe, I don't even need it!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What? That is a ludicrous suggestion!  The Avatar needs to learn airbending! It is not optional!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! This is what I need to learn! Modern styles of fighting!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Being the Avatar isn't all about fighting, Korra!  When will you learn that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I have a match to go finish.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: The Platypus Bears win round two!  Round three!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Platypus Bears come out of the gate and quickly go after the Ferret brothers! They're corralled in the corner, wedged in the edge of zone one, unable to come to the Avatar's rescue! And boy, does she need it!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Looks like the Avatar's pro-bending debut is going to be cut short! She's been pushed back to zone three, and the water is calling her name!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: It's only a matter of time before ...

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Hold the phone! Stop the presses! She's still in the game, folks! And she's moving like an entirely different player! All of a sudden, the Platypus Bears' strikes are only striking air!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How about that?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Platypus Bears have no juice left, but Mako and Bolin are still fresh and juicy!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Knockout!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Woohoo!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Fire Ferrets come from waaay behind and steal the win!  What an upset, folks! The rookies, Avatar in tow,  have nabbed a place in the championship tournament! I can not believe it!

transcript.speaker: Korra and Bolin
transcript.text: Hahaha, yeah! Yes!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra ... what can I say? You really came alive in that last round. The way you dodged their attacks ... you are a natural.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks, but I can't take all the credit.  Someone else taught me those moves.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm really sorry ... about everything I said.  I was really frustrated with myself,  and I took it out on you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I think I owe you an apology too. I was trying to teach you about patience, but I lost mine.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No hard feelings?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Of course not. By the way, you were really good out there tonight.  You moved just like an airbender!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait ...  You stayed and watched?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I did. Pro-bending turned out to be the perfect teaching tool for you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll see you tomorrow for airbending practice, bright and early!  And, by the way, I kinda permanently joined the Fire Ferrets and we're playing in the tournament in a couple of weeks!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: A chance encounter turns Korra from pro-bending spectator to pro-bending star. With her new teammates, Mako and Bolin, the Fire Ferrets earn a place in the championship tournament. But meanwhile, an anti-bending revolution brews in Republic City. Who are the Equalists? And what nefarious plan does the mysterious man behind the mask have in store for our hero?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's the big idea with making me train this early in the morning?  The morning is evil .

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We're the rookies,  so we get the worst time slot in the gym.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And you're the rookiest of us all. We gotta get you up to speed if we wanna survive in the tournament.  Deal with it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You deal with it!

transcript.speaker: Butakha
transcript.text: There are my little hard-working street urchins.  It's an honor to finally meet you, Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And you are ...?

transcript.speaker: Butakha
transcript.text: Butakha. I run this whole pro-bending shebang.  Here's your winnings from the last match.  Ah ah ah, not so fast.  First, you owe me for the Avatar's new gear,  gym and equipment rentals from last month,  rent on your apartment,  and a personal loan for groceries.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What?  I'm a growing boy!

transcript.speaker: Butakha
transcript.text: Oh, and one more small item of business: The Fire Ferrets need to ante up thirty thousand yuans for the championship pot.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Thirty thousand yuans?!

transcript.speaker: Butakha
transcript.text: Sorry, kids. You got 'til the end of the week to come up with the dough, or else, you're out of the tournament.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You wouldn't happen to have a secret Avatar bank account overflowing with gold, would you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I got nothing.  I've never really needed money.  I've always had people taking care of me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Then I wouldn't say you have nothing .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry, I didn't mean —

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, it's all right. It's just  ever since we lost our parents, we've been on our own.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm so sorry. I didn't know.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So, anyway ,  how are we gonna come up with the money?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, oh, I got it!  I got it!  I've been training Pabu to do circus tricks. Now people would pay good money to see that!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, Bolin.  We need serious ideas.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I was serious.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't worry about it. I'll figure something out. I always do.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Come one, come all.  See Pabu the fantastic fire ferret as he crosses the Ladder of Peril,  upside down!  Psst, psst.  Big finish, buddy. Stick the landing.  Ta da!  Thank you, ladies and gentlemen! You are too kind! Seriously, too kind! You can come back here and put money right in this-  Okay, that's fine, that's fine.  One yuan down, 29,999 to go.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: Hey, Bolin. Is that you?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, hey there, Shady Shin.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: Heard you're a big time pro-bending player now. Not bad.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, thanks.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: So listen. I got an offer for ya. Lightning Bolt Zolt is lookin' to hire some extra muscle.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, I don't know, Shin. Mako told me to stay away from the Triple Threats.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: Pfuh, your brother ain't the boss of you.  It's just a little security work. Nothin' crooked.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: You game?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bo, I'm back!  Picked up your favorite dumplings!  Hey, I found some work down at the power plant.  Made some decent money.  Bolin?  You here, bro?  Huh, I bet the little lovebird is making a house call.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Good. Light on your feet!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ooh, he's cute .  Korra, is that the  handsome firebender boy that drives you crazy?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Does he drive you crazy in a bad way,  or does he drive you crazy like you like him?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ahem. Oh. Hey, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You seen Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nice to see you, too.  And no.  I haven't seen him since practice. Think something's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know.  Bolin has a knack for getting into stupid situations.  See you later.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait.  I could, uh ... help you look for him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Nah. I got it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hey, cool guy, let me help you.  We can take Naga.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Who's Naga?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: My best friend. And a great tracker.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Your best friend is a ... polar bear dog.  Somehow, that makes perfect sense.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll take that as a compliment, city boy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, this is his usual hangout.  You guys seen my brother around here today?

transcript.speaker: Skoochy
transcript.text: Perhaps. My memory's a little ..."foggy".  Maybe you can help "clear it up".

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're good, Skoochy.  Humph, a real pro.

transcript.speaker: Skoochy
transcript.text: Yeah, I seen him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: When?

transcript.speaker: Skoochy
transcript.text: About noon.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What was he doing?

transcript.speaker: Skoochy
transcript.text: H-he was performing  some kind of monkey rat circus. And then ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And then what? Why did he leave?

transcript.speaker: Skoochy
transcript.text: Shady Shin showed up and flashed some serious cash.  Bo took off with him in his hot rod.  The Triple Threats? The Red Monsoons? The Agni Kais? All the triads are muscling up for something real big. Now that's all you're getting outta me!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's he talking about?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sounds like there's a turf war brewing.  And Bolin's about to get caught right in the middle of it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So where're we headed?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The Triple Threat Triad's headquarters. Hopefully Bolin's there and nothing's gone down yet.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The Triple Threat Triad? I beat up some of those yahoos when I got into town. Why would Bolin get tangled up wit —

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whoa, Naga!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's Pabu!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, Naga! Pabu's a friend, not a snack.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We gotta hurry.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Something's not right.  There're usually thugs posted out front. We better be cautious.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin? You in here?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga, come!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ugh, I can't bend.  I can't bend!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Calm down, it'll wear off.  Those guys were chi-blockers.  They're Amon's henchmen.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Amon?  That anti-bending guy with a mask?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, he's the leader of the Equalists.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do they want with the Triple Threats?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Whatever it is,  can't be good.  Urgh, can't believe Bolin got himself into this mess!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako,  we are going to save your brother.  I promise you that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We've been out all night.  No sign of him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We've gotta keep looking. But where?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Huh!  I have an idea!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The first day I got into town, I ran into an Equalist protester  over there.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And you think they'll know where Bolin is?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's our only lead right now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, why is Bolin running around with the Triple Threat Triad, anyway?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, we ... we used to do some work for them back in the day.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? Wha- Are you some kind of criminal?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No! You don't know what you're talking about. I just ran numbers for them and stuff. We were orphans out on the street; I did what I had to do to survive and protect my little brother.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry. It must have been really hard.  Can I ask what happened to your parents?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They were mugged, by a firebender. He cut them down right in front of me. I was eight.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin's the only family I have left. If anything happened to him ...

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Equality now! Equality now!  We want equality now!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I-I ... er ... eheh, humn, hmmehem.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Nonbenders of Republic City ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's the guy.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Amon calls you to action! Take back your city! It's time for the ...  It's you again!  You cannot silence me, Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Shut your yapper and listen up. My friend got kidnapped by some chi-blockers. Where'd they take him?

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, I think you do.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: "Witness the Revelation tonight, nine o' clock".  What's this "Revelation"?

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Nothing that concerns the likes of you two!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You better believe it concerns us. Spill it.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: No one knows what the Revelation is! And I have no idea what happened to your friend.  But if he's a bender, then my bet is he's getting what's coming to him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Where's it happening?

transcript.speaker: Policeman
transcript.text: Hey! What's going on over there?

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: The Avatar's oppressing us. Help!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's scram.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why didn't the Equalists put a location on these?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Probably because they don't want just anyone waltzing in to their big  "Revelation",  whatever that is.  I bet the information is hidden on here somehow. Look at the backs.  There's four different images.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So,  it's a puzzle?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, of a map!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bingo.  That must be where it's going down.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This is the place.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll attract less attention this way.

transcript.speaker: Doorman
transcript.text: This is a private event. No one gets in without an invitation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh ... invitation?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You mean this?

transcript.speaker: Doorman
transcript.text: The Revelation is upon us, my brother and sister.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I knew a lot of people hated benders, but I've never seen so many in one place.  Keep your eyes out for Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.text: Please welcome your hero,  your savior ... Amon!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: My quest for equality began many years ago.  When I was a boy, my family and I lived on a small farm. We weren't rich, and none of us were benders.  This made us very easy targets for the firebender who extorted my father.  One day, my father confronted this man, but when he did,  that firebender took my family from me. Then, he took my face.  I've been forced to hide behind a mask ever since.  As you know, the Avatar has recently arrived in Republic City.  And if she were here,  she would tell you that bending brings balance to the world. But, she is wrong. The only thing bending has brought to the world, is suffering.  It has been the cause of every war in every era.  But that is about to change.  I know you have been wondering, "What is the Revelation?"  You are about to get your answer.  Since the beginning of time,  the spirits have acted as guardians of our world, and they have spoken to me.  They say the Avatar has failed humanity.  That is why the spirits have chosen me to usher in a new era of balance. They have granted me a power  that will make Equality a reality. The power to take a person's bending away.  Permanently.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's impossible.  There's no way.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This guy's insane!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Now, for a demonstration. Please welcome, Lightning Bolt Zolt.  Leader of the Triple Threat Triad, and one of the most notorious criminals in Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Lightning Bolt Zolt
transcript.text: Ah, boo yourself!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wait, we can't fight them all. We need to be smart about this.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Then come up with a game plan,  "Team Captain".

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Zolt has amassed a fortune by extorting and abusing nonbenders.  But his reign of terror is about to come to an end.  Now, in the interest of fairness,  I will give Zolt the chance to fight to keep his bending.

transcript.speaker: Lightning Bolt Zolt
transcript.text: You're gonna regret doing that, pal.

transcript.speaker: Lightning Bolt Zolt
transcript.text: Wha ... what did you do to me?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Your firebending is gone. Forever.  The era of bending is over. A new era of Equality has begun!

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: No! Ugh!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Any ideas yet?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I think so, see those machines?  They're powered by water and steam. If you create some cover, I can grab Bolin  without anyone seeing. Then, we duck out of here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Works for me.  Mako, good luck.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's not enough.

transcript.speaker: Doorman
transcript.text: Hey, you!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is there a problem, my brother?

transcript.speaker: Doorman
transcript.text: What are you doing back here?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh ... looking for the bathroom?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks. This should be enough.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, hello, Amon, sir.  I think there's been a big misunderstanding.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, you all right?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes!  Mako! I love you!

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: You benders need to understand, there's no place in the world for you anymore.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I wouldn't count us out just yet.  Naga!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hah ... Oh ... Yah ... Stop ... I want ... to be ... on ... your back ... please!

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: The Avatar. That's her!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Let her go.  She's the perfect messenger to tell the city of my power.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank goodness.  I was just about to send out a search party.  Are you all right?  Korra, what happened? Did you find your friend?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, but ...  I was at an Equalist rally.  I saw Amon.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He can take people's bending away.  For good.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's ...  that's impossible. Only the Avatar has ever possessed that ability.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But I saw him do it.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I believe you.  I don't know how Amon has achieved this power, but this means the revolution is more dangerous than ever.  No bender is safe.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Benders be on alert. After coming face to face with Amon, leader of the Equalists, Avatar Korra discovers a terrifying truth: this masked mad man has the ability to take away a person's bending, permanently. Benders of Republic City are counting on their young Avatar. But is she prepared to face such a frightening foe?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: After I take your bending away, you will be nothing.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's ... it's all right, Naga. I just had a bad dream.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: There is a madman running around our beloved city, threatening to tear it apart. We need to create a task force whose sole mission is to find Amon and bring him to justice.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Absolutely not. A move that aggressive would only further divide benders and nonbenders.

transcript.speaker: Fire Nation councilwoman
transcript.text: Tarrlok, I'm inclined to agree with your proposal, but who would even  head up such a task force?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: It would be my honor and privilege to accept such a duty.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is just another one of your ploys to gain more power, isn't it?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: All I'm trying to do is help. Think back, forty-two years ago, Republic City was threatened by another dangerous man. Yakone.  Your father wasn't afraid to deal with him head-on.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This.. is a completely different situation ...  and how dare you compare yourself to Avatar Aang!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Amon is not going to stop with the bending triads.  Eventually, he will come for all us benders. Our friends, our families. Vote for this task force and I will stop Amon before it's too late. All in favor?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Good evening, my fellow Equalists.  This is your leader, Amon.  As you have heard, the Republic Council has voted to make me public enemy number one, proving once again that the bending  oppressors of this city will stop at nothing to quash our revolution. But we cannot be stopped. Our numbers grow stronger by the day. You no longer have to live in fear.  The time has come for benders to experience fear.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Oh, no!  I'm so sorry. I didn't see you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How could you not see me? I mean I was ju-juu ...  uh, I was ... I- I ... wow.  I was ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you okay? Did I hurt you? Ugh, I'm such an idiot.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't worry, I'm fine. My brother hits me harder than that every day in practice.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Wait, I recognize you. You're Mako, right? You play for the Fire Ferrets.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, that's me.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I am so embarrassed.  My name is Asami. Let me make this up to you somehow. Uh, how about I treat you to dinner? Tomorrow night, eight o' clock, Kwong's Cuisine.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, Kwong's? I don't have any clothes nice enough for a place that classy.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'll take care of that. All you need to do is show up.  So ... it's a date?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, yeah, I guess so. I'll see you tomorrow night.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We are grateful for this delicious food, for happiness, for compassion, and ...

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I'm not interrupting, am I?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is my home, Tarrlok. We're about to eat dinner.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Good, because I am absolutely famished.  Airbenders never turn away a hungry guest, am I right?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I suppose.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Ah, you must be the famous Avatar Korra. It is truly an honor.  I am Councilman Tarrlok, representative from the Northern Water Tribe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nice to meet you.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Why do you have three ponytails?  And how come you smell like a lady? You're weird.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Well aren't you ... precocious?  So, I've been reading all about your adventures in the papers. Infiltrating Amon's rally, now that took some real initiative.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, thanks. I think you're the first authority figure in the city who's happy I'm here.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Republic City is much better off now that you've arrived.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Enough with the flattery, Tarrlok. What do you want from Korra?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Patience, Tenzin. I'm getting to that.  As you may have heard, I am assembling a task force that will strike at the heart of the revolution and I want you to join me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Really?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What?!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I need someone who will help me attack Amon directly, someone who is fearless in the face of danger.  And that someone is you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Join your task force? I can't.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I must admit, I'm rather surprised. I thought you'd jump at the chance to help me lead the charge against Amon.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Me, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I came to Republic City to finish my Avatar training with Tenzin. Right now, I just need to focus on that.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Which is why this opportunity is perfect. You would get on the job experience while performing your Avatar duty for the city.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra gave you her answer. It's time for you to go.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Very well.  But,  I'm not giving up on you just yet.  You'll be hearing from me soon.  It has been a pleasure, Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Bye-bye, ponytail man!

transcript.speaker: Server
transcript.text: Ah, welcome to Kwong's Cuisine, Master Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, "Master"?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The scarf stays.

transcript.speaker: Server
transcript.text: As you wish, sir.  This way please.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I am such a big pro-bending fan. I caught all of your matches this season.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All of them? Wow. Honestly, I wish there were a few you hadn't seen.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Oh, don't be ridiculous, you're amazing. I can't wait to see you play in the tournament.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, well, ah, maybe next year.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What do you mean? You made it in.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It just isn't in the cards for us right now.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Tell me.  What's the problem?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We don't have the cash to ante up for the championship pot. So, it looks like we're out of the running.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: That's not fair.

transcript.speaker: Server
transcript.text: Pardon me, Ms. Sato.  Your main course.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ms. Sato? You wouldn't happen to be related to Hiroshi Sato, creator of the Satomobile?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Yeah. He's my dad.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get out of town!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm serious.  You want to meet him?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Meet the most successful captain of industry in all of Republic City? Yeah, I'll take you up on that.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hello, fellow teammate!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hey, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Missed you at practice this week.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, sorry about that.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Nah, that's all right. We're probably out of the tournament anyways unless some money miraculously drops out of the sky by tomorrow. Anyways, the reason I came by was to give you this.  Ta-da!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wow, thanks.  What's this for?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, oh I can't remember now. Oh yeah, now I remember. You saved me from Amon!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, that?  It was no big deal.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No big deal, are you serious? I was totally freaking out when he was coming at me with his creepy mask all, "I will take away your bending forever."  I mean that is.. scary stuff; I still can't sleep well.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mhmm.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: Delivery for Avatar Korra.  Tarrlok sends his compliments and urges you to reconsider his offer.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tell him I haven't changed my mind.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: Mhmm ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Who's this Tarrlok guy? Is he bothering you? Huh, 'cause I could have a word with him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Heh, no it's not like that. He's just some old guy who works with Tenzin on the council.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, good. Good, that sounds better. I like that better.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: What do you think of my little operation here?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's very impressive, Mr. Sato.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Please, call me Hiroshi. So, I understand you're dirt poor.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, well ...

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Young man, it is nothing to be ashamed of. I too came from humble beginnings. Why, when I was your age, I was a mere shoe-shiner, and all I had to my name was an idea; the Satomobile.  Now, I was fortunate enough to meet someone who believed in me and my work ethic. He gave me the money I needed to get my idea off the ground and I built the entire Future Industries empire from that one selfless loan.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dad, stop bragging. Just tell Mako the good news.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What good news?

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Well, my daughter passionately told me all about your hard earned success in the Pro-bending Arena. And about your team's current  financial stumbling block. Now, I'd hate to see you lose your chance at winning the championship just because you're short a few yuans. That's why I'm going to sponsor the Fire Ferrets in the tournament.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you serious?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: He's serious. My dad's going to cover your ante for the championship pot.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Tha-that is good news.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: There's just one catch. You all have to wear the Future Industries logo on your uniforms.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'll tattoo it on my chest if you want, sir.  Thank you both so much.  I promise the Fire Ferrets will make the most of this opportunity.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Out of the way Daddy, we're driving here!  Beeeeeeep beebeebeeeeep!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Beep-beep.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I see Tarrlok's gifts are getting more and more extravagant.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, that guy doesn't know how to take "no" for an answer.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, are you ... doing all right?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, I'm fine.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Why don't you take a break?  I'm glad you turned down Tarrlok, but I just want to make sure your decision was for the right reason.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm just really focused on my airbending right now is all.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Right, that's what you said. You know, it's okay to be scared. The whole city is frightened by what's been going on. The important thing is to talk about our fears, because if we don't, they can throw us out of balance.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm always here for you, if you want to talk.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: Avatar Korra! I have something for you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It doesn't matter how many gifts Tarrlok sends, I am no​t joining his task force.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: It's not a gift, it's an invitation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: To what?

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: Tarrlok is throwing a gala in your honor.  All of Republic City's movers and shakers will be there. The councilman humbly requests your attendance.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't believe this is all for me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm not sure what Tarrlok's plotting, but keep your guard up. It's not like him to throw a party just for the fun of it.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: So glad you could make it, Avatar Korra.  If you'd excuse us, the city awaits its hero.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Meelo! No, that's not a toilet! Oh dear.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Korra, it's my pleasure to introduce Republic City's most famous industrialist, Hiroshi Sato.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nice to meet you.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: We're all expecting great things from you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Right,  greatness.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey, Korra!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: This is my daughter, Asami.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's lovely to meet you. Mako's told me so much about you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Really? Because he hasn't mentioned you at all. How did you two meet?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Asami crashed into him on her moped.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? Are you okay?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm fine. More than fine. Mister Sato agreed to sponsor our team; we're back in the tournament!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hehe, isn't that great?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, terrific.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Chief Beifong, I believe you and Avatar Korra have already met.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Just because the city's throwing you this big to-do,  don't think you're something special.  You've done absolutely nothing to deserve this.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: If you'd be so kind, they just have a couple of questions.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But ...

transcript.speaker: Reporter #1
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, you witnessed Amon take away people's bending firsthand. How serious a threat does he pose to the innocent citizens of Republic City?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think he presents a real problem.

transcript.speaker: Reporter #2
transcript.text: Then why have you refused to join Tarrlok's task force? As the Avatar, shouldn't you be going after Amon?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I ...

transcript.speaker: Reporter #2
transcript.text: Why are you backing away from this fight?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? No! I've never backed away from anything in my life!

transcript.speaker: Reporter #3
transcript.text: You promised to serve this city, aren't you going back on that promise now?

transcript.speaker: Reporter #4
transcript.text: Do you think pro-bending is more important than fighting the revolution?

transcript.speaker: Reporter #5
transcript.text: How do you think Avatar Aang would have handled this?

transcript.speaker: Reporter #2
transcript.text: Are you afraid of Amon?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am not afraid of anybody! If the city needs me then ...  I'll join Tarrlok's task force and help fight Amon.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: There's your headline, folks.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: My fellow task force deputies, tonight we will execute a raid on an underground chi-blocker training camp located in the Dragon Flats borough. According to my sources, there is a cellar underneath this bookstore,  where Equalists train chi-blocking in secret.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm going after those two.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nice timing. Thanks, Tarrlok.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: We make a good team, Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, we do.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No Korra for practice again?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Doesn't look like it.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
