transcript.text: Avatar Korra has bravely answered the call to action. With the two of us leading the charge, Republic City has nothing to fear from Amon and the Equalists.

transcript.speaker: Female reporter
transcript.text: Question for the Avatar!  Amon remains at large. Why have you failed to locate him?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You want to know why? Because Amon is hiding in the shadows like a coward.  Amon, I challenge you to a duel! No task force, no chi-blockers, just the two of us tonight at midnight on Avatar Aang Memorial Island. Let's cut to the chase and settle this thing, if you're man enough to face me.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I know it sounds weird to say this, but I'm really glad I hit you with my moped.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, me too.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I forgot to ask. Why didn't you accept the new silk scarf I bought for you last week? You didn't like it?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, it was really nice, but this scarf was my father's. And it's all I have left of him. I just feel like ...  Like it keeps me safe.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm so sorry. I lost my mother when I was very young.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I feel so safe with you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, this is madness.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't try to stop me and don't follow me. I have to face Amon alone.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is all your doing!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I tried to talk her out of it too, but she's made up her mind.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: We'll be watching the island closely. If anything goes wrong, I have a fleet of police airships ready to swoop down.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Guess you're a no-show, Amon. Who's scared now?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I received your invitation, young Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Our showdown, while inevitable, is premature. Although it would be the simplest thing for me to take away your bending right now, I won't. You'd only become a martyr.  Benders of every nation would rally behind your untimely demise,  but I assure you, I have a plan. And I'm saving you for last, then you'll get your duel, and I will destroy you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Aang?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra!  Korra, are you all right? What happened? Was Amon here?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, he ambushed me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Did he ... did he take your bending away?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I'm okay.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Ah, thank goodness.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I was so terrified, I felt so helpless.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's all right, the nightmare is over.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You ... you were right ... I've been scared this whole time.  I've never felt like this before and ... and Tenzin, I don't know what to do!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Admitting your fears is the first and most difficult step in overcoming them.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Love is in the air! Since Avatar Korra has arrived in Republic City she's only had eyes for one fellow: Mako. The feeling seemed mutual until a fateful accident intervened. Now Mako's affections have fallen right into the arms of the beautiful Asami. Will love prove to be Korra's most formidable foe yet?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's been great having you at so many back-to-back practices, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Feels good to be back, although  Tarrlok isn't too happy about my leave of absence.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, you joined the Fire Ferrets before you joined his task force.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, come on, team huddle time!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's our first match of the tournament tonight. I know the three of us haven't been a team for very long, but even so, the Fire Ferrets have never been this good. Are we ready?

transcript.speaker: Korra and Bolin
transcript.text: We're ready!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Not quite, you'll need these.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey, Asami.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Good morning, sweetie.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: These new uniforms look great!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You look great, champ!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, teammates, I'll see you before the match tonight. Asami and I have a lunch date.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, we'll check you guys later, you know, we'll see you when we see ya.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, Korra. There they go, here we are, all alone in the gym, just you and me, two alone people. Together. Alone.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ah, I gotta head back to the air temple to train with Tenzin. See ya!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Work with me here, Pabu! You wanna look spic and span in your new uniform, don't you?  So, what do you think of Korra, in a "girlfriend" sort of way?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: She's great! But I think it makes more sense for me to go for Asami.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I was talking about a girlfriend for me! Leave some ladies for the rest of us!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know, that's what I thought you meant.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well ...?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know, Bo. It doesn't seem like a good idea for you to date Korra.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You just said she was great two seconds ago.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, Korra is a great athlete and the Avatar and stuff, but I don't know if she's really "girlfriend material". She's more like a pal.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Bro, you're nuts! Korra and I are perfect for each other: she's strong, I'm strong; she's fun, I'm fun; she's beautiful, I'm gorgeous ! Okay, I don't care what you think, I'm gonna ask Korra out.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Look, it just isn't smart to date a teammate, especially during the tournament. Keep your head out of the clouds and your priorities straight, okay?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah, I know, gah.  You know what I'm talking about, Pabu, I'm talking about real love .

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: So, how's it going with the tall, dreamy firebender boy? You've been spending a lot of time together lately.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Oooh, yeah! Tell us all about the magical romance.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What?  Listen to you two, I-I'm not interested in Mako or any romantic stuff.  Besides he's all into that prissy, beautiful, elegant, rich girl ... but let's just pretend for a second I am interested in him. What would I do?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ooh! I just read a historical saga where the heroine fell in love with the enemy general's son, who's supposed to marry the princess. You should do what she did!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tell me!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: She rode a dragon into battle and burned down the entire country .  Then she jumped into a volcano. It was so romantic!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uhh ...

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: No, no, no!  The best way to win a boy's heart is to brew a love potion of rainbows and sunsets that makes true lovers sprout wings and fly into a magical castle in the sky, where they get married and eat clouds with spoons and use stars as ice cubes in their moonlight punch. Forever and ever and ever!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The volcano is starting to make more sense to me now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, hey Pema. Uh, how long were you standing there?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Long enough. But trust me, I know what you're going through. Years ago I was in the exact the same situation, with Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Daddy was in love with someone else before you?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: That's right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So what did you do?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Well, for the longest time, I did nothing. I was so shy and scared of rejection, but watching my soul mate spend his life with the wrong woman became too painful. So I hung my chin out there and I confessed my love to Tenzin. And the rest is history.

transcript.speaker: Korra, Ikki, and Jinora
transcript.text: Wooow!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Folks, after a year of waiting the Pro-bending Championship is finally here. Tonight is the first set of matches in our single elimination sixteen team bracket. And I gotta tell ya, these are the most tenacious and talented bending trios this arena has ever seen.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Introducing our first team, the Future Industries Fire Ferrets!  And their opponents, the Red Sands Rabaroos!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: What an explosive opening volley. Both teams quickly recover and unleash a barrage of bending. I am astonished with the level of improvement displayed here by the Fire Ferrets. No wonder the Avatar has been absent from the papers lately. She's obviously had her nose to the grindstone in the gym. The Ferrets advance into Rabaroo territory and are holding nothing back. Nice sprawl there by Mako. Bolin strikes, Ula dodges, and all three Rabaroos are down. The Fire Ferrets easily take round one!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round two!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Rabaroos are looking for payback and they go straight after Bolin. Korra comes to his defense and water-whacks Umi back into zone two! The Ferrets are on fire tonight and they win round two.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round three!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: With the Rabaroos down two rounds they'll need a knockout to win, and with the way the Fire Ferrets are playing I don't see that happening. These Ferrets are working together like a well-oiled bending machine. Bolin passes Adi back into zone two and the Ferrets get the green light to advance. The Rabaroos are just fighting to stay at their feet at this point. Out goes Adi, and Ula, and Umi!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: All three rounds go to the Future Industries Fire Ferrets to win the opening match of the tournament!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's what I'm talking about!  Thank you, thank you very much! Thank you all you fans!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wow, we were really connecting out there in that ring.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah! You know, I feel like the two of us have been connecting really well out of the ring, too.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, sure.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, I was thinking we should spend some time together.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Oh, we've been spending lots of time together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I mean outside of the gym, and not while searching for kidnapped family members or fighting chi-blockers.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know. Asami and I have —

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, I really like you and I think we are meant for each other!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, I'm really sorry, but I just don't feel the same way about you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Forget I ever said anything ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Congratulations, guys! You were so amazing out there.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, Korra, I was thinking, you and me, we could get some dinner together, sort of a date situation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, that's really sweet, but I don't think so. I don't feel very date -worthy.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Are you kidding me? You're the smartest, funniest, toughest, buffest, talentedest, incrediblest girl in the world!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You really feel that way about me?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I felt that way since the moment I saw you! Trust me, I know we're gonna have so much fun together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You know what? I could use some fun. Okay, sure!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes! Who's the luckiest guy in the world? Right here, Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, how do you like it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hmm, it's delicious and totally authentic! I didn't realize how much I missed Water Tribe grub.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's great, 'cause this is my favorite joint. See? You love Water Tribe food, I love Water Tribe food, just another reason we are so great together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: They are good noodles! Hey, who's that creepy guy over there who keeps glaring at us?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's Tahno and the Wolfbats, the reigning champs, three years running. Don't make eye contact.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh-oh, here he comes. Now don't mess with this guy, he's a nasty dude.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Well, well, well, if it isn't the Fire Ferrets. Pro-bending's saddest excuse for a team. Tell me, how did a couple of amateurs like you luck your way into the tournament? Especially you, Uh-vatar. You know, if you'd like to learn how a real pro bends, I could give you some private lessons.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You wanna go toe-to-toe with me, pretty boy?

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Go for it. I'll give you the first shot.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Korra, don't. He's just trying to bait you. If you hit him, we're out of the tournament.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whoa, ho, ho, I've never seen someone harass Tahno like that. You are one of a kind, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What kind of game are you playing?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh ... Pro-bending? We've got the quarterfinal match.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I mean with Bolin. You've got him all in a tizzy and I know you're only using him to get back at me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am not, we're just having fun together. What do you care, anyway?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm looking out for my little brother. I don't want to see his heart get broken.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait a second ... you're not worried about him, you're jealous! You do have feelings for me!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What? Jealous? Don't be ridiculous.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Admit it! You like me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I'm with Asami.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, but when you're with her you're thinking about me, aren't you?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get over yourself!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm just being honest.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're crazy!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're a liar!

transcript.speaker: Random stranger
transcript.text: Hey Mako-! Oh ...

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Eight teams have been eliminated and eight advance into the quarter finals, which get underway way tonight. The rookies are about to take on the former and longest-reigning champs, the Boar-q-pines. Youth clashes against experience in a battle for the ages, or rather of the ages.  Korra dodges and, ooh , slams right into her teammate! Down goes Mako and Bolin and Korra!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round one goes to the Boar-q-pines!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You were supposed to defend while I attacked!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I had an opening so I took it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What is up with you two? All right, whatever, just pull together, guys.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Ferrets looking to mount some offense here in round two. Bolin lets fly a flurry of attacks, he's a one-man bending battalion. The Ferrets are having a rough time finding their rhythm tonight, but thanks to Bolin, they narrowly notch round two. Not sure what's eating them, but this is not the same team who took out the Rabaroos.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round three is a tie! We go to a tie-breaker to decide the match.

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: The Fire Ferrets win the coin toss!  Which element do you choose?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I got this.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I know you usually handle these, but frankly, your head's not in the game. I'm gonna take this one.  We choose earth.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Looks like the earthbenders will collide in the tie-breaker face-off. Bolin goes in for the grapple, Chang reverses. Bolin strikes from midair, knocking Chang to the edge of the circle. Another strike from Bolin, and Chang is in the drink!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: The Future Industries Fire Ferrets win their quarterfinal match!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Oh, that was a close one folks! Youth trumps experience tonight.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need to talk. Look, sometimes you can be so infuriating. But I —

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Save your breath. You've already made it clear how you feel about me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I haven't. What I'm trying to say is: as much as you drive me crazy, I also think you're pretty amazing.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So you do like me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes, but, I like Asami, too. I don't know, things are complicated. I've been feeling really confused and —

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, this isn't what you think!  Great, look at what you did!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're blaming me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You kissed me!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You kissed me back!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well played, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Morning, Narook. My brother here?  Thanks.  Come on. Wake up. Taking you home, bro.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Don't call me that. You're not my brother! You're a brother betrayer!  The only one I can trust anymore is Pabu! Pabu loves me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're a mess, and we've got the biggest match of our lives tonight. Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No! I'm not going anywhere with you, you traitor!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Guess we'll have to do this the hard way.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Why?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Told you dating a teammate was a bad idea.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're a bad idea! Put me down! Put me down!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: You can't find two teams more evenly matched in age, size, and strength than the Fire Ferrets and the Buzzard Wasps. Believe me, I've looked! This should be a pulse-pounding semifinal, folks!  The Buzzard Wasps open with a flawlessly executed combo. All three Ferrets take an early visit to zone two. And Mako is knocked all the way back into zone three! The Fire Ferrets have been struggling to stay alive since the opening bell. All three players are totally out of sync tonight.  Ooh, that has got to sting!  And Bolin loses his noodles! Literally.  Which reminds me, this match is brought to you by our sponsor, Flamey-O Instant Noodles! Noodliest noodles in the United Republic.  The Buzzard Wasps fly deeper into Ferret territory. And Mako plunges into the pool! Can the Fire Ferrets hold on? The Wasps have the Ferrets backed up to the edge now ... and the Ferrets are bailed out by the bell! They had better pull themselves together for round two, otherwise they can kiss the finals goodbye.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey! Watch it!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Wasps take advantage of Mako's unforced error and Bolin is in the pool!  Ooh, and a blatant hold by the Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Unnecessary roughness! Move back one zone!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll unnecessarily rough you up!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: And the Avatar is slapped with the yellow fan. The Ferrets are their own worst enemy right now. It's just sad to watch. With the Buzzard Wasps leading two rounds to zilch, the Ferrets' only hope of winning is with a knockout.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, I guess there's always next year.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Come on! We still have a chance, even if it is a slim one!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: The way we're playing, we don't even deserve to be in the finals.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, if we don't pull together and work as a team, we'll never forgive ourselves.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's just get this over with.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: The sooner, the better.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Bolin's knocked into zone two, followed quickly by his brother!  And Bolin takes a zinger to the shoulder! Looks like it's a clean hit.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Owww!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Mako's in the drink and out of the match. And Bolin keeps playing with one good arm! I gotta hand it to him, this kid's got grit! But how long can he keep it up?  Apparently, not very long. The Ferrets' dream of making it to the finals now rests in the Avatar's hands. But with three on one, I don't like her odds.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you okay? How's your shoulder?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ahh, it's messed up pretty bad. But I think I'll be all right.  Are we gonna be all right?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Of course we are. We're brothers. We'll get through this mess. I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Me too! Girls ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Seriously.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: What an unbelievable effort here by Korra! She's dodging every element the Wasps throw at her!  The Avatar finally gains some ground, but with only ten seconds remaining, it might be too little too late!  It's the big kibosh! What a knockout!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes! She did it!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes! Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: It didn't seem possible, folks, but the Fire Ferrets are headed to the finals!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ha, ha!  Shoulder! Shoulder!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That, was pretty much the coolest thing I've ever seen.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thanks for not giving up on us. We never would have made it this far without you. I owe you. Big time.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're welcome. So ... I know things are confusing right now, but I hope we can still be friends.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Definitely.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Ooh, oof. You boys smell something in here? Wait, I know what that is; yeah, that's the scent of losers.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hope we see you in the finals. Then we'll know who the losers really are.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Yeah, I'm peeing my pants over here.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: And now, the defending champs, the White Falls Wolfbats!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Great job!  What a comeback, Korra. I've never seen a hat trick like that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks!  But, if it hadn't been for you and your father, we wouldn't have had the chance to play. So thank you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, if everyone's done with the little "thank you" party, need some medical attention over here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ooh, let me help!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Owww! Gah! Haven't you hurt me enough, woman?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Relax, I'm a healer!  I learned from Katara, the best there is.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, no, oh- ooh! That's the stuff!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Bolin, I'm sorry I hurt your feelings. I didn't mean to let things get so out of hand.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ahh, I'll be all right. But we had fun together, didn't we?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I had a great time, honestly! You are one of a kind, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Please, go on. I enjoy praise.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Your winners, the Wolfbats!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? How is it over already?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: With a brutal round one knockout, the defending champs secure their spot in the finals.  I hope the Ferrets know a good doctor, 'cause they're gonna need one!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After a close encounter with Amon, Korra took a leave of absence from Tarrlok's task force. But the Avatar has still been hard at work, leading the underdog Fire Ferrets to the pro-bending championship finals. Only one team stands in their way: the Wolfbats! Led by team captain Tahno, the brutal Wolfbats look to repeat as champs. Have the Fire Ferrets finally met their match?

transcript.speaker: Radio host
transcript.text: You're listening to "The Music Hour"!  Brought to you by Cabbage Corp,  Republic City's trusted name in technology for over fifty years.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Man, I got a good feeling about tonight. I don't care if we are the underdogs. We can take those pompous Wolfbats.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's going to be our toughest match ever, but I think you're right.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Introducing your new champs, the fantastic Fire Ferrets!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Good morning, citizens of Republic City. This is Amon.  I hope you all enjoyed last night's pro-bending match, because it will be the last.  It's time for this city to stop worshiping bending athletes as if they were heroes. I am calling on the council to shut down the bending arena  and cancel the finals, or else there will be severe consequences.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That guy's got some nerve.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You think the council will give in?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not waiting to find out. We need to get to City Hall.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, you shouldn't be here. This is a closed meeting.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: As the Avatar and a pro-bending player, I have a right to be heard. You can't cancel the finals.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know winning the championship means a lot to you. But as far as I'm concerned, we need to shut the arena down.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What about the rest of you? Tarrlok, there's no way you're backing down from Amon, right?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Actually,  Tenzin and I agree for once.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The council is unanimous. We're closing the arena.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You can't!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I-I don't understand. I thought you, of all people, would take a stand against Amon.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: While I am still committed to bringing that lunatic to justice, I will not put innocent lives at stake just so you and your friends can play a game.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Pro-bending might only be a game to you, but think of what it means to the city! Right now the arena is the one place where benders and nonbenders gather together ... in-in peace! To watch benders ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Beat each other up! In peace!  It's an inspiration to everyone!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I appreciate your naive idealism, but you're ignoring the reality of the situation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The reality is if you close the arena, you let Amon win!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes, exactly what she said! Yes!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I'm sorry, but our decision has been made. This meeting is adjourned.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but I agree with the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: You do?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, you do?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I expected this kind of cut-and-run response from Tenzin.  But the rest of you? Come on, show a little more backbone. It's time that the benders of this city displayed some strength and unity against these Equalists.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We must prevent the conflict between benders and nonbenders from escalating into all-out war!  The council is not changing its position, Lin.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Now just a moment, Tenzin. Let us hear what our esteemed Chief of Police has in mind.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: If you keep the arena open, my metalbenders and I will provide extra security during the championship match. There's no better force to deal with the chi-blockers. Our armor is impervious to their attacks.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Are you saying that you will personally take responsibility for the safety of the spectators in the arena?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I guarantee it.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: It is hard to argue with Chief Beifong's track record.  If she is confident her elite officers can protect the arena, then she has my support. I am changing my vote.  Who else is with me?  The arena stays open. Good luck in the finals.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: And good luck to you, Chief Beifong.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: A word please, Lin.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Tarrlok's playing you and I don't want to see you get hurt.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I know what I am doing and the risks that come with it.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: In that case, I'm going to be by your side during the match.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You don't need to babysit me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's for Korra. I want to make sure she's safe.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Do what you want! It's not like I've ever been able to stop you before.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Excuse me, Chief Beifong. I wanted to thank you for your help,  it ... really ... means a lot ...  What is her deal? Even when she's on my side, she's against me!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've known Lin since we were children, she's always been ...  challenging.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What did your father do to make her hate the Avatar so much?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: My father and Lin got along famously.  I'm afraid her issues ... are with me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait a second ...  it all makes sense now!  You and Beifong, Beifong and you. You two were a  couple!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What! How-?  Where'd you get that idea?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ha!  Your wife.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Criminy! I'll have to have a word with her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So ... Pema stole you from Beifong. I'm surprised our "esteemed Chief of Police" didn't throw her in jail.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh, she tried.  Anyway, Pema didn't steal me, Lin and I had been growing apart for some time. We both had different goals in li-  Why am I even telling you this? It all happened a long time ago and we've moved passed it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hm, apparently Beifong hasn't.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What do you ...  Of course she has! Anyway, this is none of your business!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: See you at home, Mr. Heartbreaker!

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: I just got word. The council defied your threat. They're keeping the arena open.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Perfect.  Everything is going according to plan.

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: All clear, Chief.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How is the security sweep going?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Fine.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: They've checked underneath the stands?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: And you have enough officers to cover all points of entry?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I have the skies, the bay, and every nook and cranny of this place covered.  Now leave me alone and let me do my job.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin, with so much on the line it would be nice if we could help each other out, at least for one night.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Like old times?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Like old times.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Okay, I'll try to be less abrasive than usual.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I would appreciate that.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The anticipation is palpable as we are just moments away from the championship match.  Will the Wolfbats' ferocity help them repeat as champs?  Or will the underdog Fire Ferrets serve up a surprising bowl of smackdown soup?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Now I know there's a big crowd but don't be nervous. You're gonna do great, I believe in you.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Introducing the challengers, the Future Industries Fire Ferrets!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're on, Pabu.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes! Nailed it!  He's so talented!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: And their opponents, the three timed defending champions, the White Falls Wolfbats!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Pfft,  they got nothing on us, buddy. Anybody can howl.  Hm, whatever.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm gonna knock Tahno's stupid hair off his stupid head!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The champs and challengers face off at the center-line and here we go!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Tahno tries to clean the Avatar's clock with some dirty water boxing.  Ming shakes off Mako's attack and returns the favor.  Shaozu gets fancy, but Bolin ricochets a disk off the ropes and says 'No, thank you sir!'

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Nice shot!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The waterbenders slug it out, looking evenly matched.  Tahno gets a little too worked up and unleashes a deluge on Bolin that would certainly elicit a foul.  Or apparently not.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's the big idea, ref? That was a hosing foul!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: And the Wolfbats advance despite Tahno exceeding the waterbending time limit.  A questionable call by the officials.  Ming trips up Mako with another dirty trick!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh come on, refs! There was some funny business in that last play!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Wouldn't have guessed you knew the rules of pro-bending?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've been brushing up. That Wolfbat blatantly bent a disk outside of his zone.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Ferret brothers are backed up to zone three and the Wolfbats smell blood.  Looks like Tahno snuck in an illegal icing move but once again there's no call.  I don't know what match the refs are watching but it's obviously not this one.  Oh ... a splash-and-clash sends the Avatar to zone three as well.  It's a knockout! The Wolfbats win the championship for the fourth year in a-  Hold on a second, folks!  Scratch that! The Ferrets are still alive, but just barely.  What an unbelievable move! These Ferrets aren't just bending the elements, they're bending my mind!  The underdogs survive to see round two.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's wrong with these refs?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They've been paid off; it's the only explanation.  Someone wants us to lose.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If the Wolfbats are gonna fight dirty,  then so should we.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No we can't!  The refs have it out for us. If we're gonna win this thing, it has to be fair and square.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Argh, that's no fun but ... all right.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round two!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The opening salvo is a brutal call as both sides give it their all.  But once again, Tahno sneaks in a little ice to get the upper hand.  Wowzers! Those look like illegal head shots to me!

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round two will be decided with a tie-breaker!

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: The Fire Ferrets win the coin toss. Which element do you choose?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm taking this one. Let's go!  You and me, pretty boy!

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Thought you'd never ask.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Come on, little girl. Give me your best shot.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hmph, chump.

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: Round two goes to the Fire Ferrets!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Nice one!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's the stuff. You are my herooo-ah!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We might actually win this thing!

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Let's send them to a watery grave!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I can't believe your sweet-tempered father was reincarnated into that girl. She's tough as nails.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Reminds me of someone else I knew at that age. You two might get along if you would only give her a chance.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Hmph.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: One round apiece:  who wants it more?  The Wolfbats fly out of the gates, swinging with bad intentions.  The challengers are showing a lot of heart but the champs are really starting to find their rhythm now.  Can the Ferrets hang in there with the best,  especially when the best are frankly getting a little help from the refs?  It's all down to this final round!  Mako is leaving it all in the ring  but it looks like Tahno and Ming are up to more shenanigans!  Oh, this has gone too far!  That water had rocks in it!

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: Knockout!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh, come on! Those were illegal head shots! Open your eyes, ref!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Well, folks it's a controversial call but the Wolfbats notch a nasty knockout to win the match!  For the fourth year in a row, they'll be crowned tournament champions.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: I barely broke a sweat! Anybody else wanna scrap with the champs?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Look out!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Folks, there is some sort of electrical disturbance in the stands. Metalbender cops are dropping like bumbleflies. There appear to be masked members of the audience wielding strange devices on their hands.  One of them is in the booth with me right now, folks! He is leveling one of those glove devices at me now and I believe he is about to electrocute me. I am currently wetting my pants.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: What's going on here, ref?

transcript.speaker: Referee
transcript.text: I don't know!

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: All right, you want a piece of the Wolfbats? Here it comes!

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Wait, please don't do this!  I'll give you the championship pot,  I'll-I'll give you everything just  please don't take my bending!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I believe I have your attention, benders of Republic City.  So once again, the Wolfbats are your pro-bending champions.  It seems fitting that you celebrate three bullies who cheated their way to victory because every day,  you threaten and abuse your fellow nonbending citizens  just like the Wolfbats did to their opponents tonight.  Those men were supposedly the best in the bending world and yet it only took a few moments for me to  cleanse them of their impurity. Let this be a warning to all of you benders out there:  if any of you stand in my way,  you will meet the same fate.  Now, to my followers: for years the Equalists have been forced to hide in the shadows, but now we have the numbers and the strength to create a new Republic City.  I'm happy to tell you that the  time for change has finally come. Very soon, the current tyrannical bending regime will be replaced by a fair-minded Equalist government. You and your children will no longer have to walk the streets afraid! It's time to take back our city.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How are we gonna get out of here?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Pabu! Listen up, buddy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Stop fooling around!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm not! I'm trying to save us!  See? Pabu's not just a one trick poodle pony.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: For centuries, benders have possessed an unnatural advantage over ordinary people.  But thankfully, modern technology has provided us with a way to even out the playing field.  Now anyone can hold the power of a chi-blocker in their hand.  My followers and I will not rest until the entire city achieves equality, and once that goal is achieved, we will equalize the rest of the world.  The revolution has begun!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Tenzin!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: It's okay, Pabu. Just a little explosion.  Keep chewing, you're almost through it!  Yes! Great job, buddy!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm going after Amon!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Be careful!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You all right?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm fine, thanks to you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Don't mention it, kid.  Looks like we lost this one.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm so glad you're okay!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Me too!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I can't believe Amon did this. I played right into his hand.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: He played us all.  Republic City is at war.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Although the Hundred Year War has long passed, we are not living in a time of peace.  These revolutionaries who call themselves "Equalists" are not interested in equality at all. They just want to wage war against benders.  Chief Beifong was supposed to protect Republic City, but she was powerless to stop Amon's attack on the arena. She has failed us all. If we are to survive these dire times, our law enforcement needs new leadership.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I still can't believe they're shutting this place down.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah. We had some good memories here, didn't we?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Guys! Great news. You don't have to go back on the streets. I talked to Tenzin and made all the arrangements. You can come live on Air Temple Island with me!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Oh, we'd love to, but ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Asami already invited us to live in her dad's giant mansion!  From here on out, it's gonna be the lap of luxury for us.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Oh hey, Korra, I was hoping you would stop by.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I was just leaving.  So, I guess I'll see you guys around, some time.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Why not tomorrow? I'd love to have you come visit the estate.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know. I have some ... Avatar stuff to do.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Come on, Korra.  We all deserve a little rest and relaxation after all this craziness. We could swim in Asami's pool.  It'll be fun!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right, Pabu.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Great, we'll see you tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Looks like our intel was good.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: There's enough evidence here to bury Cabbage Corp for an eternity.

transcript.speaker: Lau Gan-Lan
transcript.text: This is an outrage! I'm innocent!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah. That's what they all say ...

transcript.speaker: Reporter
transcript.text: Is it true that Cabbage Corp is conspiring with the Equalists?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: The evidence points in that direction, but the investigation is ongoing. For the time being, we have frozen Mr. Gan-Lan's assets and are closing Cabbage Corp.

transcript.speaker: Lau Gan-Lan
transcript.text: No! Not my Cabbage Corp!

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: Hey, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tahno?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Listen, I know we're not exactly best friends, but I'm sorry Amon took your bending.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: I've been to the best healers in the city. Whatever Amon did to me, it's permanent.  You gotta get him for me.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Mr. Sato, if you remember anything else about what you saw during Amon's attack, be sure to let us know.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: I'm happy to help any way I can. I want these Equalists to pay for what they've done.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We're ready for you now.

transcript.speaker: Tahno
transcript.text: See you around ...  "Ah"vatar.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Earthbending bomb!

transcript.speaker: Butler
transcript.text: Avatar Korra ... has arrived.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey, Korra!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Glad you made it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Welcome to paradise!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Looks like you guys settled right in.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Pretty much,  except someone forgot to ask her father if we could stay here.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Yeah, but I smoothed it over with him. It's easier to ask for forgiveness than permission.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: This is the greatest place in the world! Watch this, watch this.  Fetch me my towel, good sir.

transcript.speaker: Butler
transcript.text: Yes, Master ... Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Master Bolin! Ha, I love this guy.  Now pat me dry.

transcript.speaker: Butler
transcript.text: As you wish.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Don't forget Master Pabu.

transcript.speaker: Butler
transcript.text: Wouldn't dream of it, sir.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, what do you have planned for us today? Let me guess, shopping, makeovers ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ooh, Ooh! I vote makeovers!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I had something a little more exciting in mind.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Pretty cool, huh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Way cooler than a makeover.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: This is where Future Industries test-drives their Satomobiles. Ever been behind the wheel?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The only thing I know how to drive is a polar bear dog.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You want me to take you for a spin?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's do it!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That was amazing! I didn't think we'd make it.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well, you can't be afraid to mix it up sometimes.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I gotta admit, I had you pegged wrong. I thought you were kind of ... prissy.  Eh-No offense!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's all right, people usually assume that I'm daddy's helpless little girl, but I can handle myself. I mean, I've been in self-defense classes since I was this high.  My dad made sure that I would always be able to protect myself.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Smart guy.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Emergency, emergency coming through, beep beep!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh, is there another bathroom I can use?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We have a lady's powder room upstairs,  first door on your right. You can freshen up in there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: No, no! No, I assure you, everything is going exactly as planned.  Uh-um, yes ... luckily, the Cabbage Corp investigation has bought us enough time.  Trust me, by the end of the week ...  we'll be ready to strike!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You're leaving? But I-I thought ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh, sorry! I forgot, I'm supposed to airsit, I mean babybend, I-I mean babysit the airbender kids. See you later!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: So, you think Mr. Sato manufactured those gloves for the Equalists then framed Cabbage Corp?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: That's a bold accusation, but what proof do you have?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I don't exactly have proof, but I know what I heard. Sato's up to something.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: He does have the means ... and he has a motive.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: A motive? What is it?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Twelve years ago, the Agni Kai Triad robbed Sato's mansion. A firebender killed Sato's wife during the break in.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's terrible.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It was tragic. It's possible that he's been harboring anti-bending sentiment all this time.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Maybe we should look at Mr. Sato a little more closely.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's going on? Why are they asking Hiroshi more questions?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I overheard him on the phone yesterday. Asami, I don't know how to tell you this, but I think your father might be involved with the Equalists.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What? I don't believe this.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You spied on Hiroshi?  What's your problem?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Mr. Sato, we just have a few follow-up questions for you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: My father is innocent. Just because we're not benders doesn't mean we support those awful Equalists.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Equalists?  Is that what this is about? I can assure you I have nothing to do with those radicals.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, you don't know what you're talking about, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I overheard you on the phone. You said the Cabbage Corp investigation bought you time, and you're getting ready to strike. Explain that!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: This is all just a misunderstanding, resulting from the young Avatar's overactive imagination. My number one competitor was knocked out of the game. It's providing me an opportunity to strike the market with a new line of Satomobiles.  It's just business. Nothing nefarious.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: In order to put all suspicions to rest, might we have a look into your factories and warehouses?

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: If you feel it's necessary, you're welcome to search all of Future Industries.

transcript.speaker: News reporter
transcript.text: Is it possible, presidents of Cabbage Corp and Future Industries both have Equalist ties, or did Hiroshi Sato frame his longtime rival, Lau Gan-Lan?  Or did Chief Beifong just plain arrest the wrong man?  So far the investigation has yielded no evidence to incriminate Sato.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't believe we didn't find anything.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: It would appear Hiroshi is innocent.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Okay, you did your search. Now you can all leave.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Hmm.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So, I hope you're convinced now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I'm not! I don't care how cooperative Hiroshi is being, I know he's lying.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Why are you doing this? Are you that jealous of me and Asami?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What?  Don't be ridiculous! That has nothing to do with it!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: If you don't drop this, consider our friendship over.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry. Hiroshi is not the man you think he is.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hmph.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think you guys should hear this.  "If you want to find the truth, meet me under the north end of the Silk Road Bridge at midnight."

transcript.speaker: Warehouse worker
transcript.text: Psst.  Over here.  Listen, I joined the Equalists because I believed in what Amon said. I thought he could make life better for us nonbenders. But I didn't sign up for this ...  this war.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What do you have on Hiroshi Sato?

transcript.speaker: Warehouse worker
transcript.text: He manufactured those gloves  for the Equalists.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I knew it!

transcript.speaker: Warehouse worker
transcript.text: And there are rumors he's working on something even bigger. Some new kind of weapon.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We searched all of Future Industries and found nothing.

transcript.speaker: Warehouse worker
transcript.text: That's because he has a secret factory.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where?

transcript.speaker: Warehouse worker
transcript.text: It's right underneath the Sato Mansion.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Raiding the Sato Mansion is a risky move with Tarrlok breathing down your neck. If we're wrong ...

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I know. I can kiss my job goodbye. But protecting Republic City is all I care about. We can't let Amon get his hands on this new weapon.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We have a reason to believe that there's a factory hidden below the mansion.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I think I would've noticed if there were a factory underneath my house. The lies you people come up with just to persecute my father.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Where is your father?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: In his workshop, behind the house.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dad? Hello?

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: Chief, the estate's been secured. No one has left the workshop since we arrived.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Perhaps we just couldn't see him leaving.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: There's a tunnel beneath the workshop running deep into the mountainside.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What? There's no tunnel.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Do you think your dad knows about this tunnel?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I don't understand. There must be an explanation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe you don't know everything about your father.  I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Officers,  into the tunnel. Be cautious.  Uh-uh, you three stay up here.  Officer Song, keep an eye on them.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Not your average backyard workshop.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And I'm guessing those are the new weapons.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hiroshi was lying all right, but where is he?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What was that?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need to get down there and see what's going on.

transcript.speaker: Song
transcript.text: Absolutely not. You're staying put until the chief comes back.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All right, we'll stay put. But could we wait outside or something? It's so dusty in this workshop.

transcript.speaker: Song
transcript.text: No! We're waiting right here!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, but don't blame me if I start sne-  if I start sn-sn-sneez-

transcript.speaker: Song
transcript.text: What's your problem, bub?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm about to-  Sorry pal, we know you were just doing your job.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, just stay put until the chief comes back. That's sounds very familiar doesn't it, why? Because you said it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami, you should stay here. We'll check it out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I have to find out the truth about my father.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I understand. That's why I'm going down, to find out for you. Please.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: All right.  Be careful.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: I'm afraid you won't be able to metalbend that wall, Chief Beifong.  It's solid platinum.  My mecha tanks are platinum as well.  Not even your renowned mother could bend a metal so pure.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hiroshi, I knew you were a lying, no good Equalist! Come out here and-

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: And do what, young Avatar? Face the wrath of your bending? No. I think I'll fight from inside here where my odds are a little more ... equal.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: That source was a set-up! You lured us down here!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Guilty as charged.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Well, I'd say that was a near flawless test run.  Load everyone into the transports and deliver them to Amon!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh no.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra was right. We gotta do something, quick!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Not so fast, boys.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hello, Mr. Sato. Wow! What a really swell, scary factory you have here under your giant mansion.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sponsoring our team, supporting the Avatar. It was all just a big cover.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Yes, and the most difficult part was watching my daughter traipse around with a firebending street rat like you!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dad, stop!  Why?

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Sweetie, I wanted to keep you out of this as long as I could.  But now you know the truth, please, forgive me.  These people,  these benders. They took away your mother, the love of my life. They've ruined the world, but with Amon we can fix it and build a perfect world together. We can help people like us, everywhere!  Join me, Asami.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I love you, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: My metalbenders are on their way to Amon, and it's all my fault. Tarrlok's right, I've failed as chief. First thing in the morning, I'm handing in my resignation.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No! You can't give up like this!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm not giving up. I'm gonna find my officers and take Amon down. But I'm gonna do it my way, outside the law.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sorry I didn't believe you. But Asami's dad being an Equalist is not an easy thing to believe. Even now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know. I'm sorry this whole thing happened.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So ... does your offer to live in the Air Temple still stand?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Of course it does. And Asami's welcome, too.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thank you so much.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: After everything she's been through, she's going to need you, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Republic City is at war! After discovering that her father, Hiroshi Sato, is working with the enemy, Asami turns against him, and following another defeat at the hands of the Equalists, Lin Beifong resigns as Chief of Police. With the Equalist army growing stronger, who will help the Avatar stop Amon and restore balance to the city?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: You're finally here!  Welcooome to Air Temple Island.  Your new home.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yes, welcome to  my domain.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, aren't you sweet,  little monk child.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: What's that fuzzy creature?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: That is a fire ferret.  An arboreal mammal common  to the bamboo forests of the central Earth Kingdom.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: He's cuuuute!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yip yip! Fly sky bison! Fly!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thanks for sending the Air Acolytes to help us with the move.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Yes, they've been amazing.  Such tireless workers.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, I thought you were only bringing a  few things.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Trust me,  it could've been worse.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No problem, everyone here wants you guys to feel welcome.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: You're pretty, can I have some of your hair?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Looks like I have some competition.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: And now for the grand tour.  The flying bison sleep in those caves down there.  And that's the temple Grandpa Aang built.  And that's the greenhouse where we grow the vegetables we eat.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I have a couple of questions.  Is this an all vegetarian island?  Is that where you train airbending?  Do we have to wear Air Acolyte clothes? Do we each get our own sky bison? And final question, how many trees are on this island?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Yes. Yes. No. No. Ten thousand five hundred and fifty two.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So, where are we going to be staying?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: You're a boy.  Boys have to stay on the boys' side.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'd be happy to show you to the men's dormitory.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm a boy!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Meelo, why don't you go with the boys too?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: We shall meet again soon, beautiful woman.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ikki and I will take you to your room this way.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Asami, did you know Korra likes Mako?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Oh.  Uh, no. I wasn't completely aware of that.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Run along, Ikki!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So,  here's your room.  I know this is a little rustic compared to what you're used to.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I think it's really charming  and the best part about it, nothing here reminds me of my father.  Thank you for your hospitality.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ikki! I swear  if you don't leave us alone, I'm gonna-  Uh, Tenzin!  Come right in.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Good day, ladies. Asami, welcome to the island.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Thank you for having me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Beifong's replacement, Saikhan, is going to be inducted as the new Chief of Police later. I think we should both be there.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: It was an honor serving under Chief Beifong for so many years  and I wish her a speedy recovery. It is with great humility that I take her place as the new Chief of Police. Republic City is facing a threat like none the world has ever seen but there is one man who's been effective against Amon's revolution, Councilman Tarrlok.  That is why for all matters involving the Equalists, I will report directly to him.  The police department will lend any and all available resources to the councilman and his task force  until we quell this insurgency.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What is that weasel snake Tarrlok up to now?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Tarrlok, I don't know what you did to get Chief Saikhan in your pocket but I highly doubt it was legal.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Oh, Tenzin.  Always the conspiracy theorist. Did you ever consider Saikhan simply recognizes my talents and wants what is best for this city?  Well, Avatar Korra. Long time, no see. Now that your little pro-bending distractions are over, I look forward to your return to my task force.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ha!  Forget it! There's no way I'm rejoining your vanity project.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: That is unfortunate to hear, but I'm sure you'll come to your senses as you have in the past.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't hold your breath, bub.  You know, Tenzin's been right about you all along.  You played me,  you played Beifong,  and now you're playing the new Chief too.  Well, I got news for you.  You need me,  but I don't need you. I'm the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: You're not, in fact, the Avatar.  You are merely a half-baked Avatar in training, which reminds me, how is your airbending going?  Made any significant progress with that?  I didn't think so.  If you will not be part of my task force, then you had best stay out of my way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't understand what's wrong with me. I've memorized nearly all of the practice forms, but I still can't produce a single measly puff of air!  I'm a failure.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No you're not. You just need to work through this airbending block.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Amazing advice. I'll get right on that.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I wasn't finished yet. You see, Aang not only had his bending teachers, but also his past lives to call upon for guidance. Have you ever made contact with your past lives?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, of course I haven't. Didn't you get the memo from the White Lotus? I'm a spiritual failure, too.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You may have made a connection without realizing it.  Perhaps something you mistook as a dream?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe. I had a few weird hallucinations,  but I hardly even remember them.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: And did you see any previous Avatars in these visions?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I saw Aang. It seemed like he was in trouble. What do you think it means?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hmm, I don't know.  But I urge you to meditate on these visions.  I believe Aang's spirit must be trying to tell you something.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra? You out here?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Korraaa!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: There you are.  Are you okay?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm fine.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, what's wrong? You can tell us.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How am I suppose to save this city when I can't even learn airbending?  I'm the worst Avatar ever!  I just feel ... alone.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: No, that's nonsense! You're amazing!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah and remember. Aang hadn't mastered all the elements when he was battling the Fire Nation. He was just a little kid.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And he wasn't alone. He had his friends to help him. Look, the arena might be shut down but we're still a team. The new Team Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We got your back Korra, and we can save this city.  Together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, let's do it!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yeah, let's do it!  What are we doing?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Get ready, Republic City.  You are about to be patrolled by Team Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami, you always know how to accessorize your outfits.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I figure one way to fight Equalists is to use an Equalist weapon.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right,  Let's ride.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Naga away!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right, scratch that.  Any other ideas?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hmm.  I think I have the answer.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You think this'll do?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I like the new Team Avatar's style.

transcript.speaker: Police dispatcher
transcript.text: Unit two sixteen, cancel that ten fifty-eight at Harmony Tower. Come back to the station, over.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: My dad had police scanners installed in all of his cars. I guess now I know why.

transcript.speaker: Police dispatcher
transcript.text: Calling all units, Level Four Alert. Jailbreak at headquarters. Officers down, electrocuted. Chi-blockers and Equalist convicts are still at large armed and dangerous.  Last seen heading east. I repeat, Level Four Alert. Equalist jailbreak!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Chi-blockers!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's them!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's get 'em!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Korra! Bolin! Give me a ramp! Now!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Help me out! We gotta make this turn!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: They don't know we made the turn. Okay, get ready.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, what do you think you are doing?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, hey Tarrlok. Nice of you to show up finally. Here, we captured the escaped convicts for you.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: What you did was tear up the city and impede the real authorities in their pursuit of these criminals.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hmm, that's funny.  I didn't see your little task force or the cops the whole time.  If it wasn't for Team Avatar,  they would've gotten away.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: This is your last warning. Stay out of my way !

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Republic City stands as a beacon of freedom, but the Equalists are using that freedom to tear it down.  The law I have proposed would make it illegal for anyone to be a member of the Equalists or even be associated with them. It also puts into effect a curfew, ensuring all nonbenders are in their own homes by nightfall.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is going too far, Tarrlok!  You can't punish all nonbenders for the actions of a few!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: That kind of cowardice will cause our city to fall into Amon's hands. We must pass this law. All in favor?

transcript.speaker: Police dispatcher
transcript.text: All available units, please respond to the fifty six hundred block of Dragon Flats borough. Equalists have taken to the streets, consider them armed and dangerous. Proceed with caution.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I call front!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: After you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What a gentleman,  thanks!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why is the power out?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Wait a second, these people aren't armed or dangerous.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sure doesn't look that way.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: All nonbenders, return to your homes immediately.

transcript.speaker: Male #1
transcript.text: Yeah, as soon as you turn our power back on.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Disperse, or you will all be arrested.

transcript.speaker: Female #1
transcript.text: You benders can't treat us this way!

transcript.speaker: Child #1
transcript.text: Mummy, look! It's the Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Female #1
transcript.text: Please, help us! You're our Avatar, too!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone, please stay calm. I'm gonna put a stop to this.  Tarrlok, you need to turn the power back on and leave these people alone.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, you and your playmates have no business here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We're not going anywhere. You don't have the right to treat these innocent people like criminals.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: This is an Equalist rally.  There is nothing innocent about it.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: They're not Equalists, they're just normal people who want their rights back.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: They are the enemy !  Round up all these Equalists!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Stop!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hey! Let me go!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: You're under arrest!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What?  You can't do that!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Actually, I can. She's a nonbender out past curfew  and her father is a known Equalist conspirator.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let her go!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Arrest him and his brother!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tarrlok!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Unless you want to join your friends in prison, I suggest you put those down and go back to the Air Temple.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, listen to him. It's not worth it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We'll be all right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't worry, I'll call Tenzin. He can get you out.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: So sad to see your little Team Avatar broken up. You had a good run.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This isn't over, Tarrlok.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Oh, I believe it is.  Take them away.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I came as fast as I could. Are your friends all right?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know! These knuckleheads won't tell me anything.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'll take care of this.  Saikhan, a word please.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Councilman Tenzin, I'm pretty swamped at the moment. Can this wait?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, it cannot. Three of Avatar Korra's friends were wrongly arrested tonight. I'd like you to release them immediately.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: They're not going anywhere. They were interfering with police business.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Your so called police business was rounding up innocent people and claiming they were Equalists. They should be released, too.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: All Equalists suspects are being detained indefinitely. They'll be freed if and when the task force deems they are no longer a threat.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Those people are entitled to due process under the law.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: You'll have to take that up with Councilman Tarrlok.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh, I plan to. At the council meeting, first thing in the morning.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're officially the worst Chief of Police ever!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
