transcript.text: Calm down, Korra.  I'll get this sorted out, we just need to be patient.  But you really are the worst!  Ever!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wake up, Naga.  Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait for me here, girl.  Don't worry, I'll be all right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You and I need to talk.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Are any of the other council members here?

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: I believe everyone has gone home for the night.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Then you should do the same.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: Are you sure, sir?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Leave us.  You obviously have something on your mind? Spit it out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't you see? You're doing exactly what Amon says is wrong with benders. You're using your power to oppress and intimidate people!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: And you don't?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Of-  Of course not!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Isn't that what you came here to do? Intimidate me into releasing your friends.  See, that's what I admire about you, Korra. Your willingness to go to extremes in order to get what you want. It is a quality we both share.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You and I are nothing alike!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Look, I'll make you a deal. You fall in line and do what I say and I'll release your friends.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's why you arrested them? To get to me?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I need your answer.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. You might be able to manipulate Chief Saikhan into following you, but it won't work on me.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: You will regret that decision.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You need to be stopped!  You're just as bad as Amon!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I've tried to work with you, Korra, but you've made it impossible.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Still think that I'm a half-baked Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you gonna do now? You're all out of water, pal.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: You're in my way Avatar, and you need to be removed.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're, you're a bloodbender?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Very observant.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's not a full moon!  How- how are you doing this?!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: There are a lot of things you don't know about me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where are you taking me?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Somewhere no one will find you.  Say goodbye to Republic City, Avatar Korra. You'll never see it again!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You can't do this!  Let me out!  Garh!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Avatar has been abducted! After Tarrlok arrested her friends, Korra confronted the councilman in his chambers. But the heated argument quickly turned into an all-out bending battle! Desperate to save himself, Tarrlok revealed his ability to bloodbend and took Korra far from Republic City. Will the Avatar's friends find her before it's too late?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you doing?  Tarrlok!  You can't keep me in here forever!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Who is this? It's six in the morning! This better be important!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Councilman Tenzin here.  What?!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What happened?  What was Korra doing at City Hall?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: As I told Chief Saikhan,  Korra came to my office late last night. She was upset that I arrested her friends. She asked me to release them and ... that's when the Equalists attacked.  I tried to protect Korra, but we were outnumbered.  Then, I was electrocuted.  When I came to, the police had arrived. But Korra was gone.  I'm so sorry.  Chief Saikhan, mobilize the entire police force. We have to find the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Radio
transcript.text: We interrupt your regularly scheduled broadcast to bring you this special report. Late last night, Equalists attacked City Hall,  subduing Councilman Tarrlok and capturing Avatar Korra. Details are still coming in, b-

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Hope you got enough beauty rest. Come on, I'm busting you out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Thanks. I owe you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you done yet?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Cover your ears! I can't go with you listening.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ahh!  A little privacy, please!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm fine! It's so good to see you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Hate to break up your lovers' reunion, but Korra's in trouble. Amon captured her.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No. No, she can't be gone!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Come on, we have an Avatar to rescue.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Your fly was down.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Thanks for catching that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Somebody! Help! Please!  Please.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I urge you to meditate on these visions. I believe Aang's spirit is trying to tell you something.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: What are you doing here, Aang?  I told you, I have this under control.

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: Under normal circumstances, I wouldn't get involved, but if what those victims said is true, we're not dealing with a normal criminal.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Fine. Follow me, Twinkle Toes.

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: Toph, I'm forty years old. You think you could stop with the nicknames?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: 'Fraid not.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: It's over! You're under arrest, Yakone!

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: What is Republic City coming to? Used to be, a man could enjoy his lunch in peace.  What's the big idea?

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: We have dozens of witnesses, Yakone. We know what you are.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Take him away.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: I've beaten every trumped-up charge you yahoos have brought against me!  And I'll beat this one, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whoa.  I finally connected with you, Aang.  But, what are you trying to tell me?  A way out of this box would be nice.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I have to go. Call me back the minute you hear anything.  Lin? Wh-wh-what are y- What are y- You should be in the hospital! And you three!  You should be in prison!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I figured you could use our help finding Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Do you have any leads?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've been on the phone all morning, but nothing yet.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need Naga! She can track Korra.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm afraid her polar bear dog is missing as well.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Then where do we start?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: My guess is the Equalists are hiding underground in the maze of tunnels beneath the city.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Underground ... just like my father's secret factory. Figures.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah! Yeah, that makes sense! When those chi-blockers had me in their truck, it sounded like we drove into a tunnel!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know where to start looking! Come on!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Wherever Amon is keeping Korra, I bet that's where my officers are too.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Let's bring them all home, Lin.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The truck with Bolin took off down this alley.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Which way?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hmm. This way kinda ...  smells familiar.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: There's a tunnel nearby.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: There!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Motorcycle tracks.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra has to be in there ... somewhere.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's try this way.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And what if Korra's not down there?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Then we pick another tunnel until we find her!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hey, is Mako all right? He seems really worried about Korra.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, we all are!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I know, but, he's your brother. Do you think that he likes Korra as more than just a friend?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: W-What? No! That's, just gossip, where'd you hear that?  Crazy talk is coming out of your mouth right now. Heh ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What do you know, Bolin? Come on, spill it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Nothing! I mean, there was this one time during the tournament when Mako and Korra kissed, but-

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: They ... kissed?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Believe me, I was upset too, but, I'm over it. I don't think it meant anything.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I doubt that.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Hide!

transcript.speaker: Equalist traffic director
transcript.text: That tram goes to the training camp.

transcript.speaker: Female Equalist
transcript.text: Everything was delivered to the prison, sir.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's where they must be keeping Korra.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We need to get down that tunnel.

transcript.speaker: Equalist
transcript.text: It's empty!

transcript.speaker: Equalist
transcript.text: Yeah, I can see that.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You two, keep an eye on them.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: My officers are inside.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What about Korra?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I don't see her yet.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Avatar Korra. Where are you keeping her?

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: Chief Beifong?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm too late. That monster already took your bending, didn't he?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm so sorry.  Come on, let's gets you out of here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'll ask you one more time;  where is she?

transcript.speaker: Equalist
transcript.text: We don't have the Avatar, and the Equalists didn't attack City Hall. Tarrlok's lying.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I scanned the entire prison. Korra's not here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Why would Tarrlok make up a story about getting attacked?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Because he has Korra. He fooled us all!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Let's go, people!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Try to chi-block that, fools!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We've got more company!  Hang on!

transcript.speaker: Prosecution attorney
transcript.text: Yakone has ruled Republic City's criminal empire for years. Yet he has always managed to stay out of the law's reach, until now. You will hear testimony, from dozens of his victims, and they will tell you, Yakone has maintained his grip on the underworld by using an ability that has been illegal for decades.  Bloodbending.

transcript.speaker: Defense attorney
transcript.text: The prosecution's entire case is built upon the make-believe notion that my client is able to bloodbend at will, at any time on any day. I remind the council that bloodbending is an incredibly rare skill and it can only be performed during a full moon.  Yet, the witnesses will claim that my client used bloodbending at every other time except during a full moon. It would be a mockery of justice to convict a man of a crime that is impossible to commit.

transcript.speaker: Bailiff
transcript.text: Councilman Sokka will now deliver the verdict.

transcript.speaker: Sokka
transcript.text: In my years, I have encountered people born with rare and unique bending abilities. Why, I once bested a man with my trusty boomerang who was able to firebend with his mind.  Why, even metalbending was considered impossible for all of history until our esteemed Chief of Police,  Toph Beifong, singlehandedly developed the skill. The overwhelming amount of testimony and evidence has convinced this council that Yakone is one of these unique benders and he exploited his ability to commit these heinous crimes. We find Yakone guilty of all charges and sentence him to life in prison.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank you all for meeting us on such short notice.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Chief.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Lin.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Have you news of Avatar Korra?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We do.  You kidnapped her, Tarrlok!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I am shocked you would accuse me of such an evil act! I already explained: Equalists attacked us and took her!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But there were no chi-blockers here last night.  You planted the evidence, didn't you?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: That is a ridiculous accusation!

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: It's true! He took her! I was here when Avatar Korra arrived last night, but Councilman Tarrlok ordered me to leave. I was on my way out when I saw Tarrlok bring her down to the garage.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Say goodbye to Republic City, Avatar Korra. You'll never see it again.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: That is nonsense!  Everyone knows you're nothing but a squeaky-voiced liar!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Why did you wait until now to 'fess up?

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: I was terrified to tell because ...  Because Tarrlok is a bloodbender!  He bloodbent Avatar Korra!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Don't make this worse for yourself.  Tell us where you have Korra.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Wake up!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ughh! Man! I had this awful dream that Korra was taken by this evil bloodbender.  So weird.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Bolin, that really happened. He knocked us out.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Are you serious?  Where is he? Is he here right now?

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Tarrlok is long gone. I'll alert the whole force.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We've only been out for a little while. Maybe we can still pick up Tarrlok's trail.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It could lead us to Korra! Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: Yakone.  You won't get away with this!

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Republic City's mine, Avatar. I'll be back one day to claim it.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: This time I'm gonna put you to sleep for good!

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: I'm taking away your bending, for good .  It's over.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Aang ... this whole time ... you were trying to warn me about Tarrlok.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: My life is a disaster now, thanks to you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So your little bloodbending secret's out?  And I know how you bloodbent me without a full moon.  You're Yakone's son.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I was his son, but in order to win Republic City, I had to become someone else. My father failed because he tried to rule the city from its rotten underbelly. My plan was perfect. I was to be the city's savior. But you, you ruined everything!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tarrlok, the jig is up and you have nowhere to go.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Oh no. No, I'll escape and start a new life. And you're coming as my hostage.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You'll never get away with this!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Amon!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: It is time for you to be equalized.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: You fool! You've never faced bending like mine.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: What? What are you?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I am the solution.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I'll take care of him. You four retrieve the Avatar. Do not underestimate her. Electrocute the box to knock her out before you open it.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: My pleasure.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: It's payback time.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: Open the box.  Tie her up.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I thought I told you not to underestimate her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga. You came looking for me.  Good girl.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That sounds like Naga!  Down there!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra! Oh, thank goodness.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Where's Tarrlok? How did you get away?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Give her some space!  I was so worried. Are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm fine. I'm glad you're here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're safe now.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Amon's revolution grows stronger by the day. First, he attacked the bending arena! Then it was discovered that Hiroshi Sato was the mastermind behind the Equalist gloves and mecha tanks! And most recently, Amon ambushed Councilman Tarrlok, took his bending, and nearly captured the Avatar as well! Everyone is on edge, wondering where will Amon strike next?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Daddy, you're home. We waited up for you. Is Korra okay?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, she's fine, sweetie.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I was scared. I thought she wasn't coming back.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm sorry you were scared, but everything is going to be fine now. I promise.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mmm. Mmm. The food tastes amazing, Pema. I'm finally starting to feel like myself again.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: We're so thankful you're home safe.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Let me help.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, I realize you've been through a lot, but I need to know everything that happened.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, first off, Tarrlok isn't who he says he is. He's Yakone's son.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: It all makes sense now. That's how Tarrlok was able to bloodbend us without a full moon.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But how did you escape? And where's Tarrlok?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Amon captured him,  and took his bending.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, he showed up out of nowhere. He almost got me, too.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is very disturbing news. Amon is becoming emboldened. Taking out a councilman, almost capturing the Avatar ... I fear Amon is entering his endgame.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Pema, are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: The baby is ... just kicking, really hard, is all. I'm fine.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Should I get Tenzin?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: No reason to worry him, it's nothing.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Can I get some hot water? Korra needs more tea.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You're a firebender. Boil it yourself.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: I'm- gonna step out in case you two want to talk.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Is there something we need to talk about?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I've noticed how you treat Korra. How you acted when she was missing.  You have feelings for her, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What? No! She was taken by a crazy bloodbender! How did you expect me to act?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I like Korra.  But you've been keeping the truth from me this whole time.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The truth? About what?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You're really going to make me say it?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes! Because I don't know what you're talking about!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: The kiss, Mako.  I know.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I- Well I-  Bolin told you, didn't he?!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Don't blame your brother for what you did. Do you have feelings for Korra or not?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Look, things are crazy right now. Can we deal with our relationship problems later?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well there might not be any relationship to worry about later.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin, um, I, I- I need to ask you a favor. It would mean the world to me ... but I-I know it could be a- a potentially awkward situation; furthermore, -

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Spit it out already!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Will you stay here and watch over Pema and the children while I meet with the council? With everything that has happened lately, I want to be sure my family is in safe hands.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Of course I'll help, old friend.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: I didn't realize you two were out here.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Pema! Ye- yes- yes, Lin has agreed to help out around here and keep an eye on things while I'm away.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Thank you! I could use the extra pair of hands.  Would you mind giving him a bath? He's filthy.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: This is not what I signed on for!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank you, Lin! Oogi, yip yip.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I gotta poo!  Really bad!

transcript.speaker: Councilwoman
transcript.text: Do you know where my keys are? I can't find them anywhere !

transcript.speaker: Husband
transcript.text: No, dear.

transcript.speaker: Councilwoman
transcript.text: Oh, found them!

transcript.speaker: Husband
transcript.text: Good, dear.

transcript.speaker: Councilwoman
transcript.text: Don't wait up for me; this council session will probably go late into the night.

transcript.speaker: Husband
transcript.text: The door, dear.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: We're here to fix a spider-rat problem.

transcript.speaker: Councilwoman
transcript.text: I didn't call an exterminator.

transcript.speaker: Husband
transcript.text: Dear?

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: Aah!  Ah, I'm so relieved to see you!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The other council members. Are they all right?

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: I'm afraid not! I just received a call from Chief Saikhan. They've all been captured!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This can't be happening.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: The leadership of Republic City is in your hands now.

transcript.speaker: Council page
transcript.text: It is a tragic day indeed!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: All right, kids, time to go inside.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We heard explosions, what's going on?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Republic City is under attack.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: I've dreamed of this day for so long.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Yes, the time has come for the Equalists to claim Republic City as their own.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Where did you say you parked the car?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's right around here somewhere.  There it is.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Wow, nice parking job.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hey, you guys got arrested and left me alone with the car! I made it very clear I don't know how to drive.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All things considered you did a great job!  But how are we going to pay for all these parking tickets?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Relax, the city is under attack. The police have more important things to worry about.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: This'll come in handy.  Why don't you sit in back? With Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I think I will.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everything all right?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, everything is terrific ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Car! Oh, we're good.

transcript.speaker: Male telegraph operator #1
transcript.text: Chief! Air unit seven was just taken out by an Equalist airship. They've crashed into the harbor!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Send a river rescue unit.

transcript.speaker: Female telegraph operator
transcript.text: Chief, all the river rescue ships have been sabotaged!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Chief Saikhan.

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Tenzin, am I glad to see you. I was afraid you'd been captured too.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm the only Council member left. What's the status?

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Amon has launched simultaneous attacks across the boroughs. The police are trying to regain control but we're spread too thin.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I need to send a wire.

transcript.speaker: Male telegraph operator #2
transcript.text: To whom, Councilman?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The general of the United Forces.

transcript.speaker: Male telegraph operator #2
transcript.text: Councilman, your wire has been sent.

transcript.speaker: Female telegraph operator
transcript.text: Chief, the phone lines just went dead!

transcript.speaker: Saikhan
transcript.text: Catch.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Saikhan, the vents.  We need to evacuate immediately. Everyone stay close to me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Not these mecha tanks again!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Saikhan, no!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Jump!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Tenzin has escaped once again. I can't stand to see Asami fighting alongside those benders.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: We'll capture them before long and you will have your daughter back.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm fine. Thank you, kids. Another moment later and I would have been on my way to Amon.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, guys ... look.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh no.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Everyone, hide inside and remain calm.  Pull it together, Pema! Didn't I just say "remain calm"?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Mommy, what's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: The baby's coming!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Oh no!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Not now, baby!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: The children, where are they?

transcript.speaker: Air Acolyte woman
transcript.text: Don't worry. They're in the other room, totally safe.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Stay away from my dad's ex-girlfriend!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Jinora! You shouldn't be out here!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Get off our island!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Girls! You need to go back inside this instant!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Taste my fury!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Meelo! Be careful!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Never mind.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Take these Equalists and lock them in the temple's basement!  Nice work, kids.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Dad!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh, thank goodness you're all right!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: We caught the bad guys.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You let them fight? Do you realize what could have happened?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I would have been toast if it weren't for your kids.  You should be proud. You taught them well.  Go on, be with your wife.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Pema!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm here, Pema.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Our new son.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hello.  Come, meet your new brother.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: A brother? Well it's about time!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Welcome, I'm Ikki, and this is Jinora and Meelo. We have a super great family and we're so happy that you're a part of it.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: What're you gonna name him?  Can I pick?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: We already chose a name.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Rohan.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm so sorry to interrupt, but more airships are coming.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Everything's not gonna be fine, is it, Daddy?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do you want to do, Tenzin?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I need to protect my family, and get them as far away from this conflict as possible. If Amon got his hands on my children ... I hate to even think of it.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: If you're leaving, then I'm going with you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But-

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: No arguments. You and your family are the last airbenders. There's no way in the world I'm letting Amon take your bending away.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank you, Lin. Korra, I want you to leave this island and hide for the time being.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not giving up.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm not asking you to. I sent word to the United Forces. They will be here soon. And once my family is safe, I will return. With the reinforcements, we can turn the tide in this war.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What you're saying is, we need to be patient.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're learning well.  Stay safe, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You too.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Tenzin, if we're leaving, we'd better do it now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oogi, yip yip!

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry #1
transcript.text: Go! We'll hold them off!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone, climb on!  Let's go, girl!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mustache guy!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nice one, Naga!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: They're gaining on us!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Faster, Oogi!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Whatever happens to me, don't turn back!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin, what are you doing?!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: That lady is my hero.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, she is.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, we should get moving.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Tell me where the Avatar is and I'll let you keep your bending.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I won't tell you anything, you monster.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Very well.

transcript.speaker: Messenger
transcript.text: General, I just received a wire from the Avatar. She says Amon and his forces have gained control of the city. How do you want to respond?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Tell her we will be arriving in three days' time. And that I look forward to winning back Republic City, together.

transcript.speaker: Messenger
transcript.text: As you wish, General Iroh.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Equalists are on the attack! The Lieutenant and his chi-blockers invaded Air Temple Island and forced Tenzin and his family to flee! In the daring escape, Lin Beifong sacrificed herself and saved the airbenders, but she was captured and Amon took her bending away. Now, Team Avatar is in hiding as they await help from General Iroh and the United Forces.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: It is a glorious day, my Equalist brothers and sisters! Amon has torn down the tyrannical bending government!  He has declared bending illegal,  and he has the Avatar on the run.  Our great leader has a vision for the future. One day soon, bending will no longer exist and we will live in a world where everyone is finally equal! The United Forces are on their way right now to try and stop that dream. But we will prevail!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Can you believe Hiroshi?! "The Avatar's on the run". I'm not running from anyone! Let's go back up there and knock some heads; they'll never know what hit 'em.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Relax. General Iroh's coming with an entire fleet of battleships. Then Amon will be the one who's running.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hate this "being patient" stuff.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You two were gone a while.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We were doing reconnaissance.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Whatever.

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Welcome back! Hope you worked up an appetite, 'cause dinner is served.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks so much for letting us hide out with you the past few days.

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Honored to oblige.  My associates and I heartily oppose Amon's so-called "Equalist" policies.  We got benders and nonbenders living together down here, but do you see us fightin'?  No siree; we've figured out how to harmoniously co-exist.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You are a wise and noble hobo.  Mmmm. This is the best-tasting street gruel I've ever had. Seriously!

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: I culled it from the finest dumpsters the city has to offer!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Can't sleep either?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I have this awful pit in my stomach.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Me too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's so crazy. A few months ago I was in the South Pole practicing for my firebending test,  and now I'm in the middle of an all-out war.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know, we didn't even know each other then. And now, I can't imagine my life without you in it.  You're the most loyal, brave, and selfless person I've ever known.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think you're pretty incredible too, but ... you already knew that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I should probably try to get some sleep.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Me too. Good night.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Good night.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: You will now be cleansed of your impurity.  Next.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Coast is clear.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Once the United Forces arrive, we need to be ready to help in any way we can.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They're here!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whoops!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Hmm ... Amon had to know we were coming. So why aren't we meeting any resistance?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait a second ... where are the Equalist airships?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't see any mecha tanks, either.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Something's not right.  It's a trick!  Water and earthbenders, detonate those mines!  What is that sound?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What now?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Where does Hiroshi find the time to keep inventing new evil machines?!

transcript.speaker: Male sailor
transcript.text: Incoming!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's all right, I've got you.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Avatar Korra? You saved my life. Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I was prepared to deal with Sato's mecha tanks, but not these new high-speed aircraft.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know.  Every time we think we have an advantage, Amon outsmarts us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No matter what our plan is, he always has a better one.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Amon is winning so far, but we're not out of the fight yet.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I like this man's confidence! So, how are we not out of the fight?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: A second wave of reinforcements is on the way, but I need to warn them.  Do you still have a way to get a message out?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know just the man for the job.

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: And who is the recipient of this top secret message?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Commander Bumi.  Second division of the United Forces.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin's brother?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Yes, bit of a wild man, but the bravest commander you'll ever meet.

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Ready, sir.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Fleet ambushed and destroyed by Equalist aircraft. Retreat to Red Sand Island until my signal. Do not approach city until you receive the all clear.  Now comes the hard part. We need to ground those aircrafts. Otherwise, Bumi's fleet would never be able to retake the city.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They flew in from this direction. The airfield must be somewhere over this mountain range.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Everyone get ready, we leave at dawn.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's time to take down my father.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, I'm sorry, but I'm not going with you tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Why not?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sick and tired of hiding from Amon. It's time I face him.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: That's not a good plan. We need to stick together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not waiting for him to hunt me down. My guts tell me it's time to end this, on my terms.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Korra, this is not a mission you should be handling alone.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: She won't be.  I'm going with you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You don't have to do that.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes, I do.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Hmm ... My grandfather would respect the Avatar's instinct.  So will I.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Love you, little bro.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Love you back, big bro.  Korra, Amon is a nasty dude. Be careful.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I will.  Good luck. If you're going into the mountains, you should bring Naga.  Take good care of Bolin for me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami.  I'm sorry things got so messed up between us, but whatever happens today, I want you to know how much I care about you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I care about you, too.

transcript.speaker: Gommu
transcript.text: Good fortune and success to you, valiant heroes.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's Amon.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need to get into the temple. Then, when he returns ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We ambush him.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: What are you two doing here?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, we were just transferred.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: Well, you're getting transferred again. Amon wants extra security at the arena today.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The arena? For what?

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: The rally. You should've been briefed about this.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll be there, sir.  I know another way in.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's hide in the attic.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, we're not alone up here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tarrlok?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I don't suppose you're here to rescue me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We had no idea you were here. Are there other prisoners on the island?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: No, I'm the only one.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And what makes you so special?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I'm Amon's brother.  Amon is from the Northern Water Tribe.  He's a waterbender and a bloodbender,  just like I was.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Did you know this all along?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: No,  not until after he captured me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How did your brother end up becoming Amon?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: It all began with my father,  Yakone. With the help of his former gang,  he escaped prison and underwent surgery to change his appearance.  He assumed a new identity, and settled down in the Northern Water Tribe.  That's where he met my mother,  a warm, caring woman.  Before long, they started a family together.  Amon was the firstborn, under the name Noatak. I was born three years later.  Noatak was a good-natured kid, always looking out for me. Those were the good years.  Before my brother and I discovered we were waterbenders. At first we were excited by our new abilities, but our training brought out a different side of my father.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Tarrlok, you'd better shape up or you'll be out here in the cold all night until you get it right.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I'm trying, but-

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Try harder!  Your brother was never this sloppy.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: Dad, he'll get it. He just needs time.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Don't talk back to me, son! Ever!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Even back then, my brother wanted everyone to be treated fairly and equally.  When I was seven, my father took me and Noatak on a hunting trip far away from our home.  He told us his true identity was Yakone, Republic City's most notorious crime boss, and that he was once a bloodbender of rare skill.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: What's bloodbending?

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: The most powerful and feared form of bending in the world. It was declared illegal thanks to that coward, Katara. Our family has the strongest line of bloodbenders in history. You boys have this power inside of you, and I will teach you to master it.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: What happened to your bending, Dad?

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: The Avatar stole it from me.  That's why I brought you out here, to learn your destiny. You two will become bloodbenders of the highest order. When the time is right, you will claim Republic City and you will destroy the Avatar. You must avenge me. That is your purpose in life.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: The good days were behind us.  Every full moon, our father took us on another supposed "hunting trip," where he secretly trained us in bloodbending.  We kept the truth from my mother.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Stop! You're hurting it!

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Toughen up, Tarrlok! You'll need a thicker skin for this.  Very good, son, very good.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: A few years later, my father taught us to bloodbend anytime, without the need of the full moon.  We practiced constantly, and I hated every minute of it.  I had no stomach for manipulating helpless animals. My brother, however, seemed to revel in this newfound power.  He was a prodigy, mastering my father's psychic bloodbending technique by the time he was fourteen.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: That's the way it's done. That's what you need to strive for.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Even though Noatak was my father's favorite, it wasn't any easier for him. He carried the burden of all Yakone's expectations and demands.  Something changed in Noatak over the years;  the loving brother I once knew became cold and detached.  Our father pushed us to extremes, and one day, he made us bloodbend each other.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Noatak, go!  Excellent.  Tarrlok, your turn.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: No.  I won't do it.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: Bloodbend your brother, Tarrlok!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: That felt awful. I don't want to do that to anyone. I never want to bloodbend again.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: You're a disgrace, a weakling. I'll teach you a lesson, you insubordinate-

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: Stay away from him.

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: How dare you bloodbend me!

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: What're you gonna do about it? You're the weak one.  You always say bloodbending is the most powerful thing in the world, but it isn't. The Avatar is. He took your bending away. What could be more powerful than that?

transcript.speaker: Yakone
transcript.text: I made you what you are. You're mine.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: We're your sons,  not your tools of revenge.  Let's go. We can run away from him.  Forever.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Run away? But what about Mom? We can't just leave her.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: He was right about you. You are a weakling.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Noatak! Don't leave! Please! Noatak!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: My father and I searched for days, but we never found a sign of Noatak. We thought he perished in that storm. My mother was never the same after the loss of my brother.  My father stopped training me. With Noatak gone, his hopes for revenge withered.  And he passed away, a few years later.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's one of the saddest stories I've ever heard.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Avatar Korra. I am truly sorry for all that I did to you. I thought I was better than my father, but his ghost still shaped me. I became a soldier of revenge, just like he wanted me to be. And so did my brother. The revolution may be built on a lie, but I think Amon truly believes bending is the source of all evil in the world.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How did you figure out Amon is your brother?

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: When he took my bending, the sensation was somehow familiar. I later recognized it as my brother's bloodbending grip.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, he somehow uses bloodbending to take people's bending.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: I don't know how he does it, but then again, I've never encountered a bender as strong as Noatak.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How in the world do we beat him?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We can't. Any attack we throw at him, he'll redirect with his mind. That's how he's been able to challenge any bender.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So much for our ambush. If we stay here, we're toast. But there's another way to beat him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This whole time, Amon has been one step ahead of us. But finally we have the advantage. We know the truth about him. If we expose him as a bender in front of all his supporters ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: At the rally.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: ... We could take away his true power!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And undermine this whole revolution!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you, for your help.  We can't just leave him here.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Go. Amon can't know anyone spoke with me.  Defeat him. Put an end to this sad story.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Korra and Mako have discovered the truth about Amon's identity. He's a waterbender, a bloodbender, and brother to Tarrlok! Now, Korra and Mako plan to infiltrate the Equalists' victory rally and expose Amon as a fraud. Meanwhile, Asami, Bolin, and General Iroh head toward Hiroshi's secret airfield, where Asami intends to take down her father?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I think we've found our secret airfield.  Bolin, once we get down there, I need you to tear up those runways. We can't let those aircraft take off.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Aye aye, captain!  Ooh, general, general.  All right, you guys wait here until we get back, okay?  Uh-uh, stay.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Why would there be fence posts but no fence?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Thank you all for joining me on this historic occasion!  When I was a boy, a firebender struck down my entire family and left me scarred. That tragic event began my quest to equalize the world.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's a lie, Amon!  Or should I call you Noatak?

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: You want her taken out?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: No.  Everyone calm down, we have nothing to fear from the Avatar. Let's hear what she has to say.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Amon has been lying to you. The spirits didn't give him the power to take people's bending away. He uses bloodbending to do it.  Amon is a waterbender!

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: What is this nonsense?

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: You're desperate, Avatar. Making up stories about me is a pathetic last resort.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Your family wasn't killed by a firebender.  His father was Yakone,  and his brother ... is Councilman Tarrlok.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Hmph, an amusing tale, but I will show you the truth.  This is what a firebender did to me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Equalist supporter
transcript.text: The Avatar is lying!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm telling you!  He's a waterbender.  They don't believe me. It didn't work!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We said what we had to. Let's get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I wouldn't leave yet, Avatar. You'll miss the main event.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... they got away.  We saw them get away!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Asami.  Asami, I know I have hurt you ... and I am sorry. But I believe that one day, you will come to your senses and we can be a family again.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you insane?! How can we be a family after everything you've done?! Mom would hate you for what you've become.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: How dare you? I am avenging her death!

transcript.speaker: Equalist
transcript.text: The airplanes are ready for take-off, sir.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Good, annihilate the fleet.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: That's right, general. I intercepted your message to Commander Bumi. I know exactly where they're hiding.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: How are we gonna get out of here?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I don't suppose you know how to metalbend?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That is a negative, Sir.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Naga! Over here!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Who needs a metalbender?  We got Naga! Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I'm going after those airplanes.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ahh! No, Naga!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Huh, what do you know ... just like a Future Industries forklift.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Tonight, I rid the world of airbending, forever.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Amon, let them go!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: You're welcome to come down here and try to stop me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He's trying to bait you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't care! We have to save them!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: The Avatar needs to be reminded of the power I possess.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where are Pema and the baby?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: In prison.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Beifong?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I don't know.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Follow me, kids.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Get them out of here. We'll create a diversion.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Let's go get your mother and the baby.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Prison break!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let her go!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I told you I would destroy you.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Thanks for looking out for me, Aang.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whoa! Thanks Naga.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: Asami, what do you think you're doing? You are aiding the very people who took your mother away!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You don't feel love for Mom anymore. You're too full of hatred.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: You ungrateful, insolent child!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi Sato
transcript.text: I now see there is no chance to save you!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mr. Sato, you are a horrible father!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You really are a horrible father.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Finally, you are powerless.

transcript.speaker: Lieutenant
transcript.text: Amon! Everything the Avatar said is true, isn't it? I just saw you bloodbend her.  You traitor! I dedicated my life to you!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: You've served me well, Lieutenant.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako ... my bending.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Everything will be all right! We just need to get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I'm impressed. No one has ever gotten the better of me like that.  It is almost a shame to take the bending of someone so talented. Almost.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Impossible!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I - I can airbend?  I can airbend!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... you ... don't !

transcript.speaker: Crowd member #1
transcript.text: Did you see what happened?

transcript.speaker: Crowd member #2
transcript.text: You bending tyrant!

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Evil Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Crowd member #3
transcript.text: He's waterbending.

transcript.speaker: Feathered hat man
transcript.text: He is a bender.

transcript.speaker: Protester
transcript.text: Whoa!

transcript.speaker: Crowd member #4
transcript.text: The scar is fake.

transcript.speaker: Crowd member #5
transcript.text: The Avatar was telling the truth.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Noatak.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: It's over, brother. I'm sorry for what I had to do to you.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Our father set us on this path; fate caused us to collide.  I should have left with you when we were boys.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: Leave with me now. We have a second chance. We can start over, together.  Please, you're all I have left in the world.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I can't believe Amon got you too.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, at least you unlocked your airbending!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bro, not the time.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Right, right, I'll just stand over here  quietly,  in silence.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You saved Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But Amon got away.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Yay, Uncle Bumi's here!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Waaaa-hoooo!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Great, now I have to entertain my brother.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: The two of us together again, there's nothing we can't do!

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: Yes, Noatak.

transcript.speaker: Noatak
transcript.text: Noatak. Hmph,  I had almost forgotten the sound of my own name.

transcript.speaker: Tarrlok
transcript.text: It will be just like the good old days.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I've tried everything in my power,  but ...  I cannot restore Korra's bending.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: But you're the best healer in the world, you have to keep trying!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I'm sorry, there's nothing else I can do. Korra can still airbend, but her connection to the other elements has been severed.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's going to be all right Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, it's not.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, wait.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Go away.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I will, but I just want you to know, I'm here for you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I mean, go away, back to Republic City. Get on with your life.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you talking about?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not the Avatar anymore. You don't need to do me any favors.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't care if you're the Avatar or not. Listen,  when Tarrlok took you I was losing my mind at the thought of never seeing you again, I realized ...  I love you, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I - I can't.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We need to be patient with her. It will take time for her to accept what has happened.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Not now Tenzin, I just want to be left alone.

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: But you called me here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Aang.

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: You have finally connected with your spiritual self.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Aang
transcript.text: When we hit our lowest point, we are open to the greatest change.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I love you too.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I am so proud of you, Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Six months ago, Avatar Korra defeated Amon and the Equalists. Since then the council was disbanded and the United Republic elected its first president. Tenzin's brother, Commander Bumi, retired and moved to Air Temple Island. And Korra and her boyfriend Mako have been the talk of the town. Peace has come to Republic City, but unbeknownst to the Avatar, danger now threatens the Southern Water Tribe.

transcript.speaker: Old salt
transcript.text: This your first watch?

transcript.speaker: Greenhorn
transcript.text: Mmhmm.

transcript.speaker: Old salt
transcript.text: Well then, better keep your eyes peeled laddie.  Ya never know what creatures lurk in the murky depths.

transcript.speaker: Greenhorn
transcript.text: Uh, Sir!

transcript.speaker: Old salt
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Greenhorn
transcript.text: Man overboard! Man overboard!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Iiiiit's pro-bending night in Republic City, and have we got a doozy for you !  Fan favorites, the Fire Ferrets, are about to take on hot newcomers, the Rhino Lions!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Now we all know that our last match was garbage. Terrible !  Even Pabu could've done a better job.  But that's in the past,  because when you back a Fire Ferret in the corner, well mister,  he comes out fighting!  So, let's get out there  and bend like there's  no tomorrow.  Are ya with me?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Ooh, the Fire Ferrets go down in the water, and right into the record books  for the fastest knockout in Pro-bending history!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Where's Mako when I need him?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Looks like you had some car trouble.  Good thing the police are here.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I think these planes are finally ready to ship.

transcript.speaker: Engineer
transcript.text: I hate to mention the elephant-rhino in the room,  but since your father was thrown in prison, no company will work with us.  We're nearly bankrupt.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Don't worry. I'm going to the South Pole to meet with someone who can help us put Future Industries  back on top.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: The Avatar is the winner!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: No fair! You can't go into the Avatar State to win!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You did what!?  The Avatar State is not to be used as a booster rocket! You are toying with a dangerous power that you obviously do not appreciate!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's the Avatar State and I'm the Avatar. Who appreciates it more than me?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Clearly you need more training to grasp the depths of your spiritual connections, not to mention that you're still a long way from mastering airbending.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I have mastered airbending!  Punch punch punch!  See?  Mastered.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Looks pretty good to me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Is it too late for you  to unretire from the United Forces?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: The paperwork's gone through, little brother. From now on, it's 24/7  Bumi time!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You've mastered Korra style airbending, now you need to master real airbending. Hopefully our visit to all the air temples  will give you the inspiration you need to look more deeply into your studies.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Can we see where Grandpa Aang was born?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: How many lemurs can I have?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I wanna get tattoos! But instead of arrows, I want lightning bolts!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You can't get lightning bolts. That doesn't make any sense.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: You don't make any sense!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Fight, fight, fight!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No one's fighting! We're going to have a wonderful time!  Now that the president is in office and I'm not needed on the council, I can finally relax with my family and give Korra the attention she needs.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Great, more attention.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Hah! Relax ... I'd pay money to see that. Maybe I'll tag along just to see "Vacation Tenzin".

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're not invited.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Before we go on your dad's study trip, we're gonna have some real fun in my home town at the Glacier Spirits Festival. They've got rides, games, and all kinds of fried food on sticks.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin's children
transcript.text: Yay!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Yep. There's Vacation Tenzin. And you can't stop me from going to the festival, Mom already invited me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So I walk up and say: "Looks like you had some car trouble. Good thing the police are here."

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Did you write that beforehand?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah! I had a few others.  Let's see, uh ... "Looks like you guys should put more 'try' in triad", huh? Or, "when you get to jail,  tell 'em Mako sent ya".

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ooh, I like that one.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, I'll use that next time. Beifong says if I keep it up, I could make detective soon.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That sounds so fun. All I do is train all day. It's like Tenzin's totally forgotten how I beat Amon.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Tenzin's just trying to help you become the best Avatar you can be.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Of course you'd take his side!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm not taking his side, I'm just ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm gonna take a walk.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Why is it so much easier to bust triads than it is to get through one conversation with my girlfriend?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin's children
transcript.text: Gran Gran!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Oh ... you've all gotten so big.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: We missed you, Aunt Kya.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Ohh, I missed you, too. Your father doesn't bring you to visit nearly enough. He's probably scared I'll beat him up  like when we were kids.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm not scared of you ...  anymore.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You remember Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sir.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I hope you're not getting my daughter into anymore trouble up in the city.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh ... No ... uh ... I ... no.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Knock it off, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wow! Look at all these people that came out to greet us.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh, no. They came to greet them.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: The great chief of the Northern Water Tribe comes to grace us with his  presence. Hooray.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Just relax  Tonraq, he'll be gone  soon enough.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whoa!  Who are the lovely ladies?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's Eska  and Desna, the  chief's children. Desna is a guy.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, no, sure,  I knew that.  Uhhh ...  and which one is Desna?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Good to see you again, Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Good to see you too.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Tonraq.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Brother.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: It's a shame the Southerners have abandoned all connections to the spirits.  Even during the most hallowed times.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I've always loved the Glacier Spirits Festival. It's fun.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: This festival  used to be a solemn time of fasting  and meditation. Now it's just  a chance to watch some rube try to stick an  entire arctic hen in his mouth.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What? Oh, it's so good.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Traditions change. It's not the end of the world.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Tell that to the sailors who are being attacked by angry spirits in southern waters.  Some traditions have  purpose.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait,  spirits are attacking ships?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: I'm surprised the Avatar doesn't know about that. Apparently you haven't been given all of the information you need. It would be my honor to instruct you in the spiritual ways of the Water Tribe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I wouldn't mind learning about fighting spirits.  Airbending is getting pretty boring.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Tenzin is Korra's instructor. He can give her all the training she needs.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: So you've said.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm glad you came with me to this meeting. Varrick is one of the richest men in the world, and he controls the entire global shipping business. So, you're my assistant. Just stand there and don't say anything.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No problem, Pabu and I are natural assistants.  Man, this is nice! I got to get into this whole business thing.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Did ya see that?  Levitation!  I was a foot off the ground!  Is that incredible or what?

transcript.speaker: Male guest #1
transcript.text: How does he do that?

transcript.speaker: Male guest #2
transcript.text: That's unbelievable.

transcript.speaker: Male guest #3
transcript.text: That's amazing.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You looked like  you were just sitting on a pillow.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Are you saying I wasn't levitating?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh ... no?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Well, why didn't anyone tell me? Now I look like an idiot!  Swami, you're fired!  I like you, kid, you're a real straight shooter, just like me. Miss Sato, he's with you?  Brought your tiger shark with ya to do business, huh? Now that's moxie!  Get over here and pop a squat. Zhu Li, get some tea for my guests!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Thank you for meeting with me. As you know, Future Industries is looking for a partner to handle our shipping.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Sure! But first you gotta check out my new venture! Moving pictures! Zhu Li, do the thing!  You're gonna love this!  Mind-blowing, right?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Now forget that! That's the past! Shut it off, Zhu Li!  Imagine watching this!  Ginger, come over here and do your poses.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Spectacular! And, we tell a story; there's romance,  action, some funny animal stuff for the kids. You know, whatever! Thanks, Ginger, go rest your gams.  How about that tiger shark? We're gonna do big business with these movers as I call them.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Okay ... but I'm just concentrating on getting Future Industries back on track. If we could hammer out a deal ...

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Stop! Look me in the eye.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: We got a deal!  We'll hammer out the details at the royal feast tonight.  Now, who wants a rocket boat ride?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Is that how business usually goes?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You are a natural assistant!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is a wonderful feast in your honor, Uncle.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: This is nothing. When this festival was founded, the tribal elders would commune with the spirits. People would watch the brilliant displays of light as spirits danced in the sky.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wow, I've never seen that.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: And that is a shame, since the Avatar is the bridge between the material world and the spirits. That is why I want so badly to teach you. To help you fulfill your destiny.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I thought I had made it clear that Tenzin is teaching her.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Every Avatar before you traveled the world to learn. It was Tenzin and your father who kept you secluded at the South Pole.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought Aang ordered the White Lotus to keep me down here?

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We all did what we thought was best for you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Who I train with should be my decision, Dad, not yours or Tenzin's.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Looks like someone's trying to take your place as the Avatar's stick-in-the-mud mentor.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Bumi, don't pick on Tenzin. You know he's always been sensitive.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm not sensitive!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: As your chief, it is my honor to speak at this festival, which was founded to bring our tribes together and restore the ancient balance between our world and that of the spirits. But I am saddened to see what it has become: a cheap carnival that celebrates greedy and trivial humans.  I feel the time is fast approaching when the North can no longer stand idly by while our Southern brothers slip into total spiritual decay. Angry spirits are already attacking ships in your waters. I only hope we are not too late to change course.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Chief Unalaq everybody, always great to have him in town. Now, let's have some fun with Wacky Wushu's Dancing Otter penguins!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wish me luck.  I'm making my move!  Whee!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Good luck.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Those two have always creeped me out. They smell like a grandma's attic.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, I'm Bolin. I'm a friend of Korra's! You're, uh, Eska right? Wow, I'm just, I am loving these robes.  So, you are from the north right? Cool, that's, like you know, that's my favorite direction.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: I think  he is trying to  establish some kind of bond with you based on your geographic point of origin.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Perhaps it would be interesting to spend time with a person whose ways are so rough and uncultured.  You amuse me.  I will make you mine.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You mean like a boyfriend, or like a slave ...?

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Yes.  Win me prizes.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Unalaq offered to train me. He says he can teach me about the spirits and my connection to them.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sounds good. What does Tenzin think?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin thinks I'm his prisoner or one of his kids. I'll never finish training with him in charge.

transcript.speaker: Game guy
transcript.text: We have a winner!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I mean, you heard what Unalaq said.  The South is spiritually unbalanced and it's the Avatar's job to fix it, but my dad won't even let me think about Unalaq teaching me. Well?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well what?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do you think I should do?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I guess you should do what you think is right. I support whatever decision you make.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh thanks. That's a big help.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I thought you wanted me to be supportive? Now you want me to tell you what I think? Make up your mind!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Just forget it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh, Naga what are you doing?  Naga, hush!  Quiet, Naga, you'll wake everyone up!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, What's going on?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What, is, that?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Got it!  Don't got it!

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Spirit, why are you angry with us? What have we done to offend you?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Go in peace.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How are you able to control that spirit when no one else could?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: As your father could tell you, I have spent my life studying the spirits and learning their ways. All of this knowledge is lost in the South, but I could teach you everything I know.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Chief Unalaq, clearly you are very knowledgeable, but Korra still has much to learn about airbending. And I hope that going to the air temples will help her connect with the past Avatars.

transcript.speaker: Korra
