transcript.text: We're gonna cut this footage together with scenes we shoot of our superstar Bolin here playing a Southern Water Tribe hero  battling the evil Unalaq. No one will root for the North after they see "The Adventures of Nuktuk: Hero of the South "!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm Nuktuk! What do you think?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, man, you should have seen Varrick today. That guy is a genius.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh-huh.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: He's gonna help Asami sell her mecha tanks to the South, and he came up with this great idea for Korra to get General Iroh to fight Unalaq without President Raiko ever even knowing.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What? That's a terrible idea!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And he's gonna put me in the movers as this hero, Nuktuk!  He's a man of action, but he's got a heart of gold. He was born in the tundra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Look, I'm trying to do something that's actually important here.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh. Oh, sorry. Uh, sure. What is it?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Something doesn't make sense about this bombing. I just don't buy that the Northern Water Tribe was behind it.  Wait a second! That's him! That's the guy that attacked the center! I gotta go show this to Beifong!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Glad I could help. Nuktuk saves the day again!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: All right, Meelo, the first thing you need to do as a trainer is establish dominance . You are in charge. Never forget that. Now call Poki.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Poki, come here!  Poki.  Poki, no!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Meelo ... you're rewarding him for bad behavior.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: But he's tickling me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You can't let him nap in the bed with you. You are the alpha lemur. He has to sleep on the floor.  I know it's hard,  but it's for the best.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: No, Poki, this is my bed.  You sleep on the floor.  Being alpha lemur is lonely.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: How did this Cultural Center attack happen right under your nose? And why haven't you arrested the Northerners responsible?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We're working on it, sir.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Well, work harder! If you don't get any results soon, I'm going to find someone who can.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I got a break in the bombing case. I I.D.'d the guy I saw at the scene.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: That's great, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Yeah, you better run that in to Beifong right now.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You think?

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Sure. You're gonna be a hero!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What makes a rookie beat cop think he can interrupt my meeting with the President ?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sorry, I just-- um, I found something out about the bombing.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Well, give it to Lu and Gang, you moron.  Now get out!

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Sorry. Was she busy?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This is the guy I saw sneaking out of the building right before the explosions. He's a member of the Agni Kais. Someone must have hired him to make it look like Northerners attacked the Cultural Center.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Hmm.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Did you learn anything about that remote control I found at the scene? That's gotta be the key to finding out who's really responsible.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Listen, kid, it was the Northern Water Tribe, okay?

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Yeah, give it a rest, Super Cop.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I've heard good things about you. You've made some big triad busts for a rookie.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thank you, sir.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: And you're dating the Avatar, right?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes, sir.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I'm concerned that she might be getting some bad advice from Varrick. You wouldn't happen to know if they're plotting anything that might compromise the security of Republic City, would you, officer?  Let me remind you that you've sworn an oath. You're a man of the law before anything else.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes, sir.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Well, keep up the good work.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wait, there's something you should know.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you for seeing me, General Iroh.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: What can I do?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The South needs military support before Unalaq wipes them out completely, but the President is refusing to give the order. So I decided to come to you directly.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I see. Well, suppose I were to take the fleet South on some routine training maneuvers. And let's say we were to accidentally run into a hostile Northern blockade. We'd have no choice but to defend ourselves, wouldn't we?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I guess you wouldn't. Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Swapping old war stories?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Mr. President.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I hope you're not planning to take any military action without an order from your commander-in-chief?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Of course not, sir.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Good. Because if a single vessel leaves this harbor without my say-so, you'll be court-martialed. Am I clear?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Crystal, sir.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Your activities here are bordering on insurrection. The Avatar does not command the military of the Republic. Don't go behind my back again.  As you were, General Iroh.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hate that guy!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I'm sorry. My hands are officially tied.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I understand. Thanks anyway.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: But you should talk to the Fire Lord. My mother and grandfather have always been good friends with the Avatar, and the Southern Water Tribe. I'm sure they'll be willing to help.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you, General.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wouldn't I be cold wearing this outfit in the snow?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Ah, Nuktuk is never cold.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ohhh.  Hey, Ginger.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: How about that, huh? It's the latest product in my Varri-manageable Hair Line: Varri-dye! We get some shots of her using it before Unalaq kidnaps her, I guarantee we sell a million cases week one.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Bolin, I need you to watch Naga while I'm gone.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Where are you going?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The Fire Nation. I'm going to try to get them to help the South.  I need a boat.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: What happened with General Iroh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He was going to help, but then President Raiko showed up. Someone must have tipped him off, but I can't figure it out. No one knew about it except for us and Asami.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And Mako.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What?  There's no way Mako would have told.  Right?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Poki, sit!  Roll over.  Good boy.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well done, Meelo! I knew you could learn to train Poki.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Not just Poki. I trained all the lemurs. Watch!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've created a monster.  Uh, maybe we should forget about all this training discipline for now. Why don't you and Poki just have fun and play?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Thanks, dad, training makes me tired. Come on, Poki.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You ratted me out to the President?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, let me explain.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Explain why my boyfriend stabbed me in the back?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Look, the President of the Republic asked me a direct question. What was I supposed to do?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You betrayed me, and my family!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Enough! Look, I have a job to do! I can't constantly be worrying about keeping you from making another huge mistake!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I have a job to do too, only it seems like you're always standing in the way of me getting it done !

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, I guess if we're both putting our jobs first, maybe there's no room for our relationship !

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, what? Are you breaking up with me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah. I guess I am.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What the flamey-o happened here?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I broke up with the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You got off easy. You shoulda seen Air Temple Island after Tenzin broke up with me!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: You ruined my wedding!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: No one steals my Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Someone has attacked the Southern Water Tribe Cultural Center. All the evidence points to Northern sympathizers, but Mako suspects there's more to this case. Meanwhile, Varrick has cast Bolin as the hero of his newest mover. Asami has also ventured into business with Varrick, and a shipment of her mecha tanks is on its way to help the South in its war against Unalaq.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: We're under attack!

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Varrick is not gonna be happy about this.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Where is he?

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: Father said he would meet us at this location. He'll be here.  Were you just in the Spirit World?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Never mind that. Where is the Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: She was within our grasp until a dark spirit attacked her.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: They're out of control.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: You didn't get her?

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: The Avatar is dead.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: We finally made it. Now, we must stop the evil Unalaq!

transcript.speaker: Evil Unalaq
transcript.text: The Southern Water Tribe is mine. Next, I will conquer the world with my waterbending doomsday device!

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Don't worry, Juji and Roh-Tan, I will end the evil Unalaq's reign of terror. For I am Nuktuk, hero of the South !

transcript.speaker: Juji
transcript.text: Nuktuk, you're not just the hero of the South, you're our best friend.

transcript.speaker: Roh-Tan
transcript.text: Nuktuk-ity!

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: You two are the best snow raccoon and arctic panda a guy could ask for.

transcript.speaker: Crowd
transcript.text: Aww!

transcript.speaker: Voice narrator
transcript.text: Who's gonna fight for friends and freedom? Nuktuk.  He's the biggest, baddest, bendingest man I know.  Who protects the icy tundra? Nuktuk.  Battling Northies out there in the snow.  When Unalaq starts trouble, he'll punch him in the mouth.  He's Nuktuk, the hero of the South.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Bolin, look up there. What do you see?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I- is this a trick question?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I'll tell you what I see: a star being born. You're a star. People love stars. Stars tell them what to think and how to act. Bolin, have you ever tried to force a monkey marmot to ride a bicycle?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh ... not that I can recall.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Of course you haven't. You can't force monkey marmots to do anything. They've got to want to do it themselves!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Right ...

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: With these movers, we'll have the support of the people, and before long, they'll persuade the President to lend his troops to the war effort.

transcript.speaker: Evil Unalaq
transcript.text: My evil plan is working. I've captured Nuktuk's beautiful girlfriend.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Not so fast, Evil Unalaq! Oh, I will save my true love and the South !  And now, your time is up.

transcript.speaker: Evil Unalaq
transcript.text: It's no use fighting, Nuktuk. My anti-energy net makes bending impossible.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: No! Please. Power ... weakening.

transcript.speaker: Ron-Tah
transcript.text: Nuk-terrible.

transcript.speaker: Voice narrator
transcript.text: Will this be the end of Nuktuk? Can he escape from Unalaq's trap and save the beautiful Ginger? Find out next week on The Adventures of Nuktuk: Hero of the South .

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wow. We got some major chemistry on-screen. Am I right?

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: Yeah. On -screen.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What's wrong? Are you mad because I left you in the clutches of the evil Unalaq? I'm gonna save you in the next episode.  Ginger, let's work through this.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Varrick, another one of your ships has been captured.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Darn it, Zhu Li, haven't I told you I hate getting bad news without first getting good news?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Oh, well, the good news is it looks like your first mover has gotten a great reception.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That's old news! Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Is it true?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm so sorry. Your entire shipment was stolen.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Without that sale, I don't know how much longer I can keep my company going. What am I gonna do?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't worry. I'm gonna find whoever's responsible. Chief Beifong is about to question the captain of the ship.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I know it's been a long day, but walk me through what happened.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: We were ambushed about thirty klicks outside the harbor. We never heard them coming.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: This is the third attack this week at about the same location.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Yep, and smack-dab in Republic City's jurisdiction, which means another problem for us.  All this stress is gonna turn old black beauty gray.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: It's gotta be Northern Water Tribe. They're trying to stop supply lines to the South.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I agree. Is there anything else about the attack you remember? Anything unusual?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: There is one thing. The bombs exploded in a way I've never seen before. They didn't have fuses.  It was like they were being detonated remotely.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Like the bombs at the cultural center.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Wait, where are you going?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I gotta grab some evidence.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Asami, I heard the news. I can't believe they took my fifth favorite ship in the Varrick Industries fleet! Named her after my mom. Rest in piece, Rocky Bottom.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Without the money from that shipment, Future Industries is almost broke.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Chief, I think there's a link between this attack and the attack at the cultural center.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What do you think you're doing?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Solving this case. Did any of the people who attacked you have one of these in their hand? I think it's a remote detonator.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: It was too dark to see anything.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Mako!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Chief, I don't think the people who attacked were Northern Water Tribe.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Of course they were Northern Water Tribe. They were waterbending.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Was this one of the guys who attacked?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: No, I don't recognize him.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Oh, that's embarrassing.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Nice try, Rookie.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Mako, leave.  Now.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Great work, everybody. Another open and shut case for the dynamic mustachioed duo!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Wait, I think Mako might be onto something.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Chief, I know it's a long shot, but I have an idea how we can catch these guys.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Yeah, let's all listen to the rookie.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: He's doing a better job than you!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Whooooo's hungry?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Enough! I don't want to hear your lame-brained rookie ideas. You're a beat cop, not a detective. Now hit the street and do your job!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Lu and Gang are idiots. I hate them and their stupid mustaches.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Forget them. What's this idea of yours?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: A sting operation. I was thinking we'd set up a bait ship, take it out into the open ocean, and capture whoever attacks it.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Let's do it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's not that easy. For the plan to work, we need the police, and Beifong already said no.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We can make it work, just the two of us.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know. I don't want to go behind Beifong's back. If she finds out, I could get kicked off the force.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Mako, I need your help. My Mom is gone. My Dad is in jail. Future Industries is all I have left of my family.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I want to help you, but this is more than a two-person job. First of all, we'd need a ship.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You need a ship? I got a ship. I want in on whatever you're talking about. I love being in on plans.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: The less you know, the better.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Perfect! I love not knowing things.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All right, I'm in. Let's get these guys.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: The ship's all loaded with the dummy crates. Let's get this sting operation going.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Not yet. We need some extra manpower.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What about Korra?  No better muscle than the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Right, uh ... Korra. Yeah, actually, she's um ... she's out of town right now.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Everything okay with you two?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, yeah. Forget about Korra. I'll go talk to Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, Mako, what do you think? I did a little redecorating. It turns out that one of the perks of being a star, you get lots of cash.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Is this a marble statue of you?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: It's also  a hat rack.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We don't even have hats.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's because we never had a hat rack. And now we do. Mako, you seem stressed. I think you need to take a little dipity dip.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't have time to take a dipity dip, okay? I'm trying to catch whoever's been attacking the shipments, and I need your help.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You need my help?  I don't know. I'm kinda busy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're sitting in a hot tub.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm maintaining my instrument. As an actor, my body is my instrument.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you gonna help or not?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You know, I recall a time when I needed your help, and you basically told me to get a life.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So that's a no. What am I supposed to do now?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I don't know, Mako.  Figure it out. Remember? That's what you said to me. Hurts, doesn't it?  Ow! My instrument!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you sure this is a good idea?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, but it's our last resort.

transcript.speaker: Triple Threat doorman
transcript.text: Hey, Mako. Whatever you think we did, we didn't do it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm not here on police business. I'm running an off-the-books operation, and I thought the Triple Threats might want a piece of the action.

transcript.speaker: Triple Threat doorman
transcript.text: How big a piece?

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: So Mr. Law and Order needs our help, huh? What's in it for the Triple Threats?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I am personal friends with that Avatar. I might be able to convince her to give Shady Shin his bending back.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: Sounds good to me, boss.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: What about the rest of us?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I've got vehicles, all brand-new and top of the line. They can be yours if you help.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: I think we got ourselves a deal.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This is right around the area where the attacks happened. So keep your eyes peeled, and stay quiet.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: I agree. Keep quiet. Mouth zipped, don't say a word. That's the best thing to do when you're trying to ambush somebody, which is what we're doing here, and it's basically what I'm always doing. I mean, I am a gangster, after all, and -

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Two Toed Ping, please.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: Oh, right. So, what's it like dating the Avatar.  Come on, Mako, I gotta know.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ping, stay focused!

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: What? What are you so weird about it? If I was dating the Avatar, I'd tell you all about it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: There's nothing to know.  I broke up with her.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You broke up? When? Why didn't you tell me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: Yeah, right. You broke up with the Avatar. Like that happened. Hey, Shady Shin, Viper. Mako says he broke up with the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: Sure he did.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Yeah, I did too.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All right, would you guys knock it off and do your job?

transcript.speaker: Assistant director
transcript.text: And action!

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: Forget about me. You must capture the evil Unalaq before he gets away.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: No! I'll never leave you.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Cut!  There's no kiss in the script.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Sorry, I just kinda lost myself in the moment.  It just felts so right.

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: Urch.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It did, huh? Your girlfriend's about to die, and instead of untying her, you kiss her. Wait a minute! Maybe that will work. Yes! It's genius! Everybody take five. Except for you, Zhu Li. Grab the tweezers. I've got some neck-hair issues to resolve.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So ... that kiss. I liked it. And it seemed like you liked it too.

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: Uch. You're confusing Ginger the actress with Ginger the character.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, okay, I'm sorry. I'm totally getting, like, a weird vibe from you right now. It's like, a minute ago, when we were shooting, you were into me, but now you're not.

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: That's because Ginger loves Nuktuk, not Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But Nuktuk is Bolin. I'm a hero.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: And that's why they call me  Two Toed Ping.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Because you have two extra toes.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: That's right. And there was already a Twelve Toed Ping on the south side.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wait, guys. Do you hear that?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I didn't hear anything.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ah! What's taking so long?

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: You just gotta relax, like me. Maybe try taking your shoes off.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm gonna check it out.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: So how long do we have to stay out here?

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: I told you, it's gonna be a few hours. What, do you have a hot date?

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: Actually, I do. And I wanna look my best. I gotta shower and shave. I have a whole routine, okay?

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Well, your date's gonna have to wait.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: She's not gonna be happy about that.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Too bad. We were paid to keep Mako and that dame  distracted for a few hours, so that's what we're gonna do.

transcript.speaker: Shady Shin
transcript.text: See? This is why I never get dates.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I just overheard Shady Shin and Viper. We've been double-crossed. We have to get off this ship.

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Where do you think you're going?

transcript.speaker: Viper
transcript.text: Get'm!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They're getting closer.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Not for long.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Watch out! We're not gonna make it.  One down, one to go.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We're stalled.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Mako, hang onto something.  What was that all about?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Someone paid the Triple Threats to keep us distracted.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Distracted? From what? Oh no.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Whoever paid the Triple Threats stole everything.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm ruined. My company ... it's over.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We should check out your other warehouses. Maybe they didn't have time to hit them all.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You don't understand. Everything I had was in here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We have to search the place for evidence. If we can find a lead ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Mako ... it doesn't matter anymore.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I can figure this out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Just stop. It's over. I give up.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, I'm not giving up on you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Sorry, I-

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh ... It's-it's okay. Um ... Anyway ... I gotta run. I'm gonna find out who did this. And I know just who to ask.

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: Hey, Mako. Uh, you're not mad about last night, are you?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Who hired you to double-cross us?

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: I don't know.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I think you do know.  And you're gonna tell me, or we're gonna have to change your name to "No Toed Ping".

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: Really, I don't know. You have to believe me. We never met the guy who hired us.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You expect me to believe that?

transcript.speaker: Two Toed Ping
transcript.text: After you left the hideout, some mook showed up and said his boss would pay us to keep you distracted. We'd never seen him before, and we ain't seen him since. Come on, Mako, you know how these deals work. Please, I would never lie to you with my lucky toes on the line.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, have you seen Varrick around? Bolin!  Nuktuk.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes? Oh, hello, Mako. Didn't notice you there.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Where's Varrick? I need to ask him something.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hmm. Can't say that I've seen him. But I've been kinda busy, you know, rehearsing for my big scene. There's gonna be some crazy  "pyrotechnics". That's mover speak for explosions.

transcript.speaker: Assistant director
transcript.text: We need Nuktuk on set. Running explosion scene.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Or sometimes we just call them explosions. Anyway, wish I could stand around here and chitchat, but you know, I gotta go shoot my big scene.

transcript.speaker: Assistant director
transcript.text: Okay, the set is clear. Camera's rolling. And ... action!

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Ginger, stay down! I'm coming for you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How did you rig those explosions to go off like that?

transcript.speaker: Pyrotechnics technician
transcript.text: Neat, huh? It's a Varrick Industries exclusive. Here, check it out.  The explosions use a remote detonator.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Varrick.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami, I think I know who set us up.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Hello, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: He just saved my company.  Varrick bought a controlling interest in Future Industries. Isn't that great?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yep, I like to think I'm always there to stand up for the little guy. Especially if that little guy can help this guy become a bigger guy.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: So what were you saying, Mako? You think you know who hired the Triple Threats?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, and I'm real close to proving it.  I'll fill you in later.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Get away from me!

transcript.speaker: Karu
transcript.text: It's okay, we're here to help you, Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Who's-who's "Avatar Korra"?

transcript.speaker: Karu
transcript.text: What happened to you? How did you end up on our island?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I ... don't know. I can't remember anything.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Avatar has gone missing. After President Raiko refused Korra's request to aid the South in the war of the Water Tribes, she headed to the Fire Nation, seeking a new ally against Unalaq. But unbeknownst to her friends, a dark spirit attacked Korra and dragged her into the ocean. She has washed up on a desolate island with no memory of who she is.

transcript.speaker: Female Sage
transcript.text: We found the Avatar washed up onshore, but she doesn't remember anything.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Raava. Raava. Raava.

transcript.speaker: Shaman
transcript.text: A dark energy has infected her. We must purge it before it destroys her Avatar Spirit.  Let the waters cleanse the darkness that plagues your spirit.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Who are you?

transcript.speaker: Korra's image
transcript.text: I am you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Who am I?

transcript.speaker: Aang's image
transcript.text: You are the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know what that is.

transcript.speaker: Roku's image
transcript.text: In order to remember, you must regain your connection with your Avatar Spirit.

transcript.speaker: Kyoshi's image
transcript.text: If you don't, darkness will engulf the world. You will die, and our era will end.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How do I regain my connection?

transcript.speaker: Kuruk's image
transcript.text: Go back.  Return to the beginning. Find Raava.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Are you Raava?

transcript.speaker: Wan's image
transcript.text: No, but I can help you find her. My name is Wan, and I will show you how I became the first Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: Nobody steals from the Chou brothers!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Really? Because I just did.

transcript.speaker: Big Chou
transcript.text: You're dead, Wan.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Actually, I feel quite alive.

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: Hey, stop!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: He-he-hey, fellas!  You're just in time for lunch!

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: I told you no one steals from us.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Did you steal from the Chous again?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Yeah, and I got to nothing show for it except a few dirty rolls and a whole lot of bruises.  Hey, Yao, I got some food for you.

transcript.speaker: Yao
transcript.text: Mmm. Delicious!  Thank you, Wan.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: You guys are hungry too, huh?

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Wan, you should eat.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: They need it more than I do.  Besides, I'm tired of eating scraps.  If only there was some way to get into the Chous' food cellar. We'd be eating like, well, like Chous.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: If Chou the Elder catches you sneaking into his palace, you'll end up dead. Or worse, he'll banish you to the Spirit Wilds.

transcript.speaker: Yao
transcript.text: No, don't get banished.  You don't want nothing to do with those spirits. They'll get inside ya, scramble up your mind, turn you into this , a monster!

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Don't do anything crazy, Wan. You just gotta accept the world is the way it is. Some people have power. Some people don't. And you don't.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Not yet, anyway.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Are you strong?  Are you fearless? Do you have what it takes to battle the spirits? Then join the hunt.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Count me in.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: We're going to be out in the wilds for a week. You wouldn't last two seconds.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I can handle myself.  We all get fire, right?

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Yeah, but do you know how to use it?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Well, not exactly, but I-

transcript.speaker: Hunter #2
transcript.text: Ah, let him come. Not like we got any other volunteers lining up.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: All right. Welcome to the hunt.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: The lion turtle.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Great guardian of our city, we are venturing into the Spirit Wilds to bring back food for our people. Please, grant us the power of fire.

transcript.speaker: Lion turtle
transcript.text: The power is yours to keep until your return.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: You're first, kid.

transcript.speaker: Lion turtle
transcript.text: May the element of fire protect you against the spirits.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Just make sure you aim at the spirits, not us, okay?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Sure thing.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Everyone, stay close. Spirits love to pick off stragglers.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Uh, guys?  I don't think I can do this.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Now, quit your whining. We haven't even seen a spirit yet.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I think I wanna go home.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: I knew you were nothing but a sniveling coward. Go give your fire back to the lion turtle,  and don't ever show your face around me again.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Wan, you're back.

transcript.speaker: Yao
transcript.text: What goodies did you snatch for us this time?

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: What did you do? You can't steal from the lion turtle.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Really?  Because I just did.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: You know it's forbidden to bring the power of the element into the city. Please, go back to the lion turtle and return the fire.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Jaya, it's time to stop being so afraid of the Chous and show them we have the power to change things.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Hey, Chous! Open the gate, and let us in.

transcript.speaker: Chou the Elder
transcript.text: What are those filthy peasants  doing here?

transcript.speaker: Big Chou
transcript.text: Don't worry father. We'll take care of them.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Hand over all the food you're hoarding,  and we won't give you any trouble.

transcript.speaker: Big Chou
transcript.text: You're not getting past us.  We have the weapons.  You're powerless.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Powerless, huh?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Follow me!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Grab as much food as you can.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Maybe you're right.  Maybe we do have the power to change things.

transcript.speaker: Palace guard
transcript.text: Stop right there!

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Looks like the Chous found backup.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Get everyone out of here. I'll hold them off.

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: No, please! Have mercy!

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: Wan?

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: Even when you have the power,  you're afraid to use it.

transcript.speaker: Chou the Elder
transcript.text: Tell me who else was involved in the rebellion, and I might take mercy on you.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I'm not telling you anything.

transcript.speaker: Chou the Elder
transcript.text: Then, you've left me no choice.  Wan, you are hereby banished.

transcript.speaker: Little Chou
transcript.text: Yeah!  And give back the fire you stole.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: No! Wait. Great lion turtle, I am sorry for stealing the fire from you, and I accept my punishment. But please, I need to be able to protect myself in the wilds.

transcript.speaker: Lion turtle
transcript.text: Never again may you return to this city.  But  I will allow you to keep the power of the element.

transcript.speaker: Yao
transcript.text: Bet he doesn't last  till morning.

transcript.speaker: Frog spirit
transcript.text: Hey,  watch where you're stepping, human!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Who said that?

transcript.speaker: Frog spirit
transcript.text: Down here!  How'd you like it if I started walking all over you?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: You're just a little frog.

transcript.speaker: Frog spirit
transcript.text: Who's little now?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Get off me! Get off me!

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: You are not welcome in my oasis, human.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Please, help me. I'm starving and I haven't slept all night.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Not my problem.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Let me pass.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: You dare use fire against me?  Now, be gone with you!

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: And who might you be?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I am Bushy, the Bush Spirit. And I would like the enter your oasis.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Very well.  You may pass.  Wait a second.  Something stinks.  I knew I smelled a human!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Come on, let me in, just for a little while.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: No! Go back to your lion turtle.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Believe me, I'd love to go back home. But I can't. I was kicked out.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #1
transcript.text: That's too bad.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #2
transcript.text: Poor human.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Don't pity him. He's just like every other human: ugly, destructive, and lacking any respect for nature.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Who are you calling ugly, Ugly?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Mmm.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #1
transcript.text: If you can't go back to your city, then you should go live in another one.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: What? There are other lion turtles?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: "There are other lion turtles?"  Of course there are,  dozens of them! Boy, you humans are stupid, too.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: So which way to the nearest lion turtle city?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Hmm. I think it's on the other side of none-of-your-business valley.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Real funny. You know what? I don't need your help. I'll find it myself.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #2
transcript.text: Good luck!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: It's okay. I'm gonna get you out of there.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Finally, we caught something.  Get it down.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Back off.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Wan? What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I'm saving this animal.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: That animal's our dinner. Now, get out of the way.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Hunter #3
transcript.text: Ahh! He-help! Help!

transcript.speaker: Hunter #4
transcript.text: Get 'em off! Get 'em off!  Ahh!

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Well, looks like you're all out of tricks, Wan.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: I. Really. Hate . Humans!

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: No, no!

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: I don't know what he's screaming about.  He's better looking now.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I feel great. What's in this water?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: It has special healing properties.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Thanks.  So what did you do to that hunter?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Spirits are able to take over a human body for a short time. If I stayed in there any longer, I would've killed him, which I did consider.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Thanks for saving my neck. But why'd you do it?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: I saw you save the cat deer from those hunters. I've never seen such an act of selflessness from a human before.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Told you I wasn't like the others.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Guess I underestimated you, human.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #2
transcript.text: Are you off to find another lion turtle city?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I was. But I think I've had enough of humans for a while. I've decided to stay here and learn the ways of the spirits.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #1
transcript.text: What a great idea.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #2
transcript.text: That'll be fun.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Oh, now, now, hold on. A human living with spirits? It's never been done.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: First time for everything, right?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Hmm. I guess we can try it. I've never had a human as a pet before. I think I'll call you "Stinky."

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: The name is Wan.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Stinky is more accurate.

transcript.speaker: Citizen #1
transcript.text: What happened in the wilds?

transcript.speaker: Citizen #2
transcript.text: Where are the others?

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: Gone. Spirits took them.  They were protecting that kid, Wan, like he was one of their own.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Did you hear that?  Wan's still alive.

transcript.speaker: Huntsman
transcript.text: And the way Wan moves fire, it's like nothing I've ever seen.  He uses it like it's an extension of his body.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Wan has proved that with the power of fire, anyone can survive in the wilds.  We don't have to live under Chou the Elder's rules anymore, so I say we leave this city and start over.  Who's with me?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: You ready to go, Mula?

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: You sure you want to leave?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Yes. It's time I see the rest of the world and find the other lion turtle cities.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: I'm proud to call you my friend, Stinky.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Thank you for everything.  Goodbye, everyone.

transcript.speaker: Friendly spirit #1
transcript.text: We'll miss you.

transcript.speaker: Random spirit #1
transcript.text: The all-powerful spirits are battling!

transcript.speaker: Random spirit #2
transcript.text: They're gonna wipe out the entire valley!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Stop, or you'll destroy everything!

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: This doesn't concern you, human!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: It does when the lives of spirits and animals are in danger.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: If you're a friend to spirits, then use your fire to help me break free.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Don't involve the human. This is between us.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Please, save me. She has tormented me for ten thousand years.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Ten thousand years?  Let him go!

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Thank you, human. You have performed a great service for the spirits.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Do you realize what you've done?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Yeah, I helped a spirit who was being bullied by you.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: You are gravely mistaken. I was keeping him under control.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: And what gives you the right?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: You don't even know who I am, do you?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Should I?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Yes. My name is Raava.  That spirit you freed is Vaatu.  He is the force of darkness and chaos. I am the force of light and peace. Since the beginning of time, we have battled over the fate of this world.  And for the past ten thousand years, I have kept darkness under control and the world in balance,  until you came along.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: So, by freeing Vaatu, I let chaos into the world?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Precisely. The human and spirit realms are headed toward annihilation,  and it's all your fault.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Raava.  I found you.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Avatar Korra has lost her memory! In order to restore it, she has connected with Wan, who would become the very first Avatar. Banished from his home, Wan survived for two years in the Spirit Wilds and learned to master fire. But then, Wan split the spirits of light and dark, Raava and Vaatu, unwittingly plunging the world toward annihilation. Will he be able to stop him?

transcript.speaker: Karu
transcript.text: Should we pull her up?

transcript.speaker: Shaman
transcript.text: No. She is connecting with her deepest Avatar memories.  She must confront her own past if she is to move forward.  We can only hope that she survives her ordeal.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: The human and spirit realms are headed toward annihilation.  And it's all your fault.  This is why humans have no place  interfering in the business of spirits.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: This world is home to all of us, and what happens here is everyone's business.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Thanks to you, this world may cease to exist! I only hope I can track down Vaatu before it's too late.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Let me help you.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: I don't want your help.  Don't interfere with me again, human!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Let's get moving.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Do you see that, Mula?  People. And they have some kind of wind power.  More humans!  I found you.  Wait! I'm friendly!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: The legends are true. Another lion turtle city. And it's flying.  I have got to get over there.  There. Okay, Mula. Wish me luck.  Oh, no--.  Wow.  Hi, how are you? I'm Wan.  Um, sorry to interrupt, but it's been a while since I've seen other humans.

transcript.speaker: Nomad
transcript.text: Where did you come from, stranger?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Another lion turtle city far away. For the past two years I've been living among the spirits and exploring the wilds.

transcript.speaker: Nomad
transcript.text: Remarkable. Come. Sit with us. We would love to hear of your travels.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Vaatu.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: So, we meet again, human.

transcript.speaker: Nomad
transcript.text: Why is the great spirit of the darkness here but not his other half?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Uh, I'll explain later.  Leave these people in peace. They've done nothing to harm you.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Be gone.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: How are you feeling since our split, Raava? I've never been better. When Harmonic Convergence comes, I will destroy you forever.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: I told you not to interfere.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I had to do something. These people were in danger.

transcript.speaker: Nomad
transcript.text: Great spirit of light, we thank you for your help. But how did you become split from Vaatu?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Ask him.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: It wasn't my fault. Vaatu tricked me into freeing him. I'd take it all back if I could.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: It's too late for that. Now that Vaatu is free, he is turning other spirits dark. The more spirits he turns, the stronger he becomes.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: He's getting bigger, and you're getting smaller.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: As darkness grows, light fades.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I'm sorry for endangering your village, but I promise to set things right.

transcript.speaker: Nomad
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Great lion turtle, I ask that you grant me the power of air so that I can defeat Vaatu before it's too late.

transcript.speaker: Air lion turtle
transcript.text: You already carry the power of fire. No human has ever held two elements at the same time.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I'm not like other humans. I can learn to do it.

transcript.speaker: Air lion turtle
transcript.text: Hmm, perhaps. But to do so, Raava must hold the power for you until you master it.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Ancient one, why would I do that for a human? Especially one who's caused so much trouble?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Raava, please, I can't let the world fall into chaos because of my mistake. Neither of us can defeat Vaatu alone, but together we have a chance.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: You may be right. Very well. I will help you to master the power of air.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Thank you. And in return I will help you restore balance to the world.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: What's this harmonic thing Vaatu was talking about?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Harmonic Convergence. That is when Vaatu and I must battle for the fate of the world.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: How long do we have until then?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: About a year in your time.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Then we better start training.  All right, I'm ready to try air. How's this gonna work?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: The only way for me to give you the other element is to pass through your body and combine our energies.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Great. So you've done this before.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: No. This has never even been attempted. It is very dangerous.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: That's what they said about living in the Spirit Wilds, and I survived that. I'm ready. Give me the air.  It feels completely different. If you and Vaatu have the same fight every ten thousand years, why hasn't one of you destroyed the other?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: He cannot destroy light any more than I can destroy darkness. One cannot exist without the other. Even if I defeat Vaatu in this encounter, darkness will grow inside me until he emerges again. The same will hold true if Vaatu defeats me.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: That doesn't sound so bad. Even if Vaatu wins, you'll come back.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Yes, but you will probably not survive to see it. Vaatu will destroy the world as you know it. Darkness will cover the Earth for ten thousand years.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: If I'm gonna help you battle Vaatu, then I should visit more lion turtles.  Why is there so much conflict between humans and spirits in the first place?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: This physical world is where humans come from. Spirits come from another realm. At the north and south poles, the two realms intersect. Over time, more and more spirits have drifted into this world.  Humans have been forced apart, settling on the lion turtles who protect them and losing touch with each other.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Most people think they live in the only human city in the world.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Most humans think only of themselves,  no matter how many others are around.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: When you pass through me, I feel an incredible rush of power.  I feel like I'm changing. The more we practice, the stronger I become.  Smells like smoke.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Humans are nearby.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Let's check it out.

transcript.speaker: Settler
transcript.text: A spirit!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Easy there, fellas. We're friendly.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: I can't believe it. Wan?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Jaya!  What are you doing out here?

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: You inspired us. Once we heard that you survived out in the wilds, we decided to try it too.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Where's Yao?  Did he come with you?

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Yes, but sadly he didn't make it.  We ... we lost a lot of good men along the way.  So why were you protecting this spirit?

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: This is Raava. Don't worry. She's not like the dark spirits you've probably run into.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Dark spirits? What's the difference? We throw fire at any spirit we see around here. Just like they attack any man.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: You have no idea what you're doing. You're only making things worse.

transcript.speaker: Settler
transcript.text: The spirits are coming back!

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Let's wipe 'em out this time!  We'll burn down this whole forest if we have to!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: What happened to you? When did you become so violent?

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: You showed me we could change the world if we just stopped being so afraid. Now we're doing it.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: This isn't what I had in mind.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Get out of the forest, humans.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Wait! We can resolve this peacefully.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Stinky?  You came back.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: It's good to see you again.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: You and Raava are just in time to help us clear these tree-killing fire-lovers out of here just like the old days.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: You are the one who's getting cleared out.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: There's no need for violence. I know there must be a way to work out a compromise.

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: You have a good heart, Stinky. But these fire tossers aren't like you.

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: Spirits like him killed our friends! I can't let them get away with that.

transcript.speaker: Dark aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: We are protectors of the forest. We won't let you burn it down.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: It's Vaatu. He's growing stronger, using their anger to turn them to his side.

transcript.speaker: Dark aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Wipe them out!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Stop, please!  Raava, we need to combine our energies. Maybe then we'll have enough power to stop this.  Enough!  You need to stop fighting now,  before you destroy each other!

transcript.speaker: Aye-aye spirit
transcript.text: Stinky, w-what happened?

transcript.speaker: Jaya
transcript.text: He's controlling all four elements.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Wan, I have to leave your body, or I'll destroy you.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: No. It's working. If you leave, the fighting will start again.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Wan!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: We have to go back.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Don't bother. Your human friends have already been annihilated.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Enjoy your final days. See you at the end of the world!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Raava ...

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: I'm sorry, Wan.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: We're almost there.  I was wrong about you, Wan. I had no idea that humans were capable of such nobility and courage. I'm sorry that we do not have much more time together.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Let's not give up before the battle's even begun. Who knows what will happen?  After all, this is my first Harmonic Convergence.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: This is the southern portal to the Spirit World. Here, Vaatu and I will do battle once again, at the place where the two worlds meet.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Are you ready for our final battle, Raava? Thanks to our friend separating us, I think this time I may be rid of you once and for all.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Before you get to her, you'll have to go through me.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: No human can stand against me .

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Haven't you heard the legends? I'm not a regular human anymore.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: I lived ten thousand lifetimes before the first of your kind crawled out of the mud!

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: It was I who broke through the divide that separated the plane of spirits from the material world!  To hate me is to give me breath. To fight me is to give me strength. Now prepare to face oblivion!

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Raava! The only way to win is together.  Ah!

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: I have to leave you. If I stay any longer, you will die.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: It doesn't matter. If you leave me now, Vaatu will destroy everything. We have to finish this together!

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: The Harmonic Convergence is about to begin. The era of Raava is over.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: We are bonded forever.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: This is your prison now. And I will close the portals so no human will ever be able to physically enter the Spirit World and release you.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: The spirits must stop fighting with humans and return to their home in the Spirit World. I will teach men to respect the spirits so that balance will be maintained.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: I will be the bridge between our two worlds.

transcript.speaker: Fire lion turtle
transcript.text: The world is entering a new age. Our time protecting mankind is over. We will no longer give humans the power of the elements.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: Different groups of people must learn to live together.  This is my mission: to use Raava's light spirit  to guide the world toward peace.

transcript.speaker: Old Wan
transcript.text: I'm sorry, Raava. I failed to bring peace. Even with Vaatu locked away, darkness still surrounds humanity.  There wasn't enough time.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Don't worry. We will be together for all of your lifetimes. And we will never give up.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I remember.

transcript.speaker: Shaman
transcript.text: Do you know who you are?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: My name is Korra. I'm the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Shaman
transcript.text: We've been raising this herd of air bison since the Hundred Year War. I never thought I'd be able to present one to the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you for all your kindness. I wonder how long I've been away.

transcript.speaker: Shaman
transcript.text: That I cannot say, but you do not have much time left. The Harmonic Convergence is only weeks away.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I have to close the spirit portal before that happens.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Korra has regained her memory. By connecting with the original Avatar, Korra learned that to stop Unalaq she must close the spirit portal before Harmonic Convergence, which is only weeks away! Meanwhile, Varrick has made Bolin into a mover star and saved Asami's company. Mako is the only one who suspects that Varrick is up to no good, but can he prove it?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Gotcha!  Furry-Foot, come back.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora, there you are. Come on, everyone's waiting.  Were you playing with someone?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Oh, just some ... imaginary friends.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Stop telling lies.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: It's true. I once beat an earthbender in a rock-throwing contest! I have the trophy to prove it.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: All right, who's ready for an exciting tour of the Eastern Air Temple? We've got a lot to see today, including ancient statues, ancient gardens,  and the meditation hall used by ancient airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Yay. Old things.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra?

transcript.speaker: Jinora, Ikki and Meelo
transcript.text: Korra! Yay, Korra! Korra's back!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Oh, I've missed you!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: And how did you know where to find us?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin's itinerary. We went over it like a hundred times before we left Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: See? This is why schedules are important.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's so great to see you all again.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's great to see you too, but why aren't you training at the South Pole?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, you don't know about the Civil War?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What? No. We've been out of touch with the outside world since we started our vacation.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Tenzin's idea. What happened?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So much. I-I don't know where to start.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Just tell us everything!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everything?  Okay. I opened a spirit portal at the South Pole, but then Unalaq turned out to be a bad guy and wanted to take control of the South, so I sort of started a Civil War, but when I went to find some help, I was attacked by my cousins, and then by a giant dark spirit, and then I forgot who I was, and then I met the first Avatar, and then I realized I shouldn't have opened the portal in the first place, and now I need to close it again!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I knew this would happen.  So Avatar Wan imprisoned this dark spirit Vaatu in the Spirit World?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, and now I think my uncle is trying to free him.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I knew Unalaq was hungry for power, but never realized how far he would go to get it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is all my fault.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, don't blame yourself. This is Unalaq's doing. Now, we must focus on setting things right before he can do any more damage.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: So, you need to close the Southern portal, but if Unalaq's army controls the South, how are we going to get to it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought about that. My best chance to close the portal is from the inside.  I have to enter the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: A journey to the Spirit World. All my years of spiritual training have prepared me for this moment.  I will help you. Today, we enter the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: Father, what are we doing here?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: You're here to straighten out the mess you caused when you failed to capture the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: I told you, it wasn't our fault.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: You're right. It was my fault for trusting you. Harmonic Convergence is almost upon us. This is my opportunity to change the world.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: We'll make it up to you, Father.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Good, because I'll need your help to open the northern portal.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: I thought only the Avatar could do it.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: I believe there is another way.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: This way.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: There it is, the northern portal.

transcript.speaker: Director
transcript.text: Cut! Okay, that's lunch, everyone.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hello? Anyone? Nuktuk's still up here, all alone.  Asami! Hey, what are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Varrick invited me to watch some of the filming.  Are you filming right now?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Right now? Nope. We're uh ... we're at lunch.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami, there you are. Is Bolin around?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Up here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Good. I've got something to tell you both.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ahh! Ow, aww. Oh, I got to stop doing my own stunts .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I found out who's been stealing from Future Industries:  Varrick.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What? No.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: He attacked his own ship?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes! It was a ploy. He wants Republic City to go to war, and he wants control of the businesses that stand to profit the most from it. He already had all the shipping. All he needed was Future Industries.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Varrick helped save Future Industries. He's my business partner now, not an evil mastermind.  Mako, you seemed stressed.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I am stressed!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: See, this is why I had to move out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You guys aren't living together anymore?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Nope. It was time for this eagle hawk to spread his wings and fly.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Sounds like you've had a pretty busy week.  Maybe you just need to relax.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait a minute. Are you two—  you're dating again? What?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Dating? No!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: That's crazy!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Korra just left a week ago!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Guys, listen to me. Varrick is up to no good, and I have proof. The detonators he uses in his movers are exactly like the one I found at the cultural center attack.  And those explosions were exactly like the ones the captain reported when Asami's shipment was hijacked. Don't you see?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Anyone could have gotten their hands on one of those detonators.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah. Let it go, Mako.  Let it go.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Gah! No! I'm not going to let it go!

transcript.speaker: Bodyguard
transcript.text: Varrick's been looking for you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're lucky. This temple is the most spiritual of all the air temples.  Why, this very garden is where my father met Guru Pathik.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wow! Spirit World, here we come.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Are you in the Spirit World?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I would be if Meelo could ring his bell at the appropriate intervals.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Aww, did I do it wrong?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Let's try something else.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought your bell ringing was just fine.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Thanks!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kya, this is too much smoke. You set it up wrong. This isn't going to work.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: I'm sorry. I did what you told me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well, the moment's ruined.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We could have tried a little longer.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Come back, Furry-Foot.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Hey, Jinora, what are you chasing?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Nothing.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Focus, Korra. Focus.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am focusing.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No talking. Feel the energy of the universe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, I feel it.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, really! I'm trying to concentrate here! I don't think this location is going to work either.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's going on with you? First, you're blaming Meelo, then Kya, and now me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well, nothing is feeling right to me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't want to rush your feelings, but we're kind of in a hurry. How did you first get into the Spirit World? Let's try that.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well ... actually, I've never been into the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You've never been into the Spirit World?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: But you used to spend days in the temple meditating.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Trying to get in. It never happened. It's my greatest shortcoming as an airbender, spiritual leader, and son of Aang.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Welcome to the "I Disappoint Dad" club.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: If you've never been to the Spirit World, how were you planning to get Korra into it?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've spent years studying the techniques and theories of ancient spiritual leaders. Now that the Avatar needs me, it must be my time.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin, Harmonic Convergence is almost here. If Vaatu escapes from the Spirit World—

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You have to trust me. I can help you.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: There might be another way. Jinora, is there something you want to tell Korra?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora? She's too young and untrained to have any knowledge about spiritual matters.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Actually, I think I do know where Korra needs to go to get into the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: And how would you know that?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: My spirit friends showed me.  It's okay. You can show yourselves.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How did you do that?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Bunnies!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Actually, they're dragonfly bunny spirits.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: I knew it. Looks like she does know something about spiritual matters.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: So cute!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Bunnies!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Come back!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How long have you been able to do this?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I don't know.  I guess I've always kind of had a connection with spirits.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I think this one likes me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Are they here to help?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I think they want you to go down there.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I don't know. The spiritual energy is historically strongest near the temple.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No offense, but I'm guessing the spirits have actually been to the Spirit World, so I'm gonna follow them.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: If we need to go to the Tenzin World, we'll call you.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Father, haven't the spirits had ten thousand years to open this portal?

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: If they could not succeed, what makes you think we will?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: By entering the Spirit World through the portal, we bring with us something the spirits never had: our bending.  Join me! Together, we can open this portal.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Desna!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Leave him! Keep bending!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: He needs a healer at once!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: This is more important!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: I'm taking him back.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I hear you've got some ideas. You wanna tell me about them?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Go ahead. Torture me all you want. I'm not gonna talk.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Torture? The only thing I want to torture is this pesky foot fungus.  Ah! Eee! Ooh! The burning means it's working.  I heard you've been investigating the recent attacks on my ships, and I think you know that I know that you know, you know?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Know what?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That the world is a dangerous place, and that's exactly why I want to offer you a job on my security force.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I have a job.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
