transcript.text: We need you. Me, Asami, Bolin. We're all in the same team here. We want you to join us. You wouldn't want anything to happen to Asami, would you? I mean, I heard you and her were kind of, uh, an item again. Or what about your brother?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you saying?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I'm saying I want your help to protect them. Without you, who knows what could happen.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thanks for your concern , but the answer is no.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Oh, you are just so cute. I'm going to name you Bum-Ju. It's short for "Bumi Junior".  Don't you think he looks like me?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The resemblance is uncanny.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I think Dad's mad at me.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Your father's not mad. His pride's just a little bruised since he isn't able to see spirits like you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You have a natural gift. That's pretty lucky.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You're the lucky one. You actually got to meet the first Avatar. I know about a lot of Avatars, but I don't know anything about him. Is it even a him? Or is it her?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's a him, Avatar Wan. He was amazing. I saw how he became the first Avatar by fusing with Raava, the Spirit of Light.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: The Avatar is part spirit? Of course! Just like the statue.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: What statue?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: When we were at the Southern Air Temple, I was drawn to this old carving. I couldn't figure out what it was until now. It was the first Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: When did this happen?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It was on the solstice.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's the day I opened the Southern portal.

transcript.speaker: Korra and Jinora
transcript.text: Whoa.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: We're here!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Are you sure these spirits are leading us into the right place?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Of course! I trust Bum-Ju with my life.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look. There are carvings on them.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is an ancient airbender meditation circle.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: There's a lot of spiritual energy in this place, but it feels really strange.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We'll have to perform a spiritual cleansing ceremony.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: What are you talking about?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Dad taught it to me. This site has been neglected for many years. A cleansing ceremony will help strengthen its connections to the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Good job, you cleansed the area of the only spirits that want to help us, and you scared away Bum-Ju.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's working.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Ah! Bats! Evil bats!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Not bats. Dark spirits.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What are we supposed to do?

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Amazing.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Your spiritual training has come a long way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Unalaq may be a horrible person, but his spirit powers are no joke.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: He taught you how to transform dark spirits. I can't even get you into the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everything Unalaq taught me was to help himself. Everything you've done was meant to help me. I am so sorry for turning my back on you as my mentor. I need you now more than ever.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I won't let you down.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The ancient airbenders must have built this site. If we meditate here, we'll be able to enter the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why don't you go first?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: After all these years, my father's dreams for me will finally come true.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hi.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Did you come by to tell me how paranoid I am?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: No. I just wanted to come by to make sure you're okay. You seemed so agitated earlier.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm fine.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Maybe you need a night off. Why don't we go get some dinner?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, thanks. I'm a little busy.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Too busy for Kwong's Cuisine?  Remember? We had our first date there.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Maybe I do need to get my mind off things.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Police!  Hey, Mako.  Hope we didn't interrupt you two lovebirds.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's going on?

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: We busted some Triple Threats who said you hired them for a job.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All right.  It's true. We were trying to figure out who stole Asami's stuff, so we hired them for a sting operation. I'm sorry for going behind your back.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: According to the Triple Threats, you did more than that. They said you helped them steal a warehouse full of Future Industries property.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: That's crazy!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're gonna believe a bunch of criminals?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I have to follow up on a lead.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Well, looky what I found: cash ...  And these.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What are you doing with explosives, Mako?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know where those came from.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: You're under arrest.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: None of that is mine.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Yeah. Should've known you'd hook up with your old pals . Once a Triple Threat, always a Triple Threat.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: This has to be a mistake.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Sorry to break the news to you, sweetie, but your boyfriend's just a crooked cop. That sting operation was just a way to lure you away from your warehouse.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: He was using you the whole time.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's not true, Asami. I would never do anything to hurt you.  It's Varrick . This is all Varrick . He set me up!

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: Yeah, it's Varrick's fault. Varrick.  Varrick.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: You in the Spirit World yet?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, I am not,  and stop bugging me.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: It's okay, Tenzin. Maybe you weren't meant to guide Korra into the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No! Just give me some time.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Stop being so stubborn. It's not your destiny. I think Jinora was meant to guide the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora will not enter the Spirit World! She's not ready for the dangers of the other side, but I am . I've spent years training, studying, and mastering everything there is to know about the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin, we're running out of time.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: If everyone could just be quiet and let me  focus .

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Aunt Kya is right. I can guide Korra into the Spirit World. I'll be all right.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Perhaps I will never have the connections with spirits like I always wanted ... like my father wanted me to have.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's okay, Daddy.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm proud of you.  Go. Close the portal. We'll wait here and keep your bodies safe till you return.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll be all right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: The Avatar is dead, and we cannot open the Northern portal. I have failed you, Vaatu.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: You have not failed me ... yet. The Avatar still lives.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: How do you know?

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Even though my connection to Raava was severed, I can still feel her presence.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: I'll find her.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: The Avatar will find you.  She has just entered the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Korra and Jinora have entered the Spirit World. With Tenzin's daughter as her spiritual guide, the Avatar has one mission – to close the spirit portal before Harmonic Convergence. Meanwhile, Unalaq has been working with the dark spirit Vaatu, who was imprisoned by Avatar Wan ten thousand years ago. Will Korra be able to close the portal and stop Unalaq from enacting his deadly plan?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I can't believe my little girl had to guide Korra into the Spirit World instead of me. If anything happens to her I won't be able to forgive myself.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: She's very smart, and she obviously has a strong connection to the spirits. She'll be fine.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Yeah, Dad went all the time!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: They won't have their bending in there. They'll be defenseless!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Ahem? Excuse me? But I've never had bending, and I don't think I'd call myself defenseless.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Of course you aren't, because you have your ...  um ...

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Positive attitude?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I would've said acute intellect and cat-like reflexes, but whatever.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Why don't you two get some sleep. I'll take the first watch.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Wake us up if you need some company.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Or if any interesting spirit-y stuff happens, like their bodies start floating around and you need someone to help you grab them before they fly off!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Bumi!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I'm just saying, we're here if you need us.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know you are. Thank you.  Please come back soon.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Isn't it beautiful?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Just ... stick close to me, okay? This seems nice, but you never know when we'll run into some dark spirits. Huh!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Look! It's like it's made of jewels!  The spirits are so much more beautiful in their own world than they are at home.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora, be careful! Hold on!  Uh!

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #1
transcript.text: Hey! Watch where you're going, you giant clod !

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry!

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #1
transcript.text: This is a residential area, in case you hadn't noticed. Who do you think you are, stomping through here like that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #2
transcript.text: The Avatar?  Not impressed.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm trying to find the spirit portals? I opened one-

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #3
transcript.text: I heard Unalaq did that!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I did, but-

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #4
transcript.text: Well if you opened it, how come you don't know where it is? Huh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: B-because I was at the South Pole!

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #5
transcript.text: I don't trust her.

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #6
transcript.text: Get out of our world!

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #7
transcript.text: We don't need you!

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #8
transcript.text: You don't belong here!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Get away from me!

transcript.speaker: Meerkat prairie dog spirit #1
transcript.text: Did you guys see that?! She tried to bend at us, in our own holes! Get her!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra! Stay calm! Your energy is upsetting them. You're only making it worse!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ahhh!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora? Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra! Where are you! Hello? I'm lost.  Can anyone help me?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Furry-Foot?  Is that you?  It's so good to see you again!  You're so big here.  I don't suppose you know where Korra is, do you?  We were supposed to go find the spirit portals,  but I don't know how to find anything down here.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's like an awesome tree house!  Wait, I've read about this place.  Grandpa Aang came here. It's Wan Shi Tong's Spirit Library.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ahhh!  Get away!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry I swatted you.  You just scared me.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: You two look lost. Maybe I can help you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know you.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I was good friends  with Avatar Aang.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Iroh!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Hello, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I'm glad you came to visit us in the Spirit World, Korra. You came just in time.  We're having a little tea party, to celebrate May-Jim's wedding.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How can you marry each other? Aren't you ...

transcript.speaker: May
transcript.text: Complete opposites? I know!

transcript.speaker: Jim
transcript.text: I tried to fight it, but she really grew on me!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: The Spirit World is very mysterious, but so is love. Help yourself to some tea and cakes.  They are spirit cakes, so you won't gain any weight-  of course, you won't lose any either!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This part of the Spirit World isn't so scary.  My teapot!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: That's right. It was yours long, long ago.  When you were Avatar Wan, you used it to carry the light spirit, Raava, around- until the two of you became one. It is my favorite thing I found here.  You know, when you make tea in it, you can still taste a little light in every cup.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Wow. I could just stay in here forever, reading.

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: The last human who said that is still here.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Professor Zei!

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: I see that you have some knowledge of the past, so you should know that humans are no longer allowed in my library. Get out.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I thought anyone could come in if they brought you some new knowledge?

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: Those are the old rules. Besides, what has a little girl got to teach Wan Shi Tong, he who knows ten thousand things?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Well, since you've been down in the Spirit World, the humans have invented radio.

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: Yes, I am well aware of the radio.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: But do you know how it works?

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: Of course I do! There is a box, and inside the box, there is a tiny man who sings and plays musical instruments.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Actually, when we speak, our voices produce sound waves. Radio takes those sound waves and converts them into electromagnetic energy that is transmitted through the spectrum-

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: All right, enough. I did not know this.  Apparently, I have been fed some misinformation about the existence of tiny men in boxes.  Still, I am not interested in that human garbage. Now, go away.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: My grandfather was the Avatar, and I came to the Spirit World with the new Avatar to find the spirit portals. I would think that you'd wanna help me.

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: You came with the Avatar, hm? Well, why didn't you say so! Fine, you may look around. But don't break anything- I'll know.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Come on, Furry-Foot, we gotta hurry!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: They say that the game of Pai Sho was invented by the spirits ... although some of them don't seem to grasp it very well.

transcript.speaker: Radish lotus spirit
transcript.text: Just hold on. I'm thinking.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: As you can see, it is a game that requires great patience. But time does not mean much to us here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How long have you lived here?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Oh, I've been here for many years. I had always enjoyed the company of the spirits,  so when my work was done in the material world,  I chose to leave my body behind and come to the Spirit World! It can be a wonderful place, and I've made so many friends.  Korra, what's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I came here with my friend, but I lost her and now I'm all alone.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: You're not alone Korra, it's okay.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! It's not okay! Jinora's gone and I need to find her! She's lost, and we need to go home!  I don't like the Spirit World, I don't want to be here anymore!

transcript.speaker: May
transcript.text: Did you say something to her?

transcript.speaker: Jim
transcript.text: Me? You're the one with the big mouth!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Korra, please stop! Look at what you're doing to everyone!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I did that?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: In the Spirit World, your emotions become your reality- especially for the Avatar, because you are the bridge between the two worlds. You must try to stay positive.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: There, you see?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can make the sun shine?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Even in the material world, you will find that if you look for the light, you can often find it. But if you look for the dark,  that is all you will ever see.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm looking for my friend. I want her here now!  Why didn't she come out like the sun?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I'm afraid finding her won't be so easy.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But what am I supposed to do?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Sometimes the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else.  This little fellow needs to go home as well. Maybe if you help him find his friends, you will be able to find yours.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll take him home! Where do I go?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: The dragon bird nest is located there, at the top of Hai-Riyo Peak.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ugh, it's not in here either! I have to find the portals. Korra is probably waiting for me there right now! I need to find a map that shows where the spirit portals are, could you help me? Thanks, this is it! The Tree of Time! That's where Avatar Wan imprisoned Vaatu! The elders believe that as long as the portals are closed during the Harmonic Convergence, Vaatu will remain imprisoned and the battle between good and evil will not be fought again. But, if both portals are open, spirit energy is amplified greatly. During the Harmonic Convergence, this energy will be great enough to allow Vaatu to break free from his bonds, and the material world will again risk being consumed by darkness. We have to warn Korra!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Leaving so soon? When Wan Shi Tong told me he had a visitor, I had to see it with my own eyes. I can't believe Tenzin sent his daughter here instead of coming himself - what kind of a father is he?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Better than you. Wan Shi Tong, how can you be helping him?

transcript.speaker: Wan Shi Tong
transcript.text: Unalaq has proven to be a true friend to the spirits - unlike the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Why would you wanna help Vaatu escape? He'll destroy everything!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Don't believe everything you read. Why don't you come with me, so you can do some firsthand research?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Furry-Foot ...?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This looks scary. Will you come with me?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: This is something that you must do on your own. The people who have been coming to the Spirit World lately have brought darkness and anger. So that is what you see now. But you have light and peace inside of you. If you let it out, you can change the world around you. Besides, look at this little fellow. This mountain is his home. When you first met him, you were frightened. But does he seem scary to you now?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Many things that seem threatening in the dark become welcoming when we shine light on them. It was good to meet you. Come visit me again - in this life, or the next.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Bye! Okay, time for you to go home. Light and peace ... light and peace ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not afraid of you. You're not scary! You just look that way. I have light inside! It's okay, you can be my friends. My name is Korra, and I'm taking this dragon bird home! Iroh said you could be nice. Do you wanna help me? All right, now let's close that portal and go find Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's where Vaatu is.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: So you've returned, Raava. The Harmonic Convergence is coming soon, and this time, I'm going to wipe you out for good .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think you've said that before, Vaatu. But I'm here to close the portal. You're not getting out.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: You might want to reconsider- that is if you want to save your friend.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora!  I can't believe I trusted you! You made me think you wanted to restore balance with spirits, but this- this isn't balance, it's madness! Now let her go!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: If you want your friend to make it out of the Spirit World, you'll open the other portal now .

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Don't do it Korra!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: What will it be? Open the portal- or lose your friend's soul forever?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Stop! I'll do it.  Now let Jinora go. Ahhh!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: You should've come through the portal. Then you could do this!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ahhh! Korra!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ahhh!

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: I'll see you soon, Raava. Once the Harmonic Convergence comes, I'll be free from this prison, and then I will have my revenge !

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra! What was it like? Did you manage to close the portal? Was Jinora able to help you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin- I'm ... I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Where's Jinora? W-Why isn't she waking up? Korra! What happened to my little girl?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Unalaq has forced Korra into opening the Northern portal and trapped Jinora in the Spirit World. Back in Republic City, everybody loves Varrick's Nuktuk movers. Everybody, that is, except Mako, whose pursuit of Varrick has landed him in the slammer. And in the Southern Water Tribe, Unalaq's army is nearing victory in the Civil War, but Tonraq isn't about to give up without a fight.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Dad's back.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Where's Jinora?  No!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Her spirit is trapped in the Spirit World, but she's going to be all right.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: How could this happen?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It was all my fault.  I should have never let Jinora enter the Spirit World without me. I couldn't protect her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm so sorry, Pema. I tried to save her, but Unalaq tricked me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Don't worry, honey,  I'm not going to stop until our little girl is back safe with us.

transcript.speaker: Song
transcript.text: You've got a visitor.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey. What's with the fancy duds?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm on my way to the big finale for "Nuktuk: Hero of the South."  Yeah, everyone's gonna be there except for, you know, you ... because you're in jail and stuff.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thanks for the reminder.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, I brought you something. I thought this would brighten up your new place. Read the inscription.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: "Dear Mako, Nuktuk says, 'Keep smiling.'"  Did you come by just to give me a poster?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, I came by to give you my sincere, heartfelt words of encouragement. I know our lives have been moving in two different directions, but I want you to know that I will always be there for you.  We are brothers, after all, even if one of us is a member of high society and the other one is a criminal.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I am not a criminal!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Of course I know that, but you do kinda look like one, cause you're in a jail and that's where criminals live.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I was set up! Varrick knew I had figured out he was hiring gangsters to pose as Northern soldiers to get Republic City to join the war. That's why he had me arrested.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ah, I see what you're doing. You're going for the insanity defense. Smart.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No! I'm trying to tell you that Varrick isn't what he seems. Where's Asami? She'll listen to me.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I asked her to come, but she said it was too hard for her. You being in jail like this reminds her of her dad.  Okay, gotta run,  but I'll be back tomorrow. And I am gonna get you the best attorney fame and fortune can buy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, wait. If my theory about Varrick is right, something might go down tonight at your premiere. Promise me you'll keep your eyes peeled.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, okay, big brother. I promise.  Whew! That insanity defense is definitely gonna work.

transcript.speaker: Rebel leader
transcript.text: Should we wait another day? Korra still might come with reinforcements.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We can't wait any longer.  It's time to take back what is ours! It's time to take back our city!

transcript.speaker: Rebels
transcript.text: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Photographer
transcript.text: Say "Nuktuk"!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: There they are folks. The sweethearts of the big screen, and Republic City's most famous couple, Bolin and Ginger.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wow, that was fun! And did you hear what Shiro said? We're Republic City's most famous couple.

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: Bolin, you're a doll, but you're as dumb as the rocks you bend. We are not a couple.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's not what Shiro said!

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Stop stuffing your mustaches with Varri-cakes and get to your post!

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: You got it, boss.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: You two are the pinnacle of refinement.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: This star-studded event just keeps getting star-studdier folks. President Raiko and the First Lady Buttercup Raiko just arrived,  and they're being greeted by entrepreneur extraordinaire Varrick.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: There they are, my two most honored guests.  What do you think?  No expense has been spared, I brought in the finest entertainers from Ba Sing Se, and the best food from around the world. Heck! I even had this red carpet imported from the Fire Nation! They make the best red stuff over there. Fact! All right, picture time.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Varrick, you didn't have to do all this for us.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I wanted to. Mister President, I took one look at your wife and I knew that you were a man of exquisite taste.  And that's why I know you're gonna love this mover!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Varrick, I know what you're doing, and I doubt your propaganda is going to change my mind about going to war with the Northern Water Tribe.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Oh, I think you'll be surprised how persuasive I can be.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Thank you all for  coming for the finale of "Nuktuk: Hero of the South"! You know, when I first started this project there were a lot of naysayers out there. "You can't make pictures move" they said. "You can't take some knucklehead earthbender and make him a star" they said.  "You can't teach a polar bear dog to speak" they said. Well, they're wrong ! Thanks to the magic of the movers, our furry friends have found their voices, and you'll be shocked to hear what they have to say.  They speak of the injustice that is happening in the Southern Water Tribe right now.  My hope, is that their words, and this epic mover, will inspire a real life hero to rise up, and help.  Thank you again, enjoy the show!

transcript.speaker: Voice narrator
transcript.text: When last we left our hero, he was captured by the Evil Unalaq's dastardly pet bird.  Amazingly, with the power of his whistling, Nuktuk escaped.  And decided to seek out council.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Thank you, wise sage. I will travel to Republic City and seek help.

transcript.speaker: Mover president
transcript.text: Have a seat, I'm just working on a cure for the common cold. No longer will my citizens suffer from the sniffles.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Mister president, there's something more important than the sniffles right now. I need your help to stop the Evil Unalaq.

transcript.speaker: Mover president
transcript.text: Did you say "help"? If there is one thing I love doing, it's helping people.

transcript.speaker: Buttercup Raiko
transcript.text: The seal lion seemed a bit far fetched, but the portrayal of this president is right on the money .

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I think this is your best mover yet.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I just wish Mako was here to see it.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: Mmm. I like to eat the top of the Varri-cake first.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: I just try to shove the whole thing in my mouth at once.

transcript.speaker: Lu
transcript.text: I love our job.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Northern Water Tribe automatons! No!

transcript.speaker: Automatons
transcript.text: Bee bow bop, Nuktuk cannot stop Unalaq, must destroy Nuktuk.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Haha! Arhg!  Looks like you forgot that water, and automatons, don't mix.

transcript.speaker: Automatons
transcript.text: Bee bow bop, oh no, circuits no working.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Hahaho!  We did it! But wait, where's Juji?

transcript.speaker: Roh-Tan
transcript.text: Nuk-no!

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: You can't die Juji! Not on my watch!

transcript.speaker: Juji
transcript.text: It's okay, Nuktuk. At least ... I got to be  your friend.

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: Juji!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you okay? It seems like this mover is really getting to you. You do know Juji's not really dead?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Of course I know. Juji's fine. He comes back to life in the end when the doomsday device shifts the polarity of the Earth. Oops. Spoiler. Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Then what's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I guess I just miss my friends. Everything is going so well for me, but it feels empty without everyone around. Korra's gone, Mako's in jail, you're doing ... business-lady stuff. Team Avatar's fallen apart.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I know. Things have changed to much since we first met.  Why don't you come back in and finish watching the mover with me?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You go ahead. I need another another minute.  That's weird.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: They're after the president!

transcript.speaker: Evil Unalaq
transcript.text: You're too late Nuktuk.  Soon, my doomsday device will shoot this block of ice into the Earth's core, freezing the entire planet, and I will be ruler of Ice Earth!

transcript.speaker: Nuktuk
transcript.text: I don't think so.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I don't think so.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mister President, get back, I'm here to help.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Looks like there's no where to go.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Secure the president and call for backup immediately!

transcript.speaker: Ginger/Actress Ginger
transcript.text: Bolin, look out!/Nuktuk, look out!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: This is unbelievable! Bolin is bending two full stacks of earth disks at once, which would normally be illegal,  but then again, he's fighting three waterbenders,  so all rules are out the window!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Tell me who sent you!

transcript.speaker: Soldier
transcript.text: It was Varrick, please don't hurt me, Nuktuk!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I think this is our cue to exit.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Where do you think you're going?

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: It's a knockout!

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: They're falling back!

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Varrick's plan was to kidnap you and blame it on the North. Then Republic City would have no choice, but to join the war on the side of the South.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I can't believe Varrick would do something like this, and no one saw it coming.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Actually someone did. Remember Mako?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: You got a great officer on your hands.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: He's one of the best.

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: I can't believe my boyfriend is a real life hero!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Boyfriend? Wait, stop. I thought you said we weren't a couple.

transcript.speaker: Ginger
transcript.text: You really are as dumb as those rocks. Of course we're a couple.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Bolin you saved the president! And you proved Mako was right all along. We have to go tell him what happened.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah!  Oh, you meant right now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: President Raiko!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Avatar Korra? What's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sir, I know I've asked for your help before, but things have changed. Unalaq doesn't just wanna take over the South anymore. He wants to destroy the whole world.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Unalaq is going to destroy the world? He really does have a doomsday device?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He's trying to release a powerful dark spirit during Harmonic Convergence, which is only a few days away. If he succeeds, the world as we know it, is over. Sir, we desperately need your help.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I'm sorry, Korra, but my answer is still no.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: There are lives on the line! And my daughter is one of them! Raiko, you must reconsider!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I'm aware that lives are on the line. And that's precisely why my troops are staying here. If the world is going to be thrown into chaos as you claim, I need to protect my citizens. I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Sir, Nuktuk needs your help. I know you love helping people.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Son, I appreciate you saving my life and I'm a big fan of your work, but my decision is final.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Never should have saved that guy.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: If you guys need help, I'm here for you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, me too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you. It's so good to see you guys again.  Wait. Where's Mako?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So, how was the big premiere?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I saved the president, in real life!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wait, wh-what?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You were right about Varrick. He tried to kidnap Raiko!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I knew it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But it didn't work, because of you, and because of me. Let's just say we both did good. Beifong says you're free to go.  Sorry for ever doubting you, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't worry about it bro.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Nice job, Mako. You're going to make a great detective.

transcript.speaker: Gang
transcript.text: But chief, there aren't any detective openings right now.

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: Actually we have two openings.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako, I've missed you so much.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh yeah, did I forget to tell you? Korra's back.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra ... hey, I missed you, too. So you're not still mad at me?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why would I be mad?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We had that fight before you left, remember?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, not really. I got attacked by a dark spirit and I lost my memory for a little while. Maybe it hasn't all come back yet. Was it a bad fight?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh ...  No. No, it wasn't that bad.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, we don't have much time. We need to figure out how to deal with Unalaq.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I think I know just the man to talk to.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Guys, hey,  what do you think? Varrick Industries built this prison, and I had this cell made special. I had a feeling I'd end up here one day.  Zhu Li, c'mon, we got guests!  Whip up a pot of that green tea I love!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Yes, sir.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zhu Li's in prison with you?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Of course! I don't go anywhere without my assistant. Do you?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We're not interested in your tea. And this isn't a friendly visit.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Don't tell me you guys are still mad about everything that happened. I did some good things, too.  Korra, who warned you about Unalaq?  I did.  Bolin, who got you into the movers?  I did.  Asami, who saved your company?  I did.  Mako, who got you thrown in jail!?  I did!  Oh yeah, guess that was a bad thing.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You stole everything from me and you tried to kidnap the president. Those are pretty bad, too.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I wasn't going to hurt him. I just needed to start a war. Well, a bigger war.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well we're gonna end it. Where's all the stuff you stole from Asami?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: The Future Industries' stuff? It's on my battleship.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You have a battleship?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Of course I do! I bought the first one they made! Named her the "Zhu Li".

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You named your battleship after your assistant?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yup. They're both cold, heartless war machines.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Your tea, sir.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Look, I'm truly sorry for the mess I caused. Let me make it up to you,  take Zhu Li.  My battleship, it's yours, and everything on it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's not the fleet we were looking for, but it's the next best thing.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right! Team Avatar is back in business. Haha!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's okay. We're going to stop Unalaq, and get Jinora back.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hope my dad's all right.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sure he's fine.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Get the men and fall back.

transcript.speaker: Rebel
transcript.text: What about you?

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I'm going to end this, right now. Go.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Hello, Tonraq. Looking for me?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Brother, I'm too strong for you.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: You're no brother of mine. You betrayed me, you had me banished!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Yes! I did.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Stop! He's mine.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: You are not the true chief.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: I am. And you will bow to me.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Now that I've defeated you, your daughter is next.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Bolin's a hero. The mover's star stopped Varrick's kidnapping attempt on President Raiko, proving his brother's innocence. Mako and Korra were reunited, but Korra has no memory of their break-up. Meanwhile, Jinora's spirit is still trapped in the Spirit World, and Tonraq and his southern forces have been defeated. Now it's up to Team Avatar to stop Unalaq before Harmonic Convergence.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's up with the coat? And where did you get that pie?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: It's a Varrick ship, you never know what you're gonna find. There's a whole level filled with fun-house mirrors. Of course, there's also the catgator deck.  I miss that guy, he really knew how to make a long trip interesting. So, have you told Korra yet about how  you guys broke up, and you kinda started dating Asami while she was off getting attacked by dark spirits?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Will you keep it down? I'm waiting for the right moment.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh Mako, you know a wise man once told me that delivering bad news to a girlfriend was like ripping off a blood-sucking leech: you just have to do it fast and get it over with.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I hate it when you listen to me. Fine!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Unalaq will be waiting for you. You'll need all of your Avatar power to stop him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm going to close the spirit portals, lock Vaatu in for another ten thousand years, and make Unalaq wish he'd never been born.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh ... Um ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Did you want something?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh no, no, nothing.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: As soon as we reach the Southern Water Tribe, we'll blast through the blockade at the main portal.  Then we can rendezvous with Tonraq and his troops, crash through the defenses around the portal, and enter the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Woah! Since when does my little brother wanna crash or blast through anything?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'll do whatever it takes to save my daughter.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: We all want to save Jinora, but I think your plan might be a tad over-aggressive, seeing as there are only seven of us and one ship.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Really? And what do you suggest?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: An attack like this calls for strategy. I remember when I was surrounded by pirates at the Hurricane Straits. We managed to capture them all, with just a feather, two eggs and a barrel of molasses.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I don't want to hear any of your crazy stories now! This is serious!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Are we almost there?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Almost, but ...  I just picked up a distress signal from the southern troops.  There's a problem.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mom!

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: I'm so happy you're here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where's Dad?

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Unalaq wiped out the entire southern resistance, and captured your father.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll get him back.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Where is my mother?

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: She's in the healing hut. So many injured.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: What happened?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Her soul is trapped in the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Oh my goodness! How long has she been away?

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Almost a week. I've tried to keep her energy flowing, but I can feel her slipping away. You're the only one who can help her now, Mom.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How much longer can she survive like this?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I don't know, but she is very strong to have lasted this long.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I talked to the rebels. They said Unalaq's got the southern portal surrounded.  Harmonic Convergence is only a few hours away.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Then we have to break through the enemy lines ourselves and get to the portal now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's no use in talking any more. We know what our mission is.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: A suicide mission ...

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: You know, I was in a similar situation once. My platoon had crawled through the desert with no water for a week! But when we finally located the only oasis for a hundred miles,  it was surrounded by angry sandbenders. I realized our only chance to get to the water was to drop in from above.  So I fashioned together a catapult, and with the help of a few well-trained hog monkeys ...

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Enough of your ridiculous lies! Can't you see that the fate of the world and Jinora's life depends on what we do here today?!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hold on, maybe Bumi's right.  We don't have a catapult and hog monkeys, but we have a flying bison and there's a plane on Varrick's ship. Maybe we can attack from above.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you thinking?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Mako, Bolin and I can use the plane to create a distraction, and scatter some of the defenses. You, Tenzin, Bumi and Kya can fly into the spirit portal on Oogi when you see an opening.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's get moving.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: What are we still doing here, Father?

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: The invasion was completely successful and the southern tribe is under our control. The spirit portals are open.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: You've restored balance. Now we would like to go home.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: You don't understand. Everything I've achieved so far will pale in comparison with what I'm about to accomplish.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: What else is there? The Water Tribe is united.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: After today, there will be no more Water Tribe; no more nations of any kind.  The world is about to be transformed into something magnificent, and new.  And I will lead this glorious revolution. Now go outside and get the troops ready to defend the spirit portal.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: From whom? We've already beaten everyone.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: The Avatar will be here soon. She has no choice ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you ready?!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm an earthbender, strapped to the wing of a plane, hundreds of feet in the air, so, no?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't worry, there's no way they'll be expecting this.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I think they were expecting it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Asami!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Get ready!  Fire!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There are spirits everywhere. I don't see an opening.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Let's circle around and see if we can find a way in from the other side.  Hold on!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The spirits are weighting Oogi down! We're losing altitude!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Get off of him you sticky, nasty little blob of goo!  Woah!  If I go, you're coming with me!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Bumi!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I wish Varrick was filming this! We could call it "Nuktuk: Sky Warrior"!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Brace yourselves!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Dad ...

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra ... I'm so sorry. I failed you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't give up. Harmonic Convergence isn't here yet. We still have a chance.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We tried.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Congratulations, everyone.  You've all got front row seats for the beginning of a new world order.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You don't know what you're doing, Unalaq. Freeing Vaatu won't make you powerful, it will only make you a traitor to everything good that's happened over the last ten thousand years.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: You think what Avatar Wan did was good? Driving almost all the spirits from this world? The Avatar hasn't brought balance, only chaos. You call yourself the bridge between the two worlds,  but there shouldn't be a bridge: we should live together as one.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Even if Vaatu escapes, I'll put him right back in his prison, just like Wan did.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: It's true that when Wan fused with Raava he tipped the scales in her favor, but this time I'll be here to level the playing field. When Harmonic Convergence comes, I will fuse with Vaatu, and together we will become the new Avatar:  a Dark Avatar. Your era is over.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Think about what you're doing. I know that you've always had a deep connection with the spirits, but you're still a man. You're still my brother, you're Eska and Desna's father. Are you willing to throw your humanity away to become a monster?

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: I'll be no more of a monster than your own daughter. The only difference is that while she can barely recognize her own spiritual power, I will be in complete alignment with mine. Vaatu and I will be as one. No one will be able to stand against us.  Keep them locked up. After the Harmonic Convergence, I will come for Korra.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Yes, Father.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I failed in every way. We've lost Jinora forever.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: There's still a chance. They didn't get Bumi.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Oh, you wanna play some more? Well, bring it on.  Oh, we're playing dirty, huh?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Hmm ... Looks like we've got a music lover here.  Reinforcements!  All right, soldiers, looks like it's on us to save the day, luckily I've got a plan.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Eska, Desna, listen to me.  You've got to help us stop Unalaq. I know he's your father, but Vaatu has made him completely crazy.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: We will never turn on our father.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Please.  If you let me out now, I can still stop him from destroying everything.  Once he fuses with Vaatu, no one will be safe. Desna, he won't be your father anymore.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: You don't know what you're talking about!  Our father is the wisest man in the world. If he says what he is doing is right, I believe him.

transcript.speaker: Northern soldier 1
transcript.text: Huh?

transcript.speaker: Northern soldier 2
transcript.text: You know, if I wanted some ball of evil lurking over my shoulder all the time, I'd have stayed home with my mother-in-law.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: All right, spirit army.  Your general is here. Follow me!  It's working!  It's not working!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Get me out of here!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: All right guys, rescue time.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Bumi, how did you manage to take out this entire encampment on your own?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I did it all with my trusty flute and ... ah, never mind, you wouldn't believe it anyway. Let's get moving.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: You run into the portal, I'll try to hold off anyone who comes after you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, you're too hurt, you need a healer.  Asami, can you take Oogi and my dad back to my mom?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Mhmm.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is my fight now.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra,  I love you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I love you too, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Yip-yip.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Once we're inside, you go find Jinora.  Mako and Bolin will take care of Unalaq, while I close the portal so Vaatu can't escape.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait a second. Worst-case scenario: so we're fighting Unalaq, you close the portals and let's just say something happens to you. Are we going to be trapped in there for eternity?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If everything goes as planned, we'll all walk out together after Harmonic Convergence.  If not ...  Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin, go find Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: C'mon!

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: You're running out of time, Raava.  I know you feel it coming.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After ten thousand years, Harmonic Convergence is here again, and the dark spirit Vaatu is free. Tenzin, Bumi, and Kya have entered the portal to rescue Jinora's spirit. Asami split from the group and took the injured Tonraq to safety. So it's up to Korra, Mako, and Bolin to stop Unalaq before he fuses with Vaatu and becomes a Dark Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Raava,  nothing could stop this moment. Harmonic Convergence is upon us again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not going to let you fuse with Unalaq. You're going right back in that prison.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't let Unalaq back in the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We're on it.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Jinora. Jinora's spirit do you hear me?  It's your Uncle Bumi.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Ah, this isn't working. We can't just randomly wander the Spirit World, call out for Jinora, and expect to find her.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: We just need to employ the simply rules of tracking.  First we locate her footprints ... then we follow them.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Do you even know what spirit footprints look like? Do spirits even leave footprints? Face it, your tracking skills won't work in the Spirit World.  Let me try something.  Jinora is over there.  I feel a lot of spiritual energy coming from that direction.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: We're in the Spirit World. There's spiritual energy in every direction.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Enough!  We can't do this by ourselves. We need a spirit guide.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: There.  Spirit, hello.  I'm sorry to disturb you, but I am in need of your assistance.

transcript.speaker: Dark Spider Spirit
transcript.text: You dare wake me, human? Humans in the Spirit World belong in one place only.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Well, that didn't work. Now where are we?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We're completely lost.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I don't know if we can win this fight.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We don't need to win, we just need to stop Unalaq from getting back in the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We're walking in circles,  I've seen that same spirit mushroom five times.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: That's not the same mushroom.

transcript.speaker: Spirit mushroom
transcript.text: Yes I am.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: See? Even it knows we're lost.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Oh sure, listen to a fungus over your own brother.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: What's that?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Mushroom? Is that you?

transcript.speaker: Spirit mushroom
transcript.text: No, wasn't me.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Iroh?!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How ...? Where ...? It's been so long.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Almost forty years. It's nice to see you again.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How did you know we were here?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: My friendly spirit fox told me you were lost, I came to show you the way out.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Iroh, we are grateful, but we're not looking for the way out. We're looking for my daughter.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I'm sorry to hear that. But you shouldn't be here, Vaatu has escaped and darkness threatens to take over.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm not leaving until I find Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I understand. But I beg you to be careful, if you travel too deep into the Spirit World, you could end up in a place where only the lost will ever find you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: A place where only the lost can find you ...? That's it! I know where to find Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm locking you away for another ten thousand years, Vaatu!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Unalaq?  Are you out there?  He must've gone home?

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Hello, my feeble turtle duck.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Don't let them escape this time.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Are you this is the best way to find Jinora?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Trust me.  Hey you! Spirit! Wake up!

transcript.speaker: Dark Spider Spirit
transcript.text: You again?!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: I thought we were gonna be taken to a prison?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This is a prison.

transcript.speaker: Dark Spider Spirit
transcript.text: Welcome to the Fog of Lost Souls. You will never escape.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Stop!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: We are now one! Now a new era for spirits and humans will begin! And I will lead them all as the new Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well I'm the old Avatar, and my era's not over yet!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: What kind of prison doesn't have any bars or walls? We can walk right out of here.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The Fog of Lost Souls is a spirit prison for humans. I read about that in ancient text. The fog is actually a spirit  that infects your mind and slowly drives you mad, imprisoning you in your own darkest memories.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: How long can we be trapped in here?

transcript.speaker: Zhao
transcript.text: I am Zhao the Conqueror.  I am the Moon Slayer. I will capture the Avatar.  I am Zhao the Conqueror.  I am the Moon Slayer. I will capture the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Hopefully we're not trapped in here as long as that guy.

transcript.speaker: Zhao
transcript.text: You, you're him . The last airbender!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Ah, no! Get off me!

transcript.speaker: Zhao
transcript.text: You've grown. But I will still defeat you.  Come back Avatar. Face me! I am Zhao the Conqueror. I will capture you! Victory will be mine!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: If we stay together, we'll find Jinora and make it out of this fog.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Give in. Your time is over!

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Korra, this fight is not over.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Raava.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Vaatu cannot win. Do not give in to ten thousand years of darkness. You are the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You cannot win.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora! Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Wait a second.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What, do you hear something?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Yes. They're all around us. The cannibals, they're everywhere.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Bumi, you must focus your mind. Right now! There are no cannibals.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Yes, there are! They're gonna eat every last one of us!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Who are you two?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kya, we're your brothers. You must remember, before the fog infects you.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: No, you're just a vision. I have no family. You can't tie me down.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: They're closing in! I gotta get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No! Bumi! Kya! Come back!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Please, let us out.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: His grovelling is pathetic.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: But I do enjoy the sweet scent of desperation.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, your dad has become an evil monster. He's gonna bring on eternal darkness. Why would you protect someone who doesn't care about you at all?

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: Father was going to let me expire when we tried to open the northern portal. Perhaps we should rethink our position.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: No. Don't listen to him. His words are poisoning your mind.  What's with this outburst of emotion?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm sorry, I can't help it. It's just so sad that I'll never be with you again.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: What? Explain yourself further.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Eska, I've always loved you. And I always wanted to be with you. But now that the world is ending,  I'm never gonna get that chance.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: We could have been together, but you left me at the altar.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, I was scared. I was scared of my true feelings for you. Gah, I should have never left you. I'm sorry. And I'm sorry that we'll never have the chance to rekindle the dying ember that was our love into a big fire of love flames.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: You'll never defeat my father. But, should you survive, perhaps we could spend eternal darkness together.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wow! That was the best acting I've ever seen. You completely fooled her.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah right, huh. That was acting.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: They will certainly perish.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You must stay focused. Remember who you are Tenzin. You are the son of Avatar Aang. You are the hope for future generations of airbenders. The fate of the world rests on your shoulders. But what if I fail?  Then your father's hopes of the future dies with you. I can't fail. You will.  Ah, stop it! I am the son of Avatar Aang. I am the hope for future generations of airbenders. I am the son of Avatar Aang.

transcript.speaker: Aang's image
transcript.text: Hello, my son.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Dad,  I've failed you. I am no spiritual leader, and I've let the world down. I'll never be the man you were.

transcript.speaker: Aang's image
transcript.text: You are right.  You are trying to hold on to a false perception of yourself. You are not me and you should not be me. You are Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I am not a reflection of my father. I am Tenzin.  I am Tenzin!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Huh? What happened?

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: I think our brother saved us.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Dad.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You'll be okay sweetie. I'm here.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: What happened? The last thing I remembered was dark spirits taking me away.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You were trapped in the Fog of Lost Souls. And I wasn't going to let you stay there.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'm so happy to see you, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Mako and Bolin
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: He's got the Light Spirit!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: The world is in trouble.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What are you talking about? How do you know?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I can feel it.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: What happened?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's Korra.  This light spirit will guide you out of the Spirit World. I have to go help.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora, wait!

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: Now, ten thousand years of darkness begins!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After fusing with Vaatu, Unalaq became a Dark Avatar and ripped Korra and Raava apart! By destroying Raava, Unalaq and Vaatu transformed into the most powerful dark spirit that's ever lived. Tenzin managed to free Jinora from the Fog of Lost Souls, but her spiritual quest isn't over yet. Can anyone save the world from eternal darkness?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Oooo ... Pretty.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: General Iroh, are your ships in position?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Yes, Mr. President. But I need to know what kind of enemy we're dealing with.

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: It's time to take back the physical world.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Fire!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Monster attack!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: They're over here.  Please, wake up.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: They're gonna be all right. But I need to get them into some spirit water. Right away.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank goodness you're all okay.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Did you find Jinora?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I was able to rescue her soul, but she wasn't ready to return to her body yet.  She sensed that the world was in grave danger.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: She was right.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Were you able to stop Unalaq and Vaatu?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. They fused, then Vaatu ripped Raava right out of me and destroyed her. Vaatu won.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No. I am too young to live through ten thousand years of darkness. Korra, can't you talk to one of your past lives or something?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: When Vaatu destroyed Raava, he destroyed my connection to the past Avatars too.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: If that's true, then-

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The cycle is over. I'm the last Avatar.  I'm so sorry, Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: She needs you now, more than ever.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: It's going to destroy the entire city.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We're going down!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: It's pandemonium in the streets! Giant vines are destroying everything. This is Shiro Shinobi, signing off!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Zhu Li, commence "Operation Winged Freedom".  Do the thing!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The other Avatars may not be able to help you anymore, but, perhaps I can.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No one can help me now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know I haven't been the best mentor to you. But I realized it was because I had a lot of spiritual growth to do myself. There may still be a way for you to stop Vaatu.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Let go of your attachment to who you think you are, and connect with your inner spirit.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Haven't you heard anything I said? Raava is gone. I'm not connected to a spirit anymore.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm not talking about Raava. Raava is not who you are.  Come with me, I need to show you something.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why are you showing me Vaatu's prison?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Because this tree had a history long before it held Vaatu. This is the Tree of Time. And the legends say its roots bind the spirit and physical worlds together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And, you think this tree can help me somehow?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes. I have read that long ago, the ancients would meditate beneath this tree and connect with the great cosmic energy of the universe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: These are my memories.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The Tree of Time remembers all. Korra, the most powerful thing about you is not the spirit of Raava, but your own inner spirit. You have always been strong, unyielding, fearless.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Avatar Wan.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Before he fused with Raava, Wan was just a regular person.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But, he was brave, and ... smart, and always wanted to defend the helpless.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's right. He became a legend because of who he was, not what he was. He wasn't defined by Raava anymore than you are.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone in Republic City is in danger.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You have to help them, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How? We're half-way around the world.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Do as the ancients once did. Connect to the cosmic energy of the universe. Don't bend the elements, but the energy within yourself.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You really think I can do this?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I have no doubt.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you for not giving up on me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm proud of you.

transcript.speaker: Wan
transcript.text: If you and Vaatu have the same fight every ten thousand years, why hasn't one of you destroyed the other?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: He cannot destroy light, anymore than I can destroy darkness. One cannot exist without the other.

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: Find the light in the dark.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Uhhh ... what did you say to her exactly?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Korra's back!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: And she's a blue giant!

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: You're looking for something that is gone.  Raava has been destroyed. And soon you will be too!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They're coming for Korra!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Leave my Bolin alone!

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: I am so done with spirits.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Eska! I love you!  Let's face the end of the world together!

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: You're so romantic.

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: With you out of the way, I will be the one true Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Mommy, it's Jinora. She's ... beautiful.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: What? Let me see.  Be careful sweetie!

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Raava!

transcript.speaker: Unavaatu
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Go in peace.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: Harmonic Convergence is nearly over. We must return to the Spirit World so we can fuse once again.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'll see you soon, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Gran-Gran, I missed you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What about Korra and the others?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Don't worry, they're all right. Korra saved the world.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The Avatar Spirit has returned.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's over.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't even know what to say.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You were amazing.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And the way you turned all gigantic like that, wow! I just wished Varrick was here to film it! It would be the greatest mover ever. After the Nuktuk chronicles of course.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry about your father. But he was already fused with Vaatu. I couldn't save him.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: It seems cousin Korra is under the impression we're saddened by our father's demise.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: But I will not miss him at all. In the end, he became a deplorable man.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Agreed. But how will we explain this to mother?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, I was thinking. I'm not really a fan of a long-distance relationship thing,  so how about you move to Republic City with me.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: I do not think it will be possible.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay. Desna can come too.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: I will not be joining you, Bolin. Desna and I must return home.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But you said-

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Eternal darkness was upon us. I became caught up in the moment.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah. I guess I did too.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: But, you will always hold the special place in the organ that pumps my blood. I will remember you fondly.  My turtle duck.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Bum-Ju, you're okay.  I missed you, little buddy.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Now that you're bonded with Raava once again, are you also reconnected with your past lives?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. I think that link is gone, forever.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I see. Why don't you close the portals, and we'll go home.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe I shouldn't.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What do you mean?
