transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What if Unalaq was right when he said the Avatar shouldn't be a bridge between the two worlds?  What if Avatar Wan made a mistake when he closed the portals?  What if humans and spirits weren't meant to live apart?  Well, what do you think I should do?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I think you should trust your instincts. There is nothing else I can teach you. You are the Avatar. Whatever your decision, I support you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey, can we talk?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Of course.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: There's something I've been wanting to tell you about that fight we had. I know I said it wasn't that bad, but, that's not exactly true. I, um ... I-I broke up with you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I remember.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: But, I thought you said you lost part of your memory.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I did, but being inside the Tree of Time brought it back. I'm sorry for blowing up at you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's okay.  I think we've both said things that we regret.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why didn't you just tell me the truth in the first place?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know I should have, but ... I didn't wanna hurt you all over again. I guess part of me wanted to forget about the break-up too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think we both know that this. Us? Doesn't work.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's over.  For real this time.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'll always love you, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And I'll always love you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You want a hug?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The war of the Water Tribes is over. Unalaq has been defeated, and the Northern fleet is returning home. The Water Tribes will always be allies, but the Southern Tribe is now independent,  and the Southern Council of Elders has appointed my father, Tonraq, to be your new chief!  I've realized that even though we should learn from those who came before us, we must also forge our own path. So that is why I've decided to keep the portals open. Humans can now physically enter the Spirit World, and spirits will be free to roam our world. I will no longer be the bridge. Humans and spirits must learn to live together. My mission will always be to use Raava's light spirit to guide the world toward peace and balance. Harmonic Convergence has caused a shift in the planet's energy. I can feel it. Things will never be the same again. We're entering a New Age.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The world has entered a new age. Harmonic Convergence created an energy shift the likes of which has never been felt before. And after two weeks, Republic City continues to recover from Korra's epic battle with UnaVaatu. Vines have sprouted up all over, creating pockets of wilds the spirits have come to call home. What other changes are in store for our city?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Come back, Bum-Ju!  If you don't want to wear the sweater I made you, that's fine. I'm sorry I got mad!  Bum-Ju, I'm running out of tree. Can we go down now?  Ahhh!  Bum-Ju, a little help!.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Look, I'm airbending!  Ah! Ow, that still hurt a lot.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How are we ever gonna clear away all these vines?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Ugh, I don't get it. I can vanquish Vaatu but not a bunch of stupid vines?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm sure you'll find a way.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Why do you want to get rid of them? You changed the world. We're connected with the spirits again. The wilds are their home.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't think that the people who used to live here are as excited about it as you are.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I gotta go face the press and tell them I still don't have a way to get rid of the vines.  This should be fun.

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #1
transcript.text: Mr President, are you concerned that your approval ratings are now nearly as low as the Avatar's?  Have you seen today's headline? It says "Raik-oh no. Polls pan pres' plans".

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I'm not concerned with snappy put-downs in the press. I'm facing this calamity just like every other citizen.  There's a tree growing right through my office. You think I'm not doing everything I can to get rid of it?

transcript.speaker: Reporters
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, few questions please.

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #2
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, do you regret the way you handled the Unalaq Crisis?

transcript.speaker: Female reporter #1
transcript.text: Why are you forcing the integration of spirits in Republic City?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Listen, I've been trying everything I can think of to get rid of these vines, but-

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #3
transcript.text: Why can't you fix this?

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #4
transcript.text: Are the vines here to stay?

transcript.speaker: Female reporter #2
transcript.text: Is this part of your New World Order?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, Harmonic Convergence was just a couple weeks ago. I just needed a little more time to get everything back to normal.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: The Avatar has put us all in a very difficult position, but my administration-

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Did I put you in a difficult position by fighting the giant force of pure evil that was going to destroy the whole world?  Maybe your administration could have handled that.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: That's all, no more questions.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is a disaster.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Don't worry, we'll figure something out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Easy for you to say. You don't have my poll numbers. Eight percent approval? Who are they asking?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You can't take that to heart. People are just frustrated.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't blame them. I should be able to fix this. I'm the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: You're not gonna believe what just happened. Where's your father?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Dad!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What is it? What's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: The most amazing, wondrous, fantastical thing just occurred. Okay,  Bum-Ju and I had a little fight.  I made him this sweater, and he didn't seem to like it, and I'll admit, it might need work, but it was my first attempt at knitting, so I was a little hurt.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hilarious.  Time for dinner, everyone.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: No, check this out.  I can airbend.  Yeah wait, seriously, I was doing it.  No hold on, I just uh, maybe if I-  No.  I swear, I'm not making it up.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Stop waving your arms around at the table. It's not funny anymore.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: It's not a joke.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's up with him?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Bumi says he airbended earlier, but he can't now. Oh, and I guess he's not very good at knitting either.  I gotta say, I love being a part of this family.  You got the grumpy dad,  the wacky uncle,  the put-upon mom,  crazy kids. Well, that's just great.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Where's Mako?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, you mean the brooding teenager? He's staying in the police station.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Still ?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I told him Tenzin invited us to stay here since our apartment is a vine habitat now, but,  he said he had to focus on work.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Oh, did you see that? I think the napkin moved.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: You blew on it.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Wait!  Maybe I can only do it when my life is in danger. Bolin, bend a giant boulder at me.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, I don't think that's a good idea.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: If you're going to be bending giant boulders, you can do it outside.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No one is bending giant boulders!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Look alive, Uncle Bumi!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I told you!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Unbelievable . You're actually an airbender.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Wait 'till I tell Mom, she's gonna love this.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ow!  Police. He what? Slow down. Okay, I'm on my way.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What the heck did all this?

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: It was my brother. He's out of control.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, just tell me what happened.

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: We were arguing about the books, and Daw was yelling at me. And all of a sudden, things started flying around. He was creating this storm, like-

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Like what?

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: Well, like he was airbending.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sir, that's impossible. There are only five airbenders in the entire world, and, your brother is not one of them.

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: I know what I saw. He was freaking out yelling: "What's happening to me?!" Then, he ran into the back room and locked himself in.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Police. Open up.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Go away!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get out here, sir, or I'm knocking this door down. One, two--

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: I'm so sorry!

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: I told you. Airbending!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Ugh, I can't figure this thing out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Do you think being in the Spirit World during Harmonic Convergence could have given him bending?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I suppose it's possible .

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Maybe Uncle Bumi is just a late bloomer.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: I have been noticing a change in your aura lately.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: And you didn't tell me?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Invisible spirit monster attack?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin, you won't believe this. Bumi just started airbending.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm afraid he's not the only one.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin and Korra
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I got a call last night. About a guy who just started airbending out of nowhere.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You mean there's another one? Where is he now?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He ... blew a door down on me and got away. We got an all-points bulletin out on him right now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, we'll help you look for him. Where should we start?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Oh, well, y'know, you should leave it with the police. It's ... police business. Y'know. It's um ... official.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay.  How are you doing? You know, you're welcome to stay here instead of sleeping at the police station.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I'm fine. I should just, get going. So, as you were  ladies.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is so exciting! New airbenders in the city. I bet we can find that guy before Mako does.  You know I'm not very good at this.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You're the Avatar, master of all the elements. You should know how to drive.  Besides, it's relaxing.  Clutch! Clutch!  That's the brake. Let's try again. You ready?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How long do you think talking to Mako is gonna be like pulling teeth?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well, Mako has never been the most ... "in touch with his feelings" guy,  but it'll get better eventually.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, when I was gone, did he tell you that we broke up?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Yeah ... we all knew. Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's pretty embarrassing.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Actually, I need to tell you something about that,  and I should have told you this sooner, but ... while you were gone ... I ... kind of ... kissed him. I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No wonder he's so nervous around us!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You're not mad?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! I mean, I kissed Mako when he was going out with you, so ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You what?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm so sorry! I thought you knew!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm just kidding. I knew a long time ago.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, whatever happened with Mako, I'm glad it hasn't come between us. I've never had a girlfriend to hang out with and talk to before, except for Naga. This is nice.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Vine! Vine!

transcript.speaker: Fruithog Spirit
transcript.text: Hey! Watch where you're going!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you doing living in the middle of the road in the first place?!

transcript.speaker: Fruithog Spirit
transcript.text: Don't ask me, Avatar! You made the world this way; we're just living in it!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, I don't have anything against spirits, but these vines are causing major problems all over the city!

transcript.speaker: Fruithog Spirit
transcript.text: Spirits, vines. We're all the same. Seems like the Avatar would know that.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Korra, you okay?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think that spirit just gave me an idea how to get rid of these vines ...  But I'm gonna need a lot of water.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's like a dream, Dad. After a hundred and seventy years, new airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Dad.  When that new guy's airbending, does that make him our brother?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well, in a way, all airbenders are our family.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Does that mean I have to share my room? Because I like my personal space.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Of course not. But we might have to get used to not being the only airbenders around anymore.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I hope we have enough for an army .  I want to be Commander like Uncle Bumi.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Air Nomads don't have armies, Meelo.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But maybe, there will be enough to fill the temples again.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: What's wrong, Daddy?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I just wish your grandfather was here to see this.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Will you be airbender President?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, but I think the new airbenders will need lots of help and guidance to understand what it means to be part of our nation. That's a big responsibility.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Don't worry dad, we'll help you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know you will.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hope this works.  What are you guys doing here?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I was alerted that you had a new plan to wipe out these noxious weed. So I thought you'd want everyone to be here to watch.

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #5
transcript.text: Avatar Korra,  do you really think-

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No questions! Just stand there. Silently!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Go in peace.

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #6
transcript.text: How did you know what to do?

transcript.speaker: Male reporter #7
transcript.text: Will you send the spirits away now?

transcript.speaker: Female reporter #3
transcript.text: How soon can we expect public water service to resume?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look out!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's go, people! Hurry.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hang on.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I think that could've gone better.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Can't talk. Meditating.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You must be at the end of your rope. You hate meditating.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought if I really tried I might be able to contact my past Avatars, someone who knows something to help me, but I can't. They're gone and I'm all alone.  Did I ruin everything by leaving the spirit portals open?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You didn't ruin anything. You did what you thought was best for the world, and now things have changed.  Change can be good or bad, depending on your point of view.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know the people's point of view. It's bad.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're not the President, Korra. Your job isn't to fix the daily problems of every person in Republic City. Your responsibility is to bring balance to the entire world, and that means no matter what you do, some people are not going to be happy about it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Right.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: On the other hand, some people will be very happy.  Like me. What you did during Harmonic Convergence may have brought back the Air Nation, and that can only be good for restoring balance. That is the act of a great Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's scary. I have all this power and all these people depending on me, but I don't know what I am supposed to be doing half the time. It seems like I should be ... wiser.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: True wisdom begins when we accept things as they are. You've started a new age, Korra. There's no going back to the past.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mako called!  The cops found a new airbender guy, but when they tried to bring him in, he ran away and climbed to the top of Kyoshi Bridge and won't come down. Ooh sorry, did I interrupt an Avatar wisdom session?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Avatar wisdom is the thing of the past, Bolin.  Come on.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh okay. Is that a good thing?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Depends who you ask.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Come down immediately, or we will be forced to take action.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Stay back! I'm dangerous.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Sorry!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't panic, I'm just here to talk.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Please, I don't know what I'm doing and I don't want to hurt anyone.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tell me about it. Rough day, huh? I'm having kind of a rough day myself. You mind if I sit down here?

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Huh.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, I know you're scared. You've gone through a big change and its kind of my fault. But you're not alone, there are other airbenders and they want to help you. Actually, they are really excited to meet you.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: I don't want to be an airbender. Please, you're the Avatar, make it stop. Ahh!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry, I can't, but I promise you things will get better if you just give it a chance. Let me take you over to Air Temple Island and we can talk this through. Okay?

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Oh! Ahh!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Daw, this is Tenzin. He is going to help you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It is absolutely my pleasure to meet you, Daw. I have never met a new airbender before. Well, at least not one whose diaper I didn't have to change.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Actually, I just fell off a bridge so I could use a fresh diaper right about now.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: So, is this the deal?  We have crisis every other day now thanks to you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Listen, I know you're having a tough time getting used to these changes and I'm sorry for that, but you and everyone else are going to have to learn live with it. The vines and the spirits are here to stay.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Well, you know who's not here to stay?  You! I order you to leave this city. You've caused nothing but trouble since you arrived.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't worry, I was already leaving.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can see my path now. There are new airbenders out there and I'm going to find them and rebuild the Air Nation.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Don't think I'm not going with you. It's so exciting. Who knows who's out there now, discovering the gift of airbending for the first time?

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: You know the drill, Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Of course.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: Hope you still like rice.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Have you ever read the poetry of the great airbending guru, Laghima?

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Guru Laghima lived four thousand years ago in the Northern Air Temple. It is said that he unlocked the secret of weightlessness and became untethered from the earth, living his final forty years without ever touching the ground.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: Is that how you plan to escape? With something you picked up from an old airbender children's story?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Like all great children's tales, it contains truth within the myth. Laghima once wrote: "Instinct is a lie, told by a fearful body, hoping to be wrong."

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: What's that supposed to mean?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It means that when you base your expectations only on what you see,  you blind yourself to the possibilities of a new reality.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Uh, uh, uh. You wouldn't want to singe your friend, would you?

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: How? You're not a ... bender.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Nature is constantly changing. Like the wind.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Now you might want to ration that bowl of rice. You've got three weeks until the next shift change. It's the dawning of a new age. The end of the White Lotus, and soon, the end of the Avatar .

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After a hundred and seventy years, there are new airbenders in the world and Bumi is one of them! So too is the mysterious Zaheer, who escaped from his prison thanks to his new ability. Now banished from Republic City, Korra made it her mission to find the new airbenders. Will she and Tenzin be able to bring back the Air Nation?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Did someone order a fully equipped Future Industries airship?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's perfect! Thanks Asami.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I figured if we're going to Ba Sing Se to search for airbenders, we should do it in style.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yay, airship!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I wanna see!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: C'mon, Poki.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: While you guys are gone, Pema and I will hold down the fort.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Who's excited to spend some time with your Auntie Kya?

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Oh!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Aw, he likes you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako, I'm so glad you're here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Of course, Korra.  Avatar. Avatar Korra.  Once I received your message I proceeded to contact various locations within the Earth Kingdom as ordered by you, the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Right, the Avatar thanks you for your loyal service. Did you find any more leads?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: There are reports of airbenders popping up all over the Earth Kingdom. I marked the villages on this map.  You guys can take it with you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Actually, I was kind of hoping you could come, too.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Really? Uh, it's probably better if I sit this one out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know things have been weird between us since we broke up, but you're a part of Team Avatar, and we can't do this without you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sorry, I can't.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: I'll miss you, sweetie.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'll miss you too. Once we find the airbenders, I'll send word. You can join us at the Northern Air Temple then.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Hey! How come Jinora gets to go with you but we don't? That's so not fair!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yeah! What this girl said! Not fair!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Because if airbenders show up here, they're gonna need some guidance from the two of you. It's a very important job.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Really? Me, a teacher?  Yay!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Those maggots will bow to me!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Go easy on them, son.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mako, wait a sec.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra already asked, bro. I can't just leave Republic City. I have a life here, and a job.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: A life? You sleep under your desk. And what's a more important job than helping the Avatar rebuild an entire civilization?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It's not just that.  I feel like I've been drifting apart from everyone.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, drift back, we need you! C'mon Mako, we're going to Ba Sing Se, where Dad grew up. What if I meet our grandma for the very first time, and she asks me  "Where's your sweet brother?" and I have to say "I'm sorry, Grandma, he had some really important police paperwork to file" and she starts to cry those grandma tears, and is like  "Mako! Why? Why? I can't go on, I ca--"  and then she dies.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, all right,  I'll come with you. I guess I gotta call Beifong. She's not going to be happy.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Bye! We'll miss you!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: As of now, these are the towns where we've gotten reports about airbenders. It looks like we can hit up most of them before we get to Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We're going to bring the Air Nation back from the brink of extinction after nearly two hundred years.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: And it's all because of you, Korra.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: Finally. Our shift change is here.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: Hey! Where are the other guards?

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: Zaheer?!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It's nice to see you again, Ghazan.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Thanks for busting me out. Where did you pick up the new skills?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I have Harmonic Convergence to thank for that. I was given a gift. I believe it's a sign that our path is a righteous one.

transcript.speaker: Townsman
transcript.text: Avatar Korra! Oh it's such an honor to have you come to our humble village.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I hate to get down to business, but is the airbender here now?

transcript.speaker: Townsman
transcript.text: Kuon and his family will be joining us shortly for a special dinner. Please, right this way.  Kuon has been the talk of the town ever since he's got airbending; he's like a local celebrity.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I just want to say it's an honor to meet a fellow airbender.

transcript.speaker: Kuon
transcript.text: Oh, I still think of myself as a simple farmer. Who can airbend!  Oh, I'm so sorry! I still don't have any control.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No worries! I love pie. And so does Pabu.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well, you're so much more than just a farmer now. Harmonic Convergence changed everything. You represent the future of a culture that is being reborn. You're going to help us rebuild the Air Nation.

transcript.speaker: Kuon
transcript.text: I'm gonna do what now? The only thing I'm planning to rebuild is my barn.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But you must come with us to the Northern Air Temple.

transcript.speaker: Kuon
transcript.text: Well, I can't do that. I have a family and a farm.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Of course you can come. This is of the utmost importance. Your wife will understand.

transcript.speaker: Kuon's wife
transcript.text: Wait, what? No, I do not understand.

transcript.speaker: Kuon's daughter
transcript.text: Daddy, where are you going? Why does the bald man want to take you away?

transcript.speaker: Kuon's wife
transcript.text: No one's going to take Daddy away, sweetheart.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Actually, this bald man does want to take him, but it's for an important cause. Your dad is an airbender, and he should learn about his culture.

transcript.speaker: Kuon
transcript.text: I think there's been some sort of misunderstanding. I'm not going with you. I might be able to airbend, but I'm no Air Nomad, I'm no monk.

transcript.speaker: Townsman
transcript.text: Okay, maybe we should just have some dessert huh? Who's up for dessert?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Sir, you must understand, you're an airbender now, and there are thousands of years of culture you must learn about, skills you must master.

transcript.speaker: Kuon
transcript.text: You expect me to abandon my entire life? My family?  No! No sir, I'm not going anywhere with you and I think it's best that you leave.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: In my head, I saw that playing out very differently.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Maybe we should have stayed and tried harder to convince him to join us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Or we could have thrown him in a potato sack and forced him into the ship.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: That's how they got me to join the United Forces.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, we can't coerce people, or throw them in potato sacks. They must come freely. But not to worry, there are plenty of other airbenders out there who will be happy to come with us once they find out what the Air Nation is all about.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: When your son becomes a master, he'll have tattoos all over his body, just like me.  There's nothing more nutritious than our vegetarian diet.  I can tell that you're going to love wearing our ancient airbender robes. They're very breathable.  You'll never have to worry about your worldly possessions again, because you won't have any.  You'll get to shave your head.  Your best friend will be a giant bison!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Ugh, I really thought I had that last guy. Who doesn't want a bison as their best friend?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: It's okay Tenzin, I still want to be an airbender.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, we've tried it your way, and people just don't seem to be responding. It's time for a little tough love.

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: Oh, are you the Avatar? When my son got airbending, my husband and I were so happy. We thought this could open a lot of doors for him, maybe he could finally move out of the basement.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How old is he?

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: He's twenty-two, and you know, still just to figuring his life out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I have a great opportunity for him. We're looking for airbenders to join us at the Northern Air Temple.

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: Ah, that sounds wonderful! I'll get him.  Ryu! Get up here!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hi, I'm Korra.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: So you're like the Avatar or something. Big deal.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uh, I just wanted to talk to you about an opportunity.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Yeah, I heard you talking to my mom, and I'm not interested.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, you're gonna be interested.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're an airbender now and you have a responsibility as a citizen of the world.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Whatever. I didn't ask to become an airbender, you know.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I didn't ask to be the Avatar, but I am, and I'm fulfilling my duties.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: So? You don't have to.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, I do have to.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No, you don't.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, I do!

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No, you don't.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well,  if I didn't embrace my role, then our entire world could be thrown into chaos. Think about that! Is that what you want?

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Maybe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, it's not!

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: So what? Who cares?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone cares!

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: I don't care.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, you do!

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No, I don't.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, you're about to care, you little slacker, because you're coming with me!

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Stop pulling on my collar! You're stretching it out! Mom, are you just gonna let her take me?!

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: I think it's a great opportunity. Just try it for a week and see how it goes.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No! Let me go!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's it!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, enough! Let's get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So nice to meet you! Good luck with your son!

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry #1
transcript.text: We're under attack!

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry #2
transcript.text: Look out!

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: I never thought I'd be so happy to see your ugly mugs again.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Great to see you too, Ming-Hua.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: I'm flattered. You busted me out before that girlfriend of yours.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: We're getting her next.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well, I guess we should just go to Ba Sing Se and try our luck there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know what to do. I just thought more people would be excited about coming with us.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Well, maybe you gotta do more to get them excited. You need to add a little razzle-dazzle.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, razzle-dazzle! We could put on some sort of airbending street performance!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I was gonna say we could cover Tenzin's robe in sequins, but that's even better!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It sounds ridiculous, but it might work.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm willing to try anything at this point.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes! That is the kind of enthusiasm I like to hear!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Come one, come all to witness The Amazing Airbenders! The airbending show that will leave you breathless ... with wind! First up, the tattooed master himself, you know him as the son of Avatar Aang, he shaves every hair on his head, every single day!  It's the one, the only guy with an arrow pointing to his nose, Tenzin!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Now, now, ladies and gentleman, ladies and gentleman, please be quiet. I have some serious news. We've heard that an escaped firebending convict has been spotted near here.  Now, I don't want to panic anyone, but if you see a firebender with a red scarf-

transcript.speaker: Crowd member
transcript.text: I see him! He's right there!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I am the escaped convict, and you will all reap my fire.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh no! Who will help us?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I will. With my airbending skills!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ah! Hey! Let me go! This is not what we rehearsed! Korra!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: With the power of airbending, even this beast can float!  Like a feather.  Look what can be done in only a few short weeks of practice!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No no, don't worry folks. She might be young, but she is in full control!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ladies and gentlemen, if you, or anyone you know is an airbender, please, send them our way! Master Tenzin and Avatar Korra would love to teach them all they know!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey! Hello. If you're looking for airbenders, you just found one.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I wanna join you guys.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Get outta town!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We got our first recruit.  Just to be totally clear, we're going to be heading to Ba Sing Se, then the Northern Air Temple to live as nomads and rebuild the Air Nation. All that sound good to you?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Yeah, Ba Sing Se, rebuild the temple, Air Nomad what-do-you-do, I'm in. Let's go right now.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: This is going to be so great!  You going to love it, er ... ah ... real quick, what's your name?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Kai. So when do we hit the road?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hang on a second Kai, where are your parents? We can't have you come with us without their permission.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: My parents are ... gone.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're an orphan?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: It happened about a year ago. My home town was raided by outlaws, but my parents fought back against them. I was so scared, but they told me not to worry they would protect me, and they did. My parents saved me and the entire village, but they died in the fight. Mum and pap meant everything to me, they're were my whole life.  Ever since then, I've been on the run. Those same outlaws are still after me.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, you don't have to be on the run anymore,  right guys? Tell him.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm so sorry about your parents. I know we could never replace them ...  but we are here for you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll keep you safe, come on.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: When you board this airship, you're going to leave your old life behind and start a new path. That's big brother advice. Just think of me as your big brother.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Guys! I think we got trouble.

transcript.speaker: Earth Kingdom sheriff
transcript.text: Release the boy, or we'll take him by force.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: The outlaws! They're here ... Uh, let's get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We are not running away from anyone.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If you want Kai, you'll have to go through me!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Your days of harassing an innocent boy is over. You outlaws are going to prison.

transcript.speaker: Earth Kingdom sheriff
transcript.text: Outlaws? Innocent boy? I'm a sheriff  and these are my deputies, and this kid is a thief.  Whatever he told you was a lie, we've been chasing him for months.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where's Kai?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Right here, I found him slipping away.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I was just going to the bathroom.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: With your stash of gold?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I told you, I found this on the road.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Enough with the lies kid. I want the truth.

transcript.speaker: Earth Kingdom sheriff
transcript.text: The truth is, he's the outlaw. He spent an entire life in an orphanage, got adopted by a real nice family six months ago, and how did he repay them? By taking their entire life savings. We've been after him ever since.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is that true?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: The person who stole that stuff was the old me. Once I got airbending, I changed. I don't know how to explain it, but I feel like airbending choose me for a reason , like I'm a new person. I'm sorry! Please, you have to listen to me.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Are, are you taking him back to the orphanage?

transcript.speaker: Earth Kingdom sheriff
transcript.text: No, he's headed to jail.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait! You've got the family's life savings, now let us take Kai.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Do you really want our first member of the Air Nation to be a liar and a thief?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He just needs some guidance, Tenzin. Who better to give it to him than us?

transcript.speaker: Earth Kingdom sheriff
transcript.text: Do you want this boy or not?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, you can release the boy into our custody.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't make me regret it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Welcome to the family, little bro.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I just want you to know that I'm going to be watching you, kid. I know exactly what you're all about, 'cause I've been there. You don't have me fooled.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Woah! Hey, lighten up.  I'm turning over a new leaf, making a change.  Don't you worry about me.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Hi, I'm Jinora.  If you need any help with airbending, I could show you what I know.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Thanks, that's real nice of you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora, we're leaving now.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: They came out of nowhere.  I'm so sorry, Lord Zuko.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: How could you let this happen?

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: They caught us by surprise, and Zaheer is an airbender now.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: No! This can't be.  Do you have any idea the power these criminals possess? Individually, they can take down any bender.  Put them all together, they could take down the entire world. And now you're telling me that their leader is an airbender?

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: We can track them.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: We don't need to track them, I know exactly where they're going.  Notify the new chiefs of the Northern Water Tribe that an attack on their prison is imminent,  and send word to Lin Beifong in Republic City. The Avatar must be protected.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus sentry
transcript.text: Where are you going?

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: To stop them.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Air Nation has its first recruit. Team Avatar's search for new airbenders in the Earth Kingdom led them to Kai, an orphan with a shady past. Meanwhile, Lord Zuko is hot on the trail of three escaped criminals who pose a great threat to the Avatar. Unaware of the danger to her, Korra continues her mission to find more airbenders. Next stop, the walled city of Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Light on your feet, Uncle Bumi. Remember, you want to be quick and evasive.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Don't worry about me, little lady. I've been in a scrap or two you know. Ha ha.  Oh, you're just a youngster, so I'm gonna go easy on ya.  Wouldn't want to hurt a kid ...

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Oh.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Uncle Bumi, you've got to work on your stance changes.  Kai, that was just, really good.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Thanks Jinora, you're a great teacher.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Hmm, did I drop my wallet?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Give me that, you little thief!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's so exciting to be on a diplomatic mission to Ba Sing Se. What's the Earth Queen like?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've never met her, but I've heard she can be quite ... demanding.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: This is it, Mako! We made it! This is where Dad grew up! Come here! Look, look!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, calm down, I'm looking.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I wonder how many airbenders are down there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uhh, the Lower Ring looks terrible.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, I can smell it from here. No wonder Dad left.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hello, Middle Ring!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Wow. Now this is more like it.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, Master Tenzin, it is a pleasure to welcome you and your party to the Upper Ring of Ba Sing Se. I'm Grand Secretariat Gun.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Aah, it's got that Upper Ring smell.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Oh no, the queen hates animals.  You'll have to get them out of sight.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, I can just stash Pabu in my shirt,  these two are going to be a little tougher.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Come with me, hurry, I'll take you to your quarters.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Now, when you meet the queen make sure you bow low enough, that's very important, and don't look her in the eye, she can't stand that. If any food is served, don't eat before she eats. Well actually, I have to taste her food first, then she eats, then you can eat. Better yet, just don't eat.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Seems like an awful lot of rules.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Oh, you have no idea. And I'm the one who gets in trouble when people don't follow them, so please, please for my sake try not to upset Her Majesty.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Here we are.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ooh, very swanky.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Now, go in and make yourselves comfortable,  and keep those animals out of sight in the backyard.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, if you'll follow me. We don't want to keep Her Majesty waiting.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Your Majesty, may I present Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: You're ruining the koi pond! It's completely overshadowed by the topiaries! Guards, take that buffoon away and get me someone who knows what they're doing!

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: You, rip everything out and start over!

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: I am surrounded by idiots.  So, I finally get a visit from the Avatar. Let me guess, you want something.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, actually Your Majesty, I was hoping you could ...

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: I hardly think you're in a position to ask me for favors after everything the last Avatar did to the Earth Kingdom.  He and Fire Lord Zuko took advantage of my father's weakness and stole our lands to make their own little empire.  The United Republic is Earth Kingdom territory!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I uh, I'm not sure what I can do about that.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Not that you care, but what's left of my kingdom is falling to ruin. Roving bands of barbarians are raiding villages in the countryside. And now, some of my subjects are refusing to pay their taxes.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm very sorry for your troubles, but actually ...

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: That topiary is supposed to be an eel swan  not a turtle duck!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Hey, has anyone seen Kai?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kai?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Kai, little bro.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: He's not over here.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I don't think I've seen him since we landed.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I knew that kid was no good. He was just waiting for an opportunity to run away again.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: We have to find him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's the point? He obviously doesn't care about us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But he's my new little brother. He's probably lost, and scared.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: He is just a little boy, and he's our responsibility. Besides, he's the only airbender we've recruited so far, we can't lose him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Fine. Bolin and I will find him.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: No, to your left! Your other left!  Do you have these problems with your servants?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't really have servants. But, Your Majesty, the reason for our visit is that we're trying to gather all of the new airbenders who are popping up in the Earth Kingdom, and we'd like your help finding the ones in Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Airbenders in Ba Sing Se. Where did you hear that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Before we left Republic City we got some reports.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Hmm. Well, before I even consider helping you, I'll need you to do something for me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, of course. What is it?

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: I have a vault full of tax money sitting in a town south of here. Barbarians have stolen my past two shipments. Go collect my money and bring it back here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, Your Majesty.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Kai, did you go fishing? You under the bridge?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Here, sir, let me help you.

transcript.speaker: Upper-class man
transcript.text: Oh, thank you, young man. What a strange sudden breeze.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Yeah, that was really weird.

transcript.speaker: Upper-class man
transcript.text: Thanks for your help.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Kai!  Get back here!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Kai, it's us. Mako and Bolin, your new family.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Excuse me, coming through  Pardon me.  Carry on.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you doing running around robbing people?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I was just practicing my airbending.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah right. Let's go.  You're in big trouble.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Your little brother, huh?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah ... just a lovable little scamp, isn't he?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Reminds me of my little brother.

transcript.speaker: Train conductor
transcript.text: Designated express line to the lower ring. Next up, Poh Kong Station.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All right. Let's see if we can catch a train back to the Upper Ring.

transcript.speaker: Ticket master
transcript.text: Passports and tickets.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We can pay, hold on.  Where's my money?  No, Kai wouldn't--  Aww, man.

transcript.speaker: Ticket master
transcript.text: Step aside, beat it you two,  before things get ugly.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: The bad news  is we're stuck here. The good news is  we can go the bathroom wherever we want.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you sure we shouldn't have brought more people to collect the tax money?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There are royal guards waiting at the vault.  I doubt anything will happen. I think Her Majesty likes ordering me around.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ohh man, aww I slipped a disc sleeping here. It's been awhile since we spent the night in a trash pile. It's about how I remembered.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I bet everyone's freaking out that we've been gone all night.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm worried about Kai; he's just a little kid out there on his own. He's probably really scared.

transcript.speaker: Waiter
transcript.text: Your breakfast, Master Fong.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Keep the change.  I love Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Fwoo, I'm getting really hungry.  Haah, we might have to hustle up a little breakfast with the old,  fruit stand scam. Come on.  You remember how it goes,  I push you into the stand,  you scream.  I pretend to faint.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't want any part of it. Besides, look at this fruit,  it's disgusting. We don't want to steal this.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Hey,  you trying to steal my fruit?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I just said I don't want any of this rotten fruit.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Oh, you're too good for my fruit?  This is the best fruit on the block.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So you want me to steal it?

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Just try me, buddy.  Go ahead.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm confused. Are we stealing the fruit or not?

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: I knew it.  Thieves!

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: What's going on here?

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Dad, these fruit thieves are insulting our fruit.

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Bolin? Mako?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How do you know our names?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, I mean I'm famous so I get that, but how do you know his name?

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: You look just like San.  Tu, you'll never believe who these guys are. They're your cousins! My brother San's kids.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: Lord Zuko, Uncle, this is a surprise.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Finally something exciting happens. Ruling the tribe is so tedious.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: Then you should enjoy this. We need to check on a secret ice prison in the western tundra.

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Your father sent us a letter years ago with your names, but that was the last we heard from him. Then we saw your pictures in the sports magazine with your bending team, and Bolin, we love those Nuktuk movers. They're hilarious!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, they're not really comedies, but uh ...

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Yeah, I could probably be a pro-bender or an actor or something if I lived in a mansion in Republic City like you guys. You don't know what it's like on the streets. You got to be tough.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, Mako and I grew up on the streets. We were homeless, then we were kinda in a gang, then we lived in a gym ...

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Hey everybody! Look who's here, San's kids: Mako and Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Male family member
transcript.text: No way.

transcript.speaker: Female family member
transcript.text: Come in.

transcript.speaker: Male family member #2
transcript.text: Welcome.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Is it true? After all these years?

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Boys, this is your grandmother, Yin.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Aw, it is so wonderful to meet my long lost grandchildren  Where is San and your mother?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait, you mean you don't know?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sorry, they were killed when we were little.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't like the looks of this. Let's hurry up and get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Royal Earth Kingdom guard
transcript.text: You here to pick up the tax shipment?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Go ahead and load it on the airship.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: So much for our escorts.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe we should have brought everybody else.

transcript.speaker: Barbarians
transcript.text: Woo hoo!

transcript.speaker: Gombo
transcript.text: Step away from the gold ladies and you won't get hurt.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry to disappoint you, but we're taking this gold back to Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Gombo
transcript.text: Aww, we love gals with spirit, suit yourself.

transcript.speaker: Gombo
transcript.text: Retreat, retreat!  You're on the wrong side of this fight, Avatar. That gold belongs to the people, not the Queen.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why do I get the feeling he's right?

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Why didn't anyone tell us we have a secret prison we could have been throwing people in?

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: I'd like to put my tailor in here. He never gets my cuffs right. They're so ... crease-y.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: We built this place secretly with your father to hold a very special prisoner. She's a powerful firebender named P'Li who can create explosions with her mind. Ironically, I hired a guy with a similar ability to kill the Avatar myself once.  Didn't work.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Don't feel bad. I tried to kill Korra  after she ruined my wedding. It happens.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Let's just focus on keeping this woman in prison.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: The intense cold prevents her from firebending.

transcript.speaker: Desna
transcript.text: There's certainly no way anyone's breaking out of here.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: That's what we thought about the other three prisons.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: There must be something exciting going on . No one interesting has visited me in thirteen years.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Don't get used to it.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: He's out, isn't he? Mmm, I'm feeling warmer already .

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: This is so great! We never had a family before. Now we've got one, two, five ... eleven ...  ... a big family! Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So why did Dad leave Ba Sing Se?

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Oh, he always had big dreams. He couldn't wait to get out and see the world. Your grandfather thought it was ridiculous. He wanted San to stay home and work the fruit stand. But San was determined to leave, and they had a huge fight.  And that was the last time they ever spoke.  Oh, um ... sorry, Mom.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Come with me. I have something to show you.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: This is the only letter we ever got from San. It says he married a beautiful girl from the Fire Nation, and had two wonderful sons. He sent this picture of you all on his birthday.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Look, Mako! Dad's wearing your scarf!

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: I'm so sad that I never got to meet your mother,  but you have her eyes. I know from looking at you two that she must have been a wonderful bride for my boy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sure they would want you to have this.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Your Majesty. The Avatar has returned with the tax payments.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Finally. Secure it in the vault.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: It's being done as we speak.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So now, Your Majesty, if I could start meeting some of the airbenders here in the city.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: The Dai Li thoroughly searched the city, but it seems your reports were incorrect. There are no airbenders in Ba Sing Se. So, you can gather your little band and be on your way tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You make me do your dirty work extorting your own citizens for your stupid palaces and topiaries and then you just want to send me away? We're not going anywhere until we find some airbenders! We know there are some here!

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Get her out of my sight!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This isn't over! I'm going to find the airbenders!

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: You know, San would've been so proud of you guys! Traveling the world with the Avatar? He would've loved that!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We actually need to get back to the Avatar in the Upper Ring. We're supposed to be helping her find airbenders in Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What? What happened?

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: One of our neighbors started airbending about a week ago. A couple days later, two Dai Li agents come out of nowhere and snatch him up. No one's seen him since.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: They say the Earth Queen's locking all the airbenders up somewhere, and using them for experiments.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Tu! Don't talk like that about Her Majesty!  Long may she reign.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We have to get back to the Upper Ring and tell Korra.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I hope Kai is okay.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Here, sir, let me help you.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey! What's going on?  I didn't do anything! I'm with the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li agent
transcript.text: Welcome to Her Majesty's army, First Airbending Regiment. From now on, you live to fight for the Earth Queen.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Airbenders are mysteriously disappearing in Ba Sing Se, including Kai. The Earth Queen denied any knowledge of the airbenders, but Korra refuse to give up her search. Meanwhile, Mako and Bolin met their long lost relatives, who told them that Dai Li agents have been rounding up airbenders for the queen's army. And at a prison in the north, Tonraq and Lord Zuko prepare for Zaheer's imminent attack.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Did you see Zaheer?

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: The only thing I saw was a snowstorm heading our way.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: That's not a snowstorm. That's him.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I put you away once, Zaheer, and I'm going to do it again!

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: Ming-Hua.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Let's get you out of here.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: We could have just taken the elevator.  Show-off.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: I've waited thirteen years to feel this warm.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: I thought I'd never see you again.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I've never doubted it.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Really. Right now?

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: I've got them. These passports should get you into the Upper Ring.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Awesome! Tu, you're the best cousin that I can have.  And my other cousins as well. Yeah. Yeah, you're all the best.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Thanks. I know this wasn't easy.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: It's such a shame you two must leave so soon.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I wished we could stay. But if it's true the Earth Queen is forcing airbenders into her army, we have to do something about it.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: I love you both. Come visit again.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We will, Grandma.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I love you too, Grandma. And Chow, and Tu, and Meng-Meng, and Chow Jr., there is Big Tee and Little Tee, and Medium Yu, and ... and ... and what was your name again?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know that Earth Queen  is lying to me!  I can tell by that stupid little queenly smirk of hers! I can't believe I helped her. I should have known she was using me!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hey, I think I can use a break. You letting off steam is starting to,  hurt. A lot.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Mako. Bolin. You're okay. Where have you been?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We chased Kai. Train. Slipped away. Lower Ring. Slept in trash pile. Met our family. Grandma tears. Mako scarf.  Earth Queen. Lying.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Can you interpret that?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The Earth Queen's been secretly taking away airbenders and forcing them into her army.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: She was lying. I knew it! I swear, the next time I see her-

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's the Queen.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Quick! Pabu. Shirt.  I know. Sorry. Kinda sweaty.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Good. You're here. Gun, tell them the news.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: We've received word from the Yang Province. There have been reports of airbenders there.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Wonderful, isn't it? It's the very thing you've been looking for.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you! That is just the most wonderful news. Ever. Yay.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: So, I assume you and your  friends here will be leaving immediately.  Is there an animal in my presence?

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: N-no, Your Majesty. I would never allow an animal near you.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: If I find one within fifty feet of me, it's your head.  Anyway, if you need any assistance packing, let Gun know. He'll see to it that you're on your way by evening.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uhh, this evening? I'm not sure about leaving so soon-

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Because our airship is having engine trouble. It'll take me until tomorrow to finish the repairs.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks for buying us some time.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I can't believe the Earth Queen is conscripting airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Those people should not be forced to join an army!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Well, technically, the Earth Queen has a right to conscript her citizens.  What? It's true.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Guys, what if Kai was spotted airbending? He might have been taken too.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Probably not. He's surprisingly difficult to catch, like a— like a little, greased hog-monkey.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: But, what if he was?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't worry, Jinora. We'll find him. We just need to figure out where to look.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I bet they're under Lake Laogai.  What? I've been reading some of Jinora's books. The old Dai Li agents used to have a secret fortress beneath the lake.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Mako's right! It's the perfect spot to hide airbenders, and I know how to check it out without being caught. I can project my spirit into it!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: You mean that out-of-body thing you did to help giant, spirity Korra?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You can still do that?!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's not as powerful as it was during Harmonic Convergence, but if I can get close enough, I think I can do it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's go get Kai out. Let's get all the airbenders out.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: You are the property of the Earth Kingdom.  You will become the Earth Queen's elite fighting force and protect her at all cost. It is your duty to serve the Earth Queen.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: Go easy on me! I'm not that good.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: Never show mercy! Now attack your opponent, and this time, like you mean it!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: A soldier never apologizes to his enemy!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I'm not a soldier!

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: You will be when I'm through with you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: If anything goes wrong, come back immediately.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I will.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What happened? What did you see?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: The airbenders aren't there! It's completely deserted.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: They're not down there?!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora, you've read all about Ba Sing Se. Can you think of any other places the airbenders might be?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I guess they could be in the catacombs beneath the Upper Ring, or the ancient sewers beneath the Lower Ring, or the maze of tunnels that connect the rings together, or they could be—

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: There are just too many places. There has to be another way to locate them.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe there is.  How did you find me during Harmonic Convergence?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I don't know. I just kind of focused on your energy. I think our spiritual connection led me to you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe you can find Kai the same way. I know you two have a connection.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What do you mean "a connection"?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I don't know. Let me try.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: You again?! If you have time to help your friend, then you're not getting enough rocks for yourself!

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: I guess you're not as good as you thought.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li sergeant
transcript.text: Throw him in the hole!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Jinora?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It worked!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: How are you here right now?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Shh, quiet. It's a high-level airbender move. With a little spiritual stuff thrown in.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: At first, for a second there, I thought you were a ghost.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's good to see you. We've been looking for you and the other airbenders. We're going to get you all out of here. Where are we anyway?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Underground somewhere. Other than that, I don't have a clue.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'll figure it out. Don't worry.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Jinora!  Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: The Earth Queen's Temple!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't believe Miss Queeny Smug Face had them right under our noses the whole time!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We have to get into that compound tonight and get those airbenders out.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: All right. We go in under the cover of darkness: two small insertion teams and a third on the outside. Then all we'll need is twelve tons of blasting jelly, a medium-sized bulldozer and ... does anyone have a badgermole that knows Morse code?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Oh great, not the Queen again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone, act natural. And Bolin -

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm on it!  What? Hey, I'm not sweaty this time!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin? What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We need to get Korra out of here immediately. Her life's in danger.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What?!  What's going on?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I just got word from Lord Zuko and Tonraq.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why is Lord Zuko with my dad?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Zaheer and the others have escaped.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How is that possible?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Because Zaheer is an airbender now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right, hold on! Will you quit ignoring me and tell me what's going on? Who's Zaheer? Why is my life in danger?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Shortly after we found out you were the Avatar, Zaheer and three others attempted to kidnap you. Luckily, your father, Lord Zuko, Chief Sokka and I were there to stop them. We apprehended the criminals and locked them away in prisons designed to impair their abilities.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So that's why you and my dad sheltered me away.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It was for your own safety.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Why were they trying to kidnap Korra?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We spent thirteen years interrogating them, but they never broke. To this day, no one knows what their motive was.  Now we need to get you back to Republic City, where I can protect you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... I'm not running.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Korra, you don't understand. These criminals are like nothing you've ever faced before.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, I'm not a little kid anymore. You don't need to protect me. I came here for one thing: to find airbenders. And I'm not leaving without them.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Fine. Let's get them and get out of here. Where are they?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: In a military compound, and we're busting them out.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Hi.

transcript.speaker: Guard #1
transcript.text: Hey! What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Guard #2
transcript.text: Oh, it's just that little airbender girl who came with the Avatar. You shouldn't be walking around here all alone.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'm not alone.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Bumi and Korra, come with me to find the airbenders.  You three, find Kai. We'll meet on the surface shortly. Radio us if anything goes wrong.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: What's going on? Who are you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm the Avatar, and I'm getting you all out of here.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Everyone, please! You must stay calm and quiet if we want this to work.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: What to work?  We're sneaking out?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, and we must leave now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We're going to get you away from the Earth Queen and out of the city.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: There's an airbender that's not here. His name is Kai. We need to get him.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We're already taking care of it.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Topside, this is Papa Bear. The breezies are in the hold; cue the balloons!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What? Are you in trouble?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: No! We've got the airbenders and we're headed out!  No one likes code names anymore.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Copy that. Asami and I are on our way.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on. We're getting you out.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Kai!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whoa! Tenzin's not gonna be happy about this!

transcript.speaker: Mako
