transcript.text: Then don't tell him.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: How can I not? This is too juicy!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Thanks for coming to get me. I'm really sorry about stealing your wallets, and running away, and getting you stuck on that train.

transcript.speaker: Bolin

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm fine!

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: It doesn't take a truth seer to know that you are under a dangerous amount of stress. If you don't deal with your suppressed feelings, there will be severe consequences to your health ... and your job.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm not interested in talking about my feelings.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: You won't have to say a word. I know a great acupuncturist in town who will be able to help you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Hmm.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: Seems like you made quite the stir on Air Temple Island. The cops are swarming the city looking for us.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: You still want to try to take out the president?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No, he'll have to wait. We leave today.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: There's our ticket out of here.

transcript.speaker: Driver
transcript.text: There's no money! I just made my last delivery!

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: We don't want money.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: How many of those things are you going to stick in me?

transcript.speaker: Guo
transcript.text: I'll be placing several needles on each of your acu-points. There's nothing to be scared about.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm not afraid of needles!

transcript.speaker: Guo
transcript.text: Please, close your eyes and take a deep breath.  This process corrects an imbalance in your chi. Please tell me if you feel any pain or pressure.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I can't feel a thing.

transcript.speaker: Guo
transcript.text: That's unusual. Your chi must be powerfully blocked. We're going to need more needles.  Acupuncture often taps into peoples' buried memories. These memories can sometimes be difficult to process.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Huh, buried memories. Uh-huh.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Su, what are you doing home?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Wow, you almost look like a real cop!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You're supposed to be in school.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Oh no, are you going to tell Mom? It's not like she's going to care.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Where'd you get all that stuff?

transcript.speaker: Boy
transcript.text: Oh, it fell off the back of a truck.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What are you doing hanging out with these losers?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: They're my friends and you have no right to call them that! Come on guys, let's get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Su, stop.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Get your hands off of me!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You have so much potential. You're ruining your life!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: At least I have a life!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: These meteorites are perfect for beginning metalbenders. The metals have a unique property, making them easier to bend.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's amazing!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Here, try it!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Bolin? Is that you?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, hey ladies. Just uh ... I was just looking for Pabu. Pabu!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He's on your shoulder.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, look there you are!  You know, I thought something was chewing on my ear. Probably need to get a shot. Pabu has sort of a ... a venom. Anyways, so what are you guys doing? You metalbending over here or something?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Want to give it a shot?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Nah, it's okay. I mean, only like one earthbender in a hundred can metalbend.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Well, don't believe everything you hear. The only thing limiting you is your attitude.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, maybe I'll just ... I'll just stay and watch.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Try to focus on the fine pieces of earth within the metal.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't believe it! I'm metalbending!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wow, you picked that up really, really quick. Guess you're that one in a hundred.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Great job, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Radio
transcript.text: Calling all units. Property reported on the corner of 5th and Harbor. Suspect's vehicle headed south on Hallow Boulevard. Units responding, identify.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Unit three responding.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Leave them alone!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Su?

transcript.speaker: Guo
transcript.text: Wait! Leaving in the middle of a session could make you sick!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm done here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Are you going to stay in your room feeling sorry for yourself all day?  You owe Opal an apology for the way you treated her last night. Are you okay? You don't look good.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm fine!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What did you do to me?

transcript.speaker: Guo
transcript.text: I tried to warn you. Come with me. Let's go finish the session.  Just relax and breathe.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: So, you're robbing stores with the Terra Triad now?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I didn't steal anything. I just drove the car. I owed my friends a favor. It's not a big deal.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm not letting you get away with this.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Oh, what are you going to do, Officer? Arrest me?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Don't even think about taking one more step!

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: Good afternoon. Where are you off to today?

transcript.speaker: Driver
transcript.text: I, uh, got a delivery to make at Bao Yu. I should be back later today.

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: You all right?

transcript.speaker: Driver
transcript.text: Yeah, just a little tired. One more pick-up, then I'm clocking out.

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: I thought you said you had a delivery?

transcript.speaker: Driver
transcript.text: Did I?

transcript.speaker: Officer
transcript.text: I'm going to need you to step out of the vehicle and open the back of the truck.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Let's get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Hey, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal! Oh, wow, you ... really know how to sneak up on someone.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: What are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh nothing, you know, just ...  just thinking about my body and mustaches that I might have in the future.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: You're acting weird again.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Sorry. I wasn't really thinking about all my mustaches. I'm just frustrated. I've been trying to metalbend and I can't figure it out. Don't tell anyone, okay?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Why not?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Because it's embarrassing. This isn't the first time I've tried, and I've been wanting to metalbend ever since I heard about Toph. Your grandmother is my biggest hero!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: My mom grew up learning from Toph. Just go train with her. Stop being so scared.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You know what? Maybe I am scared. But what about you? I know that you want to go to the Northern Air Temple to train with Tenzin, but you haven't done it, because you're afraid too!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: You know what? You're right. I don't want to leave my family and disappoint my mom.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Look at us! Talking about our feelings, supporting each other.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: It's nice.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: What were you thinking? And what were you thinking? You two have put me in an impossible position.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You're mad at me?  She's the one who was running around with criminals!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: This is all your fault!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I was doing my job!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: All right, enough! Here's what we're going to do. Su, you need to leave the city as soon as possible.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: What?! Where am I supposed to go?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: You'll go stay with your grandparents. Lin, give me the arrest report.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Mom, what are you doing?! You can't cover this up! There are witnesses.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I'm the Chief of Police! I can't have a daughter in jail!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: So, once again, Suyin gets to do whatever she wants and there are no consequences.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: This is our only option.

transcript.speaker: Guo
transcript.text: You're going to feel a bit fragile, so it's probably best if you take it easy for a while.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I don't need to rest. I need to do something I should've done a long time ago.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Congratulations. You're the first metalbending Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, umm, I've been thinking, and I'd like to try to learn metalbending.  I mean, I'm sure you have a waiting list or something of a couple years so.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Let's get started.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I think Lin is mad about something.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Su, it's time we talk.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: After thirty years, you're finally ready to talk?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: When we were in Mom's office that day, you could've taken responsibility for what you did. But instead, you stayed quiet and let Mom throw her whole career away.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Mom didn't throw her career away. She retired the next year. She was a hero.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You think she wanted to retire? She was so guilt-ridden about what she did to protect you that she didn't feel worthy of her badge.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Look, I admit that I was not a perfect kid and I've made some mistakes in the past but-

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You made some mistakes?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Lin, Mom and I already talked about this years ago and worked things out. If you had gotten together with us like we'd asked, you would know that I'm a different person now. I've been a different person for a long time.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You think that just because you live in a big, fancy house, and have a chef who cooks you fancy food, that you're a different person? Maybe you could fool everyone else, but you can't fool me. I see right through you.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You know what, Lin? You're the one who hasn't changed. You're still a bitter loner who only cares about herself. No wonder Tenzin ended things with you years ago.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Okay,  I guess this is how it's going to be.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Should I stop them?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You don't have any siblings, fighting is all part of the healing process.

transcript.speaker: Wei
transcript.text: Go Mom!

transcript.speaker: Huan
transcript.text: My sculpture!  Actually, it looks ... kinda better now.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You've got it out of your system?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Not quite yet!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: What are you two doing?! You're sisters! Why would you want to hurt each other?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uhh, Whose going to knock?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, no, no, no, no, no! Not me! You're the Avatar, why can't you do it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uhh, I can. But I just thought that ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'll do it.  Uhh, Chief, you've been sleeping for sixteen hours. We just wanted to make sure that you're okay.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Good morning.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What's this?

transcript.speaker: Chef
transcript.text: I call it the kalenutsco. It's a mixture of kale, coconut water, and walnuts.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Not bad!  Opal, don't go. Please sit down, I want to talk to you.  Look, I'm just not really comfortable talking about these kinds of things, and ... well, I wanted to say that I'm sorry about the other night.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: It's okay.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Your mother and I have a complicated relationship and ...

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: It's probably difficult for you to be here.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You're a smart young woman, and an excellent airbender. I think it would be a wonderful opportunity to train with the other airbenders at the Northern Air Temple.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: There's a part of me that wants to go, but ... I don't want to upset my mom.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: When I was younger, all I wanted to do was please my mother. I became a police chief because I thought it would make her happy ... but it didn't. You need to make your decisions based on what you want. Don't make the same mistakes as I did.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Mom, Dad, can I talk to you?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Opal has decided to go to the Northern Air Temple. I guess you had something to do with her decision.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Well, I was just ...

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: It's okay. I'm glad she was honest with me. I want her to do what makes her happy. Mom gave us too much freedom, but I feel like I made the mistake of giving Opal too little. I think it's about time I let her choose her own way.  I'm sorry I gave you such a hard time when we were younger. I can't imagine what my life would've been like if Mom hadn't sent me away, if I had stayed in the city ...

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You'd probably be in prison.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You're probably right. Mako told me that you're an excellent police chief. Republic City is lucky to have you. I know Mom is proud.  Can we move on? I'd love for you to be part of my life again. There's plenty of space in the house, and the kids would love having their aunt around. I do need a new co-director for my new dance performance.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Whoa! Slow it down. How about for now, I just promise not to show up at your house and attack you again?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Deal!

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: We should've grabbed one of those cops. Maybe they know something about where the Avatar is hiding.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: She could be anywhere.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: We'll find her. It's just a matter of time.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: She's with the Metal Clan.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Air Nation is reborn. Thanks to the energy shift from Harmonic Convergence, certain people have acquired airbending abilities including Bumi, Kai, and Opal. Although the new recruits show a lot of promise, they still have a lot to learn. While Korra remains safe in Zaofu, Tenzin brings the new airbenders to the Northern Air Temple to begin their training.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: His pupils pleaded with their master  to eat something, but he refused,  just like he had each day during summer.  Instead he meditated and got his nourishment from the universe. So when Tang Xu completed the ninety-seventh day of his historic fast on which island?

transcript.speaker: Otaku
transcript.text: Oooh! Oooh!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Anyone besides Otaku, who already studied this in his acolyte training?

transcript.speaker: Otaku
transcript.text: Ooh, ooh, ooh!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: And is answering every question.

transcript.speaker: Otaku
transcript.text: Ooh! Ooh! Ooh!  Whaletail Island.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That is correct. Again. Now, on day ninety-eight ...

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Greetings, air people. I come seeking boring stories to take back to the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: That is incredible! When do we get to fly around on our own sky bison like that?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Only after many years of practice and intense training.  Besides, we don't have enough bison here for all of you.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: What about those?  It's a whole herd of bisons.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Actually, the plural of bison is bison.

transcript.speaker: Recruits
transcript.text: Whoa! Cool! Wow look at that!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Can we ride those?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, that's a wild herd. It would take many years to tame them. Now, let's get back to our lessons.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Dad!  We brought you more airbenders!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Okay, everyone is dismissed. We'll pick this up ...  tomorrow.  How is everything in the city?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Well, we had a little scare but everything is okay. Zaheer infiltrated the air temple.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What! Is everyone all right?

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Everyone's fine. I fought with him, but he got away. And he stole some old necklace that had something to do with ... Guru ... Lak ... shmir.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Guru Laghima?

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Right ... you know I can never keep all those gurus straight. There were like a million of them. Remember that long, boring story about that guy who never ate?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes ... I remember.

transcript.speaker: Air Acolyte member
transcript.text: Avatar Korra is calling on the temple's radio.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Are you all right? Where are you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: With Beifong's sister in Zaofu. We're totally safe, unless we get caught in another fight between Su and Lin.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Lin willingly took you to her sister?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Not exactly. We got a call about an airbender and it turned out to be Su's daughter Opal. She'll be headed your way soon.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Really? That's wonderful!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: She is wonderful, and pretty,  and so smart, and she smells like flowers ...  Sorry. Bolin, out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How's the training going?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Not so well, I'm afraid. No one seems to be interested in the hard work of becoming part of the Air Nation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You need to give yourself a break. Let Jinora and the kids help you out, and what about Bumi? He was a naval commander, maybe he has some ideas about how you get people motivated.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Bumi?! He's my worst student.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, but he loves to organize people. If you ask him for help, you can trick him into taking more responsibility by making him think the whole thing with his idea.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That actually sounds like a good plan. You're turning into a pretty wise Avatar after all.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Conflict resolution, that's what I do.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: We should go down there. I want to fly one of those bisons.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I don't know. We might get in trouble.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Come on? Let's have some fun. We'll be back before anyone realizes we're gone.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I guess it would be all right.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Look! Baby bisons.  How come they're on the ground?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Air bison calves can't fly after a week or two after they're born. So the entire herd will stay near the ground, near the valley.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Let's go see the babies.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Be careful. The mothers are very protective.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Aww, look how cute!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Kai, get out of there!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Wow, you really saved me down there. You know, you're an incredible airbender.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Well, I've been training for a long time.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Then, why don't you have tattoos like an airbending master?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: My dad says I'm not a master yet.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: You can do everything your dad can.  Plus, you have all these spirit-y powers. If anyone's a master, you are.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: And so, we bring the net down on  the head pirate, and he looks around real sad and says,  "I knew I should have followed my dreams and become a dentist."

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: How come you grow up to be so cool, while Tenzin became  such a stick-in-the-mud?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Well, I guess cool is something you're born with.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Bumi, can I talk to you?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Let me guess, you want to criticize me for something?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Actually, I need your help.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Oh yeah. With what?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I don't think I'm doing well with the new airbenders, and everyone knows you're a natural leader.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: True, I did win the Admiral Tung Natural Leadership Award, twice.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What would you do if you were in charge? Help me be more like you.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I'd love to.  You've got to use military discipline to whip these troops into shape. The only way to deal with new recruits is to  break them down so you can  build them back up. Rule with an iron fist.  Show them who the master is.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thanks for the insight.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: My pleasure.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Dawn patrol! Everyone up!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: What are you doing? It's barely light out.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm taking your advice. I'm going to break you down and build you back up!  Now get moving recruit!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Nothing like a ten-mile hike first thing in the morning.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: Don't these robes come in a warm bison fur version?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No! Of course not.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: If it weren't so cold, I'd go right back to sleep.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Then, this is the perfect time to learn meditation and proper breathing technique. Airbenders are able to warm themselves only with their breathing.  Everyone get into the lotus position. Ah, this is so much more refreshing than sleeping.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: You know when I said that thing about an iron fist-

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hush! Meditation time. Focus.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Can we go back to bed now?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Now that we're refreshed and loose from our hike and meditation, it's time for a balancing exercise.  The key is to maintain your heaven and earth connection.  Now you try.  Back up your posts! It's not hard if you concentrate.  Get back up!  What's the matter, you can't handle it, soldier?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Don't you think you're a little hard on them.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Don't worry, they can take it. You'll see.  Ignore the lemurs digging in your ears. Concentrate on your breathing and, you won't even know they're there!  When the head is shaved, an airbender is able to feel the wind around him. It is both humbling and freeing.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey, you want to go sneak away and check on the baby bisons?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Shhh. You should be paying attention.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: All right, who's next?

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: I'm not sure I want to shave my head.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That's fine, shaving your head is a personal choice.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Wait, what?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Anyone else?  Fine! Then we can get to our next training exercise: obstacle course.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You're pushing too hard. Maybe we should give them a break.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora, I have this under control

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Concentrate! Remember, airbenders move like the wind.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Stay light on your feet, and you'll never feel the stinging rash cactus.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Everyone is waiting for you, Bumi. If you don't make it over the next thirty seconds, they'll all have to run through the course again!

transcript.speaker: Airbenders
transcript.text: You can do it, Bumi! Come on!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Get back up the wall, recruit! You're letting your fellow airbenders down.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I'm finished! I've never wanted to be an airbender and I'm too old to be back in boot camp.  Count me out!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Fine, quit! We don't need your attitude in the new Air Nation.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Master Tenzin, when do we get to go home and visit our families?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Go home? You just got here.

transcript.speaker: Female airbender
transcript.text: When's dinner? I'm starving.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: Can I change out of my robe now? It's itchy.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: This is just as bad as the Earth Queen's prison.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm tired of all this complaining! Jinora, take over!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Does this mean, I'm the master now?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, just lead them through some basic exercises.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Well, since I'm a master, when do you think I can get my tattoos?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What brought this on?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I was just talking to Kai, and he was asking me, so-

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kai!  What does he know about when you should get tattoos? The answer is "no"! You're just a little girl.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'm not a little girl anymore. I can airbend just as well as you. I know everything about our culture and history, and I have a stronger connection with the spirits that you ever will.  Lead your own class!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Ikki, Meelo, you're up. Just lead them through the Bagua circle.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Look to your left! Look to your right! One of those people will not make it out of here alive.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Sorry what I've said got you into trouble with your dad.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's not your fault. He just can't believe that I'm growing up now and I don't need him telling me what to do like one of his recruits.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I know something that'll cheer you up.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Where did all the spirits go?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Where are the babies?

transcript.speaker: Ganbat
transcript.text: What are these kids doing in my camp?

transcript.speaker: Rustler #1
transcript.text: We caught them sneaking around. Thought they might tell someone we're here.

transcript.speaker: Ganbat
transcript.text: They're the new airbenders. Must be living up in the temple. Hurry up and gather the rest of the gang and let's get out of here before someone comes looking for these kids. I'll take them to Ba Sing Se, with the rest of the fresh meat.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Tattoos. How could she think? Focus. Breathe. Bumi ruins everything. Inhale. Focus.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Taking a little break from teaching?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've failed. Bumi quit, the rest of the airbenders want to go home. Can't they see that I'm trying to rebuild an entire culture?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: You know, just because these people can airbend, it doesn't automatically make them Air Nomads.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Tell me about it.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: I remembered when I moved down my parents' house to become an Air Acolyte. That first night I was so scared and lonely and the bed was so hard.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's actually better for your back.  Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: The point is: I really wanted to be there, but it still took time for me to adjust to feel like I was a part of it all. The people are probably feeling the same way. You have to be patient.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Now I know how Korra feels when I'm talking to her.  Thank you, Pema.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Bumi, I want to apologize for losing my patience.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I'm not talking to you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hey! Get back here.  Where's Jinora?

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: I saw her fly off on her glider with her boyfriend.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What?  Her boyfriend?  Kai!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: How can you steal these bisons? They're endangered.

transcript.speaker: Ganbat
transcript.text: Well, that's why they're worth so much. The Earth Queen and her fancy friends pay big money for bison steaks and other rare meats. I even heard she ate her dad's pet bear.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You're disgusting.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey, do that spirit beaming thing you did to find me. Go to the temple for help.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I can't. I'm all cramped in here and I need quiet and time to focus. But, maybe I can send a message.  Spirits, I need your help.  Go find Bum-Ju, tell him we're in trouble.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: No, I don't think I should apologize. Tenzin just wants to boss everybody around. I'm too old for that.  Well, let's face it. I'm just not cut out to be an airbender!  Well, that's your opinion.  Wait, Jinora sent this spirit? Is she in trouble?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Jinora's in trouble. We have to go get her.

transcript.speaker: Yung
transcript.text: How do you know?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Bum-Ju's friend told me.

transcript.speaker: Otaku
transcript.text: You're able to communicate with the spirits?

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: More or less, I get the gist. Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Shouldn't Master Tenzin be dealing with this? I don't want to get into trouble

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Master Tenzin isn't here. It's up to us. Ikki and Meelo, grab some bison. Airbenders, move out!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Bison rustlers. They've got Kai and Jinora locked in crates. Looks like they're getting ready to leave, we'll have to move fast.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: I don't know if I'm ready to get in a fight with some bison rustlers. I can tell without that telescope that they're mean-looking.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Listen, this is what we've been training for.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: We haven't been training that long.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: That's not important now. Remembered how we persevered together on that obstacle course?

transcript.speaker: Otaku
transcript.text: You actually quit.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Well, I'm not quitting now. I know we've had a tough time, me more than anyone, but we're airbenders, and there aren't many of us so we've got to stick together. They've got two of our own in cages out there, and we're not leaving until we bring them home.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Leave no airbender behind!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: In. Down. And twist.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Free the bison first.

transcript.speaker: Bison rustler #2
transcript.text: Hey! What are you doing out?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Kai!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What's going on down there?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Kai! Help!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm coming Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Ganbat
transcript.text: What the ...

transcript.speaker: Ganbat
transcript.text: You got me. I give up.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: You think you can kidnap Jinora, and all these baby bisons?!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kai, that's enough! An airbender never attacks a defenseless opponent.  But that was very good technique.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Maybe you boys haven't heard, but there's some new airbenders on these parts. And you never mess with an airbender's bison.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Without my shaved head, I'd never could have dodged that net. I really felt it coming at me. You guys should totally get shaved.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm proud of you. Your connection with the spirits, natural leadership, you remind me of Dad.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I'm sorry I've been causing you so much trouble. I guess I was just scared of not being able to measure up as an airbender. You know, even though I'm Aang's son, I never really felt that I was a part of the Air Nation before.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You are now.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: They're so friendly now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The bison are the original airbenders. They recognize their own kind.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'm sorry for running off.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm just lucky no one's hurt.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I know.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But I also realized that perhaps I was too harsh on you.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Does that mean I can get my airbender tattoos?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's hard for me to believe that my little girl is grown up enough to have her tattoos. I'll promise I'll think about it. Fair enough?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Jinora, look. They're flying!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I guess everyone is growing up.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Korra is now the first metalbending Avatar! After training with Su Beifong, Korra quickly picked up the new skill, and Bolin is hoping to follow in her footsteps. Meanwhile, the airbender Zaheer is closing in on Zaofu. By his side are the lavabender Ghazan, the waterbender Ming-Hua, and the combustionbender P'Li. But what do these mysterious criminals want with the Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: I can't believe I'm sparring with the Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Wei
transcript.text: I can't believe I'm stuck with her friend.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hang on, I think I got it. Let me just try this.  Nope, okay maybe-

transcript.speaker: Wei
transcript.text: Trial by fire. It's the best way to learn metalbending.  Agh!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Whoa. Nice shot, Bolin!  But I thought you were supposed to be practicing metalbending, not earthbending.

transcript.speaker: Wei
transcript.text: Yeah, cheater.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mako, metalbending is extremely difficult. No one gets it right away, if they can get it at all! It's not normal!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Woo-hoo!  Metalbending champion!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh sure. She's the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Guys, it's time to get cleaned up. Tonight is Opal's farewell dinner.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, now I have to say bye to Opal? This is the worst day ever!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Thanks for making my favorite meal.

transcript.speaker: Chef
transcript.text: I'm really going to miss you, Opal. No one appreciates my raw veggie wraps like you do.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Every time I eat raw kale, I'm going to think of you.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: You're so sweet.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: This stinks! We were just starting to get to know each other, and now you're off to the Northern Air Temple.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We'll be together soon. You guys are coming up after finding more airbenders, right?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, but that's ... in the future. Ugh, I hate the future!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Until then, we'll always have kale.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Kid, can I give you some relationship advice?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Umm, no.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Well, your loss.  Zhu Li!  bring the, uh, thing.  Check out my latest invention:  an airbender finder.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, that can find airbenders?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Uh ...  I think  it's broken.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It's not broken. She needs to  airbend into it!  How else do you expect the thing to work?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's going on? I can't hear anything. I hate sitting down here!  Uh, not because of you.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: I can tell you're lying.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Everyone, if I could have your attention please? Tonight, my beautiful little girl leaves for the Northern Air Temple.  Opal, none of us could be more proud of you. You're an incredible daughter, sister, friend,  and soon to be  airbending master.  Here's to Opal. May she help lead us into the new era!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Lock it down for the night.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We'll head out first thing in the morning.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Kale, kale, kale ... Opal ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What?  What's going on?  Pabu, sleep!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Huh? What? Oh, Pabu.  It's not play time right now. Okay, we are seriously going to have to have a talk-  What the heck?! They've got Korra. They've got Korra!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let her go!  They've got Korra!

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: So much for the element of surprise.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Back-up plan.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We can't let them take her.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I don't think they're going to get far. Look!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: We have you surrounded. It's over. Release the Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No way! That guy is lavabending! That's awesome ... ly not good for us.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I'm going to create some cover. We've got to get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: How did they get in here?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I don't know, but we're not letting them escape!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: There's no way to cross that moat.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: We don't need to cross it. Lin and I can drop in from the dome on cables.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: That's a great idea. Except we'll get blown up the second that third-eyed freak sees us.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: She's a combustionbender. If one of you can stun her, her powers will be knocked out temporarily.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin can land a shot.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I can?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You have to take her out right before we drop down.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I do?

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: Open the hatch.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: If we get in trouble, metalbend us up.

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: We're in position.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Copy that. It's Bolin time.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right. Bolin time. Bolin time!  I can't get a clean shot!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You have to!

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: Are we a go?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No go!

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: Copy that, we're a go.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I said no! Wait!  Bolin, take the shot!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Haha, nice job, little bro!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: We've failed!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Where did they go?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: They can't be far!  Guards, search the entire estate!

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: This should neutralize  the shirshu toxins.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: How could you let this happen?!  You assured me this was one of the most  secure places in the world.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: It is. I don't know how this happened. Obviously this was a well-planned operation, so  don't blame me.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: We searched the entire estate. There's no sign of them.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Well, keep looking!

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: It would seem they had some inside knowledge of Zaofu. They must've been working with someone.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The-  the guards. It had to be one of them.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: I agree.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Question them all! Whoever betrayed my city will suffer the consequences!

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: What is your full name?  Where were you last night?  Do you have any knowledge of the people who tried to kidnap the Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Guan
transcript.text: My name is Zhu Guan.

transcript.speaker: Second guard
transcript.text: I was patrolling the south wall of the Beifong estates.

transcript.speaker: Third guard
transcript.text: I have absolutely no knowledge of the people who tried to kidnap Korra.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: What was I doing last night?  Same thing I always do. From nine to ten, I checked my body for ticks. Lyme disease is a serious killer.  Then I did my nightly  Varrick calisthenics, followed by  thirty minutes of breath holding. I filmed the whole thing if you want to watch it.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: That won't be necessary.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Maybe it wasn't a guard after all. Maybe it was someone a little higher up the food chain. Aiwei, why don't you question Su?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Lin, stop! Your sister was not involved!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: No,  I'll gladly be questioned. I have nothing to hide.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: What is your full name?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Suyin Beifong. I'm the daughter of Toph and  the only sister to Lin, and I had nothing to do with the attack last night.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: She is telling  the truth.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is a waste of time! Just bring in the next guard!

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: Give me your name and tell me where you are from.

transcript.speaker: Hong Li
transcript.text: I'm Hong Li. I was born and raised here in Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: Do you have any knowledge of the people who tried to kidnap the Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Hong Li
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: Did you help the attackers enter Zaofu last night?

transcript.speaker: Hong Li
transcript.text: No, of course not.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: You're lying.

transcript.speaker: Hong Li
transcript.text: What?! No, I'm not!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: How did they get in and out?  Where are they now?

transcript.speaker: Hong Li
transcript.text: I don't know! I'm telling you, I didn't help them!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You're a traitor to the entire clan!

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: I suggest we search his place.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I got something!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It looks like it's from them.  "Team assembled. Ready to rendezvous."

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And look at this.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: These are the guards' logbooks. All their schedules and routes are in here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That guard knows everything.  We have to get him to talk.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's go confront him with this evidence right now.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: No.  Let's give him a little time to sweat it out. He will talk eventually.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't understand why we're not talking to that guard right now .  Every minute we waste here, those guys get further away. I mean, how does a random guard get involved with a group of super criminals anyway?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That guard is only eighteen years old and has lived in Zaofu his entire life. Zaheer and his gang have been in prison for more than thirteen years.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know, but we all saw the evidence. It's pretty overwhelming.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Maybe a little too overwhelming?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, Varrick. What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Collecting pumice stones with Zhu Li. That lavabender did a lot of damage, but he makes a nice exfoliating rock, and when you got callouses like mine, you take all the pumice stones you can get your hands on. Or in my case, feet .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What were you saying about the evidence?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I was saying that I can smell a conspiracy when I see one. Look, if I was trying to set someone up, I would tell everyone he's guilty and then plant the evidence in his apartment as proof.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Oh, you mean exactly like what you did to me?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes, just like that! Remember how great that worked? Well, not for you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're right. All the evidence points to this guard, but maybe he's just the fallback.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But for who?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: For the only person who can truly keep a secret in this city: Aiwei.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: He's not home. Or he's hiding in there.  Or he's invisible.  Probably just not home.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We have to get in there and find some evidence that links Aiwei to Zaheer, otherwise Su won't believe us.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's just an empty book.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hmm, it's like a desert on a jar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, put that back! We don't want Aiwei to know we were in here if we can't find anything.  You forgot where it goes, didn't you?  These look like scuff marks. I think this bookshelf slides open.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do you think is down there?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Could be a storage cellar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Or it could be how Zaheer got in and out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Aiwei's coming back! Quick.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: What are doing in my house? You are trespassing on the property of one of the highest-ranked officials in the city. You'd better have a good explanation.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We do. We do. We actually knocked on your front door and we thought we heard you say,  'Come in, I'm in the bathroom!'  I don't even know why I'm saying that. You know I'm lying, and you don't even sound like that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We came here because things weren't adding up, and we thought you might have some answers.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: Sit. If you want to talk, let's talk over some tea.  Now, what is not adding up exactly? Hong Li was clearly lying and we found evidence in his apartment.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: But don't you think it's weird how young he is? How did he ever get mixed up with this group?

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: Perhaps through a relative, or maybe he was bribed. We will find out those answers in time. But if wasn't him, who do you think it was?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We don't know.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: You don't think I had something to do with this, do you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We're just looking for answers.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: And you think you've found something, don't you?  You have no idea what is coming for you, Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, he's getting away!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm still a little new at this, so back off!  Ugh!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He's gone.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Look, he must've escaped through there! Help me clear it out.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What happened? We heard an explosion.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Where's Aiwei?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Your trusted adviser is the one who betrayed us. He was lying about the guard.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: What? No!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We confronted him and he bolted through here.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: He must have collapsed the tunnel behind him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And he rigged an explosion to destroy any evidence that might have been here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This is where Zaheer got in and out. Aiwei was the traitor.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I ... trusted him.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Is everyone okay?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Aiwei is a fugitive. Get all available guards to search the mountainside, and find out where this tunnel exits immediately!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What did you find?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: We located the end of the tunnel, but there's no sign of him. Just some fresh tire tracks.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He had an escape plan all ready to go.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I trusted him with my life. I thought we were family, but it was all a lie.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Whoever these guys are, they're more powerful than we thought, and more dangerous.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's why we have to find them. We're going to hold off our search for airbenders and hunt down Aiwei. Naga can track his scent.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And I bet if we find Aiwei, we'll find Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: No! We're not hunting this group. There could be other secret agents in other parts of the world looking for you right now! I'm taking you back to Republic City, where I can protect you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If I wasn't safe here, then I'm not safe anywhere. I have to stop them!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: It's too dangerous! You are not going!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Stop trying to protect me! I'm the Avatar. This is my job!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Don't lecture me about jobs!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Enough! Korra, listen to Lin.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But ... they ...

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Please. Lin's only looking out for you. I promise you, Aiwei and everyone he's working with will be brought to justice.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Fine, if you really think it's best.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I do.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Thank you, Su.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Everyone should get some rest tonight. I'll have my people prep your airship and you can leave first thing in the morning.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Su.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You really think Naga could track Aiwei?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Definitely.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Then, here.  There's a jeep packed with supplies on the east gate. It's all gassed up and ready to go.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? Why?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Because I want you to hunt down Aiwei and bring him back to me.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But you said -

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I said what Lin wanted to hear and I bought you guys some time. Go. I'll deal with Lin in the morning.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's get this guy!  Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Zaheer infiltrated Zaofu and attempted to kidnap the Avatar. After a harrowing battle, she was saved and discovered a shocking truth: Aiwei, Su's trusted adviser, has been working with Zaheer. This truth seer turned traitor managed to escape but Su tasks Team Avatar of tracking him down. Now the hunted becomes the hunter as Korra searches for answers.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Aiwei has definitely been through here.  Nice tracking, girl.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's ask around. Maybe someone's seen him.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ohh look, they have a mover poster of me.  Must be big Nuktuk fans,  yeah,  I should go out and say hello ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No. Those are wanted posters,  and there's one for each of us. "Wanted by Her Majesty, the Earth Queen, for crimes against the Kingdom."  I'm guessing this is because we took her airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: They weren't hers to keep! I swear, if I see her pinchy  little queen face again, I am going to ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Uhh, guys ...  We should get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Where's everyone? I've been waiting to leave for half an hour.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: And good morning to you, Lin. Now don't get mad, Korra's fine. I'm just waiting to hear if she'd tracked down Aiwei yet.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What! You let Korra go?! I thought we were on the same page about this, and then you go and stab me in the back?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Oh, don't be so overdramatic. You can't control the Avatar's every move.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I can try.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga found something.  Oh ... Sorry, I forgot to bring treats  but, good girl.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: This must be Aiwei's jeep. He can't be far.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin and I  will investigate the Misty Palms Oasis, and see if he's hold up there.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes!  I love it when you talk like a cop.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm coming too.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No. You and Asami wait here in case he comes back. Besides, we don't want to call too much attention to ourselves.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ooh, Mako, Mako, Mako! We should wear disguises and pretend we're going undercover! That way,  no one will recognize us. Haha, police work is so exciting!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right, now we need our undercover identities!  I'm an ex-United Forces operative named Ting-Ting. War was the only woman I ever loved, until Ivy came along and showed me what real love is. Tragically, she was taken from me by my archenemy Dr. Razor and -

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Enough!  Let's just find Aiwei.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: But I haven't even told your backstory.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm a cop. I don't have a backstory.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh! You're good at this.

transcript.speaker: Tavern owner
transcript.text: Shoo ! Human customers only.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's see if this guy knows anything.  Excuse me, sir? We're looking for a man about sixty, balding, wearing glasses in a long green robe.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And he's got this weird piercing that goes from his nose  to his  ear. Freaks me out.

transcript.speaker: Tavern owner
transcript.text: Yeah, sure. Sounds like a guy who came in last night. I told him I had the best drinks in the Earth Kingdom and he called me a liar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's him! Any idea where he is now?

transcript.speaker: Tavern owner
transcript.text: Nah, afraid not. But he was right.  My drinks are terrible.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you okay?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm just frustrated. What does Zaheer want with me? What's his plan?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I don't know. But I think I found a clue.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Xai Bau's Grove, sundown. This must be where and when Aiwei's going to meet Zaheer!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: All right. Xai Bau's Grove, where are you?  Go away! I'm trying to find something.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, aren't you a cute little spir-  Ow! Hey!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No luck here.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I think there might be a couple bounty hunters over there who recognize me!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We've been made. Let's lose 'em!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, I think we're clear. We should head back to Korra before someone else recognizes us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We could, or ... we could follow Aiwei instead.  Look!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: All right.  Stay cool and follow my lead.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ting-Ting always finds his man.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Keep an eye on him. I'll go get Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We found Aiwei hiding in an inn.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's great!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We found something too.  It looks like he's gonna meet Zaheer at sundown at a place called Xai Bau's Grove. But I can't find it anywhere on the map.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's go bust down Aiwei's door and finally get some answers.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No. Once Aiwei knows we're onto him, we lose our advantage. I say we stake out his room and when he leaves for this meeting, we follow him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And he'll lead us straight to Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Good afternoon. We'd like a room on the ground floor, across from 102, please.

transcript.speaker: Innkeeper
transcript.text: Forget it! Last time a bunch of teenagers came in here, they trashed the whole room.

transcript.speaker: Macao
transcript.text: We found you!

transcript.speaker: Innkeeper
transcript.text: Hey, no bending in here! Take it outside!

transcript.speaker: Macao
transcript.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. We're not here to fight you.  We're here to meet Nuktuk!

transcript.speaker: Lily
transcript.text: We're your biggest fans. Can you make it out to Lily and Macao?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, I'd be happy to. Always love meeting my fans.

transcript.speaker: Lily
transcript.text: I made this Nuktuk doll for you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Uh, it's ... cute.

transcript.speaker: Innkeeper
transcript.text: Why didn't you tell me your friend was a mover star? I'd be happy to rent you any room in the inn.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We'll just take the one across from 102.

transcript.speaker: Innkeeper
transcript.text: But that room is too small for the four of you!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Trust me, it'll be perfect.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'd just like to say, for the record, this room is definitely not perfect.  Naga!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There he is.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I thought stakeouts were supposed to be exciting. This isn't. At all!  Ooh, I wonder if there's any snacks in here.  Hey, look! A Pai Sho board! Mako, you want to play?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Kind of busy here, bro.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'll play.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, well, ugh, no offense but I learned street Pai Sho from Shady Shin, and I'm pretty good. So, wouldn't really be a fair game.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: So? I learned to play from my dad, the diabolical genius. I'll destroy you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, looks we've got ourselves a Pai-Shodown.  Ladies first.  Uh, I don't mean to rush you, but let's speed things up a bit.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Why? This game is all about slow, methodical strategy.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, it's not. This is a fast-paced, edge of your seat, game of chance! Don't think. Just go.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I don't know what Shady Shin taught you, but it wasn't the real Pai Sho.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh really? I think Mr. Rulebook might disagree with you.  The origins of Pai Sho date back over ten thousand years. It is a game of both strategy and chance. Wait, how can it be both?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Let me see that.  There have been countless variations of Pai Sho through the centuries and each culture has its own rules and variations of the game.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's no help at all. Korra, as the Avatar, you need to standardize these Pai Sho rules.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, I'll put that on my to-do list, right after bringing back the Air Nation and taking down the group that tried to kidnap me.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's cool. Whenever you get to it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Assuming we do find Zaheer, what then?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Then I make him talk.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He was locked away for thirteen years, Korra, and never broke. I don't think a little bending is going to intimidate this guy.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You have a better idea?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, we spy on them. If Aiwei and Zaheer don't know they're being watched, they'll talk freely. Then we'll find out who they are and what they want.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's just like Pai Sho!  In order to defeat your opponent, you first have to know your opponent.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Then I guess I know you pretty well.  I win.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What? Ugh. All right, you know what that was just a fluke. Best two out of three.  Oh, come on! Best four out of seven. Eight out of fifteen. Seventeen out of thirty-three?  Ha, ha! Looks like you're on the ropes this time.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I can't believe it. You might actually win this one.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, Pabu?  Why?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's almost sundown. Why hasn't Aiwei left yet?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Maybe he sneaked out when you weren't looking.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I just saw him peeking out of his window fifteen minutes ago. It's in my logbook.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm going over there.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, wait! You're going to blow our element of surprise.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's over, Aiwei! Where's ...?  What?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's a weird way to nap.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He's not sleeping. He's meditating. Wait! Asami, those spirits were trying to tell us something earlier. Xai Bau's Grove isn't on the map because it's not in the physical world! It's in the Spirit World! I'm going in after him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We'll watch him in case he wakes up. Be careful!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: What happened back in Zaofu? You told me we wouldn't have any problems getting the Avatar? Because of you, we've all been compromised.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: No, any evidence was destroyed when my library burned.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Where is your physical body now?

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: At the Misty Palms Inn. But there is no need to worry. I was not followed.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You left a loose end.

transcript.speaker: Aiwei
transcript.text: I assure you, no one knows anything about us.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No, you are the loose end.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It seems Aiwei was mistaken. He was followed.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's right. We knew he'd lead us straight to you. Now, what did you do with him?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: He'll be spending eternity in the Fog of Lost Souls, which just leaves the two of us.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't move, Zaheer. You're going to give me some answers.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: There's no need for aggression. Neither of us has our bending, and I'm not going anywhere. I'll answer whatever questions you have. You deserve that much.  What would you like to know?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: First off, who are you people, and why do you keep trying to take me?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: We are part of a secret society, dedicated to restoring freedom to the world. We are the Red Lotus.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Red Lotus? Are you related to the White Lotus?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: We are what the White Lotus was meant to be. But after the Hundred Year War, the White Lotus lost its true purpose. Its members came out of hiding and openly served the Avatar. They became nothing but glorified bodyguards who served corrupt nations. So a great man named Xai Bau broke from the White Lotus and began his own society.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's a great story, but it doesn't explain why you tried to take me when I was a kid.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: That was Unalaq's idea.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? My uncle was part of the Red Lotus?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Avatar Korra. Misty Palms Inn. Find her.

transcript.speaker: P-Li
transcript.text: You two go. I'll stay here and make sure Zaheer's body is safe.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I met your uncle when I was a teenager, after we had both joined the Red Lotus. We learned about Raava and Vaatu, and how Avatar Wan foolishly severed them, disrupting the balance of the world forever.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Avatar Wan wasn't foolish! He was trying to restore balance.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: He closed the portals, severing humans from spirits. Even you realize the error in his ways.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So all along, you and my uncle planned to use me to open the portals and release Vaatu? That's why you tried to take me when I was a kid?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Yes, and with members of the Red Lotus as your elemental masters, we could've taught you so much.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It sounds like you were just trying to brainwash me so I'd do whatever you wanted.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No, Korra. All I wanted was to show the Avatar a better path for the world.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, I don't know how, but Water Arm Lady and Lava Guy found us.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I just said I don't know how!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Korra, come on! Wake up!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What do we do?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get Korra out of here. Bolin and I will hold them off.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: The Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If my uncle came up with a plan to abduct me when I was a kid, why wasn't he caught?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: He wasn't with us that night, and he covered up his involvement afterwards.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So he betrayed you, just like he betrayed me.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Yes. He allowed me and my friends to remain in prison while he pursued his own selfish goals. Unalaq becoming a Dark Avatar was never part of our mission.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And what is your mission, exactly?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I want what you want: to restore balance to this world.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't think our ideas of balance are the same.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Are you sure about that? You kept the spirit portals open. But why stop there? Bringing the spirits back should only be the beginning.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: The idea of having nations and governments is as foolish as keeping the human and spirit realms separate. You've had to deal with a moronic president and a tyrannical queen. Don't you think the world would be better off if leaders like them were eliminated?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. I mean, I don't really agree with what they've done, but taking out world leaders isn't the answer.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It wasn't too long ago that the airbenders were nearly all wiped out, thanks to the Fire Lord's desire for world dominance. True freedom can only be achieved when oppressive governments are torn down.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But that won't bring balance. It will throw the world into chaos .

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Exactly. The natural order is disorder. Do you know who once said, "New growth cannot exist without first the destruction of the old"?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: The wise Guru Laghima. An airbender.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I can't beat this guy! It's like I'm giving him ammo! Want to trade?

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Go get the Avatar! I have these two under control.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You know, being locked away for so many years, I was beginning to lose hope.  But when I awoke with airbending, I knew I would be the one to destroy the old world and plant seeds for a new world to flourish.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer, please, as an airbender, you could help make a positive difference in the world, instead of destroying it.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You're a very smart young woman, Korra. But you must realize that once change begins, it cannot be stopped, even by the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Enough with your philosophical mumbo-jumbo! I want to know one thing. If you do capture me, what are you going to do with me?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You'll have that answer soon enough. The Red Lotus should have you by now. See you in the physical world.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer!  Zaheer, you tricked me! Let me go!  Asami, are you okay? Where's the rest of the Red Lotus?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What's the Red Lotus? And Zaheer didn't capture us, the Earth Queen's forces did.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where are we?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm not sure. Some camp by the desert. They're taking us back to Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: The Earth Queen's army snatched up the Avatar before I could.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: But we figured you could find a use for these two.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Load them in the truck. We're taking a trip to Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Red Lotus is the world's newest threat. After confronting Zaheer, Korra learned that he is part of a secret society whose mission is to take out all the nations' leaders and destroy world order. But before Korra could warn anyone, she and Asami were apprehended by the Earth Queen's forces. And the Red Lotus have Mako and Bolin. Now both parties are headed toward Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You have to let me out! The Earth Queen is in danger from a group of terrorists calling themselves the Red Lotus.  I talked to one of them in the Spirit World yesterday. He's insane!

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Screaming about terrorists in the Spirit World? You're the one who sounds insane.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Do I have to be chained to the floor the whole way? It's going to be so uncomfortable.

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: Sorry Ma'am, I'm under orders.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Can't you just chain me to that railing?  I mean, where am I gonna go?  Please?

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: Well, as long as you're chained up, I guess it doesn't make a difference.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Thank you, Sir.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Can I have ... some water?

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: No water. We're also not going to bring you any rocks or fire, so don't ask. I guess there's air, but there's nothing we can do about that. We're not opening your compartment 'til we reach Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hoped Mako or Bolin would have shown up to save us by now. I wonder if they're okay.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: If you think  holding us hostage will give you some leverage against the Avatar, you're gonna be very disappointed.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Can't we just enjoy our time together in silence ?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And why did you need Korra alive back in Zaofu? You had her paralyzed. Why didn't you just take her out when you had the chance?

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Look, all you need to know is that the world is about to change, for the better.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So you guys were like locked up for fifteen years, huh ? It must've been like crazy boring.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Actually, it was only thirteen years. But it felt like thirty.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I mean, what did you do with all that time? Did you sing songs, work on crafts?

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Not a lot of craft supplies in a volcanic prison cell.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: And I must've renamed the constellations about a thousand times. When it rained, that was a big event.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: I would've killed for some rain. Mostly I just made up stories about the guards: who was having trouble with his girlfriend; which one secretly wished he'd become a pastry chef.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
