transcript.text: Ooh okay, that sounds like fun. Let me try that on you guys.  You were raised by an older sister, your mustache grew in when you were ten and I'm sensing - just sensing - an unspoken attraction between you two.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Two out of three. Not bad.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, would you stop making friends with the bad guys?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Sorry!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Ghazan, gag those two. We're almost there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We have to find a way to get out of this prison before we get to the Earth Queen.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Don't worry, I have a plan. These airships the Cabbage Corp sold to the Earth Kingdom are way cheaper than the ones Future Industries built.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Now that's just shoddy workmanship.  There's no way I can get these locks off. I need the keys.  Give me five minutes, then start yelling for help.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: When is the Avatar scheduled for delivery?

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: The airship already left Fort Bosco and should be arriving in a few hours.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Excellent. Bring it to me as soon as it lands.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Yes, Your Majesty. But first there are some ... people here who captured two of the Avatar's friends. They would like to present them to you personally.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: You know I don't meet with bounty hunters.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: And of course I told them that. But they say they have some information that might interest you; about the location of your stolen airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Really?  Fine, send them in.  Ah, yes, I remember these two. We'll find an acceptable home for you in prison , with the rest of the dissidents.  Now, I'm told you have some information for me. I hope this isn't just some ruse to increase your bounty.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: We don't want any bounty, Your Majesty. You can consider these two a "thank you" gift for simply taking the time to talk to us.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: How very magnanimous. So, where are my airbenders?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I'd be happy to tell you, once you hand the Avatar over to me.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Who told you that we have the Avatar?!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: How I know is not important. But if I found out, others will too. And that could put you in a difficult position.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Is that so?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Your Majesty, imprisoning the Avatar will cause the other nations to turn against you and demand her freedom. Before long, we'd be in the midst of a sticky international incident. If you let me take her today, no one need ever know she was here, and you can get your airbenders back without interference. We both win.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: And what do you plan to do with the Avatar should I see fit to grant your request.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: All I can say is: I have business with her. But she won't be bothering you again. I can assure you of that.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: I find these terms agreeable. Gun, escort them to the antechamber until the Avatar's arrival.  Send these two to the dungeon.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Guards!  Get in here!  Something happened to my friend. She needs help.

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: Where is she?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nice work. Now let's take control of the ship.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Mayday! Mayday! The Avatar has escaped. We're going down in quadrant four of the Si Wong Desert.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I think you might have been a little over-aggressive with the airbending. The controls are busted.  Also, you broke the radio.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry, but it's not my fault this airship's a hunk of junk.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Hang on to something!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well. They say any landing you could walk away from is a good landing.  But, given our location, I'm not so sure about that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're the engineer. What do you think? Can we get flying again?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It doesn't look good. Even if you metalbend the propellers back into shape, we have to dig this whole thing out of the sand.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is everyone all right?

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: Like you care.

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: What the heck happened?

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: She said her friend needed help, then they knocked me out!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry. But I couldn't let you take me to the Earth Queen as a captive. There are dangerous forces at work that you don't know anything about.

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: More dangerous than being stranded in the desert?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Don't worry, Kong. I've radioed Ba Sing Se before we went down. We just need to sit tight. Somebody will be here to rescue us.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not waiting around for that. We need to get out of here now .

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: If we all work together, we might be able to get the ship up and running.

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: Not likely. I just tunneled out the engine room. It's like a sandbox in there.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: This ship isn't going anywhere. And neither are you. You're prisoners and it's our duty to transport you to the Earth Queen.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You realize that I'm the Avatar, right?  You don't want to fight me.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: I'm afraid you aren't giving us much of a choice. We have our orders.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Wait, did that sand dune just move?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: It was probably just a mirage. The desert will play tricks on you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: That's no mirage. Look.

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: I heard that since all the spirits came back, this desert has been haunted by them.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh right, so I guess that's my fault too. Do you want to help us get this ship up and running, or do you want to wait around and meet that thing?

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: We want to fix the ship. Right, Cap?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Let's get to work.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everybody stand back.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We have to find a way out of here before Zaheer gets his hands on Korra.

transcript.speaker: Prisoner
transcript.text: Take me with you. I haven't seen my wife and five kids for four years.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Four years?

transcript.speaker: Prisoner
transcript.text: The first few months were great, I-I could finally get some sleep, but ...  now I really miss them.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Listen. Bolin, this is up to you. I know you can metalbend.

transcript.speaker: Prisoner
transcript.text: You can metalbend?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes you can. I believe in you.

transcript.speaker: Prisoner
transcript.text: I believe in you too, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I appreciate that, Mako, and fellow ... prisoner man. But I've been trying and trying and trying and I've never been able to do it. Not even a little.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You've always had the ability deep down. You just haven't had the motivation. But this is your time! Get us out of here to save Korra. You can do it!  Bolin! Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Other prisoners
transcript.text: Bolin! Bolin! Bolin! Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're right.  Okay, here I go. Metalbending.  I can't metalbend.

transcript.speaker: Other prisoners
transcript.text: Aww!

transcript.speaker: Prisoner
transcript.text: Hey, you guys didn't happen to bring any toilet paper, do you?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: First, you scare the life out of me, now you want to lick me.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Here, chew on this  and leave me alone.  Tonraq, you read me?

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Yes, we copy.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I've found Korra's jeep, but the kids aren't here. Meet me at the Misty Palms Oasis.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: How's it looking in there?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I just airbent all the sand out of the engine room. I think it's clean.

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: Hasn't been this clean since it floated off the showroom floor.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How's it going out here?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well, she's still pretty banged up, but I think she might be able to limp out of the desert. Kong, you want to see if you can get the engine started?

transcript.speaker: Kong
transcript.text: Aye aye!

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: All right!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's no spirit!  I think it's gone now.

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: Kong, are you all right? What are we going to do? All of our supplies were on the ship. We've got no food, no water.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Easy, Arik. Another ship is on the way. We just need to hold our position for a few hours.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We might not have a few hours.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How far are we from the edge of the desert?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Too far to walk, if that's what you're thinking.

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: We can't just wait around to for that thing to pick us off one by one !

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: You'll do as you're told, Airman. Now get a hold of yourself!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Maybe we can still build something to get us all out of here.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: You want to make some wings out of scrap metal and flap real hard?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: No, but we might have enough material to construct a makeshift sand-sailer. Like the sandbenders use to get around. All we need is a sail and some kind of sled to attach it to.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's worth a try.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Gather every piece of metal you can find. We'll give that sandy beast a run for his money yet.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Looks like he's in hurry. Wait here.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li agent
transcript.text: Your Majesty, we received a distress signal from the airship carrying the prisoners. We believed the ship crashed in the Si Wong desert and the Avatar may have escaped.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: This is outrageous! Send another airship to retrieve the Avatar immediately.

transcript.speaker: Dai Li agent
transcript.text: It's already on its way, Your Majesty.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: What are we going to do now?

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: There's no way we can track her down in the desert before the queen gets to her.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: You really think we'd be lucky enough to capture her again? She'll be long gone by the time they arrive.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It doesn't matter. We're through chasing her. It's time to make her come to us.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: What is this riff-raff doing in my throne room unannounced?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Apologies, Your Majesty. But I couldn't help overhearing that the Avatar won't be joining us today.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: The Avatar is still in my custody. However, eavesdropping on royal conversations will land you in a cell right next to those boys you brought in. Now, if you value your freedom, you'll tell me where the airbenders are right now!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: That wasn't the deal.

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: I will not bandy words with bounty hunters!  Seize these hoodlums and throw them in prison until they decide to show proper respect for the crown!

transcript.speaker: Hou-Ting
transcript.text: Gun! Get in back here and lay down your life for your queen, you coward !  You wouldn't dare attack a queen!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Maybe I forgot to mention something to you. I don't believe in queens.  You think freedom is something that you can give or take on a whim ...  To your people ... freedom is just as essential as ... air. And without it ... there is no life.  There is only ... darkness.

transcript.speaker: Radio operator
transcript.text: Hey! You can't be in here!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No need for alarm. I just need to make an announcement to the entire city. How do I do that?

transcript.speaker: Radio operator
transcript.text: Who do you think you are?

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: He's the man who just took down the Earth Queen. You want to be next?!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Ming-Hua, please. We're here to help citizens like him, not hurt them.  Now, can you help me?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Attention citizens of Ba Sing Se. I have an important announcement to make.  Moments ago, the Earth Queen was brought down by the hands of revolutionaries,  including myself. I'm not going to tell you my name, because my identity is not important.  I'm not here to take over the Earth Kingdom. I think you've had enough of leaders telling you what to do. It's time for you to find your own path. No longer will you be oppressed by tyrants. From now on, you are free!  I deliver Ba Sing Se be into the hands of the people!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We have to get out of here, Bolin. Zaheer came here to take out the Earth Queen, and now Korra is next.

transcript.speaker: Prisoner
transcript.text: You know that guy? He's my hero!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Shut up!  You have to metalbend us out of here. C'mon! I know you can do it! This is your time!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You said before "was my time".

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know I did it, but now it's really your time.  Do it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Did you see that? I did it! I mean, not for us, but I metalbent all the other cells open!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't think that was you.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Listen to me. I'm going to set you free, but I want to talk to you first. I have a message that I need you to take to Korra.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: She ain't pretty, but I think she'll do the job.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No time for a test run. Let's move!

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: I think he's gone. We did it!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You want to buy a slightly used sand-sailer?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Thanks, Asami. You got a good head on your shoulders.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry for getting us stranded out there. I didn't mean for that to happen.

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: You know, whatever the conflict between you and the queen is, I'm sure it's above my pay grade.  You've got a tough job. Good luck, Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Arik
transcript.text: Captain, have we been in the desert for too long? Or is that really a dragon over there?

transcript.speaker: Captain
transcript.text: Ugh, let's go get a drink.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Dhaaah!  Easy, girl. Did you think we weren't coming back to you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What are you all doing here?

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra, you're safe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, we made it out of the desert. Thanks to Asami.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Do you remember Lord Zuko?

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: I met you when you were a very young girl. It's good to see you again, Avatar Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's good to see you, Lord Zuko.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Thanks for ditching me back at Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, sorry about that. But, how did you all find us?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I am a detective , you know.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Did you find Mako and Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Some people at the inn saw them captured by Zaheer's crew. We don't know where they are.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Did you hear about the Earth Queen?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What about her?

transcript.speaker: Radio
transcript.text: Once again, the Earth Queen's reign has come to an abrupt and violent end. Ba Sing Se has descended into chaos. Rioters and looters have overrun the palace.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The Red Lotus.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: What's that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The name of the group that's been trying to capture me and just took out the Earth Queen. I'm afraid this is only the beginning, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Ba Sing Se has fallen. After Zaheer and the Red Lotus toppled the Earth Queen, the city descended into chaos. Meanwhile, Korra and Asami tried to escape their captors, but crashed in the desert. After getting to safety, they met up with Lord Zuko, Tonraq, and Beifong. Back in Ba Sing Se, Zaheer freed Mako and Bolin, giving them a vital message to deliver to Korra, but will the brothers find her in time?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I can't believe it! The Upper Ring is in chaos!

transcript.speaker: Looter
transcript.text: Don't try to stop us; we're taking back what's ours.

transcript.speaker: Royal Earthbender Guard
transcript.text: Stop you?  I'm gonna join you.  I know where the good stuff is.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Should we do something?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This isn't our battle.  We have to deliver Zaheer's message to Korra immediately.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Right. Okay, find Korra, deliver message.  Yeah, this should be easy. We just got to get out of the city and get to the desert, then somehow find her in the vast expansive wasteland that goes on for thousands, and thousands, of miles.  This isn't gonna be easy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need an airship.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Excuse me, may I have your attention please? I'm with the Republic City Police and I need to commandeer this airship to help the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Let me give it a shot.  Hey, the Queen's gold's on the third floor of the palace, second door on the right!  You just got to know how to talk to 'em, bro.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What, they took everything. I mean, who rips out a transmission radio?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Some folks just do not have respect for other people's property.  Now let's steal this airship!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You know how to fly this thing?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Technically speaking, no. But, c'mon, how hard could it be?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Up! Up!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I don't see any up button. I see levers and switches, oh, there it is.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The whole city is falling to pieces.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mako, our family's down there.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Move over, we're getting them out.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, you think just because you dated Asami, you know how to fly this better than me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Bolin? What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I came to get you guys out. This whole block is about to go up in flames. Come on, Mako and I have an airship on the roof.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: We can't. Grandma won't go.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: This place is my whole world. I will not leave!  Oh, but I'm so glad my little Bolin has come back to visit. Sit down, would you like some tea?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Grandma, we don't have time for tea.

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Mom, please!

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: No! I can't abandon the place where I raised my family. It's my home.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Grandma, there's one thing Mako and I've learned from all our years on the street. It doesn't matter where you go.  If you have your family with you, you'll always be at home.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: I'm not going.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Fine!  You leave me no choice.  We're rolling out!

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Wait.  Okay, let's go!

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Thanks for getting us out of there. I mean, I probably could have handled it myself if you guys didn't show up, but, thanks.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: May she rest in peace.  This airship is nice. Is it our new home?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, Grandma. I'm not sure where we're gonna take you, but right now, we need to find Korra.

transcript.speaker: Chow
transcript.text: Did something happen to the Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm afraid so.  Her airship went down somewhere in the desert. She was coming from a military base near the Misty Palms Oasis and heading to Ba Sing Se. If we retrace her route back to the base, we should find the wreckage.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Guys, it's the wreckage!  I found it!  There!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's a Ba Sing Se airship, all right. But where's the rest of it?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I don't know. But there's some tracks.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: See, I told you. Landing is hard.

transcript.speaker: Female relative
transcript.text: Spirits!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, guys. We think Korra found her way back here.  Now let's split off into teams and scour the town. Yes, we'll need your help too, Pabu, now just give me a second while I- wait, Pabu? Pabu!

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Why is Bolin hugging that big rat?  Eww,  now he's kissing it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm never gonna let you go again!

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Guys, look out! Giant dog beast thingy!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, all right, Naga. It's good to see you, too. Gah! Stop! You're licking my mouth.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Asami! Korra!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You guys are okay!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sorry. I was just- It's so good to see you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's really good to see you, too.  Both of you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Good. You guys aren't dead.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't get all mushy on me, Chief.  Tonraq. Sir.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh my gosh, it's Lord Zuko! I can't believe it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uhm,  forgive my brother. We're just really honored to meet you, Sir.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: It's a pleasure to meet you as well.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: You must be the Avatar.  Mako told me so much about you. You are even more beautiful than I imagined.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uh, actually, that's Asami. This is Avatar Korra. Korra, this is my grandma, Yin.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: You are very muscular for a woman.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Uhm, thanks. You too?

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: What lovely young women. Mako, why aren't you dating any nice girls like them?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Uh, so what happened to you two? Where have you been?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We were captured by Zaheer and taken to Ba Sing Se. We were there when the Earth Queen was overthrown.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? How did you escape?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Zaheer let us go.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? Why would he do that?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Because he wanted us to find you and deliver a message.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Zaheer is headed to the Northern Air Temple as we speak. He said he's gonna wipe out the new Air Nation and everyone in it. Unless you turn yourself over to him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer's threatening innocent lives just to get to me.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: He could be bluffing.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He's already taken out the Earth Queen. I don't think he bluffs.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We need to radio Tenzin and warn him that the Red Lotus is coming.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I agree. Unfortunately, we don't have a radio on the airship.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: There's a portable radio on the jeep, but the signal will never make it to the Northern Air Temple.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We need to get to a place that has a strong radio transmitter. The Metal Clan will have one.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's go. We'll radio Su on the way. Hopefully she can get a hold of Tenzin at the air temple by the time we get to Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Did you have any luck getting through to Tenzin?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: No one's answering. What if Zaheer's already up there? I should never have let Opal go.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: It's going to be okay, Su.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I hope so.

transcript.speaker: Radio operator
transcript.text: We have a strong signal, but no one's answering.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't just sit around here while a madman is on his way to the Northern Air Temple. We have to do something.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I'll ready my airship. With a full force of the Metal Clan security backing us, we can take them.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We'll never make it up there before Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There might be another way to stop him. It's a long shot, but Zaheer is always meditating into the Spirit World. And I know exactly where he goes: Xai Bau's Grove. If I can find him there, maybe I could somehow trap him.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We can't protect you in there. I don't like it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll be fine. I have to try.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'll watch over her as she meditates.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I guess, in the meantime, Mako and I will stay here and try to get through to the temple.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We'll help Su ready the airship.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: I'm going to take a nap.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer! Come out! Face me! Leave the airbenders out of this!  There you are.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Please don't hurt me, Korra. I'm just an old man.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Iroh? What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: I was just out searching for a new teapot to add to my collection. But instead, I found you.  In the Spirit World, you always seem to find something you don't know you were looking for.  You look troubled.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Sit.  What is on your mind?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's a maniac on the loose and he's threatening to destroy the new Air Nation. I don't know what to do.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Just because you are the Avatar, doesn't mean you will have all the answers.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know many Avatars have needed guidance. But I'm the only one since Avatar Wan that can't get help from my past lives. I wish I could talk to Aang.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: You know, Zuko and Aang were close friends.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Lord Zuko, of course.

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Yes, my nephew. Their relationship started off  a little rocky, but they grew to become lifelong friends. Best friends.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you! Thank you so much. You're right about the Spirit World. I came here looking for someone else, but I'm glad I found you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Did you find Zaheer?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, he wasn't there. But there's someone I need to talk to.  You're leaving? Aren't you coming to the air temple with us?

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: I'm sorry, but I can't. I'm going back to the Fire Nation. If it's true that the Red Lotus is targeting the nations' leaders, I need to protect my daughter.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I understand. You have to keep the Fire Lord safe. But before you leave, I was wondering if you could help me with something.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: I was often Aang's counsel and I'd love to be yours.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That just it. You knew Aang better than anyone. I was wondering if you knew what he might do if he were in my situation.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: Hmm. Rebuilding the Air Nation was Aang's biggest dream. He would be beside himself with joy with what you've done. And if he accomplished that goal, he might have sacrificed anything to protect it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So he would give himself up to save the Air Nation?

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: I don't know for sure. The airbenders might have been closest to Aang's heart, but, as the Avatar, he was concerned with people of all nations. No one knew better than Aang that in times of turmoil,  the world needs its Avatar the most.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks. Your uncle was right. It was helpful talking to you.

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: Wait, you spoke with my uncle?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes. In the Spirit World. A couple of times actually.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Guys. We got through to the air temple.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Who is this?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I told you, it's Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Bolin's not here right now. Can I take a message?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No! I'm not looking for Bolin, I am Bolin! Gah, look, I need you to find your dad.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: He's outside with the bison. Did you know we found a whole herd full of baby bison?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, a whole herd? Really?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Meelo, this is your commanding officer. Go get your dad, now!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yes, sir!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Come on, come on!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hello? This is Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin! Listen to me carefully. Zaheer is on his way to the temple. He's coming for the airbenders. You have to get everyone out of there immediately. Drop everything. Leave! Now!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh no.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? What is it? Tenzin! Tenzin, what's happening?!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's too late.  He's here.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: What is it, Daddy?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We need to get everyone out of here.  Stay close to me.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: What's going on, Tenzin?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's Zaheer.  Round everyone up! We need to get to the bison and evacuate immediately!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Guys, we got an emergency. We're evacuating the temple.  Come on.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Look out!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: It's Zaheer! We have to leave.

transcript.speaker: Ming Hua
transcript.text: No one's going anywhere, or she gets it.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Good. The entire family is here.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It's a pleasure to finally meet a true airbending master.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What is it you want from us?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Nothing at all. In fact, if everyone cooperates, you will all walk out of this situation unharmed.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Then what are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I want Korra, and I'm tired of chasing her.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're using us as leverage.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I will never let you get to Korra.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Unfortunately, you don't have a choice.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Yes, I do.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora! Get everyone out of here. Bumi, Kya, help me hold them off!  And stay out of her line of sight! Go, go !

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: It's too dangerous. We'll never make it to the stables with her up there.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I see you're having as much fun as I am.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I can't wait any longer.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Wait, what are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Whatever I can.  Get to the bison! Get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Kai! No.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: I got you.

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: Bumi, let go!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: But we could die!

transcript.speaker: Kya
transcript.text: We're gonna die if we hang on!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Give up. It's over.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: As long as I'm breathing, it's not over.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Woah!  Thanks, buddy. Yip, yip!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The new Air Nation is in jeopardy. In an effort to force Korra to surrender herself, Zaheer ambushed the Northern Air Temple. Tenzin, Bumi, and Kya attempted to hold off the Red Lotus, but were injured in battle. The airbenders were unable to escape and everyone was taken captive except Kai. Now Korra and Team Avatar race to the temple hoping to mount a rescue.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I say we make our approach from the west, drop down from the airship on cables, ambush these Red Lotus low-lives before they know what hit them.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: It will never work. That Combustion Lady will pick us off one by one.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You have a better idea on how to save the airbenders?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Yeah. We come up from the valley, scale the side of the mountain and take them off guard.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: That could work.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: And give them the high ground? No, if their lavabender spots us, he'll melt the mountainside and us with it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait, I've got it. I'll disguise myself as a lost hiker, and once I'm in the temple, I'll distract the Red Lotus with my bird calls.  That's when you all strike.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bird calls, really?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well I haven't noticed you offering any suggestions.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It doesn't matter. None of these ideas will work. The second Zaheer realizes we're up to something, he'll wipe out the airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: And Opal is one of those airbenders. Believe me, I understand what's at stake.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Then I'll think you agree that the only plan that will work is for me to give myself up.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Korra, no.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We'll figure out another way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I talked it over with Lord Zuko, and I've given it a lot of thought. I have to do this.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You can't expect us to sit by and let Zaheer take you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The world has been out of balance for far too long: it needs the Air Nation back again. I can't let Zaheer destroy it and everyone we love. Help me save the airbenders, then you can worry about saving me.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We're with you, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Yes, whatever you need, they're here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll go radio Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer, are you there? It's me.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I've been waiting for your call. So, do we have a deal?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes. You release the airbenders, and then I'll turn myself over.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: And take away the only leverage I have? No. I can't do that. Listen carefully, here's what I need you to do.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Will you sit down? I'm already tense enough as it is.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm just worried about Opal, and Pabu's not here to comfort me.  I hope he and Naga are doing okay back in Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: No, not Mako's scarf! Bad dog and rat thingy! I'm very disappointed in you two.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Did you speak to Zaheer?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes. He told me to come to the top of Laghima's Peak at noon, alone. Once he has me, he'll release the airbenders over to you at the temple.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I think I figured a way to play this so that the airbenders and Korra all come out in one piece.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Zaheer doesn't know how many of us there are, so we have the numbers advantage. I say we split into two teams:  Mako, Bolin and Asami will take the airship up to the temple.  Meanwhile, my metalbenders, Tonraq, Lin, and I will get in position below Laghima's Peak.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Let go your earthly tether. Enter the void. Empty and become wind. Empty and become wind.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: The airbenders are secured.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Thank you, P'Li. For everything.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: Of course.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I want you to know:  not one day went by in that prison when I didn't think of you.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: The years apart only made my love for you stronger. And deep down I knew you would find a way to get me out. Just like you saved me from becoming that warlord's killing machine when I was a girl.  You've shown me what true freedom means.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: And after today,  we'll show the entire world what it means. No more prisons, no more running.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: I love you, Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I love you too.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Radio the second you see those airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I will, Chief. Good luck.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Be careful, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You too.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't worry, Dad. I'll be all right.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I just want you to know how proud I am of you. The risk you're taking to save the Air Nation will be remembered for generations.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I love you, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I love you too, sweetheart.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And Dad, watch out for Zaheer. He's not very fond of world leaders.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I can handle him. Just stay focused on your mission.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, man.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Must have been some fight.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako, did you see the airbenders?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Not yet. We're just arriving. Don't turn yourself over until I get a visual on them.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: This way.  You want the airbenders, or not?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Drop your staff and surrender yourself.  Don't make me come get you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako, what's going on?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: They're here. And so is the lavabender.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tell Ghazan to let the airbenders go.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Not 'til you turn yourself over. This isn't a negotiation.  Wipe them out!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! Wait. I'm coming.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Stand down.

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: Don't bother trying to metalbend out of these: they're platinum.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: We have her.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's okay, Tenzin. We're about to get you out of here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, it was a trick! They're not here. Don't turn yourself over!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We had a deal!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Chief, get Korra out of there. Now!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Go! Go!

transcript.speaker: P'Li
transcript.text: Get the Avatar on the airship. I'll deal with them.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Nowhere to go, Zaheer!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Where're the airbenders?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I don't know. Zaheer moved them out of the temple.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Won't you just bury them already?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Come on.  We have to get to the airship.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Not gonna happen. The exit's blocked.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Where's Oogi?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Gone. All the bison got scared off during the attack. But, I think I know another way out. Bolin, can you get us to that wall?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: On it!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Through there.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Is it just me, or is it uh, getting really warm in here?  Oh, this is not good.  Let's move it, people!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Say hello to the Earth Queen for me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Dad!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: We're pinned down.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm gonna draw her fire. You take her out.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Lin. No.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I love you.  Come and get me, you Third-Eyed Freak!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: P'Li!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: It's over, Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Let go your earthly tether.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Release the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Enter the void.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: This is your last warning!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Empty, and become wind.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: No! Stop!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Did he just, fly?

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Guess he doesn't need a ride.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We can't outrun it! This way.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Now what?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Incredible.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're a lavabender.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I know. I just found out.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey, you guys need a lift?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kai. You're all right.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: More or less. Everyone hop on.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I owe you my life. Thank you, Captain.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You can call me Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey everybody, there's something I got to tell you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: How did you guys make it out of the temple alive?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It was all Bolin. I thought we were done for, then out of nowhere, he lavabends .

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I knew you had the potential for something big. You just had to believe in yourself.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're right. Being moments from death was a pretty good motivator too. Of course, we would have never made it back with Kai.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Glad I could help. So anyway-

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Did Zaheer get away with Korra?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'm afraid so.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Apparently, he can fly now.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: How?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Are you sure?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I wouldn't believe it either if I hadn't seen it for myself.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've heard the legends about Guru Laghima's ability to fly. I'd never imagine they were true.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: So what's our next move?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I have an idea.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Not right now, kid! We need to figure out where Zaheer took Korra.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: And find the airbenders.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: That's what I've been trying to tell you.  I know where the airbenders are, and I bet it's where Korra is too.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, why didn't you say something?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Where are they? How did you find them?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: After I got blasted out the sky, I woke up on the side of the mountain,  where this little fellow found me. I tried to sneak back into the temple, to see if I could rescue anyone, and that's when I saw the airship leaving. I followed it into some caves a few miles from here. The giant lady and some people put the airbenders into the caves.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Was it Ghazan and Ming-Hua?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: No, there were four more of them. They didn't look familiar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Must be more Red Lotus members than we thought.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I couldn't fight them on my own, so I came back here, hoping you guys would show up.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We need to get to those caves.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: How? I don't think we can all fit on my bison.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oogi!  I'm glad to see you too, old friend.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I want to come with you.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: No, Kuvira. Stay with the injured. We'll be back for you once we have the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey. Um, I appreciate you coming back for us. Sorry for ever giving you a hard time.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: That's okay. I probably deserved it.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, you kind of did.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Why didn't you ever tell us you could fly?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I wasn't sure I could. Only one other airbender in history had the ability.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: How did you figure out how to do it?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I found true freedom. I am no longer bound to this earth by worldly desires. I have entered the void.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Where's P'Li?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: She sacrificed her life for our cause. Now let's make sure it wasn't in vain.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You. You killed my father!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I understand your grief. I also lost someone I loved today. But your pain will soon be over.  Bring the poison.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Red Lotus has captured the Avatar. Korra gave herself up in exchange for the airbenders, but Zaheer double crossed her, while Ghazan trapped Team Avatar at the temple. All seems lost until Bolin saved their lives by lavabending. But he's not the only one with new skills. Zaheer unlocked the ancient airbending ability of flight. Will Team Avatar save the Air Nation and Korra before it's too late?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: When I get out of here, none of you will survive!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You won't get out, unless the Metal Clan has taught you a way to bend platinum.  Once we administer this poison, your body will naturally react, forcing you into the Avatar State in an effort to keep you alive. Sadly for you, you'll be entering it for the last time.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! The Avatar Cycle.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Yes. When we dispatch you in the Avatar State, the cycle will end.  So we lucky few, this band of brothers and sisters in anarchy, are witnessing the beginning of an era of true freedom. Together, we will forge a world without kings and queens, without borders or nations, where Man's only allegiance is to himself and those he loves. We will return to the true balance of natural order. And though you will never again be reborn, your name will echo throughout history: Korra, the last Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Did you find any way to escape?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: No. Not yet. But don't worry, we'll find a way out soon.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: They might not make it that long.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Korra will come and save us, right?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I think we're gonna have to do this on our own.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Administer the poison.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Get ready. As soon as she's in the Avatar State, take her out.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: Wait. Why isn't she staying in the Avatar State?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Give it time. She can't resist for long.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: The place where I saw them taking the airbenders is around here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's got to be where they took Korra.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: That's it. Down there, Lefty.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Find the airbenders, and my family.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Don't worry. I'm not coming out without our children and the rest of your people.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: It's working.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I told you, Korra.  The world doesn't need you anymore.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: The time of the Avatar is over, Korra. Give up.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: You're too weak to resist, and I'm stronger than ever. There's no use fighting. Let go.

transcript.speaker: Amon, Unalaq, and Vaatu
transcript.text: Let go. Let go. Let go.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I'm thirsty!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I gotta go pee.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Me too.

transcript.speaker: Red Lotus sentry #1
transcript.text: Hey! Keep it down over there, or you're all gonna end up like them.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Sir, please. We just ask some water. There are children, and a baby here.

transcript.speaker: Red Lotus sentry #1
transcript.text: Oh, so you just called me over to attack me? Fine! Now nobody gets any water.  I don't know how we ended up in daycare while everyone else gets to watch the Avatar being destroyed. I can hold a bowl of poison!

transcript.speaker: Red Lotus sentry #2
transcript.text: Hey! What do you think you're doing?!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Mom!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Oh, honey, I'm so glad you're safe.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Me too.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You're alive!  I can't believe it.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Why? Just because I was blown out of the sky, and fell hundreds of feet down a cliff? Don't you know it takes more than that to get rid of me?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We have to get these two out of here now. They don't look so good.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: What are you talking about? I feel great!

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: You guys get everyone out of here. I'll search for Korra.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We're going with you.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You don't have to search for her. I know exactly where she's being held.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Now! Destroy the Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We have to help her.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Look out!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You help Korra, we got this.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Daddy!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Oh, thank goodness you're all right.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Honey, are you okay?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'll be fine.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: We have to help Korra.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What are you smiling about?

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: I was just remembering the last time we fought.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, a lot has changed since then.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: So that's how you got out of the temple. Not bad. Let's see what you got!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You can't fight me and the poison.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I can fly up on my bison to help her.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You'd never be able to keep up with Zaheer. He's too powerful.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: We have to do something!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: How can he fly like that?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: He's unlocked powers of airbending that haven't existed for thousands of years.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: There haven't been this many airbenders in one place for a long time either. We have power together.  Hurry, everyone form a circle! Follow me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You have no water. It's over.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Not yet.

transcript.speaker: Ming-Hua
transcript.text: Now it's over!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Give up, Ghazan! You can't win.

transcript.speaker: Ghazan
transcript.text: I'm never going back to prison. If I'm going down today, you're coming with me!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Mako, hang on!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: The poison has done its work. The Avatar Cycle will be over momentarily.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra. Sweetheart. It's me, Dad. Please hang on.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What are you laughing about?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You're too late! The poison has been in her system too long. The Red Lotus has won!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You can save her! The poison is metallic!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Dad. You're alive.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I'm here for you.  I'm never gonna let you go.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No! No! You don't understand! The revolution has already begun. Chaos is the natural order of-

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: See what I did there? I put a sock in him, literally.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Classic Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I do what I do.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: There you go. All fixed up for a formal Avatar appearance.  Take a look.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's great. Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You know, nobody expects you to bounce back right away. It's only been two weeks. You need time to heal.  I want you to know that I'm here for you. If you ever want to talk, or, anything. But let's just try to enjoy this today; for Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're right.  Okay, let's go.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: You look beautiful, sweetie.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're looking stronger everyday, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I'd like to officially welcome you back to Republic City. I know that the last time we saw each other, it didn't end on the best terms. But I want to thank you for taking down those Red Lotus terrorists.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We should go inside.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I-I can help.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I want to ride with Korra.  Jinora's already inside. Smells like shoe trees.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Sandalwood, Meelo.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I got this.  Hang in there, kid.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: She's not looking good.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Neither would you if you'd gone through what she had.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: She'll be fine. She just needs time to heal. The poison took a great toll.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Of course. I'm just saying, with the Earth Kingdom in complete disarray since the loss of the Queen ...

transcript.speaker: Zuko
transcript.text: And even with Zaheer locked up again, we still don't know how many Red Lotus members might be out there, hiding.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Exactly. With the world getting more and more dangerous, we need the Avatar now more than ever. Who will protect us while she's in a wheelchair?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora, come forward.  Today, we welcome the first airbending master in a generation. And I couldn't be more proud of my daughter.  When the existence of our people was threatened, when the Avatar's life hung in the balance, Jinora never gave up hope. Thanks to her leadership, I see a very bright future for the Air Nation. Of course, there would be no Air Nation without Avatar Korra: she opened the portals and somehow the world began anew for us. And she was even willing to lay down her own life in order to protect ours. There's no way we can ever repay her for all she's done. But we can follow her example of service and sacrifice. So while she recuperates, the Air Nation will reclaim its nomadic roots and roam the earth.  But unlike our ancestors, we will serve people of all nations, working wherever there is corruption and discord to restore balance and peace. Avatar Korra, I vow that we will do everything in our power to follow in your footsteps and bring harmony to the world.  Now, let us anoint the master who will help lead us in our new path.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Welcome to Republic City, the place of hopes, dreams and Spirit Wilds!  This metropolis truly has something for everyone. Visit Air Temple Island, the hub for all airbenders as they travel the world, helping others. Or take a stroll through beautiful Avatar Korra Park, named in honor of "You-Know-Who"! We've missed her these past three years and we can't wait to welcome her home. Get well soon, Korra! And of course, you'll want to see our most unique attractions: the Spirit Wilds. Here, spirits and people live harmoniously together.  Like this old codger, and his new pals. Yes siree, this town is truly on the up and up! Come be a part of the action in Republic City!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: And of course, my biggest thanks goes to Asami Sato and Future Industries. She brought our old central terminal into the modern era. Ladies and gentlemen, the world is entering a new age of peace and prosperity. Soon, Prince Wu will take his rightful place on the Earth Kingdom throne.  And thanks to our updated rail system, Republic City and the Earth Kingdom will be united like never before!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Hey there! Asami, right? Great train house. Maybe you can give me a personal tour sometime, what do you say?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I do like the idea of putting you on a train and sending you far, far away.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: That's ... that's funny. I like funny dames. Maybe I should introduce myself. I'm Prince Wu, future king.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Yeah ... I'm aware of who you are.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Don't let my reputation intimidate you. I'm still human just like everyone else. Only more human, like, extra human, or, hmm, superhuman .

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Superhuman?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: So, what do you say? Can I show you a low-key night out with a superhuman soon-to-be king?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Prince Wu! President Raiko has some really important ... king stuff to talk to you about.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Now?  Fine.  Think over the offer.  I'll be back.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He's a real charmer, huh?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: He's ... something. How can you stand being his bodyguard?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, I just remind myself that once he's on the throne, I go back to being a detective.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And that works?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I also go home, and smash my head into the wall for an hour, you know, just to get the stress out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's good to see you, Mako. It's been too long. You hear from Bolin lately?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I haven't talked to him for a while, but he's coming in a few days for the coronation. And Beifong told me that Korra is getting in tonight.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I can't wait to see her.  It's going to be weird, having the old Team Avatar back in the city after all these years.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: After your coronation, the United Forces will escort you to Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Right. About that. Are we all positive that the Earth Kingdom is safe enough for me to return? I don't have to remind everyone what happened to my great-aunt three years ago?!  May she rest in peace.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Prince Wu, I assure you, Kuvira has the Earth Kingdom pretty much stabilized at this point.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Uh ... define "pretty much".

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well, the roving bandits have mostly been dispersed.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Mostly?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Don't worry kid. The chances of you being assassinated are almost zero.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Almost ?

transcript.speaker: Shopkeeper
transcript.text: Get out of here! We don't have anything left.

transcript.speaker: Bandit #1
transcript.text: Now you don't have anything left.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: It's safe to come out, everyone! The airbenders are here.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: You finally made it! So where are the rest of you?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Actually, it's just the two of us, but we're going to do everything we can to help. I'm Opal, and this is Kai.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: It's nice to meet you.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: What? I called Master Tenzin because my state has been under siege by bandits for months. They blocked all the roads, cut off our supply lines, and all he sent is you two kids?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey, us two kids just took care of those three guys for you.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: There are hundreds more where they came from. My citizens are going hungry. Our entire state is on the brink of collapse.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Unfortunately, the Air Nation is spread thin right now. We're all you have.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We just got some good news.  Two more Earth Kingdom states have agreed to join us.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Excellent! Thank you, Bolin.  We're ninety percent there, Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That's great! Zhu Li, dish out some of that special celebration tea!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: None for me. I won't celebrate until the Earth Kingdom is one hundred percent reunited.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Why have we stopped?

transcript.speaker: Driver
transcript.text: Apologies. There are rocks on the tracks. It's most likely bandits. We're sending troops to handle the situation.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Call them off. I will take care of the bandits myself .

transcript.speaker: Female bandit #1
transcript.text: You're ... Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: And you're the bandits who have been causing chaos where I'm trying to establish order, aren't you?

transcript.speaker: Female bandit #1
transcript.text: We're sorry, we didn't know this was your train and ...

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Don't talk over me!

transcript.speaker: Male bandit #1
transcript.text: Please, take mercy on us!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Stop groveling as if this is the worst day of your life. This ... is a good day. I'm going to give you all the opportunity to rehabilitate yourselves, and become productive members of your nation. Right now, you're lost, but pledge your loyalty to me, and I'll give you a new purpose in your lives. Of course, if you don't want to join, you could always stay right here. Hopefully, someone saves you before the next train speeds through, but I wouldn't count on it.

transcript.speaker: Male bandit #1
transcript.text: No, we'll join. Don't leave us here.

transcript.speaker: Female bandit #1
transcript.text: We pledge our loyalty to you, Great Uniter.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know why we're leaving so early if you're just getting a haircut. The dinner at Air Temple Island isn't until later tonight.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Because I'm not just getting a haircut, it's a spa day! We're talking minimum four hours.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you kidding me?  What are you having done that takes four hours?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: A rejuvenating tea-leaf skin wrap. Have you ever gotten one of those, Mako?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, I'm ... not interested.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You will be.  So while your hands soak in a bubbling milk-bath, your feet are in a tub full of these little sucker-fish that literally eat your calluses away. Gobble them right up! Crazy, huh?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's disgusting !

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Then, they scrape your skin with blocks of sea-salt and lube you up with seaweed-infused aloe, wrap you in tea leaves, put you in a hot box for four hours, and bam ! You're done!  Mako, look at all my fans! They must be in town for my coronation.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know if all those people are your fans.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wu, we have to get you out of here!  Go! Go!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: What just happened out there?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I think those were Kuvira's supporters in the crowd.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Oh no! Mako, I've been hit! It's a gusher !

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's not blood. It's strawberry pie.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Oh. Yeah, you're right.  But that was close. I don't know what would have happened if you weren't there.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You would have been hit by a pie. It's really not that big of a deal.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Or I could have been killed! I don't know what I'd ever do without you! Wait a second. Did you say strawberry pie?  I'm allergic to strawberries!  I don't think I can breathe! Get me to the hospital! Wu down!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're allergic to bee stings!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Oh. Yeah, you're right.  I always get those two mixed up.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Look! A train made it through!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Maybe they brought food and supplies!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Hey, what's your boyfriend doing here?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: If he's here, he must be with Kuvira and my brother. This isn't going to be good.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Bolin!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Kai!  Wow , you are a lot heavier than you used to be. You're really growing up.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: What's up with your new hair? You look like a stiff.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hey, Kuvira says it makes me look intelligent and professional.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Don't believe everything she says.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal, I can't believe you're here too!  I missed you so much.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I missed you too.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Look who it is. It's good to see you again, little sister.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What a wonderful surprise. A happy reunion for my favorite couple.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: How's Mom doing?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Like you care. She still hasn't forgiven you.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You know, for someone who claims to be so enlightened, Mom can really hold a grudge.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I guess when her son betrays her ...

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Please, Opal, we're not here to bicker with you about something that happened three years ago. We're here to help this town, just like you.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I've heard how you help towns. By conquering them.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I know the rumors about me can be pretty nasty, but I am giving everyone in this nation a better future. And with Bolin's help, and my fiancé's ideas, we're laying the ground work for the people to achieve their own greatness.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Your fiancé?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You haven't heard?  Your brother and I are getting married.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Isn't that great, sweetie?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I know things got heated with your family when Baatar and I left Zaofu, but don't you think it's time to forgive and forget?
What are you doing here?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Hello, governor. I was wondering if you and I could talk privately.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: So, have you had time to rethink my generous offer?

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: Generous ? You want to take everything. How is that generous?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Governor, your state has been overrun by bandits. They have you outnumbered and outsupplied. The question's not if they'll take over; it's when . Unless you sign our deal. Agree to the terms, and you'll have the full force of my army backing you. You will remain in charge, just under my supervision. I will save your life, and the lives of your citizens. I think that's pretty generous.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: I know how you manipulate states, and force them to join up under you. I know the only reason you want this region is because it is rich in ore.  They might call you "The Great Uniter", but you're destroying everything! I'll never turn the great state of Yi over to you!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You have a lot of pride, but it cannot protect your people.  Your pride will not stop the hordes as your city crumbles to the ground. And your pride will certainly not feed your hungry when all that is left is rubble!

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: Leave! Get out of my state!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You will perish, unless you take my generous offer.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: It's time to go. We're not wanted here.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What happened?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: It appears we can't make a deal right now.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Wait! Aren't you guys going to stick around and help?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Here's the contract. We'll wait at the border for one day. You get the governor to sign it, and you'll have all the help you need.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I guess ... I got to go.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Don't! Please, you can't turn your back on these people!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm not! I wanna help, but if the Governor wants us gone, there's ... there's nothing I can do. I'm sorry.  Hey ... Opal, please.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Leave, if that's what you're going to do.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: You know, we might not need their help after all. The roads may be impassable, but not the skies. We can use Lefty to fly to all the nearby villages, pick up supplies, and fly back.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: You're right. We can save this town ourselves.

transcript.speaker: Farmer
transcript.text: Sorry we couldn't give you more. That's all we could spare.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Every little bit helps. Because of you and the other farmers around here, we have more than enough food to feed the town until we can get some reinforcements.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Thanks!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: So ... you and Bolin doing okay?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I don't know. It's really tough having a long distance relationship. And I can't stand that he's working with Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: I can tell. But it does seem like he found his calling, doesn't it? He loves helping people.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Maybe. It's just ... he's changed a lot since he's been around her.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: He's growing up.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I just hope we're not growing apart.  Speaking of long-distance relationships, how are you and Jinora doing?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: Actually, we're doing fine.  You hear that?

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: It's more bandits!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: We're hooked!

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: What happened? Where's all the food?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We were attacked in mid-air. We lost everything.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: It might be time to make a tough call.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: Here. Tell Kuvira to save my people.

transcript.speaker: Kai
transcript.text: For what it's worth, I think you made the right decision.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: Did I ever really have a choice?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: When Korra gets here, I bet she's not even going to know who I am.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Why is that?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Because Meelo the boy  has turned into Meelo the man !

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Right. You're completely unrecognizable.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You've never had the tea leaf wrap? You have no idea what you're missing. The face massage alone is to die for.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ugh. This coronation cannot come soon enough. I can't wait to go back to being a detective.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Right ... umm ... yeah, about that ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What?

transcript.speaker: Lin
