transcript.text: I don't know how to tell you this ... you're going to Ba Sing Se ... with the prince.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I tried to get you out of it, but it's over my head.  Wu personally asked Raiko. He says he doesn't know what he'd do without you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This can't be happening! I'm not even an Earth Kingdom citizen; I work for the Republic City Police Department.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Not anymore.  You're just a pawn in Raiko's diplomatic game. You can try talking to him, but I don't think he's going to let you quit.

transcript.speaker: Acolyte
transcript.text: There's a Southern Water Tribe ship pulling up to the dock!

transcript.speaker: Children
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: The State of Yi is now under the full protection of my army.  Proclaim your loyalty, if you wish to keep your post.

transcript.speaker: Governor
transcript.text: I pledge my loyalty to you, oh Great Uniter .

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Tonraq. It's good to have you back in the city. And everyone is excited to see the Avatar again.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: What do you mean? Isn't Korra already here?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, we thought she was coming with you.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Korra left the South Pole six months ago. She's written me letters. She said she was here in Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I assure you, your daughter is not here.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: Then where is she?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is that all you got?

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.text: We have a winner!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.text: Here.  For your lackluster participation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.text: You know, you look very familiar.  Yeah, you ... you kind of look like that Avatar girl!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I get that a lot.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.text: Whatever happened to her anyway?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I wouldn't know.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Avatar has gone missing! Three years ago, Zaheer poisoned Korra, severely injuring her. While her friends moved on with their lives, Korra remained in the South Pole. Everyone thought she was still recuperating, but six months ago, Korra left home and hasn't been seen since. Even Chief Tonraq was shocked to learn that his daughter's whereabouts are unknown. What has become of the Avatar and when will she return?

transcript.speaker: Man #1
transcript.text: Hurry up in there!  Come on, I got an emergency situation!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Knock yourself out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Huh?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Leave me alone !

transcript.speaker: Man #2
transcript.text: What's wrong with her?

transcript.speaker: Woman
transcript.text: Young lady, are you all right?  Can I take you to a doctor?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I-I don't need any help.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Now don't take this the wrong way, but, I can't wait for you to leave!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How else is she supposed to take that but the wrong way?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I mean, because I've never had a pen pal before!  I'm gonna write so many letters and, just to get the ball rolling, here.  Spoiler alert: Pabu and I already miss you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks. That's sweet.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you sure you don't want some company in the Southern Water Tribe? I'm happy to come with you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... I appreciate it, but I'll only be gone a couple of weeks.  A little time alone will be good for me.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Now, I don't want you to worry about a thing while you're gone. Your recovery should be your number one concern.  Jinora, the airbenders, and I have everything under control.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Bye, Korra!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get better soon!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Don't forget to write!

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Can't sleep again?  Honey, your father and I have tried to give you as much space as you've needed, but we're worried.  You're not sleeping, you're barely eating. We don't want to push you, but it's been three weeks .  Will you please go see Katara?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right ... I'll go.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: You're going to get through this.  I love you so much.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: The poison did a lot of internal damage.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Can you fix it?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I can help guide your healing process,  but whether you get better or not,  is up to you.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I know what it's like to go through a traumatic experience.  And I promise you, if you dedicate yourself to getting better, you'll recover,  stronger than ever.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's what I want.  More than anything!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Then try something for me. Concentrate  on your big toe.  Visualize it moving.  Breathe.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Did you see that?  It worked!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: The mind can be a powerful ally,  or your greatest enemy.  Now, I want you to try  taking a step.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: You're okay.  Your body thinks it is still in danger, but you're safe here.  Use your mind to overcome the pain. Try again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm done for today.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dear Korra. I miss you. It's not the same in Republic City without you. How are you feeling?  Things are going well here. I just got a big contract to help redesign the city's infrastructure, so I'll be keeping pretty busy for a while.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey, Korra! Sooo, I'm not very good at writing letters. It's 2:15 in the afternoon. Weather is fair. Chance of snow showers later today. But enough joking around.  I hope you're dong well. Me? I'm back on the beat. Beifong has me staking out the Red Monsoon hideout. You won't believe what's going down.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: My dearest Avatar Korra. Though several fortnights have passed since your departure to convalesce in the homeland of your tribesmen, I feel our friendship knows neither time ... nor distance.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You will be most pleased to learn that I found gainful employment with Sir Varrick and the Lady Kuvira. I set off on the morrow with some trepidation,  but I am eager to offer any aid I can in stabilizing the Earth Kingdom!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Whenever you're ready.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What's the point? We've been at this for almost six months and I can still barely take a couple of steps without collapsing!

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I know you're frustrated, but—

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Of course I'm frustrated! A crazy man poisoned me and now I can't dress myself, or cook for myself, o-or do anything for myself! And this whole time, my friends have been off helping the world while I'm stuck with you and you can't even heal me !

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That came out wrong.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: It's ... all right.  Let your anger and frustration flow like water.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am trying to understand why this happened to me,  but nothing makes any sense!  I'm tired, Katara. I'm so tired.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Korra, I know you feel alone right now. But you're not the first Avatar who's had to overcome great suffering.  Can you imagine how much pain Aang felt when he learned that his entire culture was taken from him?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That ... must have been so awful.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: But he never let it destroy his spirit.  He chose to find meaning in his suffering and eventually ... found peace.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And ... what am I going to find if I ... get through this?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: I don't know.  But won't it be interesting to find out?

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Close your eyes. Visualize yourself walking over to Naga.  Can you see it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Katara
transcript.text: Now ...  take that first step.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where'd you come from, little cutie?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You can see her, too?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If you can see her too,  maybe I'm not going crazy.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How'd you do that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You want me to follow you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right. Let's see what I find.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's so good to see you!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: How have you been, Korra? You look great!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I feel great!  Come on, I want to show you how much better I'm doing.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Attack! I can take it!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: All right! The sparring match is over!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought I was ready.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: There is no shame in taking the time you need to make a full recovery.  Being the Avatar can wait.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But what about the Earth Kingdom? I hear it's still a mess out there.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The situation has been stabilizing since Kuvira took charge.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But that should be me out there fixing things, not her .

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I know you want to help. But trust me, everyone has this under control. I just think you need to ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If you say, "be patient", I swear I'm gonna water-smack you in the mouth!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Nooo ... I was going to say, you need to ... not worry about the future. Be grateful for where you are now and the progress you've made.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Dear Asami, I'm sorry I haven't written to you sooner, but every time I've tried, I never know what to say.  The past two years have been the hardest of my life. Even though I can get around fine now, I still can't go into the Avatar State. I keep having visions of Zaheer and what happened that day.  Katara thinks a lot of this is in my head, so I've been meditating a lot, but sometimes I worry I'll never fully recover.  Please don't tell Mako and Bolin I wrote to you and not them. I don't want to hurt their feelings, but it's easier to tell you about this stuff.  I don't think they'd understand.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Everything all right, sweetie?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's something I need to tell you both.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: What is it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I want to go back to Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Senna
transcript.text: Are you sure?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know I'm not a hundred percent yet, but I feel like I've hit a wall. I need to be where the action is,  where my friends are.

transcript.speaker: Tonraq
transcript.text: I'll have the White Lotus prepare a boat and they can take you back to Republic City as soon as you're ready.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I want to go alone and have some time to clear my head. It'll be good for me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Two lobster crabs, please.

transcript.speaker: Fishmonger
transcript.text: Why, you're the Avatar, ain'tcha?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yup, that's me.

transcript.speaker: Fishmonger
transcript.text: I can't believe it! Mind if I took a picture for my "Wall of Avatars"?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, uhm, I'm kind of in a hurry.

transcript.speaker: Fishmonger
transcript.text: I-it'll only take a second!  Avatar Aang was a big fan of my seaweed wraps, you know, so,  I named 'em "Aang Rolls"!  Now they're my biggest seller! And they ain't even got fish in 'em!  Now, smile!

transcript.speaker: Fishmonger
transcript.text: But if I coulda met any Avatar,  I'd have to pick Kyoshi. Taking down a shark squid with one hand! Now that's a lady I'd like to get to know!

transcript.speaker: Vendor
transcript.text: Thieves! Get back here!

transcript.speaker: Fishmonger
transcript.text: Oh, don't worry, the Avatar's right here!  Well, what are you waiting for?  Go get 'em!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hand over the bags or else.

transcript.speaker: Vendor
transcript.text: You sure she's the Avatar?

transcript.speaker: Light spirit
transcript.text: Everyone, come here! It's the Avatar!

transcript.speaker: Skeptical spirit
transcript.text: You sure? I don't sense any Raava energy around her. Besides, she's not dressed like the Avatar. And, doesn't the Avatar have ponytails?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Do you mind? I'm trying to concentrate here. And yes , I am the Avatar. I'm just wearing different clothes and I cut my hair.

transcript.speaker: Light spirit
transcript.text: See? I told you guys it was her!  How come you've been away so long?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I was hurt pretty bad a while ago and lost touch with my Avatar Spirit.

transcript.speaker: Skeptical spirit
transcript.text: No wonder I couldn't feel Raava's energy.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I came to the Tree of Time hoping to reconnect with Raava and turn on the Avatar State again. But it's not working.  The last time I was here, I saw all sorts of visions.  Now I don't see anything.

transcript.speaker: Light spirit
transcript.text: Maybe we can help you get better.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry, but for years, people have been saying they can help me get better.  Nothing's worked.  I need to figure this out on my own.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Dear Mom and Dad,  I arrived in Republic City a couple weeks ago and couldn't be happier. It's nice to be back at the temple and it's great to see my friends again.  Don't worry, I'm taking it easy, but hopefully I'll be back in action soon. I miss you both very much. Please, give Naga a big hug for me. Love, Korra.  Raava?  Raava!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am ending this.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Excuse me. Who do I talk to about getting in the ring?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is that all you got?

transcript.speaker: Ring announcer
transcript.text: We have a winner!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why did you bring me to the swamp?  Wait, I met you at the Tree of Time.  You should have told me who you were.

transcript.speaker: Light spirit
transcript.text: If I did, would you have followed me?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I get your point. But why did you bring me here? What am I gonna find in the swamp?

transcript.speaker: Light spirit
transcript.text: Not a what , a who .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, wait!  Come back!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're just in my mind. You're not real.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Help !

transcript.speaker: Unknown woman
transcript.text: Feeling better?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where am I? Wha-what happened?

transcript.speaker: Unknown woman
transcript.text: I was hoping you could tell me. I found you passed out in the mud.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How'd you know I was out there?

transcript.speaker: Unknown woman
transcript.text: I'm pretty tapped into the goings-on around here. What brings you to the swamp, anyway?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: A spirit led me here and told me I was supposed to find someone. Is that you?

transcript.speaker: Unknown woman
transcript.text: Beats me. But if your Avatar senses called you here, you should probably listen to them.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait, you recognize me?

transcript.speaker: Unknown woman
transcript.text: In a manner of speaking. We were good friends in your previous life.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't believe it ... Toph?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Nice to see you again, Twinkle Toes.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: So much has changed these past three years! Mako is a bodyguard for the future Earth King, Prince Wu, while Bolin works for Kuvira, the Earth Kingdom's interim leader, who has brought stability to a nation plagued by chaos. Meanwhile, after wandering the world trying to heal herself, a spirit led Korra to the swamp, where she met Toph Beifong. Will this earthbending master be the key to Korra regaining her Avatar mojo?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: So then the crowds are gathered, all excited to see my coronation, when all of a sudden, these boulders come rolling through. And guess what pops out of 'em? Earthbender dames! These gals start banging the boulders like drums, and sing the song of my royal lineage.  It's the most dynamite six-hour show you'll ever see in your life.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Shouldn't you be getting ready to,  I don't know ... rule a whole nation?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Now, now, now, don't get yourself in a tizzy .  I'll have ministers for all that!  No, sir, Mako, when we get to Ba Sing Se, it'll just be two kooky pals, living the life!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yay ...

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Getting excited for your big day?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Does a platypus-bear poop in‒ Hey!  You can't put bleachers there! There won't be enough room for the Dance of the Badgermoles! Look, it's going to go like this.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You sure that's the guy you want running the Earth Kingdom?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Trust me. We'll be sending a delegation of experienced advisers to handle day-to-day governing.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I see the prince is becoming accustomed to the burdens of leadership.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: You know royals. They love a ceremony. Have you received any word on the Avatar's location?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Not yet, but I have airbenders all over the world on the lookout for her.  I hope they find her soon. I'm concerned about reports I've heard regarding Kuvira's growing military. They say she's throwing some of her dissenters into prison camps.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Well, she'll be stepping down tomorrow. We can worry about correcting any of her mistakes after that.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And you're not worried about her handing power over to Prince Wu?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: When Kuvira started cleaning up the Earth Kingdom, she knew her position wasn't permanent. She gave me her word that she'd step down.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Still, I'd feel a lot better if Korra were here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You got to help me get back into Avatar fighting shape.  I'm getting my butt kicked by losers all over the Earth Kingdom. The world needs me.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Get over yourself! The world doesn't need you one bit.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But, while I've been the Avatar, I've stopped some really bad people from doing some really bad things.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Listen, when I was Chief of Police in Republic City, I worked my butt off busting criminals. But did that make crime disappear? Nope. If there's one thing I learned on the beat, it's that the names change, but the street stays the same.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, basically, you're saying that everything I've ever accomplished has been pointless.  And I thought Beifong was grumpy.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I'm the original Beifong!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So ... you're not going to train me?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Well, I was planning on soaking my feet in mud for a few weeks.  But I can't stand you being so pathetic and getting your butt kicked all the time. All right, I guess I can help.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Na-uh-uh-uh. You want to hug something,  go hug a tree.  We're here to work!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hello Republic Cit-ay! Bolin ... is back!  And ... Eska is also here.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: I see you have replaced me with a new girlfriend.  Well done, she seems very threatening.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh no no, that's Kuvira, she's kind of my boss.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: Boss, girlfriend. Same thing.

transcript.speaker: Cam
transcript.text: I'm afraid there's been a mistake, Your Eminence. We have you and your brother booked in the same room, with only one bed.

transcript.speaker: Eska
transcript.text: It's no mistake. Desna sleeps in the tub.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Never thought I'd be allowed back in the Republic City Four Elements.  Raiko must have turned purple when Kuvira made him pardon me of my alleged crimes.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: You're an upstanding citizen again, sir.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Upstanding is right!  And don't forget to fill the extra bag with as many of those little soaps as you can grab.  Love the lavender scent.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin!  Look at you! My little brother got all ... important .

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I know, right? I see myself in the mirror sometimes and I think I'm in trouble before I realize: it's only me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So, what's it like working for Kuvira?  From what I've heard, she's pretty harsh.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No! I—I mean, she can be tough, sure, but we're turning around the Earth Kingdom like you wouldn't believe ! You remember how bad Grandma's neighborhood in Ba Sing Se was? All that's completely changed, I mean, we are really ... helping people. But what have you been up to? Fighting crime?  Busting triads? Chasing the ladies,  Mako-style ?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, I've been working for Wu.  And, uhhh ...  Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, have you seen Korra yet?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No. She was supposed to come in with Tonraq, but he said she left the South Pole months ago. No one knows where she is.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Mother.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Hello, Baatar Jr.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: It's just "Baatar" now. So, now that you've seen all the good we've done since we left Zaofu, you must be sorry that you didn't come and help us.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I don't know if I'd call marching all over the Earth Kingdom, forcing people to bow to Kuvira, "doing good".

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You're going to have to get over your grudge with her. I'm sure you've heard that we're engaged. She's going to be an official member of our family.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I'm just glad she'll be stepping down after tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You prefer to be ruled by  that royal idiot?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I hope I'm not out of order saying this: You're pretty easy on the eyes for a military type.  I'll put in a good word for you with the hotel staff, maybe get you a little upgrade. I've been living here for years, they love me.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I won't be needing your help. We've reserved the presidential suite.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Well, I think someone is pulling your chain, gumdrop! See, I'm in the presidential suite.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Not anymore. I had you moved out.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Wait, what?  Cam, where's all my stuff?

transcript.speaker: Cam
transcript.text: We've moved you into a very nice junior suite on the seventh floor.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Junior suite?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Something you should know about me: I always get what I want.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Your royal cabinet is here, your majesty!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Where have you been? My coronation is in ten minutes!  Where's everyone else? Where are the Seven Sacred Chests of Exquisite Finery? Where are my grandfather's taffeta pantaloons?

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Sadly, most of your servants were scattered and the royal things were looted after the queen was  removed from office. So your coronation may not have some of the usual items ... like ... the crown.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: There's no crown?! How can you have a coronation without a crown?  How will people know when I'm officially the king?

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: We still have one of the royal jewels we can pin on you.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: An earring?

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Think of it more as a royal brooch.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Are you telling me that there are no dancing badgermoles? No acrobat bell ringers, no horn blowing announcery guy?

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: It will be a very simple, intimate, elegant ceremony. A wonderful day for your kingdom. Just try on the brooch, Your Grace, you will see it looks beautiful ...

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Don't ... touch me .

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Okay, bring it!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Tell me what you did wrong.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I was thinking that you were ...

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Exactly! You were thinking!  Go again.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Pathetic. Of all the Avatar's I've worked with, you're by far the worst. I know that's only one other Avatar,  but still.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Gah! Hey! It seems like you're enjoying having someone around to beat up an awful lot.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Yeah, the swampbenders out here really can't take a punch.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So ... what made you want to drop out and disconnect from the rest of the world?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I'm more connected to the world than you've ever been! The roots and vines ... they run all over the world. I can see Su and Lin, Zaofu and Republic City. I see everything.  You're blind compared to me.

transcript.speaker: Gun
transcript.text: Now rise, Wu of the Hou-Ting Dynasty, King of all the Earth Lands and glorious defender of Ba Sing Se. Long may you reign!

transcript.speaker: Spectator #1
transcript.text: Go Wu! Woohoo ...

transcript.speaker: Spectator #2
transcript.text: Woohoo ...

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Thank you, for that incredibly brief, but very moving ceremony. I am touched by the love of my devoted countrymen, who have worked so hard to restore their beloved leader to the throne. One of them deserves special attention.  Kuvira, rise!  For your service to the realm, I would like to present you with the Kyoshi Medal of Freedom, our nation's highest honor, which was somehow not stolen, unlike the royal pinky rings.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Thank you. And if you don't mind, I would like to say a few words.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Why not?  We've got six hours to fill ...

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Growing up in Zaofu, with Suyin Beifong,  I learned that the idea of a royal family passing a title from one generation to the next was archaic, and that technology and innovation should be what drives a nation forward. It was the pathetic rule of kings and queens that caused the Earth Kingdom to descend into such incredible disarray. It's taken me three years to get it back on track, and there is no way I will allow it to slip back into the dark ages.  I'd like to make an announcement to the world: the Earth Kingdom is no more. And from here on out,  this man has no authority.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Wait, what? But I just got the royal brooch!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I have created a new Earth Empire , and I will continue to lead it into the future myself, bringing about a new era of prosperity for my people.

transcript.speaker: Crowd
transcript.text: We love you, Kuvira!  All hail the Great Uniter!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: And let me assure my fellow leaders of one thing:  Anyone who crosses our borders or stands in our way, will be crushed.

transcript.speaker: Crowd
transcript.text: Thank you, Kuvira! All hail the Great Uniter!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Worst coronation ever.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Were you surprised? Because I was really surprised. Won't this turn all the world leaders against us?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Relax, kid, what can they do? Kuvira controls the whole nation now, and Republic City is begging for the metal that we're mining. This train has left the station, and we own the track!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Now that's a nice looking hunk of spirit vine! Let's take it back to the lab and get it stabilized immediately.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You look worried, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah, well, I just have some misgivings about how you kind of ambushed Tenzin and the other leaders.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You believe in the work that we've done for the people of the Earth Empire, right, Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I do, but ...

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Then stick with me. I'm going to need your help now more than ever. Raiko and the other leaders want to bully us into accepting some idiot king who will serve them but neglect the people. We have to stand strong against them.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm just not sure about this whole "Empire" thing. It seems pretty aggressive. And what was that part about the crushing?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: That was just some ... tough rhetoric to let people know that we mean business. Believe me,  conflict is the last thing I want. Will you help me make history, Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'll stand by you.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: We need to talk.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Can you give us the room, please?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I met with the world leaders, and I've come as their representative.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: So now you're taking an interest in world affairs. A little late, isn't it? When the queen fell, and everyone was asking you to help keep the Earth Kingdom from falling apart, all you wanted to do was hide in Zaofu, and let others deal with the consequences.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: That's hardly fair. I didn't want to seize power for myself, which is what you've done. I'm telling you for the good of everyone, you have to step down.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I stepped up . I provide stability and equality. Tell your world leaders to stay out of Earth Empire business. We won't accept their hand-picked dictator.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: What makes you so different? You're just another tyrant. And don't pretend the people put you where you are. I know what happens to cities who don't want to hand over control to you.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Then you know what's coming for Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: First I lose my suite, then I lose my throne. My royal brooch is a lie!  I know you must be crushed, not getting to come back to Ba Sing Se with me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Don't worry about me. I'll ... find a way to make it.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Good ol' Mako, my big tough guy.  Okay. I just have to go on, move forward, take decisive action.  Let's go shopping!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Ugh. Get rid of him. He's with her .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He's my brother.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Interesting ceremony, huh?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You aren't going to keep working for Kuvira now that she's going against the wishes of the entire world, are you?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You don't understand. Kuvira is helping out all the poor people of the Earth Empire. People like our family. This is for the best.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't know, bro.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, why don't you come with me, and you'll see for yourself? We've done a lot of good, and Varrick is working on some new innovations. We're making history .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: By "crushing" anyone who gets in your way?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That was just some tough rhetoric to let the people know that we mean business. I mean, Kuvira is basically just like Korra.  She might seem hard to deal with, but just because she's so passionate and believes in what she's doing.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It seems like she's just a dictator who's taking the Earth Kingdom by force.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, okay, you think your new best friend in there  would be a better leader than Kuvira?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, no, but still ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Still what? Come on, Mako! I'm making a difference out there, what are you doing, huh? You're just some glorified butler for some snotty rich bozo!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm sorry, I don't want to work for your glorious emperor and her military dictatorship.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Fine ! I'm going to go back to my awesome train, where we bring freedom where ever we go! Enjoy licking the king's boots in your junior suite!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Sorry, sport, I heard it all.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I can't believe him!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I know! Insulting another man's suite? It's beneath low. But I think I know what would cheer you up: a visit to Little Ba Sing Se Fashion Mall! I'll buy you a smoothie.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah. Okay.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That was terrible.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Hah! Maybe for you. I had a great time! I never realized how much I missed tormenting the Avatar  I wish you were putting up more of a fight, but it was still fun.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You were tossing me around like a ragdoll all day long.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I know! And I'm an old lady! Imagine me in my prime!  I would have destroyed you!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I just don't understand why I can't get back to my former self. It's like ... I'm a step slower. I'm tentative, I'm out of sync, I just can't get back in the groove.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Probably carrying around that metal doesn't help.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What metal?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: The little bits of metal poison stuck in your body. Are you trying to tell me you can't feel metal in your own body? You really are the worst Avatar ever.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought Su got it all out.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Oh, my girls never really picked up metalbending all that well, if you ask me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's been my problem this entire time! I gotta get it out! You can get it out for me, right?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Who do you think you're talking to?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Once we're done with these, we can go into the Middle Ring and I'll let you pick out some new suits, then we'll hit the boutiques in the Upper Ring for me.  Where did you get those shirts?

transcript.speaker: Girl #1
transcript.text: Aces, right? Kuvira is my hero.

transcript.speaker: Girl #2
transcript.text: They're selling them over there.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You can't sell that junk in here! This is the Little Ba Sing Se Fashion Mall, and I'm the Little King here! Respect the brooch!

transcript.speaker: Crowd
transcript.text: Stop it, Little King!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I am the Glorious Defender!

transcript.speaker: Crowd
transcript.text: I'm covered in juice! Get him!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need to get you out of here.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: It's destiny. Look where we are, Mako! The Royal Palace.

transcript.speaker: Little Boy
transcript.text: Hey! It's my birthday!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: It's my coronation day! You'll have another birthday next year, but I'll never have this day back again! Never !

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okay, you're losing it.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: This is the worst day of my life !

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Why? Do you really want to be the king? I mean, Kuvira might be a power-crazed dictator, but at least she spent the last few years working hard to make the Earth Kingdom somewhat better. If you were an Earth Kingdom citizen, do you think you're the kind of person you want as your king? What have you ever done for your people?  I'm sorry, that was out of line.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: No, you're right. No one ever talked to me like that before. I guess I'm just a joke who got what he deserved.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's get you out of here and back to someplace safe.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Carry me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Okay, if you want me to bend out this metal, you need to relax.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am relaxed.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Seriously? Your body is like a twisted tree-trunk!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Just do it! I'm ready.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: It wouldn't hurt if you would just relax! Stop fighting me!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not fighting!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: All right, that's it. You're going to have to do this yourself. Clearly, you want to keep the metal in there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What do you mean? Why would I want poison inside me?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I don't know! Maybe so you have an excuse not to go back to being the Avatar. If you don't get better, you can't do your job, so you don't have to worry about getting hurt again!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wha‒ That's ridiculous!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Whatever. When you want it out, you can bend it out. I can't deal with all your issues for you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait! What am I supposed to do now?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: How should I know? Ask the spirit that brought you here. The good news is, if you're looking for a place to hang where no one will bother you, you picked the best swamp in the world!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: This ... is a mission of the utmost importance. Conflict is coming to the Earth Kingdom and we need to find the Avatar.  Can I count on you three to bring Korra home?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: You can count on one of us. I don't know about these two ladies.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: From now on, developing this technology is your number one priority.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: This is going to change everything!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After Korra failed to return to Republic City, everyone has been worried about her fate. So Tenzin tasked Jinora, Ikki and Meelo with finding the Avatar. Unbeknownst to the kids, Korra found refuge in the swamp with Toph, who discovered there was still metal poison in her body, but when Toph tried removing it, Korra resisted. Will the airbender kids find the Avatar and help her return to action?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Tenzin, are you sure you can't go with them?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Raiko asked me to stay here and help figure out a diplomatic solution to this Kuvira problem.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Mom, we'll be fine. Grandpa Aang and his friends were around our age when they traveled the world.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Well, at least I don't have to worry about you starving out there.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Mom, we're going to be out in the wild, living off the land! We don't need your food!

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: But I made your favorite treat ...

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Sweet buns with happy faces on them?  Well, I guess we're not officially on the road yet.  Aww, this one is smudged.  I can't eat this.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: You know, sometimes things get smudged in the wild.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: We're you able to get a read on Korra yet?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: No, but once we're further out, I'll be able to hone in on her spiritual energy. We should be able to find her within a few days.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Good luck! And be careful! Remember, Jinora's in charge!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I answer to no man. Or girl, even if she does have tattoos.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Meelo ...

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Now let's move out, soldiers!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ugh ... Pepper, yip-yip!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Finally! I've been holding my pee for an hour!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: If you get through to Korra, tell her I said hi.  You feel anything yet?  What's taking so long?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Ikki, I can't concentrate if you keep talking.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Why don't you go play with some of those spirits?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Jinora's spirity powers are broken, and she doesn't know where Korra is.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: My powers are not broken. I just need more than two seconds and some quiet.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: While you try to pull yourself together, Poki and I are gonna go into town and find out if anyone has seen Korra.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Sounds like a good plan to me!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Enough chit-chat, you can hold the picture of Korra I drew.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Wow, I didn't know you could draw!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: You don't know a lot of things about me, sister.  Let's roll!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Have you seen this woman?

transcript.speaker: Old lady
transcript.text: Well, aren't you an adorable little thing.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I'm not adorable! I'm dangerous .

transcript.speaker: Old lady
transcript.text: Dangerously cute with those cheeks.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Aww.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: This. Never. Happened. Let's split.

transcript.speaker: Man #1
transcript.text: The Avatar? We still have one of those? Haven't seen her, kid. Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Man ...

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Can I trust you?

transcript.speaker: Tuyen
transcript.text: I guess so.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I'm on a top secret mission to find the Avatar.  Have you seen her?

transcript.speaker: Tuyen
transcript.text: I haven't, sorry. Top secret mission, huh?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yeah, it's been pretty dangerous. I've seen some things.

transcript.speaker: Tuyen
transcript.text: Really? What kind of things?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Craaazy things.

transcript.speaker: Tuyen
transcript.text: Cool.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I'm Meelo. What should I call you, other than "beautiful"?

transcript.speaker: Tuyen
transcript.text: I'm Tuyen. Nice to meet you.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Ooh!  Meelo's got a girlfriend!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Go away, Ikki!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Jinora's been looking for you. We're moving on.

transcript.speaker: Tuyen
transcript.text: Looks like you got to get back to your mission.  Good luck.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Thanks a lot, Ikki. You drove away the love of my life .

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Jinora! Ikki! It's Korra!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Where?! Where?! Where?!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: It's just a photo of Korra.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: At least it's something.

transcript.speaker: Fishmonger
transcript.text: Pretty neat, huh? She came by here, about uh, six months ago.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Looks like someone just strummed up a good-old-fashioned lead.  Then where did she go?

transcript.speaker: Fish monger
transcript.text: Oh, I don't know. But she wasn't looking too good.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Ikki, this is all your fault.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: What? I didn't do anything.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Exactly!  You need to start pulling your weight!  That goes for you too, so-called leader!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Remember when he used to be so nice and sweet?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So ... what's the plan for today?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: You're looking at it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We didn't do anything yesterday, or the day before that.  I know! Tell me the story of how you taught Aang how to earthbend.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: What's there to tell? I threw some rocks at the Avatar, he got all whiny and Sokka fell in a hole.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought there'd be more to it than that.  What about the time you took down the Fire Lord? That must have been epic !

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Oh yeah. It was hot. I was on a blimp. And I think a giant turtle showed up. Wow . What a day.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, you're terrible at telling stories.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: You're terrible at listening to them!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Quit making all that racket! If you're so anxious to do something, why don't you collect some mushrooms for dinner?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You got it.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Take the path until you see the boulder with the hole in it. Then go to your left. Oh, and make sure you get the big, slimy ones!  They're the tastiest!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Hey, where's all the food Mom gave us?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I threw it in the river.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: You did what ?! That food was supposed to last us two weeks !

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Hey, keep it down! I'm trying to meditate.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yeah, keep it down, Ikki.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Meelo threw away all our food!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: From now on, we hunt for our meals.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Meelo, we're vegetarians. We don't hunt!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Enough whining. Poki and I will go find some grub.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: My name is Meelo. I like to throw away food and fart at inappropriate moments.  I'm Jinora. I'm above it all because I'm meditating all the time.  Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't see you there.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Wait! You dropped your breakfast!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Hey!  Does this mean we're friends?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: You're trespassing! Hold it right there.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: All right, little airbender. Tell us what you're doing in the Earth Empire. Are you spying?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: No! I swear I'm not a spy. I've been traveling with my brother and sister. It's our first big mission and my dad, Tenzin, is counting on us. But if we don't find the Avatar, he's gonna be really disappointed.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Can I talk to you for a second?  This girl is Tenzin's kid and she's looking for the Avatar.  Do you know what that means?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: No, but try this macaroon!

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Get that out of my face! Look, if we capture these three airbender kids and bring them to Kuvira,  I bet we get a big-time promotion.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: You mean we get out of this dump?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Sorry, little lady, it looks like we got off on the wrong foot. So, you're out here with your brother and sister, where's your campsite?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Why do you want to know?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: We just want to get the family back together again. Maybe we can sit everybody down and have a nice plate of macaroons.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Where did you get those?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: I found a whole sack of food down by the river! And with each delicious snack, comes a lovely hand-written note.  This one says: "You're my handsome little man." That is so touching!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: My mom wrote those notes! That's our sack of food!

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Enough with the cute notes! Where are your brother and sister?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Who cares ... I don't want to see them . I'd rather hang out here with you guys. Hit me with one of those macaroons.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Are you okay?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yep, totally fine!  I hope you're hungry, because we found some ...  We found some berries!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Looks like you got some bad berries.  So much for living off the land.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: They're fine, I just ate too many of them because they're so ... so delicious.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Did you run into Ikki while you were picking your poisonous berries?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: No, what? Did she run off or something?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I think so.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Great. Now I've got to go find the Avatar and her. This mission is getting worse by the day.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: This isn't only your mission, Meelo. I thought we were doing this as a family.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: It seems pretty lonely out here. Where's everybody else?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: I ... don't want to talk about it.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: He's just upset because Kuvira's taking all the troops to Zaofu and we had to stay here.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Well it's the last city left and then the whole empire will be united! And you know there's gonna be a huge party afterwards.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: It's tough to be left out, huh? I know exactly what you're going through.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: You do?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Yeah. My brother and sister are always leaving me out of fun stuff. I mean, we're supposed to be looking for the Avatar together , but they won't even let me help.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: Well, that's not fair. Maybe we can help you out!  So, where have you looked for her?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: We've been traveling down the west coast, and the only lead we have is some guy who said he saw her six months ago.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Well, we have troops ... pretty much everywhere. If anyone saw her, they would have reported it.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: What about this place?

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #1
transcript.text: Well, that's the swamp. No one goes there.

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: Don't get discouraged, Ikki. You're a valuable member of the team, and you have a big heart! I know you're going to find her. Now let's get you out of those ropes.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: You're welcome, Ikki.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Why did you do that?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: We're saving you. Let's go.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I had everything under control. I just found our food, and I have an idea where Korra is.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You do? Then lets get going!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Hold on.  Sorry my brother and sister knocked you out. Nice chatting with you!

transcript.speaker: Outpost soldier #2
transcript.text: Ugh ... Macaroon ...

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: There you are. You got my dinner yet?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... this swamp ... it did crazy things to my mind. I had visions, of all the times my enemies hurt me.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Yeah, I figured something like that might happen.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What ? You wanted me to see those visions? You are one twisted old lady, you know that?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Look, I know you want to get better. And so does the swamp! It can sense you're out of balance. It will teach you what you need to learn, if you're open to listening.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, swamp. I'm all ears.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: You said you saw your past enemies. Now, why do you think that is?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know. Because they made me and a lot of other people suffer.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Sounds like you're carrying around your former enemies, the same way you're still carrying around that metal poison. You maybe consider you could learn something from them?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sounds like the swamp is messing with your mind too.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: My mind is just fine, thank you. Listen,  what did Amon want? Equality for all. Unalaq? He brought back the spirits. And Zaheer believed in freedom.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I guess ...

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: The problem was, those guys were totally out of balance and they took their ideologies too far.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Okay, fine. But that doesn't explain why they keep haunting me.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Because you need to face your fears. You can't expect to deal with future enemies if you're still fighting the old ones.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe you're right, but how am I supposed to move on?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Boy, you Avatars sure need a lot of hand-holding. Get up! We're going to the banyan-grove tree.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Those soldiers said there weren't any troops here and, I figure, if Korra's not feeling good, she might come to a spiritual place like this to get better.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: There is an enormous amount of spiritual activity here, but I don't feel Korra.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Well, that's what we get for listening to Ikki .

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Guys! We just got here. Let's at least look around.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'm sorry, Ikki, but I'm with Meelo on this. I don't think we're going to find her here. Let's go Pepper!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Why did those stupid vines pull us in here anyway?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Because they want us here. I'm telling you, Korra has got to be close.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I don't know, Ikki, I still don't sense Korra.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Well, you haven't sensed her the entire time we've been looking for her!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Next time I go on a mission, it's going to be boys only. Just Poki and me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's beautiful.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: The roots of the banyan-grove tree spread out for miles in every direction, connecting this whole swamp. Your problem is, you've been disconnected for too long. Disconnected from the people who love you and disconnected from yourself.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I'm tired of listening to you!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra! I know where Korra is!

transcript.speaker: Meelo and Ikki
transcript.text: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't believe it! I saw Jinora, Ikki and Meelo, they're here!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Good. Hopefully they're here to take you home.

transcript.speaker: Jinora, Ikki, and Meelo
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: We missed you so much, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I missed you so much, too. How did you find me all the way out here?

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Jinora sensed your energy.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: But we never would have been here if it weren't for Ikki.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I never would have stormed off and run into those soldiers if it weren't for Meelo.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I was trying to toughen up these ladies, but I guess it was a team effort.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: I love your hair.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: It's so you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm so sorry. This is Meelo, Jinora, and Ikki. Aang and Katara's grandchildren.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Your grandpa was a real pain in my butt.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Wait a minute. Cranky? Old? Blind? You must be Toph !

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Oh, I like this one.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You need to come home, Korra. Kuvira is taking over the Earth Kingdom.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: You have to stop her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know ... I'm not the Avatar I used to be. I can't even go into the Avatar State.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Please, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: The world needs you back.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: All right. I'm ready.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I'm not bending it out of you. You've got to do this on your own.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Close your eyes. Clear your mind. And don't freak out, like last time! Now, focus your energy. Find the metal. Let it move through you body.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: That fight is over. Release the fear.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Well done, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: The Avatar is back in business!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I feel so much lighter. Thank you so much for helping me. I'd like to give you a hug now, if that's okay with you.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: All right, you earned it.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Finally, some peace and quiet.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After three years, Kuvira has finally united the former Earth Kingdom states under her new Earth Empire banner! But one holdout remains: Zaofu. During that same time, Asami rebuilt the company her father created and helped redesign the city's infrastructure. And, most recently, the airbender kids found the Avatar! Korra rid herself of the residual poison in her body and is ready to return to action!

transcript.speaker: Guard
transcript.text: We have an emergency!

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: I'll contact President Raiko. He'll send the United Forces.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Call whomever you want, but they'll never make it in time.  Kuvira's already here and she brought her entire army.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: By this time tomorrow, my mother will have signed the treaty, and the Earth Empire will finally be united.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. Securing your hometown won't be like every other city.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Zaofu stopped being my home long ago. I'm ready to take it by force.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: No . The eyes of the world are on us now. We must do this right . That's why we need Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Do you really think we can rely on him?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Su trusts him. She'll listen to him.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Are you sure we should be going to Zaofu? Dad wanted us to bring you back to Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If Kuvira's heading to Zaofu, so am I. She needs to know that the Avatar is back.  The world needs to know.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Woo-hoo! Avatar fight! This is going to be awesome!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Meelo, there's not gonna be a fight. Kuvira saved my dad. She was a captain in Su's guard; I think she can be reasoned with.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: What? No fight? Why did we go through all that trouble to save you if you're not going to beat someone up?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Zhu Li! Is this thing on?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: We're rolling, sir.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Okay. I'm Varrick, of Varrick Industries, International--  --and this is Spirit Vine Experiment 3-02. Hand me the thing!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: In this stasis capsule is a preserved spirit vine sample weighing approximately two "Zhu Lis".

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I have postulated that these spirit vines are a form of pure energy that's unstable in what we call--  --"typical earth conditions".  This machine should transfer the energy from the vine into a battery using electrical currents, reverse magnetic polarity, and a little-known phenomenon I like to call--  -- the Varri-Effect !

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It's working! It's registering five "Varricks" of power.  Now seven Varricks!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Whoa! What is this? What's going on?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Zhu Li! Shut it down! There are too many Varricks!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Sir!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You're too heavy! You know, you could stand to lose a few Zhu Lis!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I think you're just weak, sir! Pull harder!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Varrick ... you saved me.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Of course I saved you.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I can't clean this place up by myself!  Grab a broom!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What happened? Were we attacked?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: No! We were spirit-vined! But don't worry! I'm putting the kibosh on this project.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: No, you're not . Do you realize what we could do with this kind of power?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes! I do! And that's why we gotta put an end to it! What if it fell into the wrong hands?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Since when does that matter to you?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I know, it's not like me, right? Usually I look at a project like this and think, "Wow! I could make a ton of money off this!" But recently, I've been having these strange feelings ... inside.  It's like I'm ... concerned with others. And there's this nagging voice in my head constantly telling me what's right from wrong!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I believe that voice is your conscience, sir.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Well, I'm the other voice in your head, and I'm telling you you will continue with this project.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Sorry, no. I just really gotta stand my ground on this one-- Whoa!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: And now there's a voice in my head telling me to drop you on the tracks.  Should I listen?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: No! No! Head voices are liars, what do head voices know? I'll work on the project! Please don't drop me!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Asami, you came.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I came to return these.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: You never opened them.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Stop writing me. I never want to see or hear from you again.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Please , just let me say one thing, then I'll never contact you again.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: I can't forgive myself for all the horrible things I've done. And I never expect you to forgive me. I tore our family apart, and destroyed our good name.  But in a life of regret, you're the one thing I look back on that makes me smile.  I just want you to know I'm so proud of you, Asami. You are the greatest thing I ever created.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Am ... I in trouble?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: No. In fact, I have good news. We want you to be a part of our inner circle.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Inner circle? No way! Yes!  That is a great honor. What does it mean, exactly?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: It means you've proven your worth. We're so close to uniting the Empire, but Su has some resentment towards me and Baatar that might cloud her judgment and stop her from making a wise decision. We believe you can help her see clearly.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I can do that! By the time I'm finished telling her all the great things we've done, she'll be begging to join!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Good. Because we're here.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Aren't all these troops gonna send the wrong message?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: The army is here to project strength. You're here to present peace.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal! You're here, too!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: No! You've chosen your side.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Sides? There shouldn't be sides!  I know, why don't we all stand in a circle, huh? Maybe hold hands?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I'm not giving up Zaofu. I don't care if you brought your entire army.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Su, I didn't bring my army to threaten you. I wanted to show you all that your son and I have accomplished.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You must realize what you're doing goes against everything your father and I tried to teach you.

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: Son, you belong here.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Why? So that I could go on living in your shadow?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Don't say that! Can't you see she's brainwashed you!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Ha! I didn't brainwash him! I set him free! And now he's accomplished more with me than he ever could with you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, guys, obviously, there's a lot of personal, painful history here, so what do you say we just all forget about that stuff, huh? I mean, that's the past!  Right Wing? Right Wei? You guys know what I'm talkin' 'bout, right? High five!  All right. No, that's cool.  You know what I think we need to do? Focus on the future! And the future is bright, let me tell you!  I've seen it! Yeah!  Saw it last month! We went to this town that had nothing. Most of the people there had never seen a Satomobile before. Now, they have two Satomobiles, running water, and a magnet train that goes right through their town! I mean, how awesome is that ?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: They might have been happy when you first arrived, but I've seen what happens after you leave. Citizens are forced to work as slave labor, dissenters are sent off to who-knows-where!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're wrong, Opal! Now, I don't know what you think you've seen, but I am giving you the one-hundred-percent Bolin guarantee that we're making the Earth Empire a better place to live!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I can't believe you brought Bolin here to try and sway us. Leave! Zaofu will never accept you as their leader!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Then you leave me no choice. You have twenty-four hours to agree to join the Empire, or we take the city by force.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I see it! Zaofu! We made it!  And a bunch of other people are here, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Oh, no. I hope we're not too late.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Korra? I can't believe it, where have you been?  You disappeared; everyone was so worried!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll tell you the whole story later. Right now, I want to help you stop Kuvira. What can I do?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You were just bluffing, right? I mean, you're not really gonna attack Zaofu ... are you?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: When people don't cooperate, we must find other ways of convincing them to join.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Other ... ways? How many ... times have we used these "other ways" in the past?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: It's not for you to worry about.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So, uh ... what does happen to all those towns and villages after we leave? I just realized I'd never really ... gone back and ... checked on them.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Those people are my loyal subjects, and they contribute to the Empire however I see fit. Now that you're in the inner circle, you're going to have to accept some hard truths.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Maybe ... I'm not really an "inner circle" kind of guy. Or--or maybe, we don't take over Zaofu! Maybe we can just--let them be on their own, and then, "Yay! The Empire's united! Congratulations to us!"

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I didn't know your personal feelings for Opal were stronger than your loyalty to me. Zaofu will join us. The only thing I'm second-guessing is my decision to bring you along. Maybe you need to spend some time in a reeducation camp.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I ... thought that's where we sent people to learn new trade skills.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Hard truths , Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Your loyalty seems to be wavering.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No--no, I'm totally on your side, completely, one-hundred-percent loyal.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How did things get so bad between you and Kuvira? I thought she was your protégé.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: She was more than that. She was like a daughter to me. I took her in when she was eight years old and nourished her talents. Kuvira was smart, a natural leader, and quickly rose through the ranks. I saw myself in her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What happened?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Three years ago, after the fall of the Earth Queen, Raiko and Tenzin came to see me.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: The Earth Kingdom is in chaos. There's a vacuum of power, and I'm concerned about what will happen if someone doesn't take control of the situation.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: And you think I should be the one?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're the perfect person to take charge. The world leaders trust you, and, as a Beifong, you have credibility in the Earth Kingdom.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I'm honored that you thought of me, but I'm not interested in imposing my ideals on an entire nation.  I'm afraid I can't help you.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Suyin, I know this isn't my place, but I think you should do this. Zaofu has always been a beacon of modern progress, and now you can share that with everyone.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: What would you have me do? March into Ba Sing Se with an army? We'd be seen as conquerors and greeted with nothing but war.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: There are already wars. The Earth Queen nearly destroyed our nation. This is our opportunity to change things.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: It's not going to happen.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I didn't realize it at the time, but that moment put a rift between us. Kuvira turned my own son against me, and together they plotted behind my back.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: What do you think you're doing?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: We're doing what you don't have the guts to do: We're going to Ba Sing Se to help bring order back to the Earth Kingdom.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: No! You will stay here!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: And who's going to stop me? Your security force was more than happy to join my cause. They're some of the best fighters in the world, and they are tired of being treated like exotic birds in your cage.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: If you leave now, you will never be welcomed back.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: When I choose to return, it'll be on my own terms.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Kuvira and Baatar left that day with Varrick, my security force, and a few of Zaofu's wealthiest citizens. After Kuvira proved herself by stabilizing Ba Sing Se,  Raiko and the other world leaders made her the provisional head of the Earth Kingdom. When she refused to step down, I knew it was only a matter of time before she made her way back here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I want to fix this.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You can. Go into the Avatar State and demolish her entire army. Remove Kuvira from power once and for all.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Fighting is something the old me would do. That always made things worse. Let me talk with Kuvira. Maybe I can reason with her.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Kuvira doesn't listen to reason.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I can't believe Kuvira locked me in here like a prisoner ! I'm not feeling well! I think I'm running out of air! Zhu Li, hold your breath!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I'm not holding my breath.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Great ! Now we're both gonna die!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Varrick? Varrick?!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Ahh! And the head voices are back!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Bolin! Thank goodness you're here! Where did that hatch come from? Forget the hatch! There's something important I gotta tell ya!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, there's something important I gotta tell you, too!

transcript.speaker: Varrick and Bolin
transcript.text: Kuvira's crazy!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: How'd you find out?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: When I refused to build her a superweapon, she threatened my life!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: She threatened me, too! And she's threatening Zaofu and it turns out, she's been threatening villages this whole time!  We gotta get outta here.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I couldn't agree more, kid.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: We have an unexpected guest. The Avatar is here to see you.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Korra, it's such an honor to see you again. The last I heard, you were still healing in the South Pole.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I'm feeling much better now.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: That's wonderful news.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm here to ask you to back down. Please. Take your army and leave.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I think we both know that's not going to happen.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't let you take Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
