transcript.text: Look, I was tasked with bringing stability to the Earth Kingdom. Zaofu is the last holdout. Why should I treat it differently than any other state?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What you're doing isn't right!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I understand you're just trying to do Su a favor, but you can't come to me as I am on the verge of reuniting my nation and tell me to stop. The world was descending into chaos while you were gone.  In order to fix it, I had to make some tough decisions.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know what that's like. I've had plenty of people mad at me about decisions I've made.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Exactly. Korra, if you really want to help, go back to Su and try to talk some sense into her. Let's call a temporary truce. I won't make any moves until you talk to her and get back to me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Maybe that will be for the best.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Have you seen Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Guard #1
transcript.text: He came by to see Varrick, but we turned him away.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Open the door.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: We have some fugitives to catch.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, I say we go up and around the mountains--  --and sneak into Zaofu from the rear.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: We're not going to Zaofu, that place is doomed ! We gotta head to Republic City!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What? No, nonono, we gotta help here .

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: We'll be helping by warning the world about Kuvira's potential superweapon!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, that's helping, but it's a completely different type of helping.  Hmm . Let me think about this.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That's not the flamethrower! What idiot designed these things?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: You did, sir!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Less lecturing, more saving my life!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Hey! I think I figured it out!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Sir, you're making this very difficult.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Stop! Turn yourself over, or else ...

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Thanks a lot , Zhu Li.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: You came back.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: When I first came here, it was because I wanted to tell you face to face that I never wanted to see or hear from you again. I wanted my words to hurt you so that you would know how you hurt me.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: But when I saw you, it wasn't anger I felt. It was sadness. You tainted our past and destroyed our future together.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: I want to make amends.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm not sure I'll ever be able to forgive you. But that doesn't mean I shouldn't try.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I thought we could play some Pai Sho. Like we used to.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Nothing ... would make me happier.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Don't ... torture us.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Send these three away on the next train. Bolin and Zhu Li will be going to the reeducation camp for our most severe dissenters.  And you will continue work on the spirit-energy project, under close, armed supervision. I want it weaponized immediately.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Please! Have mercy on me! Don't send me away! Take me back!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Why would I?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Because my only mistake was being loyal to the wrong person. I was blindly devoted to Varrick, and I looked past all the times he ridiculed me, or ordered me around , or made me clean his disgusting feet --  --because I thought he possessed the most brilliant mind in the world. But when I met you, I realized I was wrong. Compared to you, Varrick's a fool.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Hey, come on! I'm right here!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I believe in everything you've done, and I believe in your vision. I want to devote my life to you. I pledge my allegiance to you, Great Uniter.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You two could learn something from her. Rise, Zhu Li. I'll give you another chance.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Think about what you're doing! We're partners! We have history!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I did everything you ever asked of me, and you never appreciated it!  Guards, do the thing!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: No! Not the thing ! Zhu Li!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where's Su? I have to talk to her.

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: She's not here. She took Wing and Wei. They're going to sneak into Kuvira's camp and put an end to this.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Kuvira threatens to take Zaofu by force! After tensions flared between Su Beifong and her former protégé, Korra brokered a truce, but it was too late. Su and her sons were already on their way to put an end to Kuvira. Meanwhile, Bolin and Varrick learned of Kuvira's true tyrannical intent and deserted her army, but they were captured and betrayed by Zhu Li. Now they're being held against their will!

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: Are you sure this will work? Even without Kuvira, they could still crush us.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Most of this army has been forced into service by Kuvira. If we take her out, they'll have no reason to fight. Tonight  we end her reign of terror.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: She's alone in there. Now's our chance!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Don't hurt me!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Zhu Li?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I knew you'd try a sneak attack.  You were afraid to step up and lead the Earth Kingdom when you had the chance.  You were afraid to join me when I became the leader, and now, you're afraid of a fair fight.  You've always been a coward. Take them!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra, you have to go stop Su before she does something terrible.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Stop her, we should be helping her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We have no idea where your mom is, or what her plan is. If we go charging into Kuvira's camp, we could get them all captured, or worse. All we can do now is wait.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Attention citizens of Zaofu. Your leader, Su Beifong, attempted to attack me tonight while I slept, ignoring the terms of our truce. Luckily, I now have her and her assault team in custody.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Rest assured that I will not take revenge on the peaceful citizens of Zaofu, unless your remaining representatives meet me outside the city at dawn to offer the full and unconditional surrender of your city. That is all.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Korra, you can't let Kuvira get away with this! We have to go break out Mom and my brothers!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: You swore an oath of non-aggression when you became an airbender.  You can't just attack Kuvira!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I don't care about the oath! I have to save my family!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, Jinora is right. Your mom attacked the camp. Kuvira was just defending herself.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: "Defending herself"? She was going to attack our city! I can't believe you're refusing to fight!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Why is that loudspeaker lady talking when I'm trying to sleep ?

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: Korra, what are we going to do?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora and I will go talk to Kuvira at dawn, and, maybe, we can work something out. I promise, I'll do everything I can to keep the peace.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I'll go with you.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: We'll go, too.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: No! Dad told us to find Korra, and we did. Now you need to stay safe.

transcript.speaker: Ikki
transcript.text: Come on! Let us help!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't risk anyone else being captured. You can stay with Baatar and Huan while I work things out with Kuvira.  Make sure they get back to Tenzin if anything goes wrong.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Aw, man! When am I gonna see some action ?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Cookie ... jar ... empty. No ... hot ... towels! Waxy ... buildup!  Zhu Li !

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Oh ... she really is gone.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Up and at 'em, Varrick! Time to go to work.  We have another lab set up for you.  Kuvira wants the spirit vine weapon operational as soon as possible.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Zhu Li always greeted me in the morning with a  a hot cup of tea.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You'll get your tea when you start working.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Well, I'm really only productive for about fifteen minutes a day, usually in the afternoon around three-forty-five.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You'll work now. I want you to show me how the device works.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What's goin' on?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Go back to sleep. We only need Varrick. You'll need your energy when you get to the re-education camp.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I can't be expected to work without an assistant! Without Zhu Li, I'm helpless!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: One of the guards will be your assistant. I'll be supervising.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Well, I guess he'll be fine. As long as he doesn't need his hands afterwards!

transcript.speaker: Guard #1
transcript.text: What's he talking about, sir?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: The last time we worked with the spirit vines, it created an uncontrollable blast  that burned through a wall and could still be blowing up comets in space, as far as I know! I wouldn't want to assist me if I were you!

transcript.speaker: Guard #1
transcript.text: Maybe we should just let the kid help him out.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Fine. Bolin can assist.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait, what? I need my hands!  Uh, hold on! Can we have breakfast first?  While we still have hands?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Release them now!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: If Su agrees to bow to me and turn over Zaofu, she and the rest of your family will not be harmed.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Never! I'll never bow to you!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There must be some way for us to resolve this!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I've already laid out my terms, and I think they're very reasonable. After all, Su did try to take me out during our peaceful negotiations.

transcript.speaker: Wei
transcript.text: You call bringing an army to threaten our city "peaceful"?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Where's Bolin? I know he would never go along with this!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Bolin is with my fiancé, working on something very important.  But, I assure you, he's on board with my plans. You two have been apart for some time. I guess you don't realize how much Bolin has grown up.  Now turn over Zaofu .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't just let you take the city!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Avatar Korra, you are interfering with internal Earth Empire business, and letting your personal feelings get in the way of reason. Zaofu cannot continue to rule itself. They have been hoarding their riches and technology too long. I'm here to distribute those resources fairly throughout the nation. This is about equality.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: You don't care about equality! This is about control!  Just take her down! You know it's the right thing to do! You have to stop this!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: The only way you're going to keep me from marching into Zaofu is if you physically stop me. Now what are you going to do?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It looks like you're not giving me a choice.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Fine.  I want you all to know that I would never ask any of you to do something that I'm not willing to do myself.  So, rather than risk your lives, I will fight the Avatar one-on-one .  Korra, if you win, then you can do whatever you want with Zaofu.  But after I beat you, I want you out of my business for good. I'm the one who brought peace to the Earth Empire, not you . You're not relevant here anymore.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Fine.  You wanna fight the Avatar? Then let's finish this, right here, right now.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Are you really ready to fight her?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Just stay back and let me handle this.  It's been a while,  but I got a lot of pent-up rage.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Don't mess around!  Kuvira is too good! Just go into the Avatar State and get it over with!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I'm only going to use that as a last resort.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Be careful.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Use whatever you want: all the elements; the Avatar State; anything you need.  I know you're a little rusty .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Enough talk!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Looks like the Avatar's a little off her game!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Don't let her get you frustrated! She wants you to make a mistake!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Bolin, do the thing.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What thing?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: The thing ! I never had to tell Zhu Li what thing !

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I'm not Zhu Li, okay? Pretend I don't know anything about anything that's happening here, also pretend I don't want to build a super weapon or get my hands blown off!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Walk me through what you're doing. I want to know every detail of your work.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You know, when I started working with the vines,  the point was to find a clean, unlimited source of energy, not develop some spirity death ray.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Clean energy! Sounds great ! Who doesn't like that stuff? Let's do that instead!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Quiet! You're here to help , not talk.  And you of all people, should realize that once a discovery is made, it is our responsibility as scientists  to pursue it as far as we can.  Wherever it leads.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: How would you know? You couldn't discover a wolfbat if it was building a nest in your butt.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You're pathetic.  Wolfbats don't build nests.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Ooh. You got me there, Dr. Science. You'll never know how it feels to give birth to genius, only to have it kidnapped, and raised by fools !

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Are you done with your rambling, or do the guards need to encourage you to continue your work?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Okay, okay,  The last time we ran the current through the vine  we couldn't control the power, so I'm trying something new to see if I can direct it.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Come on, Avatar, get up! Show me what you've got!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We have to help her!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No! Stay back! I can handle this.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: So I see how the current interacts with the vine, and here is a kind of directional tube, but that is baffling here at the base. It looks like that would only redirect the energy back where it came from. And what's that piece of equipment you're fiddling with now on the power source?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Hand me the ... screw-turn-thingy, would ya?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ugh, I can't believe you're helping them, you know this isn't right.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Funny story, Bolin. I first got the idea for harnessing spirit power when I watched that giant Unalaq-monster attack the city from my jail cell. That giant monster set me free!  Trust me, kid, I know what I'm doing.  That ought to do it.  Huh.  Okay, stand back.  There we go!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: What's that ticking?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That's the timer.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: The timer for what ?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: For the bomb , of course!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What?! What bomb?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: The bomb that's gonna explode in five minutes and destroy this entire train, all of the spirit vines, and everything else within a few hundred yards.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You know what, I'd get out of here if I were you. This is the first time I've built a timer and it might run a little fast. Bolin and I are ready to go down with the ship, or train , in this case, but you seem like you have a lot to live for.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Nononono! I'm not ready to go down with the ship, or the train !

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You're bluffing.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Stick around five minutes and you'll find out who's bluffing.  You'll be sorry you left me, Zhu Li! When they write the history books, your name will be synonymous with betrayal ! People will say, "Hey, what happened to that guy? Oh, didn't you hear? He 'Varricked' himself because some girl 'Zhu Li'd' him!"

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Enough! What makes you think we would let you blow yourself up? You're working for Kuvira! You don't get to quit.  Grab him.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You try to pull me away from this thing and I'll hit this remote, and blow it immediately!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Why do you have a timer and a remote?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Well, first, I built the timer, but then I thought, you could drag me off the train, so then I built a remote, but then I thought, do I really need the timer, because now I got a remote in my--  Whatever! I'm covering all my bases! The point is, you're leaving, we're staying!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You have to go into the Avatar State! Do it!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I don't understand. We got the poison out; what's wrong with her?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I knew you were weak.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You broke our agreement!  Attack!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Keep them back, I'm calling for help!

transcript.speaker: Huan
transcript.text: Stunning work, Ikki. It hurts my eyes with its ... raw, emotional power!  Ugh, pedestrian. I already know what you look like on the outside, I want you to show me, the inner Meelo!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Help! You have to get Korra and the rest of us out of here now! Hurry!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Finally! Let's get it on!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: That's everyone, our half of the train is clear.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That's good, we're almost out of time.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You're insane.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You knew that when you hired me! Bolin, do the thing!  Unhook the cars, oh, come on, that was an easy one!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Man, that was great! I gotta admit, you had me going there for a while, I really thought you were gonna blow us up! Now, how do we turn this thing off?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Ooh, we can't turn it off. We're gonna blow up--  --but, we had a pretty good run, right?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What are you talking about, "a good run"? I'm still running! I like running!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I'll see you on the other side,  Zhu Li.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I want you to know,  I hate you .

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: I can't believe he actually blew himself up. That man was crazier than a sewer pipe elephant-rat.  Let's get back to Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes !  You did it, Bolin, you did the thing !

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I can't believe Zhu Li worked for you as long as she did.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Dive, Pepper, dive!  Here comes a hurricane!  You can't handle all this Meelo!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: We've got her, go!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We have to save them!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Opal,  get out of here, we'll be fine!  Just go!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I'll be back for you! I love you!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Zaofu is ours!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Bring the citizens of Zaofu to kneel before the Great Uniter! All who pledge their loyalty to me will keep their freedom and will be dealt with fairly as full citizens of the Earth Empire. The rest will be imprisoned as traitors, like Su Beifong and her sons. Now bow !

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Bow to her! Do it! She is your rightful leader!

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: I am so disappointed in you, Junior.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Take them away!

transcript.speaker: Huan
transcript.text: Get your hands off me! You're crushing my individuality!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: All hail the Great Uniter!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Are you sure, there's no way they survived?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Positive. But I think I can replicate his work with the spirit vines and get us back on track. I'll just need an assistant.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: How would you like to help Baatar build the most powerful weapon the world has ever seen?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: It would be my honor, Great Uniter.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Begin dismantling the domes.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Kuvira has defeated the Avatar and now controls the entire Earth Empire. Luckily, the airbender kids and Opal rescued Korra and escaped Zaofu. For the first time in three years, Korra will finally be back in Republic City! Meanwhile, Varrick and Bolin escaped from Baatar Jr. and are on the run. But will they make it back to the city in time to warn everyone about Kuvira's new spirit energy super weapon?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Naga!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I missed you so much, girl!

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Mom! Dad! We're back! And we got Korra!

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Aren't you a sight for sore eyes!  Bum-Ju and I sure missed you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's so great to see you again, Bumi. And you too, Bum-Ju.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Well done kids!  I'm proud of you all for finding Korra.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Proud enough to get me my tats?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Welcome home.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I missed you, Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Now, I hate to get right down to business, but I want to hear what happened in Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Way to ruin the moment.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Kuvira's whole army was there. She captured Mom, Dad, and my brothers.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought I was strong enough to stop her. I feel like such a failure.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No one expected you to handle Kuvira on your own. It's up to all of us to find a way to deal with her.  We're just glad to have you back.

transcript.speaker: Bumi
transcript.text: Where's Bolin? He's not still on Kuvira's side, is he?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I can't believe he would stay with her after what she did to my family. But we don't know where he is.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: How about you use your own legs for a while?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You know, when I fled Republic City with Zhu Li, she carried me twenty miles in one day. And that was after she sprained her ankle.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, Zhu Li's not here, okay?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: That's fine, leave me here, let the worms gobble me up. I deserve it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No way mister! You're not getting off that easily. You're responsible for that weapon Kuvira is trying to make. Which, may I remind you, could hurt a lot of people.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: No, don't remind me! I know, I'm a horrible, horrible person!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, look. Kuvira fooled us both into doing her dirty work and I'm not happy about it either. But , you know how we're gonna make it up to the world? By getting back to Republic City and warning everyone what she's up to! So, I want you to take my hand  and march with me out of this forest!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You really have a way with words, kid. No wonder I made you a mover star. All right, I'll take the driver's seat for a while, hop on.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, great, my feet could use a break.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Oh, boy, here we go!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Are you kidding me?!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I hope you haven't been waiting long.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Only three years.  It's so good to see you again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You too.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And I'm loving the hair.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks.  You're looking snazzy as always.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Come on. Mako got us a table at the restaurant.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hi, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Hello there, Prince Wu, rightful heir to the throne and  this guy's boss. I bet he's told you a lot about me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Nope. Not a thing.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Then we have so much to talk about.  You are going to love the food here, I know the chef personally.  Let's start with a round of your spicy octopus fritters  and keep the cucumber-aloe water coming!  Gotta keep this princely skin hydrated.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I thought it was going to be the three of us.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Sorry, but I couldn't ditch him. But he promised to be on his best behavior.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Hey, pop into the Avatar State for me. I want to see your eyes glow.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: What? No!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: So can you go into the Avatar State again? I was worried when you told me you couldn't.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wait, when did she tell you she couldn't?  What's going on with you two?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I wrote to Asami while I was away. I asked her not to tell you. I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, why didn't you ever write to me? Or Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know. I guess ... I didn't know what to say.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: "Hello" would have been nice.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Mako, if it makes you feel any better, she didn't write me either.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Why would she ...  Never mind.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry I didn't stay in touch, but I'm back now.  And I wanna know everything about what's been going on with you two.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well, I kind of have some big news. I went to visit my father for the first time. He had been writing me letters and I guess I finally felt ready to try and forgive him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You sure you can trust him? He might just be manipulating you again.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You think I don't know what my own father is capable of?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, I didn't mean ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You don't get to disappear for three years and then act like you know what's best for me!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's not like I planned to be gone for that long, I wanted to come back, but I never felt ready until now.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: As much as I'm enjoying this little catch-up, my royal bladder is about to explode . Mako, come on, I need you to stand guard.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm not gonna hold your hand every time you have to empty your "royal bladder". Go to the bathroom on your own for once.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Fine.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Do you always go to the bathroom with him?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't go with him, with him, I just stand there in the general vicinity while he ... I don't wanna talk about it.

transcript.speaker: Bathroom attendant
transcript.text: Good afternoon, Sir. Perhaps a spritz of cologne, to freshen up?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Make it a double, buddy!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Mako, help! Wu ... down ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I wish Pabu were here. He could just chew us out of this.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You know who else has incisors sharp as a knife? Zhu Li ...

transcript.speaker: Ahnah
transcript.text: Well look what we caught. Wonder if they were tracking us after we escaped.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hello fellow travelers! I don't suppose you can help us out of this net?

transcript.speaker: Ahnah
transcript.text: Why would we free a couple of lowly Earth Empire soldiers?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Lowly ? We were part of Kuvira's inner circle!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Were, not anymore! Please, just, let us out!

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: I know just what to do with a couple of Kuvira's top men.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I wonder what's taking Wu so long. He's not one to miss out on lunch. I'll go check on him.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wu, are you in here? Come on, your octopus fritters are getting cold.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll be right back.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Excuse me, did you happen to see if Prince Wu came out this way?

transcript.speaker: Bathroom attendant
transcript.text: Sorry miss, I haven't seen him.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Hmm, I'm in laundry ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: They've got Wu! Get the car, I'm going after them!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Get in!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We're losing them!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hang a right at the next block. We can cut them off on Seventh.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You missed the turn! Where are you going?!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I know these streets better than you. I built some of them!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you doing? Sit down!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Where is he?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wu's not here. This guy was the only one in the truck.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Where's the prince?

transcript.speaker: Bathroom attendant
transcript.text: Halfway to Kuvira by now.  All hail the Great Uniter.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: They must have moved Wu to a different vehicle when we lost sight of them.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Take this guy in for booking. Charge him with kidnapping and tell Chief Beifong that Prince Wu is missing. Put out an all-points bulletin. We'll keep looking.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Where do we start? There are thousands of cars in the city and he could be in any one of them.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Or they might try smuggling him out on an airship.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Or maybe a boat.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: He could be anywhere!  The one time I don't watch him pee and this is what happens.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: They're taking Wu to the train station!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you sure? How do you know?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll explain on the way, just drive! We're running out of time!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So how did a bunch of water and firebenders end up in one of Kuvira's reeducation camps?

transcript.speaker: Ahnah
transcript.text: Call it what it is: a prison.

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: Kuvira's been purging states of anyone who's not of Earth Kingdom origin and locking them up.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Purging?!

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: What are you acting so surprised for? You must have known what she was up to, being part of her "inner circle" and all.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, I swear! And the inner circle thing lasted like, less than a day!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Will you at least tell us where you're taking us?

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: The border checkpoint. You're gonna help us talk our way past some Earth Empire soldiers.

transcript.speaker: Ahnah
transcript.text: And once we're through, we'll see about letting you go.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Lava time! Bet you didn't expect that!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Look, I'm sorry for what happened to all of you, but as I've been trying to explain, we don't work for Kuvira anymore.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yeah. If our handsome mugs get recognized trying to go through that checkpoint, we're goners!

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: If you really are fugitives, you better listen up. We've been scouting this region for days. There's a wall stretching along the entire border and patrols guarding every part of it. That checkpoint is the only way out.

transcript.speaker: Ahnah
transcript.text: It's not worth the risk, Baraz. How do we know they won't turn us in?

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: If he wanted us gone, we'd be at the bottom of a pool of lava right now. If any of us want to get out of the Earth Empire alive, we'll have to trust each other.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right, where is this checkpoint?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So, how do you know where Wu is just by touching some spirit vines?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I learned how to connect to people's energies through them.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Who taught you that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Lin's mom.  I found her in the swamp, that place is like one giant spirit wild.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You met Toph ? What was she like?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: A cranky, more miserable version of Lin.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Is that even possible?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You'd be surprised.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Which train is Wu on?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't know!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Split up and start looking.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Follow my lead.

transcript.speaker: Guard post soldier
transcript.text: Good afternoon, sir. Can we help you?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You sure can. We captured these escaped prisoners. We need to get them to a secure facility.

transcript.speaker: Guard post soldier
transcript.text: Where did they escape from?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Camp fourteen.

transcript.speaker: Guard post soldier
transcript.text: Then why are you bringing them through here? Camp fourteen is the other way.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You think we don't know where Camp fourteen is? Kuvira wants them transferred.

transcript.speaker: Guard post soldier
transcript.text: Then I'll need to see the transfer order.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Listen pal! I had to fight off two badgermoles, six wolfbats and eighteen hog monkeys to capture these guys, so sorry if I don't have the paperwork! I was too busy cramming it in a hog monkey's mouth, while it was trying to eat me! I am in sore need of a shower and I have blisters that are the size of cantaloupes and twice as juicy! So you can let us through, or you can give us your name and rank and I'll make sure to pass it on to Kuvira! You know what happens to soldiers who question her orders, don't you? Bad stuff!

transcript.speaker: Guard post soldier
transcript.text: Let them through!

transcript.speaker: Guard #2
transcript.text: Wait! Stop them, they're traitors to the Empire!

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: There's no way I'm going back to prison!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Boy, I sure hope this works.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I still got that Varrick touch!  We're clear, come on!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Varrick, wait, we can't leave them!

transcript.speaker: Guard post soldier
transcript.text: Retreat!

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: Thanks. You didn't have to come back.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yeah. I kind of did. Let's go!

transcript.speaker: Over the PA
transcript.text: The 4:15 bound for Omashu is now leaving on track number six. All aboard!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: If we don't find Wu soon, we might never find him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He's on that train!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How do you know for sure he's here?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I don't. But I had a feeling, okay?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: And I'm just supposed to trust your "Avatar Feelings"?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You wouldn't have to if you had guarded the prince like you were supposed to.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Oh, so it's my fault Wu disappeared.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's certainly not mine!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Guys, shh. Listen.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Wu! Wu, it's me.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Mako? Where am I? Am I dead?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, you're on a train. We're gonna get you out of here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone out.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I'm not going up there.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jump!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You all right?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Yes! Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you.  You are definitely getting a raise, Buddy.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You should be thanking Korra. We never would have found you with out her.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I owe you my life, Avatar. If only there was some way to repay you. Oh, I know.  How about I take you out for a night on the town?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Really? You're asking me out right now?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: So ... I put you down for a "maybe"?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How about a never?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Not exactly what I imagined for our first day back together.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: But it was kind of like old times.  Except for the getting on each other's nerves part.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Actually, that is like old times for me and Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm sorry things got so tense earlier.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: It's all right. I guess after being apart for three years, there's bound to be a bit of an adjustment period.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, but it's great to have you back.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's no place else I'd rather be.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You guys are the greatest friends a guy could have.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, what are we gonna do with him? It's too dangerous to take him back to the hotel.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Whoo! You're telling me! I need a cushy safe house somewhere.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I think I know just the place.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Nice digs, Mako. You didn't tell me you came from money.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't. This is Asami's place. She was nice enough to let my family stay here after they fled Ba Sing Se.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Mako! It's so wonderful to--  Are you ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Grandma, this is Prince Wu. He needs to stay with you and the family for a little while.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: It's an honor, Grandma Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: She loves royalty.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I think I'll fit right in here.  Thanks for looking out for me, Mako.  Now where's the nearest bathroom? I have been holding it all day!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I know it might not mean much coming from a guy wearing this uniform,  but I'd like to apologize for what Kuvira's put you through.

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: I appreciate that.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Guess this is where we part ways.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It's been a blast!

transcript.speaker: Ahnah
transcript.text: We're heading north too. Why don't you come with us? It's the least we could do after you saved our necks.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: On that hunk of junk? No thanks. I'm allergic to drowning.  I mean, uh, we'd love a lift!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: This area is overrun with spirit vines.  And they appear to be even more powerful than the samples we took from Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Perfect. Harvest the vines until there's nothing left.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Avatar Korra is back, and yours truly, Shiro Shinobi, couldn't be more thrilled! It's been my honor to bring you news of Korra and her friends over the years; so many heart-pounding moments! Who can forget Amon and his Equalist revolution? I still have nightmares! Then there was the time I covered the Nuktuk mover premiere! Boy, was that fun! But enough about me. Sit back, relax, and take a trip down memory lane!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You know, there's something about being kidnapped that makes a guy realize he needs to get his act together.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah, I agree. Let's toughen you up.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Daaah , I wasn't ready!  Wu down!

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: What's going on?  Mako, how dare you injure the prince! Would his royal highness like a cherry-berry lemonade?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: And maybe some of those sticky dumplings, too?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Look at you! You're so weak, "Wu down" is your catchphrase.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I know, I'm a wimp. But it's not my fault, I was born that way! I'm not like you Mako, I wasn't raised by a pack of cops in the woods.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You don't know anything about me, do you?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Yeah, I'm drawing a blank. Why is that? How do I not know stuff about you?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Uhh ... you never asked?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Well, I'm asking now!  What's your favorite food? What's your favorite color? Is there a special lady in your life?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Not since Korra and I broke up.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: What? You dated the Avatar ?  Sit!  You and I need to have a little gab session right now!  How'd you guys first meet?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin and I were playing for the Fire Ferrets.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You were a pro-bender?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes. Will you just let me tell the story?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Carry on.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin and I grew up dirt poor, so once I became a pro-bender, I wanted it all: Riches; fame; accolades. But all that changed when I met Korra.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Come on, I want you to meet my brother, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako? Wow, I-I heard you play on the radio!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on, Bolin, we're up.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Whoa! That was the first time you met? Kind of rude there, buddy!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You know what else is rude? Interrupting .  Korra proved to be an amazing pro-bender  and a loyal friend. She helped me save Bolin when he was taken by the Equalists.  After going through such a crazy experience, I felt like Korra and I had a powerful connection.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: So then you smooched her real good, eh?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Not exactly.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ahhhh!

transcript.speaker: Asami Sato
transcript.text: Oh no! I'm so sorry, I didn't see you!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: How could you not see me? I mean I was ju-juuuu  I was, I-I, wow.  That was ...

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Wait. That was the first thing you said to Asami? You really gotta work on your introductions.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hey. When you got charm like mine, you don't need introductions.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hanging out with Asami was awesome. But it made things with Korra  complicated.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, I was thinking we should spend some time together.  Look, I really like you and I think we were meant for each other.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, I'm really sorry, but I just don't feel the same way about you.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: That's harsh, Mako.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know.  And the worst part about it is, it wasn't totally true.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We need to talk.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Save your breath. You've already made it clear how you feel about me.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: No, I haven't. What I'm trying to say is, as much as you drive me crazy, I also think you're pretty amazing.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Hot dog! Smooch City, here we come. You player.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Whoa. I thought you were dating Asami.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Tu! Get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Naughty Mako! You take after your grandfather!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Guys, Grandma, everything wasn't so cut and dry. I wasn't dating Asami.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Denial .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Okaaay, maybe I was dating her; it was all very confusing.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: But my feelings for Korra became clear when Tarrlok captured her. It felt like a piece of me was gone.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I was so worried. Are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm fine. I'm glad you're here.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Hoo! I bet Asami wasn't too happy about that.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I've noticed how you treat Korra, how you acted when she was missing. You have feelings for her, don't you?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Things are crazy right now. Can we deal with our relationship problems later?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Well, there might not be a relationship to worry about later.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami !

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Ouch!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yep. Turns out, she was right. It was time to man up and call it quits.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Asami. I'm sorry things got so messed up between us. But whatever happens today, I want you to know how much I care about you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I care about you, too.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Wait. Was that supposed to be you breaking up with her?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yes. That was a breakup.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Didn't sound like a breakup.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: It was mutual. We had an understanding!  We both knew—  Can I just get on with the rest of my story or what?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Fine.  But I hope you weren't as ambiguous with Korra as you were with Asami.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Trust me, I wasn't.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra and I ended up stopping Amon together and after that, I was finally able to tell her how I felt. Exactly how I felt.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I love you, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I love you, too.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Awww. And then you two lived happily ever after?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ummmm ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Tenzin's just trying to help you become the best Avatar you can be.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Of course you take his side.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm not taking his side.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You know, sometimes I wonder whose side you're on.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: There aren't any sides!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How could you take his side?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's with you and sides?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, excuse me , officer! Don't let me stand in the way of you writing tickets! I'm just trying to save the world!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, I guess if we're both putting our jobs first, maybe there's no room for our relationship!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, what? Are you ... breaking up with me?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Yeah ... I guess I am.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Now that's a breakup!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: After that, I dove into my work. Someone had been taking out supply ships heading to the Southern Water Tribe.  Asami's company was one of the victims, so she and I worked together to catch the perps.  The stakeout was the perfect way to get my mind off Korra. It was an intense night.  Asami and I discovered the triads had double-crossed us. We barely got away, but by then, Asami's warehouse had been cleared out.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: My company ... it's over ... I give up.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well ... I'm not giving up on you .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know, I know, don't tell me ... I had no right kissing Asami.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: No, actually, I'm completely fine with that. You officially broke up with Korra and therefore, you're free to smooch whoever you wish.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: If only it had been that simple.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Mako, I missed you so much!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra ... hey, I-I missed you, too.  So you're not still mad at me? We had that fight before you left, remember?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Not really. I got attacked by a dark spirit and I lost my memory for a little while. Maybe it hasn't all come back yet. Was it a bad fight?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Ahhhhh ...  Hmmmm, no. No. It-it wasn't that bad.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! So you were back with Asami, but then Korra came back and thought you guys were still together and you didn't tell her you weren't ?

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: Just like your grandfather.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, me and Asami were never officially back together.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Really ? That again? You know, it seems like you're so afraid to disappoint anyone that you end up disappointing everyone.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Truer words have never been spoken.  High-five!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Well, eventually, I did tell Korra. But by then, she already knew.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Why didn't you just tell me the truth in the first place?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I know I should have, but ... I didn't want to hurt you all over again. I guess part of me wanted to forget about the breakup, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think we both know that this ... us ... doesn't work.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You're right.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's ... over. For real this time.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: After Harmonic Convergence, the world changed. Team Avatar traveled around, searching for new airbenders. At first, it was awkward being around Korra and Asami.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: As you were.  Ladies.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: But then I realized I had to figure out who I was without a lady in my life.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I know what that's like.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I mean, to need distance from women.  Because I have so many, all over me, all the time.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Anyway,  I eventually helped Korra defeat Zaheer and save the airbenders.  And we did it as friends. Korra showed me the importance of putting others before myself  and whenever I think of her, she continues to inspire me.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Wow! That story is amazing and I really learned something!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You did? Good.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Yeah! I learned that I really didn't know anything about you! Crazy!  Also, I realized that ladies are complicated. No offense, Grandma.

transcript.speaker: Yin
transcript.text: None taken.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I better just focus on being a better king.  Okay, come at me. I can take it.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Aahhhhh! Wu down!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I brought you some tea.  I thought you might be cold out here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You're so sweet.  Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Are you okay? You seem out of sorts.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry. I've just been thinking about something Toph said. She told me that the world doesn't need me and it's basically pointless to try and stop Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: That's ridiculous.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: At the time, I thought so, too. I figured she was just being her normal, cranky self. But I'm beginning to think she had a point.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: No, she doesn't . The world does need you. You're the Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But no matter what I do, the world seems to always be out of balance!  Growing up, I couldn't wait to be the Avatar. I thought I was really gonna change things. I was so naive.  The first time I saw Amon take someone's bending away, I was terrified.

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Your firebending is gone! Forever .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Then my worst nightmare came true.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: I told you I would destroy you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Korra, you're forgetting about all the good that happened after you exposed Amon as the fraud he was. The Equalist Movement lost its leader and its power.  Free elections were held in the United Republic and nonbenders finally had a voice.  People had hope again and it was all because of you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And I was hopeful, too. That feeling didn't last long.  As soon as I defeated Amon, a new enemy took his place.  I can't believe I trusted you. You made me think you wanted to restore balance with the spirits, but this, this isn't balance, it's madness! Now let her go!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: If you want your friend to make it out of the Spirit World, you'll open the other portal now .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Because of Unalaq, I betrayed Tenzin, opened the portals, and threw the Spirit and human worlds into chaos.  It was my fault he fused with Vaatu and became a Dark Avatar.  And I was helpless to stop him from destroying Raava and cutting off my connection to my past lives.  With Raava gone, Unalaq and Vaatu became more powerful than ever.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: But you became more powerful, too. I mean ... you turned into a giant spirit.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah ... that was pretty awesome.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And opening the spirit portals turned out to be a good thing.  You brought back the airbenders and caused a positive shift in the world.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes,  but Zaheer got airbending too and nearly killed me.  If it weren't for Zaheer,  the Earth Queen would still be alive. There would have been no crisis in the Earth Kingdom  and Kuvira wouldn't be in power.  Things are more out of balance than ever now. Nothing's changed!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You're right, Korra.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: She is?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's true, there will always be new conflicts and enemies to face. But the important thing is to learn from your enemies and better yourself over time, which you have.  You've changed so much since you first arrived on Air Temple Island. When you first came here, you were hot-headed and a bit selfish.  But you've matured into a thoughtful young woman who puts the needs of others before herself.  The new Air Nation is a testament to that. You sacrificed everything to save them. You're an inspiration to the world.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you both. I know this Kuvira problem is only going to get worse. But no matter what happens, no matter how crazy things get, I'll always try to restore balance.

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: And that's when I made a solemn vow never to eat bark-onion soup again.  Been six years, four months and fourteen days ...  Urgh!  I can still taste it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Does anyone else feel like throwing themselves overboard?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Not me!  I've spent the last few hours tuning out all these incredibly boring stories ...

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: All the while  mentally composing the most exciting tale  ever told, soon to become the greatest  mover  ever made!  I present to you now:  Bolin,  as Nuktuk, Hero of the South—  Trademark Varrimovers International—  in  the incredible true story of Bolin! Hero of the world!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait, am I playing Nuktuk, or is Nuktuk playing me?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Both. It's your true story, but we'll capitalize on the  audience of the Nuktuk franchise.  Duh!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: How can you call me "the hero of the world"?  I left my friends and family to join up with a psychotic dictator who imprisoned me and now,  I'm running back home with my tail between my legs.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Nyahbabababab! You're emphasizing the wrong story beads. Let me tell it. The story of Bolin begins in an exotic port of call.  A wise sage, the richest merchant in the world, and a handsome devil all  sit on a single pillow in the living room of a luxury yacht! How do they all fit on one pillow?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ooh! Giant pillow!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Wrong! They're all the same man! Me!  I try to teach a swami the power of levitation, but he's too stupid  to understand it, so I kick him out.  "Upon whom can I bestow my awesome knowledge?" I ask myself. Then, in walks Nuktuk, with a twinkle in his eye, a gorgeous dame on his arm, and a song on his lips. He bursts into a rapturous melody!  " Where can I find my teacher? "

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, come on! I wasn't singing, you were not levitating, and Asami is just a friend, thank you very much.  If you want to tell my true story, you should start from when I met Korra. She came to the bending arena, one fateful night ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This place is even more amazing than I imagined!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Name's Bolin, by the way.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Korra.

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: Bo-ring !  When does the singing start?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: There wasn't any singing!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You're on-screen talent, kid. Leave the storytelling to the masters.  So, the trouble begins when the Avatar is trapped in the Spirit World. The world's most evil villains realize that with Korra out of the way, the time is right to try to take out Bolin.  So, the worst of the worst team up. They're led by ... Zaheer , leader of the Red Lotus and master of the skies, a flying chaotic chaos machine!  He's joined by ... Vaatu , the ultimate force of pure spirit evil in the universe. The biggest, meanest, scariest kite that ever flew!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait! Zaheer didn't team up with Vaatu. How would that even happen?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: How do you think?

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Hello?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Hey. It's Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Oh. Hey, Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Glad I caught you at home.

transcript.speaker: Vaatu
transcript.text: Uh-huh. Very funny. Like I can leave this stupid tree.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Hold on, let me conference in—

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Amon! The reanimated  zombie body  of the bloodbending leader of the Equalists!

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Hey, guys, I'm totally in for taking out Bolin. He's way too powerful and awesome. But can we please not include—

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Not include who , Amon?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: The evil Unalaq . The diabolical but incredibly boring and unpopular sorcerer from the north, who's listening in on the other line!

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: I've spent my life trying to defeat Nuktuk, I mean, Bolin , and I know just where to find him: With all the beautiful ladies!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes, Bolin had a reputation as the world's greatest ladies' man.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oooh, now the story's getting interesting.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: After leaving the beautiful but emotionally unstable Water Tribe princess at the altar,  he met a fetching airbender , the heir to a vast Earth Kingdom fortune!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal , so smart and caring, so pretty to smell,  and she'll probably never talk to me again because I'm so stupid! Stupid ! So, so, so  stupid.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Pull it together, you leaky lug.  But the darkest moment is always right before the dawn! For at his lowest point, Bolin sought advice from the man who started it all, the wisest of the wise— Me !—for some of my signature sage advice!  Nuktuk, I mean, Bolin, there's only one thing for you to do if you want to save the Avatar and defeat the "Fearsome Foursome"  —I'm not really sure if I like "Fearsome", I mean, "Evil Squared" might be better. Whatever— You have to assemble the fighting-est airbender army of all time! But it turns out the airbender recruits are a sorry lot,  so Bolin brings them to a secret mountaintop training facility, where he teaches them the ancient art of dodging fruit and balancing on sticks! Meanwhile, back with Zombie Amon ...

transcript.speaker: Amon
transcript.text: Okay, guys, I think we finally ditched him.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Haha, very funny, I'm still on the line. So, about that evil plan to destroy Nuktuk.

transcript.speaker: Unalaq
transcript.text: Hello? Anyone there?  Guys !

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: And with danger closing in, Opal realizes how much she loves Bolin and forgives him for whatever stuff he was talking about earlier, which will probably not be in the final cut of the mover anyway.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: She does?

transcript.speaker: All refugees
transcript.text: Awww!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: And she kisses Bolin, magically passing on the airbender power of flight!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, that part seems a little unbelievable.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: This is no time for thinking, kid! We're heading into the big finale !  Bolin gathers his airbender army to fight alongside Rotan and Juji against the Terror Square!  Maybe that's the name of the bad guys, "Terror Square"!  What about "Legion of Darkness"? Well, we'll put a focus group on it.  Bolin teaches the airbenders to create a giant tornado.  Then he flies around in the sky,  pushes Zaheer into it,  turning him into wind, forever ! But Bolin doesn't realize that the Universal Interplanetary Combination Zero-Hour—talk about a ticking clock—is almost upon him!  And when Juji shoots his laser eyes at the evil Unalaq,  the beams accidentally fly into the magic spirit doorway!  They bounce off Vaatu, setting him free,  and hit Bolin, turning him into a giant !  But when Vaatu is set free, the evil Unalaq, who has always been an annoyingly clingy person, is so close to Vaatu that they combine into one horrifying monster!  Giant Bolin and the evil UnaVaatu fight toe-to-toe, zapping each other with their laser beams as they stomp around Republic City!  It looks like the evil UnaVaatu might win !  But thankfully, Bolin's spiritual mojo is so strong that he attracts the queen of the fairies !  With her help, Bolin turns UnaVaatu into magic dust and sprays him into the sky.  And that's where the stars come from.  Oh yeah, and he turns into a dragon and he goes into the Spirit World and he saves the Avatar.  The end!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Wait! You like that?  It didn't make any sense! What about Zombie Amon? What happened to him, huh ? And-and-and-and stars are magic fairy dust?  Are you guys crazy?  Are you crazy?

transcript.speaker: Baraz
transcript.text: It's just a mover.  Don't over-think it. It's like a ride.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Never let the truth get in the way of a good story, kid!

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Korra is safely back in Republic City, but Bolin and Varrick are still on the lam! Weeks ago, Korra removed the remaining poison from her body, but the memory of Zaheer's attack still torments her and, after being defeated by Kuvira, she questions if she will ever fully recover. Meanwhile, Kuvira has been secretly harvesting spirit vines from the swamp, but how close is she to completing her spirit energy weapon?

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Everyone! Mom! Can we stay together, please? The tour is about to begin.

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: That's my boy. Ryu, he used to live in the basement, but then he got airbending, and he's been doing important Air Nation stuff all over the world.  His father and I are here, visiting him and, we're just having the best time in the big city, we're so proud. Right, honey?

transcript.speaker: Ryu's father
transcript.text: Well, at least he has a job now.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Mom, Dad, I'm trying to work!

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Fun fact, everyone. All these vines were created by UnaVaatu when he battled giant spirit Korra for the fate of the world.

transcript.speaker: Tourist #1
transcript.text: Excuse me, are we in the Spirit World right now?

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No.

transcript.speaker: Tourist #1
transcript.text: Is the Spirit World in the ground below us?

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No! Can I just get through my cards?

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: Aw, honey, don't get flustered.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: I'm not!

transcript.speaker: Tourist #1
transcript.text: Uhh, why is that vine coming toward us?

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Uh ... I don't see anything about that in the cards.

transcript.speaker: Tourist #1
transcript.text: I'm gonna poke it with a stick.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: No! Why would you do that?

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Everyone back!

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: This tour is exciting!

transcript.speaker: Ryu's mother
transcript.text: Isn't Ryu the best airbender ever?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everything okay?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: No. Kuvira has my family and no one seems to care but me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We all care. Don't worry, we'll get them back safely.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Guys, there you are! I just felt a weird surge of spiritual energy coming from the Spirit Wilds. Something's wrong .

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Are you sure you felt a disturbance? Maybe you just had some bad food for breakfast.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'm telling you, I felt it. Maybe something happened to Ryu's tour group. We should've run into them by now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yeah, but it's Ryu. They might be at the mall, for all we know.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra, can't you feel how strange the energy is?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... but maybe I can get a reading.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Korra, what is it? Are you okay?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It was Kuvira. I saw her taking vines from the swamp. It must be affecting our Spirit Wilds. I bet that's what you were sensing, Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Why is she taking vines?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whatever the reason, I'm sure it's not good.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We have to tell Raiko. This might help him convince the other leaders to finally take her down!

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: I'll keep looking for Ryu and the others.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I say we deal with this Kuvira situation immediately.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Yes! Agreed! And I know just how to get rid of her: we tell her she won an all-expense paid vacation to a tropical island. Then, when she gets there, we reveal that it was a trap. The island's a prison! Boom! Got her!  Or, okay, uh, I'm just spitballing here. We march in with an army of highly trained badgermoles!  Do we know if Kuvira has any allergies?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Look, I think we all know what must be done. We take the fight to her .

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I don't believe attacking is the right move, since she hasn't done anything aggressive toward the United Republic.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Not yet. But Kuvira can't be trusted. She told us that she was going to turn over power and she didn't. I'm with Raiko. I say we go on the offensive and start by retaking Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: President Raiko, I'm sorry to interrupt, but ...  What's going on here?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Oh, hey, Avatar Korra. Just kickin' it world leader-style, trying to figure out what to do about Kuvira. For the record, I told Raiko he should've invited you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You invited him ,  but not me?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Please, Korra, it's not personal. We just thought, perhaps we called you back into action a little too soon.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Again, him , not me?!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Korra, we're in the middle of a meeting and we can't have people just barge in whenever they want!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Guys!  Oh,  perfect! You're all here.

transcript.speaker: Opal and Mako
transcript.text: Bolin?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: What are you doing here?! Guards, remove these traitors!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No! We escaped Kuvira's army!  We're back on your side now!  We have top secret information for you!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Okay, I guess we should've opened with that line.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Listen to me. Kuvira's making this thing that goes  I don't know how it works, but it has this

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It's a super weapon! Like a regular weapon, only super.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And let me guess: it has something to do with spirit vines.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes! How did you know?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I saw a vision of her taking spirit vines from the swamp.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: If she figures out how to harness their power, we are all doomed.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: She might use the weapon to attack Republic City. The only way to protect ourselves is with a preemptive strike.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: My airbenders won't be part of an unprovoked attack!

transcript.speaker: Izumi
transcript.text: Neither will the Fire Nation.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: But, Fire Lord Izumi, Kuvira is a threat to the world! She has to be stopped!

transcript.speaker: Izumi
transcript.text: The Fire Nation has spent too much of its history  fighting nonsense wars.  And I refuse to drag my nation into another one  unless there is no other choice.  If you attack Kuvira, you'll do it without my army.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Fine. I'll hold off any plans of attack. We'll go on the defensive and fortify security on the borders.

transcript.speaker: Izumi
transcript.text: In that,  you'll have my help.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal, wait! Please,  I just want to say that I'm sorry for everything .

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I'm glad you're okay, but it's a little late for "sorry".

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I know, I know.  I didn't listen to you, and I  sided with Kuvira, and I helped her take over the Earth Kingdom, and topple your home, and get your  mom captured, and  your brothers, and your dad ...  Wow, that does sound really bad when I say it out loud like that. But I'm gonna make it up to you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Pardon me, lovebirds, but I need a word with Opal.  Privately .  I'm sorry, kid, but Raiko couldn't convince the other leaders to attack Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: So our family ...

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Looks like we're going to have to save them ourselves.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Don't you think some other people would agree to go with us?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: This is an unsanctioned and dangerous mission into enemy territory. We can't ask other people to risk their necks for our family. If we want to break them out, we'll have to do it alone.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Bolin, I'm so glad you're back. I was worried about you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We all were.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Thanks, guys. Mako, I'm so sorry about the way we left things. I'm such an idiot. You tried to warn me about Kuvira and I ran off anyway, like an idiot. You were right and I'm just an idiot . I hope ... that ... I'll be able to earn your trust again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: If anyone has lost people's trust, it's me. Ever since Kuvira kicked my butt, no one even wants me around.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We want you around.  And Bolin, you're not an idiot. You were just doing what you thought was right.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
