transcript.text: Aww, I love you guys. And I really wanna hug again.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra! The vines! They're taking me! Help!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Get everyone out of here. Put up a perimeter. Cancel all tours. Somebody get a hold of Tenzin.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We gotta get in there and find Jinora.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I don't think anyone should be going in there right now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know I'm not the old Avatar I used to be, but I can do this.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Be careful.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Hello, anyone?  Wait. Do you hear that?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Come on!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra, look.  What are those?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's Jinora and the rest of them. Their spirits are trapped in the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Let's get them out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't! You'll provoke the vines. Let me try.  They won't open.  Maybe if I meditate into the Spirit World, I can free them.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait ... this isn't the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Zaheer! No!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You can't fight me and the poison!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No ... I got it out!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You'll never get it out!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra! What's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What are you talking about?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: He's been haunting me ever since I fought him. I can't get any peace. It's like he's blocking me from meditating into the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm here for you. What do you need?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I want to face Zaheer.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, he's too dangerous. Even when he's locked up, he can't be trusted.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I need to if I wanna save Jinora and the others. There's no other way.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: There is another way. I'm calling your father. He can lead an expedition into the Spirit World from the Southern portal.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You've lost faith in me, too, haven't you?  No one thinks I'm capable of anything anymore.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: It's not that at all.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know I can do this.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm just so worried for Jinora. I can't imagine if something happened to you, too.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Tenzin, please. I'll be okay.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Zaheer's imprisoned deep in the mountains outside the city. I'll call Raiko and get the clearance.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Pab-pabs, where are you?  Pabu! Oh, I missed you so much!  So, I don't know if you've heard, but Opal's kind of mad at me. I was hoping ... you could help me win her back.  Awesome! Yes, I have an idea.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Hello, Pabu.  Well, it's good to see you, too.  What do you got there?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal, you made it!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: What's this?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: A picnic, just for the two of us! Well, the three of us. Sorry, Pabs.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: So, this note Pabu brought me saying you broke both of your legs was just a ruse?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Maybe ... but now that you're here, don't you want to just sit back, relax, try some of my homemade steam buns  —Pema's recipe—and watch Pabu do some of his world-famous backflips for entertainment? Ha-hah!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Oh. Steam buns. My favorite. This will totally make me forget that you worked for Kuvira, the person who captured my family and is probably torturing them right now. So yeah, let's just sit down and have a great picnic because we're so in love!  I'm sorry you had to see that, Pabu.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Thank you both for coming.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It's nice to be welcomed back with open arms.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Actually, I brought you here out of necessity. It's no secret I never liked you. Especially after you tried to have me kidnapped.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Allegedly.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Right. Everything you do is "allegedly". Like when you took over my company and bombed the Southern Water Tribe Cultural Center!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I own that building! A man has a right to blow up his own property!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Right now, I need you to put aside your differences. If Kuvira really is creating a super weapon, we're going to need the two brightest minds in the city working together to stop it.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: What do you say, Asami?  Partners again?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Fine. I'll help.  But don't even think about double-crossing me again.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are you sure you're ready for this?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes. I think if I see Zaheer chained up, I'll finally realize that he's not a threat anymore.

transcript.speaker: White Lotus guard
transcript.text: Approach the wall.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. I need to do this alone.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I figured you would show up sooner or later. So ... you must really be in trouble if you came all the way down here to see me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I came here to look you in the eye and tell you that you have no power over me. I will no longer be scared of you.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I guess it didn't work. You still seem scared.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: This was a mistake.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I know why you're here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You don't know anything about me!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You can't go into the Spirit World. I spend most of my time in the Spirit World and it's well known that the Avatar's spirit hasn't been there for a few years.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You can meditate into the Spirit World from here ? Doesn't feel very spiritually charged.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: This is your problem. Republic City is flowing with spiritual energy and you can't even tap into it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, my problem is you! You poisoned me! You've ruined me! People used to think I was unstoppable, but now they don't think I'm capable of anything!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Blaming me is a crutch to make you feel better, but it's not helping you recover.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I thought seeing you face-to-face would put an end to all of this. But maybe it's time I realize I'll never be the same.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Neither of us are the same as before. I learned to fly, but now I'm bound in chains. You have all the power in the world and the freedom to use it, but you choose to hold yourself down.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not holding myself down, but my powers have limits!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You're wrong. That poison should've killed you, but you were able to fight it off. You think your power has limits; I say, it's limitless.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Whatever. Before , you were always talking about chaos and freedom. Then you took out the Earth Queen and created the worst dictator the Earth Kingdom has ever seen. Thanks for that!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I've heard rumors about her, but I didn't know she achieved so much power. She needs to be stopped.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Well, I can't stop her unless I get over this block.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: I think I can help. Let me lead you into the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No way. I can't trust you.

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Maybe not. But if you had any other options, you wouldn't be here now, would you? We may have been enemies once, but for now, our interests align.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I've come this far. What have I got to lose?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Focus on the sound of my voice and clear your mind.  Let it play out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I can't!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: You can. Accept what happened to you. Don't fear what might have been.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I have no control!

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: Don't be afraid. Hold on!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I made it ... and you led me here. Do you know where Jinora and the others are?

transcript.speaker: Zaheer
transcript.text: No, but you do.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Raava, I missed you. Where have you been?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: I have always been inside of you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Can you help me find Jinora?  How do I release their spirits?

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: You must bend the energy within.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But I'm powerless in the Spirit World.

transcript.speaker: Raava
transcript.text: No. You're most powerful here. In the Spirit World, you're connected to all the spiritual energy.

transcript.speaker: Ryu
transcript.text: Ugh ... I feel all spirity.

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Dad!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I'm so glad you're safe. What happened? How did you get out?

transcript.speaker: Jinora
transcript.text: Korra saved us.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: So ... how are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I feel ... whole again. I feel good.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Do you think you're finally able to forget about what Zaheer did to you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. But I am finally able to accept what happened and I think that's gonna make me stronger.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Where are you going?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We've got some family business to take care of.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right, listen. Before you go, I just want to tell you that I understand how you feel. I know there is nothing I could do or no big gesture that could make up for all my mistakes, but that doesn't mean I'm gonna stop trying to win you back because ... I love you.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Thanks for saying all of that.  You know ... there is one thing you could do to win me back.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What is it? Yes, I'll do anything!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Come on a secret mission with us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Where to?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Zaofu. We're going to rescue my family.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: After Kuvira harvested spirit vines from the swamp, the vines in Republic City reacted by abducting people. Korra saved everyone, but all is not well. Varrick and Bolin returned to warn everyone about Kuvira's spirit vine super weapon. Now Raiko wants to mount a defense against the Earth Empire! Meanwhile, Bolin, Opal, and Lin are on a mission to rescue Su Beifong and her family, who are being held captive by Kuvira!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: All right, let's do this!  Saving the Beifongs and saving our love, because I vow to repair the rift that has grown betwixt us and make us whole again!

transcript.speaker: Lin Beifong
transcript.text: You. Zip it. Now. I had enough of your babble on the way in.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes, ma'am.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Kuvira tore down all the domes. Why would she do that?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: She's got a whole battalion of troops stationed there. There's no way we'll be able to spot anything useful from here. We'll have to go in for a closer look.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Don't bother. All the prisoners have been moved.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Uh ... hey, Chief.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Hey, Chief.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Grandma Toph!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: You were only up to my waist the last time we were together.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, man! Ohh, I can't. This can't be happening!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: What?! Do you have to pee or something?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No ... well, now, maybe. You're my hero! My name is Bolin. I'm dating your granddaughter, I mean, kind of. I may have screwed that up, but that's why I'm here and you're my hero! Oh, I said that. Can I have a hug too?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: What's up with him?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: He's an actor. So, you already checked the city for Su? How did you know she was captured?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I've been living in the swamp and keeping watch on Zaofu through the vines.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Sure, okay, makes sense.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: By the time I got here, they were gone. I snooped around town and heard that they were taken away to some nearby prison camp.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Where would that be?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: There's a factory and reeducation facility not too far away.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: How do you know that?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Bolin used to work for Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: How did you end up dating the kind of dipstick who works for Kuvira?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: "Used to"!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: It's not his silver tongue, I can tell you that.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Please tell me this attitude isn't hereditary.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Grandma, this is Juicy.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: And I thought Appa was smelly. Why would you choose this leaky, nasty thing?

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: You don't choose your bison. He chooses you.  And once he chooses you, you can't change. Believe me, I checked.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: The borders are secure and troops are guarding the rail lines into the city.  So what have you two geniuses come up with to fend off Kuvira?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It's a flying mecha suit!  Asami got the idea from watching dragonfly-hummingbirds. You can take off straight up, fly in any direction—

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Where does the spirit ray come out?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: It doesn't have a spirit ray. I'm telling you what I told Kuvira: That technology should not be used!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: It's already being used by Kuvira! I need spirit vine weapons and I need them now!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No. It was Kuvira's harvesting of the vines in the swamp that caused the Republic City vines to go crazy and grab all those people.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: You're supposed to be the bridge between the two worlds. Why can't you harvest the vines?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I won't do that. But maybe since the spirits love Republic City so much, I can convince them to help us defend it somehow.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Hm.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Okay, maybe while the weapon geniuses and the spirit bridge are getting ready for battle, we should be evacuating the ordinary citizens so that if Kuvira attacks, they won't be hurt.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: That's ... actually a good idea.  Prince Wu, you work with the police to coordinate getting people out of the city. Now everyone get to it. I want daily updates.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Nice job in there. I'm proud of you. You're starting to act like the kind of king I'd like to work for.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Thanks.  And if Korra buys this "man of the people" thing, I still might get to date her.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You always have to ruin it.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: What? Come on! Why do you think guys do anything great? To pick up girls. Every work of art, every song, every city evacuation, all for the ladies.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: All right, everybody, let's test the power core.  I want everything in order for the full demonstration for Kuvira tomorrow. Load the energy capsule.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Zhu Li, initialize phase one.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: There's a problem with the condenser. It's backing up!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Shut it down.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I can't. The override isn't working. Everyone needs to evacuate. This thing is going to blow!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Everyone get out! Now!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Come on, Baatar! It's too late!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: This channeling ring was cracked. That's what caused the reaction to overload.  Now we're taking this whole thing apart tonight and checking everything! Nothing is too small. This has to be ready by tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So how long as it been since you two have seen each other?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Little while now. Couple of years.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Try twenty.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Ah, time flies when you get to be my age. I'm surprised you came to save Su. I thought you guys didn't get along.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Su and I finally worked out our old grievances.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Good, glad we can put all that behind us.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Right. "We".

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, there's the factory.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Whoa, that's one big ... thing.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I think I know where they are. Feel that cavern a few stories down? It seems empty, but it's guarded by an awful lot of mech.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Right. Why would you need soldiers guarding an empty cavern? They must have them in some kind of suspended prison, so they can't use their earthbending.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Someone's coming. Hide!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: I didn't expect you until tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I just wanted to check in to make sure everything was on track. It looks wonderful.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: We've had a few minor malfunctions, but we should be ready for the test tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You've been working on this the entire time, Zhu Li. What do you think the problem is?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: It's a very complex machine. There are bound to be some bugs to work out.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: But you're doing everything you can to fix those, correct?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Of course, your eminence.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: She's lying.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Tell the troops and the factory workers to attend tomorrow's demonstration. I want them all to witness this incredible new weapon in action.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: We should be thinking of a way to take out Kuvira while we have the chance.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Or at least destroy the cannon. If she takes that to Republic City, it could obliterate everything.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I didn't come to fight with Kuvira or destroy a cannon. I'm here to save my family.  It will take everything we have just to get out alive.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hmm. Kuvira wants every single one of her people to see the weapon test tomorrow, so the factory will be mostly empty then. That's our best chance to sneak in and free Su without being spotted.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Good thinking, Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Thanks.  I kind of have a headache now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Excuse me, spirit? Can I talk to ...  and you're gone.  Just like all the other spirits.  They're abandoning the city.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So let me ask you about metalbending. Su tried to teach me, but I couldn't get the hang of it.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I used to have an academy to train metalbending. Even blockheads like you can figure it out with the right instruction.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Yeah, you're a real sensitive instructor.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I did learn how to lavabend.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Really? It's a very rare ability.  Maybe you do have some talent.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I can't believe ... you think I'm talented?  That means so much to me coming from my hero.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Yeah, she's real encouraging.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Hey! I'm blind, not deaf.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: So here's something I've always been curious about: Who's Lin's dad?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: He was a guy named Kanto. Nice man, but it didn't really work out between us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And ...  okay.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Lin, I can feel your enraged breathing from here. Just say what you have to say and let's get it over with.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Just get it over with? Yeah, let's not linger on the fact that I grew up without a dad. No need to get all touchy-feely about it. Just one of those things, right?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Hey, I forgave you for all your garbage a long time ago and Su and I worked things out.  You're the only one who wants to hold on to this family drama nonsense  for the rest of your life.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Forgave me for what?!  And not knowing my dad is nonsense to you?  It was pretty important to me.  And until now, you would never even discuss it. You know, after Su and I patched things up, I thought, "maybe I should try to reach out to mom."  But now that we're together again, I remember why we stopped talking.  You make me furious  and you don't even know why. And when I tell you, you don't care.  Once we save Su, you and I are finished.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: If that's your decision and it makes you happy, then fine.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: The test is about to start. They're going to blow up that empty town we flew over yesterday.  You're clear to go.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Copy that.  We're clear to go.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: The guards are on the other side of that door.  We'll have to be quiet.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Shoot me over to the cage  and I can swing them back on my cable.  Bolin, you'll have to catch them since mom won't be able to see them.  Ready?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: We'll get you out one at a time. Come on.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I got you!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Congratulations on all of your hard work.  This weapon is proof that the Earth Empire is the strongest nation in the world. And believe me, this is only the beginning!  Fire the weapon.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Probably something minor.  I should be able to find the problem.  The distributor pin is gone.  I swear I locked it in place yesterday. There's no way it could have just fallen out.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: And this could cause the entire weapon to fail?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: It could cause it to explode.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What do you know about this?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Nothing.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You swore your loyalty to me and I gave you a chance at greatness.  This is how you repay me?!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: You're a monster. I regret nothing.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Chain her up in the target town. She can see how the weapon works  up close and personal.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Oh, no.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Sweetie, it'll be fine. Lin won't drop you and Bolin will catch you.

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: No, no. Just go. Just leave me. I'll stay here.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Sorry, but I have to do this.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: The prison. Get there now!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Should we postpone the test?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I didn't come all this way to stop now. Fire when ready. I want to see that town destroyed.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We got 'em. We're coming out.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Mom! Dad!  Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Let's move.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Kuvira caught Zhu Li and threw her in the town.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What?  No, I have to go save her.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: You can't go in there, kid. It's suicide. Kuvira's onto us.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: We've been through too much together. I can't leave her. Toph, you said Zhu Li was lying about fixing the cannon. She must have been trying to stop it.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: For all you know, she could just have been covering her butt because she made a mistake.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No, Zhu Li doesn't make mistakes. You guys leave. If we make it out, we'll make it to the city somehow.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Bolin, no!  You guys get out of here. I have to go with Bolin.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Could be our best chance to stop Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Maybe take out that weapon.

transcript.speaker: Wing
transcript.text: We can't let Opal be the coolest!

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: If you all want to get yourselves captured again or worse, that's your business. I'm through.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Watch out for Baatar Sr. and Huan.

transcript.speaker: Baatar
transcript.text: So how have you been, mother?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: I told you never to call me that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Spirits, this is the Avatar.  Please listen to me.  Since I opened the portals, spirits and humans have lived happily together in Republic City. It's all I could have hoped for. I know you felt the effects of Kuvira cutting down spirit vines. But now isn't the time for you to flee the city.  It's time for you to help me save it from Kuvira, who was perverting spirit power to use as a weapon against other humans.

transcript.speaker: Dragon eel spirit
transcript.text: We don't  get involved with human wars.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Spirits worked with Unalaq.

transcript.speaker: Dragon eel spirit
transcript.text: He was misusing Vaatu's power during Harmonic Convergence to force spirits to fight you. Is that what you want?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, but as the Avatar, I'm hoping that you will come to my aid to save the new world we all share.

transcript.speaker: Dragon eel spirit
transcript.text: What you want is exactly what Kuvira wants: to use spirits as a weapon in a human war.  The answer is no.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wait! Please, listen.  If spirits and humans are gonna live together, we have to work with each other!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Opal? No!  We have to stop the test!

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Whoa.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: You give metalbenders a bad name!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Thanks for coming to save us, Mom.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Yeah, thanks, Chief.  I'm sorry for what I said last night. I was just ... you know.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Look, I know I wasn't a great mother, but one way or another, I ended up with two great kids. Good enough to risk my bony old butt for, anyway. If you can just find some way not to hate me, maybe that's enough, at least for me.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Me too.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You know, I never had any family except for my brother  until a few years ago,  and reuniting with them made me realize how special it is.

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: Argh, enough!  Enjoy the ride back to the city  with the gum flapper here.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: Aren't you coming back to Republic City with us, Grandma?

transcript.speaker: Toph
transcript.text: No, my fighting days are over. Don't tell Korra, but my back is killing me now. This is why you didn't see Katara messing with that civil war nonsense. At some point, you gotta leave it to the kids.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I want to thank you for coming back to save me. And don't be too hard on Bolin for working with Kuvira. His heart was in the right place.

transcript.speaker: Opal
transcript.text: I think Bolin has worked his way out of the polar bear doghouse.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: We should get going. I'm afraid I have bad news to deliver to Republic City.  Kuvira is going to attack in two weeks.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Bolin, Opal, and Lin rescued the Beifongs and Zhu Li from Kuvira. Now they are racing to Republic City to alert everyone about the Earth Empire's imminent attack. Meanwhile, Korra and Team Avatar have been preparing for just such an event. Prince Wu is leading an evacuation effort, while Asami and Varrick are creating flying mecha suits. But with Kuvira planning to strike in only two weeks, will they be ready in time?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Today, we stand on the precipice of history. For the past three years,  we've fought side by side to unite the Earth Empire and we've proven that no one can stand in our way,  not even the Avatar. But our mission is not yet complete.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: There is a grave injustice that must be corrected. As you all know, after the Hundred Year War, Avatar Aang,  along with Fire Lord Zuko, stole Earth Empire land and formed the United Republic.  This land belongs to the people of the Earth Empire and it's time to take it back! Republic City will be ours!

transcript.speaker: Soldiers
transcript.text: All hail the Great Uniter!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Are you ready to show the world what a true superpower looks like?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Yes. I'm honored to march into the city by your side.  I love you, Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I never could have done this without your help. After we claim victory, we can finally get married  and rule our empire together.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How's the evacuation coming?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Could be better.  At this point we've evacuated almost ...  eighteen families.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Only eighteen ? There are millions of people in this city!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I said it could be better.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: The problem is, it's a voluntary evacuation and there aren't very many volunteers. They just don't feel like they're in any immediate danger.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Guys! Good, you're all here!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: What's with you interrupting my important meetings all the time?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Su ... what are you ... you're okay!  I'm so sorry about Zaofu. How did you escape?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal, Beifong, and I rescued everyone. But we had a run in with Kuvira. We saw her super spirit weapon up close. Like, really close. Way too close.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Is she going to use it against Republic City?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Yes. I found out she's going to attack in two weeks.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ooh! And Zhu Li's on our side now. Actually, she never really switched sides and I'm just gonna let her explain the whole thing. Zhu Li?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I pretended to be loyal to Kuvira so I could sabotage her weapon. It didn't work, but I did overhear her plans to attack.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I knew she wouldn't stop at Zaofu.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: My guess is, she's coming by rail. It's the only way she can transport that weapon.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Then we'll cut the rail lines.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I agree. But let's get as many citizens evacuated before we do.  Put out the announcement. The evacuation is now mandatory .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We're on it.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't worry Mr. President. I won't let Kuvira take our city.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Weld hotter! Tighten tighter!  The president said we only have two weeks to get these hummingbirds humming !

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Varrick! Good, you're here.  Can I talk to you for a minute?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: What is it? I'm busy inspiring my workers.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Well, I went to Zaofu and saved Su and her family ... and guess who else we found?  Ha!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Zhu Li.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Now, isn't there something you wanted to say to her? Hmm?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Please, let me go first. I know I said a lot of terrible things about you in front of Kuvira. But I need you to know ...  I didn't mean one word. When you were being taken away, I thought my only chance to save you was to join her.  But every day, I hoped for the chance to see you again and tell you the truth.  Varrick, you mean the world to me and I'm sorry if I hurt you in any way.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Don't be so hard on yourself.  Apology accepted! Now be a good assistant and  man the assembly line!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: No! I am not your assistant anymore.  If you want me around, you need to start treating me like an equal !

transcript.speaker: Radio operator
transcript.text: We're patched into the emergency broadcast line.  You're going out to every radio in the city.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Attention citizens of Republic City. This is not a test.  An attack on our city is imminent. President Raiko has ordered a mandatory evacuation for all citizens. Please find  your evacuation handbooks and turn to  subsection one-dash-two-six.  There you will find initial instructions for your area. For example, if you live in northwest vector one, report to your primary meeting location,  which would be at the eastern entrance of the Southern Water Tribe library.  There, you would choose a leader as specified in section one-dash-two-eight.

transcript.speaker: Radio operator
transcript.text: Uh, Chief,  we're getting confused calls from all over the city. I think Mako's starting a panic.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What's confusing?  I'm giving very specific instructions.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Great, this is just what we need.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I got this.  Hello, everyone, this is Prince Wu. Now, I know you're all a little scared. Believe me, I know what it's like to be afraid. I used to not be able to go to the bathroom by myself. But if we let that fear control us  none of us will ever be able to go to the bathroom and then we all lose.  But the people of Republic City aren't losers , we're winners .  Winners that are going to  get out of this city in a calm and orderly fashion.  So I want you to grab your family, grab your neighbor  grab that guy down the street you don't know very well and head to the nearest bus,  train or ferry station.  We're going to get you out of here, safe and sound.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Good job, kid.  You might not make such a bad king after all.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Rohan's with the Acolytes. They have the boat ready to leave.  Why aren't you all packed yet?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: The kids and I have been talking and we decided we want to stay. This is our city and it's going to need all the help it can get.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Yeah! Only a coward flees his fate.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Thank you.  I'm sure Prince Wu could use your help with the evacuation.  And you three can help the other airbenders keep an eye on the Earth Empire troops from above.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Kuvira's gonna rue the day she messed with  Meelo.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I still don't like having to abandon my office in the city.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Air Temple Island is the ideal location for your base of operations and you'll be safe here.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: There's something we need to discuss with you.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: What is it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The four of us have been talking and ... we wanna take out Kuvira's spirit weapon before it gets too close to the city.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That sounds like a risk we don't need to take. The evacuation is on schedule and General Iroh is getting his army in place.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know Iroh can go toe-to-toe with Kuvira's army, but that weapon ...

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: It's too powerful! It can destroy the city.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: We can't let it get to our doorstep.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll sneak behind enemy lines and disable the weapon.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: If it works, it'll even the playing field.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: But if you get caught ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's worth the risk.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I agree, and it might be our only shot at preventing an all-out war.  Good luck.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll head out tonight.

transcript.speaker: Sentry
transcript.text: There's something out there!

transcript.speaker: Sentry
transcript.text: It's Kuvira's army!  They're a week early! Get the commander immediately and radio Republic City!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Guys! I see something.  Down there!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Is that – ?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Kuvira.  She's already crossed into United Republic territory. She's a week early.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: This doesn't make sense.  There aren't any train tracks this way. How are they transporting that super weapon of theirs?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Apparently on a giant mecha suit!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Did you know Kuvira was building that thing?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Oh, did I forget to mention it? No, of course I didn't know!

transcript.speaker: Mecha operator
transcript.text: There's a flying bison up ahead.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: The Avatar.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I know what happens next! We gotta get out of here, now! Now!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Should we go after them? They're going to warn Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Let them. No one can stop us.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra? Are you all right? Why are you back so soon?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's Kuvira. Our intel was wrong. She must have known Zhu Li had the information.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: What are you trying to say?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Kuvira's army is only a few hours away.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: No, they can't be! We're not ready.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: And that spirit weapon of hers is attached to a giant mecha suit. It's over twenty-five stories tall!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Get General Iroh on the line and tell him that the attack is happening today. We need to lock down the city.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Pema! Find Wu and get the remaining citizens to safety, immediately.  We can't have innocent lives in jeopardy.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: What should we do?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Let's go to my factory. Maybe we can get a few of those hummingbird suits up and running.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: We're coming with you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'll head to the front lines and help General Iroh.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Kuvira, this is President Raiko. I order you to stand down. Turn your army around and leave.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You're in no position to give orders.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Stand down, or we will attack!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I don't think you understand the power I possess.  Let me make it clear.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: This is exactly why I didn't wanna build that weapon!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Mister President, do I have your order to engage?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You have three seconds before I wipe out your army.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I have no choice.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Time's up!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Stop! We surrender. Republic City is yours.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Good. Turn your army and the Avatar over to me, and give Baatar your location.  He'll present you with our terms.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I'm not surrendering!

transcript.speaker: Iroh
transcript.text: Get back to the city before she sees you. And Korra --  --find a way to beat that thing.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I will.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: We've done it, Kuvira.  And I just got word that President Raiko is on Air Temple Island. I'm heading there now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Raiko surrendered.  It's down to us now.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: How are we supposed to fight an entire army, a mecha giant, and that crazy weapon?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We can't fight it, but maybe we can cripple it.  Zhu Li, when you were spying on Kuvira, did you learn anything about that metal monster?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I had no idea they were even building it.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Guess Baatar Jr. is a better inventor than I thought.  Don't tell him I said that.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's it! Baatar Jr. built it, he'll know how to take it down! I say we capture him, and get him to talk.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Hmm ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know it's a long shot, but it's the only chance we have, and if we don't ...

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, I'm in.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll need a stealth team of airbenders to get in and out of Baatar's airship unnoticed. Tenzin, Bumi, Jinora, Kai, let's get moving.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: What about me?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sorry, buddy. This mission counts on everyone being as silent as possible -  - and your farts are just too much of a wild card.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I can be quiet!  Okay, point taken.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Is everyone ready?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You've made a terrible mistake.  Once Kuvira finds out I'm missing, you're all done for.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: That's why, before she finds out, you're going to tell us how to stop that mecha giant, or else.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Or else what?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: You won't hurt me. I know an empty threat when I see one.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Was this your best idea?  You've lost, only you haven't accepted it yet.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Let me talk to him.

transcript.speaker: Soldier #1
transcript.text: Are you sure?

transcript.speaker: Soldier #2
transcript.text: Check the engine room.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: What's going on? Is everything all right?

transcript.speaker: Soldier #3
transcript.text: Just a minute, sir.  I'm telling you, I looked everywhere.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: All right, enough whispering!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: I'm ready to discuss the terms of the surrender with Baatar Jr. Where is he?

transcript.speaker: Soldier #3
transcript.text: Uh ... I'm not really sure.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Baatar --

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: If you think I'm going to spill all my secrets to you, Mother, you're sadly mistaken.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Why are you doing this? I know you set out to help better the world, but this is madness!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: It's madness to let others take what's yours and accept it blindly! The United Republic belongs to us, and we're taking it back.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: But at what cost? How many people have to lose their lives before Kuvira is satisfied?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: It doesn't have to cost any lives if you would all just surrender! All that Kuvira and I want is a united Earth Empire!

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I don't know what I did to hurt you, but whatever it was, I'm sorry. When you left Zaofu, it broke my heart --  -- and our family has never been the same since. Please, Baatar -- stop all this and come home.  We want you back with us.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Kuvira is my family now.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We've been going about his all wrong.  You're right. I'm not gonna physically hurt you if you don't talk. But there is something I could do that will be even more painful.  I will take away the one thing you care for the most ... Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: What do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Kuvira might win. She might chase us out of the city. But you won't be around to enjoy the victory. Because wherever I run, I'll take you. I am going to make it my life's mission to never let you see the one you love again.  Is taking the city worth losing Kuvira forever?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: No! You can't!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I will ... unless you convince Kuvira to back off. You two will still have the Earth Empire. Just leave the United Republic alone.

transcript.speaker: Soldier #4
transcript.text: It's Kuvira. She wants to talk to Baatar. What should I tell her?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: For goodness' sake, give me that radio! Let me talk to her.

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: Kuvira, this is Raiko. What kind of game are you playing? You told me you would send Baatar over with your terms, and then he doesn't show.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What do you mean, "he didn't show"?

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: According to your people, he's not on the airship.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: If he's not on the airship, then where is he?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Kuvira? It's Baatar.  I've been captured. My airship was ambushed and I was taken by force. Korra refuses to release me unless we back down and leave the city.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Are you injured?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: I'm fine.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Is the Avatar there with you now?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Yes, everyone is here.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Find out where that signal's coming from.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Listen to me.  If you try to take Republic City, the Avatar will never let me see you again ... and I refuse to live that way.  Forget the United Republic; we have our empire! We have each other!  Let's go back home and get married. The only thing that matters is that we're together for the rest of our lives.

transcript.speaker: Mecha operator
transcript.text: We've identified their position.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You're right. This city isn't worth sacrificing our life together.  I love you, Baatar.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: As soon as we work out terms with Kuvira, we'll let you out of here.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Guys! She must have our location! She's pointing that weapon right at us!

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: No! She wouldn't!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone out! Now! Now!

transcript.speaker: Raiko
transcript.text: No!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Keep the president safe! I'm going to check for survivors.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: The Earth Empire has invaded the United Republic! After Kuvira demonstrated the power of her spirit energy weapon, President Raiko surrendered the city, but the Avatar refused to give up without a fight. Korra held Baatar Jr. hostage, hoping to force Kuvira to back down, but the plan failed and she fired on Team Avatar's hideout. Can anything or anyone stop Kuvira and her mecha giant?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Go ahead, take your time, just bending a giant wall! Man, have we got a lot of people hurt!  Is that everybody?! Gah!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Kuvira is heading our way, with a platoon of mecha suits!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: What should we do?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: This is my hometown and I hate to say it, but there's no use risking all our lives to fight that giant thing! Let her take the city for now! We'll think of some way to come back and beat her!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: What about all the people who haven't been evacuated yet? If Kuvira finds out that Wu is with them, she might fire that spirit cannon at him and take them all out.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I couldn't stop Kuvira from taking Zaofu. I'm not letting her conquer Republic City. The world isn't safe as long as she has that weapon.

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I agree. We take down that giant today .

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Lin!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Glad to see you all made it out. You had me worried.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Well, you benders are going to have to fight her alone. She just blew up our factory with all our hummingbird suits.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Not all of them. There are the prototypes back at my office. If we can get those ready to fly, we'll at least be able to offer a little air support.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Su, you take Baatar Jr. and the rest of the wounded back to Asami's office. Get those suits working as soon as you can. The rest of us will just have to face Kuvira on our own.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Everyone, please settle down. The trains should be returning to pick us up soon.

transcript.speaker: Evacuee
transcript.text: Tell that mecha jerk to settle down. She's the one blowing up the whole city!

transcript.speaker: Train conductor
transcript.text: I hate to be the bearer of more bad news, but I just heard on the radio that Kuvira's army has destroyed the train tracks. We're not getting out of the city by rail.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: Everyone! I was just up on the observation deck and saw a bunch of mecha suit soldiers heading this way!

transcript.speaker: Evacuee
transcript.text: Oh great! The giant one wasn't enough?! It's over! We're all gonna get blown to bits!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Listen everyone, I can get us out of here if you just sit tight.  Can you step off the bench, please? It's a little crowded up here.

transcript.speaker: Train conductor
transcript.text: Sure. I'm only the conductor. No one needs me on the bench.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Just stay calm. I'll be right back.  Come on.

transcript.speaker: Evacuee
transcript.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Where are you going?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I'm going to get some help.  You think you can handle this unruly mob for a little while?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: I raised Meelo. I can handle anything.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: A paint store? That's it!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: What are you doing, Meelo?

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: I just got an idea how to beat the giant. Now, everyone, grab some paint and find me some balloons!

transcript.speaker: Soldier
transcript.text: Airbenders approaching.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I see them.

transcript.speaker: Meelo
transcript.text: Bombs away!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Clear the glass!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Now!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: The joints are platinum, too! We can't metalbend any of it!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're about to get the world's largest hot foot, metal lady!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Hit it now!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Opal!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Everyone retreat! Take the wounded back to Asami's office!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'll meet you there! I'm going to see if I can find any help!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: All right, let's fire it up again!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I can't stabilize it! I thought you fixed the hydraulics.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I did! Twist harder!

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: I hope you have something in here that can take out a platoon of mecha suits. Kuvira's troops are headed this way!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I know how to take down some mecha suits and it just might take down that giant, too.  Asami, disconnect anything electrical in here until we get back.  Zhu Li, let's go.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Where am I? Mom?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Just rest, son. I'm here.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Mom, I'm so sorry. I betrayed you, the whole family. I gave my life to Kuvira and she just fired that weapon at me. How could she do that?

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: I don't know, sweetie. She's a complicated person.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Wing and Wei will never forgive me. And Opal.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Yeah, they might take some time to come around. But we'll work through it as a family.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Do you think this plan will actually work, sir?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I know I can stop the mecha suits with an electromagnetic pulse, so it stands to reason that I can stop a giant mecha suit with a giant electromagnetic pulse.  Zhu Li, I've been thinking.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: You're always thinking, sir.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes. But lately, I've been thinking about you. I know we might not make it out of this mess and I feel like there are some things I should tell you.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: There are?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I remember when I was a boy, I had an ostrich horse. Named her Mrs. Beaks.  I grew up on a farm. Did I ever tell you that, Zhu Li? This was before the circus people took me away. Anyway, I loved old Mrs. Beaks, but I took her for granted.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: You'll have to finish your story later. Kuvira's troops are in range.  Okay, I hope this works.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes! Dead in their tracks.  Oh, rats. She's still coming. Zhu Li, do the thing!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I'm afraid there are no more things to do.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What was that?

transcript.speaker: Soldier
transcript.text: An electromagnetic pulse. It shut down the mecha suits, but our power source is fine.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Locate the source of the pulse. That must be where Varrick is. Third and fourth mech platoons, move in and continue the sweep. Capture anyone left in the city.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Varrick, how come your electro-thingy shut down the small mecha suits but not the big one?

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: Because it's powered with spirit vine energy. I'm sorry. I wish I could help you, but it's unstoppable.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: It's not.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dad?

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I got him out of jail to help. I figured we need all the geniuses we can get our hands on right now. If the prison's still standing after all this is over, we can throw him back in.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: I know what you all must think of me, but I love Republic City and I would do anything to save her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You think you know how to defeat this thing?

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: You must act like an infection: break the skin and attack its vital organs, disconnect the heart and the brain and this beast cannot live.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But how are we supposed to get inside?

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Future Industries has plasma saws for cutting platinum. If we had one on the mecha suit ...

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: But the saws are way too big. We'd never get the suits off the ground.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: I think I can add an electrical element to the welding torch on your suit and convert it into a plasma saw. Then we'll just have to land on the giant and cut open a hole big enough for someone to get in.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Like a metal mosquito.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You know what happens to mosquitoes that land on me? I squash 'em!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We'll have to attack in a swarm to try to keep you guys safe in the hummingbird suits. It looks like they're our only hope.

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Oh, first he ate the fruit, then he ate the leaves. Hungry little lemur, ate up all my trees.  Okay, great job everybody. Who's got another song for us?

transcript.speaker: Evacuee
transcript.text: We can't just sit around here singing old airbender songs until we're all captured, or worse .

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Should we play the button game? Who has a button?

transcript.speaker: Pema
transcript.text: Where do these badgermoles come from?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: The zoo! Mako always hated my singing, but they love it!

transcript.speaker: Evacuee
transcript.text: Well, what are we supposed to do with badgermoles?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: They're the best earthbenders around! We can use them to tunnel out of the city without Kuvira's troops spotting us.

transcript.speaker: Evacuee
transcript.text: Are you sure this is the best plan?  Let's follow the moles!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Badgermoles, digging holes, under Republic City. Got to run away from Kuvira today, although I do still think she's pretty.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Mech platoons, report.

transcript.speaker: Third platoon
transcript.text: Third platoon, no sign of anyone so far.

transcript.speaker: Fourth platoon
transcript.text: Fourth platoon, en route to train station.

transcript.speaker: Soldier
transcript.text: I think we found the source of the electromagnetic pulse:  Future Industries Tower.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: That's the place.

transcript.speaker: Daw
transcript.text: Kuvira is headed our way!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How long will it take to get the plasma saws ready?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Just a few more minutes.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Get out there as soon as you can.

transcript.speaker: Baatar Jr.
transcript.text: If you do manage to get inside, find the engine room. There are two emergency levers. If you switch them off at the same time, you'll cut the power.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Thanks.  We may not be able to beat that thing, but we can slow it down. Let's go!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Jinora!

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Oh, Yin, you're the sweetest evacuee I've ever known.  And I just want to thank you for being so kind, when I was living in your home.

transcript.speaker: Earth Empire sergeant
transcript.text: Halt!  Turn around slowly and please, stop that singing. You're all Earth Empire prisoners. Come with us and no one will get hurt.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You don't need these people. They're just innocent civilians caught in the crossfire, but I'm Prince Wu, rightful leader of the Earth Kingdom.  Take me to Kuvira. I've got business with her.

transcript.speaker: Tu
transcript.text: No! Don't do it, Wu.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: I have to. But before I go,  I'd like to sing you a song.  If you don't respect the broach, you don't respect me. Oh, no, no, no, no, no. You're no better than a roach,  but I'm royalty. I got my badgermoles with me.

transcript.speaker: Earth Empire sergeant
transcript.text: Actually, your song is so bad, your badgermoles deserted you.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: You don't know what you're talking about.  Oh, badgermoles I love you, I love you. I want to, I want to pet your snouts.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: If we stop that mecha giant, it will all be because of you.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: You're the one who designed these incredible suits.  It's great to be working together again.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I love you, Dad.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: I love you, too.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Zhu Li?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Yes?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I have something I need to attach before we take off.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Attached to what?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: I need to attach this ring  to your finger. Zhu Li Moon, will you do the thing for the rest of our lives?

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Yes!  Now let's go attach these barely functional rust buckets to a giant killer smashing machine!

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: It's exactly how I always pictured our engagement.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Aim for that spot in the middle of the back - the one I can never reach.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Got it.

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Wah, let's get out of here!  Wow! I wish I had that kind of flexibility.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Hang on!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I need more power! They're cutting in! More power!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We need to get out of here.

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Almost there.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: We have to go now!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Almost there. Almost there!

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dad! Now!

transcript.speaker: Hiroshi
transcript.text: Goodbye, Asami. I love you.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Dad!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Hiroshi's plan worked. There's our opening.

transcript.speaker: Shiro Shinobi
transcript.text: Republic City is a war zone! While Prince Wu led the remaining citizens to safety, Team Avatar battled Kuvira's giant mech, but no amount of bending could bring it down! In a last-ditch effort, Asami and her father outfitted the hummingbird suits with platinum cutters. Hiroshi helped Team Avatar infiltrate the mecha giant, but he paid the ultimate price! Is victory within reach for our heroes?

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Initiate lockdown! Find the Avatar and whoever else is with her.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: We need to move fast. Su, Lin, climb up to the arm and try to disable that weapon. Mako, Bolin, get to the engine and see if you can power this thing down.  I'm going after Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: Are you sure? When you fought Kuvira before ...

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know.  She almost destroyed me.  Not this time.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm going for that lever. You get the other one.

transcript.speaker: Guard
transcript.text: Hey!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: I'll deal with this guy! Disable the weapon!

transcript.speaker: Lin
transcript.text: Nice work.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: The outside may be platinum,  but we can do a lot of damage in here.

transcript.speaker: Helmsman
transcript.text: The weapon's loading mechanism has malfunctioned. We're unable to fire.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: It's no malfunction.  I can feel someone metalbending inside the arm.  I've lost the connection! The weapon's useless now.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm ready!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Be with you in one second! Kind of busy!  Okay, ready now!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: One ... two ... three!  Nothing's happening!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Kuvira must've done some override thing and taken control!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: There's got to be some other way to shut down power from here.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Ummm ...

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Come on. You spent all that time working with Varrick and Baatar Jr. Didn't any of their genius rub off on you?

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Look, the only thing I know about these vines is that if you mess around with them too much,  they explode.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Get those engineers out of here. I have an idea.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Want to fill me in?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I'm gonna zap these vines with some electricity.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Let's back it up, okay?  I said that will make the vines explode .

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Exactly. This is our only way of shutting this thing down.  I can handle it.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: No! You can't! This isn't the time to prove how awesome you are. I already know how awesome you are  ... you're awesome.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I don't have time to argue!  I'm doing this, so get out of here!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Okay, but for the record,  I do not approve. Just,  get out as soon as you can.  Promise?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Promise.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: I love you.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: I love you, too. Now go!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's over.  You're gonna call off your army  and surrender to President Raiko.  Then you and —

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Stop!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Kuvira! Give up!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Never.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Please, stop this madness! It has to end now!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: If you really want to end it, then come and get me!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Now it's over.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Don't!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Shut it down!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I can't!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: Look!

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: A new spirit portal.

transcript.speaker: Mecha suit captain
transcript.text: Spread out and find Kuvira!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Korra!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Tenzin, there's no sign of her.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Keep looking! Korra!  Korra!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: What happened? Are we ... dead?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: No, we're okay, but we're in the Spirit World.  All the energy from your weapon tore open a new portal and blasted us in here.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Why would you save my life, after everything I did to you?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I guess ... I see a lot of myself in you.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: We are nothing alike!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Yes, we are. We're both fierce and determined to succeed,  sometimes without thinking things through.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: This wasn't how I wanted things to end.  If you would have all just surrendered,  none of this would have happened.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You brought this on yourself. Messing with the spirit vines, acting like a dictator over your people ... you had to know what you were doing wasn't right.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: I was trying to help my people. Su turned her back on the Earth Kingdom, you were gone ! I had to do something.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think I get it now.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: You don't understand anything about me.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I do.  Su told me how she took you in when you were younger.  It must have been so hard being an orphan.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Don't pretend you know what it felt like!  The Avatar is adored by millions! I was cast aside by my own parents like I meant nothing to them.  How could I just stand by  and watch the same thing happen to my nation, when it needed someone to guide it?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: You wanted to create a place where you and your people would never be vulnerable again.  I may not have been an orphan, but believe me, I understand what it feels like to be afraid.  After I was poisoned, I would have done anything to feel in control.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: The spirits have returned.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: And so has Korra!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You're okay!

transcript.speaker: Mecha suit captain
transcript.text: Release Kuvira, or we will attack!

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: Stand down. This battle is over. I owe the Avatar my life.  Her power is beyond anything I could ever hope to achieve.  I'll accept whatever punishment the world sees fit.

transcript.speaker: Kuvira
transcript.text: And Su, I'm sorry for all the anguish I've caused you and your family.

transcript.speaker: Suyin
transcript.text: You're going to answer for everything you've done.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And though the battle took a severe toll on our beloved city, out of the destruction, love did bloom!  So that is why, dearest friends and family, we gather today to celebrate the wondrous, and at time inexplicable bond between Sir Varrick and the Lady Zhu Li!

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: Hey, pal, camera on me! This is my big day!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: True love is a fickle creature.  Difficult to find, nearly impossible to tame.  But Varrick and Zhu Li have proven that even the longest of long shots  can have a chance at happiness together. Now, for the vows!  Thank you, Master Pabu. Do you, Sir Iknik Blackstone Varrick of the Southern Water Tribe, Master of the High Seas, take the Lady Zhu Li Moon to be your lawfully wedded wife? Will you promise to treat her not as your assistant, but as your honored and cherished partner?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You're darn tootin' I do!

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: And do you, Zhu Li, take Varrick, to be your lawfully wedded husband? Do you promise to care for him, in sickness and in health,  and also scrub his callouses on a bi-weekly basis, which ... isn't really that much to ask ...  Okay, I'm not reading all this.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: I do take Varrick. Callouses and all.

transcript.speaker: Bolin
transcript.text: You may now  do the thing.

transcript.speaker: Zhu Li
transcript.text: Are you all right?

transcript.speaker: Varrick
transcript.text: You just make me so dang happy!

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: My cousin told me how level-headed you were during the whole evacuation. I got to admit, I'm impressed. I think you're going to make a great leader.  But that doesn't mean I'm gonna set you up with Korra, so don't ask.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: That's okay, Mako. Sometimes, a good evacuation is its own reward.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Good to see you, Prince Wu. Or should I say, King Wu? You ready to get back to Ba Sing Se and finally take the throne?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Yeah  ... about that  ... I was actually thinking of stepping down as king and getting rid of the monarchy all together.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Are ... you joking?

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: For once,  I'm not. Now I know what you're gonna say, I'm being lazy, I'm afraid of responsibility, I'm putting my singing career before my people, but it's none of those things. I really think the Earth Kingdom would be better off if the states were independent and had elected leaders, like the United Republic.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: That's ... actually pretty wise and mature of you.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I think it's a great idea. The Earth Kingdom should evolve, and I'll do everything in my power to help you make that happen.

transcript.speaker: Wu
transcript.text: Looking forward to working with you. But for now, the dance floor calls.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: How's the arm?

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: Much better.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: The words "thank you" don't feel big enough for what you did. But I honestly don't know what else to say.

transcript.speaker: Mako
transcript.text: You don't need to say anything. I want you to know, I'll follow you into battle, no matter how crazy things get. I've got your back  ... and I always will .

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I spoke to President Raiko.  Tomorrow, he's announcing a plan to expand the city, rather than rebuild downtown.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I bet Aang never could have imagined there'd be a spirit portal right in the heart of Republic City.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: Korra, you've transformed the world more in a few years than most Avatars did during their lifetimes.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: But I feel like I've only just begun.  There's so much more I want to learn and do.

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: You don't know how happy I am to hear you so full of hope again.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: It's been a bit of a bumpy ride, huh?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: I've come to realize life is one, big, bumpy ride.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I know I was in a pretty dark place after I was poisoned. But I finally understand why I had to go through all that. I needed to understand what true suffering was so I could be more compassionate to others, even to people like Kuvira.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Excuse me Tenzin, Varrick is looking for you. Something about wanting to borrow a glidersuit to fly off the tower?

transcript.speaker: Tenzin
transcript.text: That doesn't seem like a good idea!

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Wanna sit with me for a minute? I'm not ready to get back to the party just yet.  I don't think I ever really apologized.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: For what?

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: For being gone all that time. For not coming back sooner.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: You don't need to apologize for anything.  I'm just so happy you're here now.  I don't think I could have handled losing you and my father in the same day.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: I am so sorry for what happened.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Thank you. I'm just glad I was able to forgive him.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: So, what now? Back to the dance floor?

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: I'm kind of all danced out. Honestly, after everything that's happened the past few months, I could use a vacation.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Let's do it! Let's go on a vacation, just the two of us. Anywhere you want.

transcript.speaker: Asami
transcript.text: Really? Okay ... I've always wanted to see what the Spirit World's like.

transcript.speaker: Korra
transcript.text: Sounds perfect.
